Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Brian L
Reviews.Content: Second visit. This time a room at the front where we could see and hear the cable cars if the window was open. Practically instant hot water and great pressure in the shower, perhaps because it was the 6th floor. Great location and easy for public transport with cable cars passing the door, buses and trolleybuses only a street away and the Muni (metro), street cars and Bart about a 10 minute walk. Parking seems expensive anywhere in the centre of the city. Didn't try the restaurant for lunch as we were away till the evening, but a good variety of bars, diners and restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “So wanted to agree with reviews”
Reviews.Author: BuckBrisbaneAus
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after reading the reviews here on TA. I do agree with the comments re location, the staff going the extra mile to help and the hot drinks and cookies availability. our biggest gripe was the very poor water pressure. i do undertsnad this is an old hotel but this is something that must be addressed sooner rather than later.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: EvanstonCubFan
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel near Union Square in San Francisco and don't want to pay over $200 a day, you should try the Chancellor Hotel. Our room had limited space, but was just fine for us.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in top location”
Reviews.Author: Robertsclubman
Reviews.Content: This was our second and third stays at the Chancellor on Union Square, 3 nights each, interrupted by a road trip. And it just confirms my view- why would you stay anywhere else in San Francisco. OK it's not the last word on luxury but it's clean and comfortable and by far the best value hotel in the Downtown area. The hotel 's location on Powell Street just off Union Square is hard to beat. The cable cars run right outside and the shops and restaurants are right on your doorstep. Buy a Muni Passport from the kiosk in reception and the City is at your feet. Can't wait to come back for a 4th time. I love this City and the Chancellor is the place to stay. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “How all hotels should be”
Reviews.Author: Denise M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel and were extremely impressed. They have thought of everything you could need. The staff were extremely professional, knowledgeable and friendly. The rooms were spotless with every amenity, great toiletries, umbrella, ice - too much to mention. complimentary hot drinks in the lobby were of exceptional quality as were the delicious cookies. We had breakfast in the restaurant and soon got used to the fact that we wanted our coffee/tea after our breakfast, thanks for your patience with two English people! We also had lunch in the restaurant and all meals were of exceptional quality and efficiently served. We would recommend this hotel unreservedly. Well done. Other hotels should take note.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent stay! Thank you all! Good Job!”
Reviews.Author: Lenny N
Reviews.Content: Thank you to all staff to make my stay very comfortable. Great location, very friendly and helpful staff. Good amenities, great little extras in room like sweets, umbrellas, pillow menu. Free tea/coffee all day. Thank you all! Good Job!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place”
Reviews.Author: 574Nancyr
Reviews.Content: Fantastic central hotel. Room was large enough for the two of us (twin room) so that we were not falling over each other, the beds were comfortable and with the lovely views of the square and the sound of the man playing the trumpet of an evening we had a brilliant stay. Complimentary tea, coffee and fresh cookies are available 24 hrs (due to jet lag I was a regular visitor at 4am) if the coffee and water isn't hot enough go and spend your money in a Starbucks. My stay was to celebrate my birthday and we arrived to a lovely chilled bottle of sparkling wine, glasses and gift in the room, a really nice touch (as was the jar of sweets). For breakfast the hotel is cheaper than Sears up the road and just as tasty. All in all a brilliant hotel which we would stay at again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel in SF”
Reviews.Author: mmwc
Reviews.Content: Whenever we visit San Francisco we stay at The Chancellor. Its location is excellent, on Powell Street right at Union Square. Wonderful restaurants are nearby, shopping is literally across the street, and the cable car stops right outside the door. The hotel glories in its history, and maintains a decor reminiscent of a gentler time. The rooms tend to be on the small side, but only in comparison with the huge rooms offered by some of the big chains: we find the rooms cozy and intimate, but certainly with room easily to accommodate two 26" suitcases and carry-ons in the spacious closet. The hotel is perfectly clean and neat, and staff are warm, friendly, knowledgeable, professional and very helpful. It's one of our favorite places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel in a perfect location - everything in one!”
Reviews.Author: FreedomFighterDublin
Reviews.Content: Wow, I was not disappointed for choosing this hotel. Fantastic locstion but quiet. Great staff, brill amenities, great little extras in room like sweets, umbrellas, pillow menu. Free tea/coffee all day. Nice restaurant attached. Rory on reception is brill! No a/c but fans in room, and windows do open so you can keep cool. Close to all transport and not up too steep a hill. Recommend this to all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay At The Chancellor!”
Reviews.Author: jkkjhrdn
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 6 night stay at the Chancellor Hotel. What a wonderful gem in the city! From the time we made our reservations to check out, we had nothing but exceptional service. A special thanks to Nate in reservations. His kindness in helping us with our reservations and even during our stay there. He gave us great recommendations and always friendly! The rooms were clean, the location perfect and we would definately be returning! Thanks again Chancellor Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Chris V
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and had a suite on 15th floor. What a great location. Bed was very comfortable.The room was clean and in good shape for a building of this age. Bathrooms were ok but could probbly do with an upgrade soon. Staff were excellent and helped us through the trauma of losing a case. I would stay at the Chancellor again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Centrally located in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: MightyredEngland
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel in the centre of San Francisco. Hotel price came with car parking which was located less than a few hundred yards away. Quiet room with a lovely deep bath which came in handy after all the walking that I tend to do. Only 2 lifts but never really that busy. Very close to the best of SF, Cable car stops outside and all the best stores in SF are literally just around the corner from Macy's, Louis Vuitton and all the other quality shops on union square. We used taxi's a lot as they were so easy to grab as they went past. Would stay again when I next go to SF. Free Wi-fi which really came in handy as i grabbed the latest uk news.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure”
Reviews.Author: eugnie05
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight in this lovely facility. The room was spotless, the staff was very helpful and friendly. I travel to San Francisco on a regular basis to visit family, have stayed at many of the boutique hotels in the area, and this is by far my favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy hotel, great location to explore the city!”
Reviews.Author: nkdewitt
Reviews.Content: We were visiting friends on the nearby Air Force base and decided to spend our last night in the city by ourselves. We chose this hotel because of its close proximity to Chinatown, that it had a cable car stop right outside the hotel, and that it was so highly rated on TripAdvisor. We took the cable car down to the pier and back, were able to take a nice stroll through Chinatown, access the Mission district via BART, and get to the airport via BART. I couldn't recommend this hotel more, just based on its location, but it was also cozy and sweet and perfectly comfortable. It kind of reminded me of a hotel we stayed at in Florence, Italy, a few years ago--just the right amount of space to put your things down, take a nice shower, and get a good night's rest.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: SharonI1958
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a four day get away in San Francisco. We stayed at the Chancellor Hotel. The hotel is in a perfect location with the cable car stop just outside the front door. The room was quiet, clean, airy, and very comfortable. We took advantage of trying out their pillow choices during our stay. The staff was friendly and helpful. If you want a home away from home in San Francisco I would definitely suggest the Chancellor!

Reviews.Title: “The Original "San Francisco Treat"”
Reviews.Author: Soccermom1964
Reviews.Content: My family and I have spent quite a few nights at The Chancellor over the years, where the staff maintain the highest standards in professionalism, courtesy, and friendliness. The rooms are well-appointed, comfortable, and clean. While the cost is very affordable, the location is priceless. The Chancellor embodies all that is special about San Francisco. It is our home away from home and always a real treat.

Reviews.Title: “Teriffic Value!!”
Reviews.Author: Stay_Broke
Reviews.Content: Convenient, central shopping location, (on the Powell/Hyde cable line) feather comforter beds, candy jar, flat screen TV, rubber ducky, pillow menu, free cookies and coffee in the lobby, responsive professional staff-- all add up to a GREAT SF visit. The hotel restaurant was great for breakfast and their eggs benedict was much better than the one next door at the Sears Restaurant. If you prefer smaller, local boutique hotelswith character --this is the one for SF. Rooms are european size (small) but in good condition. Elevators are smallish but faster than they look! So close to Bart, (4-5 blocks uphill) just pay the $8.10 fare to/from the airport and save $$. Bart terminates in the international terminal with shuttles to other SFO terminals.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Darlene3838
Reviews.Content: We always stay at the Chancellor. It is friendly, clean and in a great location. The restaurant is very good. Nice little bar and comfortable lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Felt old and loud”
Reviews.Author: siren913
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from San Francisco where we stayed at the Chancellor. The other reviews are correct; this location is tough to beat. The lobby is lovely, as well. Unfortunately, our visit started out badly when the gentleman at check-in couldn't find that I'd reserved a "parking included" rate on Expedia. It was late in the evening after many flight delays and this certainly wasn't a warm welcome. We parked our car in their offsite garage and hauled our luggage through the rain to the hotel - I suppose it should be expected that parking is, of course, off site. In the end, it took speaking to two people until the issue was resolved. Our room was nicely decorated but is just a facelift on an aging hotel. It was tiny, loud (!) at night (overlooking cable cars and Union Square) and the bathroom struck me as almost creepily old. The toilet is that of a public restroom. Although there are deep bathtubs, these have been there forever and there was no way I would get in one, despite the lovely bathsalts and rubber duck provided. My overall verdict is "meh." Walking past the Westin on Union Square had my heart longing to return there, instead. For the price, I suppose this is what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Happiness at the Chancellor hotel union square”
Reviews.Author: Sheila Y
Reviews.Content: Fabulous!!!!!!!!!! Stayed many times, wont stay any where else!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Eyal L
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay on union Square,near to every thing ,and on the way of the cable car. Friendly staff,basic room but clean .Free wifi in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Saved our trip”
Reviews.Author: rebecca c
Reviews.Content: We were staying in another hotel that was WAY out of the way and not currently on the train route, due to construction. It was a nightmare using public transportation to get places and the hotel itself was dirty and we wanted out! Thankfully we had booked through Tripadvisor and were able to cancel and book Chancellor. The representative for Chancellor quoted me a LOWER rate than what was on the internet. Chancellor is in an EXCELLENT location. It is close to shopping, wonderful restaurants, and the conference center, & the price was extremely competitive.

Reviews.Title: “A Family Tradition”
Reviews.Author: Stephen D
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been staying at the Chancellor 1-2 times per since 1988 (not a typo) for Christmas shopping, going to the ballet, or going to the symphony. Haven't stayed anyplace else in the city for many years. Best deal for such a location, and the best for parking too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: LancashireLass21
Reviews.Content: Very central for everything! Room was quite small but very comfortable - no view, we looked onto the fire escape stairs but because of that there was no noise from the street which could be a problem with rooms at the front. Helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in the middle of EVERYTHING!”
Reviews.Author: SandyB55
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean and right in the middle of all the action. The cable car stops right in front of the hotel. No need for a car. The staff was extremely helpful and very friendly. The rooms are a little small, but very clean. Our window faced the front of the hotel. We kept our window open at night and enjoyed the sights and sounds of the city. We were able to walk or take the cable car everywhere. The restaurant staff was so nice. I ordered my husband breakfast one morning and while I shopped they delivered it to our room in no time. I highly recommend this hotel. And the price was amazing!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JayM224
Reviews.Content: If you want to be close to public transit, museums, Chinatown, or retail shopping it's a great location. The staff and general ambience are the Chancellor's other best features. Susan at the concierge desk is extremely helpful, as are all the front desk staff. There's a lot going on at Union Square so it does tend to be noisy, especially nights on the weekends, and there is no air conditioning so you'll want to leave the windows open at least part of the time. There is a ceiling paddle fan though. The beds are pretty comfy, pillows are pretty good. If you pre-purchase the Luques card at a discount, breakfast is a good deal. Pick up a Muni passport at the concierge desk -- you can hop on a cable car at Powell and Post if there's room.

Reviews.Title: “European style in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: karlowsj
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed around Union Square at different hotels for our short stays in lovely San Francisco, but this hotel is our favourite. Staff are amazing - long term and know their city so share wonderful advise of hidden gems. The rooms are small but if you are a tourist in the city, you are out most of the time. Pillow menu is amazing - wish every hotel had one. Breakfast or a cocktail in the afternoon is covered as you start out or regroup. Ideal location for transportation or walking to shops.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to stay in Union Square, this is the place to be!”
Reviews.Author: JezandStacy
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean and cozy. The pillow menu was a particularly nice touch. The hotel was clean and the staff Very Friendly. The restaurant serves a great breakfast. We checked out early, but only because we decided not want to stay in Union Square. The staff was very accommodating and let us check out early. The normal policy is to tell them before 3:00 and they allowed us a leeway of an hour and a half, which was really nice of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “It is a great place”
Reviews.Author: ZMC29103
Reviews.Content: The people at this hotel are wonderful. The rooms are a tad small but the beds are very comfortable, equivalent to the 4 seasons and the bathrooms have deep tubs. The staff is friendly and helpful and the rates great. True it is not the 4 seasons but the price isn't either. I love staying at this hotel because the people are nice, room adequately and really lovingly appointed including a rubber duck in the bath tub. There is parking availability. If you plan to spend all your time in your room and need/want a view and lots of space, maybe this isn't what you want but I have stayed at this hotel for several years - maybe now many years and I am not disappointed. It reminds me of a wonderful hotel I stayed in Lutz, Sweden. Great bed, bathroom, terrific feeling of attention to detail. Comfy. I have spent a lot of the day in the room working and the free internet is easy on the soul. The hotel has a relationship with Club One just around the corner wtih a pool and great workout facility. I will be staying for my birthday next month.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Union Sqaure”
Reviews.Author: sford87
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights in February and everything was perfect. I went on a girls trip with my mom. We stayed in a room with 2 twin beds. It wasn't a large room but it was plenty for us. I loved the big walk in closet, it was perfect for storing our bags. The room was very clean and we had absolutely no complaints at all with the hotel. I loved the free coffee, tea, and cookies downstairs. Room service from the restaurant was great and well priced. The cable car pick up was right across the street. It really is a perfect location for shopping, it's only a short ride to Fisherman's Wharf, and I felt very safe in our location.The staff was always polite. Mike at the tour desk was really helpful. He advised us to get the 3-day MUNI pass which is by far the best deal. I would recommend that to anyone who will be staying at least 3 days. He gave us a map and highlighted the routes that they go. He also set up our shuttle to get to the airport.I would definitely stay at the Chancellor again.

Reviews.Title: “Chancellor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Deborah O
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff, and a great location on Union Square. No complaints to speak of. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here anytime!”
Reviews.Author: bbeadles
Reviews.Content: I just could not believe all the great reviews of the Chancellor before staying there. Have these people ever stayed at a Ritz Calrton or Four Seasons? Well, I get it now. While it is not one of those properties, it is one of the most friendly, well located and well-kept (older) properties I have visited in a long time. My 15 year-old son and I did a last minute trip to San Francisco. He too has experienced club level at the Ritz, etc. and he loved it. Rooms and bathrooms are small and as shown on everyone's pictures but incrediably well kept. My matress wasn't great but after walking San Francisco each day I slept like a baby. For the class of hotel and value, it is unbeatable. Bottom line: I will make this hotel my first choice to stay in San Francisco especially when not travelling on my company's account.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in san francisco downtown”
Reviews.Author: QwanKim
Reviews.Content: nice hotel with reasonable price and good location. Good to go everywhere san francisco. Comfortable bed and pillows, good amenity.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: SunHol1
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to San Fran and we loved this hotel - the location is fantastic (much prefer Union Square to Fishermans Wharf). Professional and friendly staff, felt like a family run hotel with little extras such as free tea/coffee and biscuits in reception. Rooms were very clean, bathrooms a little on the small side but functional. Great value for money and a location that would be hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value -and Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VTLongTimeTraveler
Reviews.Content: The location just off Union Square is fantastic. Walk from BART. The lobby is a little small and has lots of activity. The room is nicely updated, and the bed is super comfortable. The windows open so real air is possible. The bathroom is not big but it has the deepest tub I've seen short of a hot tub. I would definitely be happy with the room at almost twice what we're paying. Besides the desk said that it's expected that the guests will take the rubber ducky. Now that's a real nice touch. The room is very clean and has no smell at all.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: fujido
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Chancellor before, so we had the pleasure of already knowing some of the staff and being familiar with all the great features of the hotel. Such a convenient location on Union Square so it was easy to get to where we wanted to go each day. And absolutely the best deep extra-long bathtub ever--blissful to soak in after each day's adventures. A very good restaurant and bar staffed with friendly folks; who could ask for more?

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, charming and great location”
Reviews.Author: Steven C
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel. Fantastic location, friendly staff, small but charming rooms. Bathroom a little small however very quaint and functional. Old fashioned hotel rather than a Chain style hotel. Stay at this hotel and enjoy comfortable beds clean rooms, great location one block back from Union Square and three blocks from BART. All within easy walking distance of great shopping, eating, easy transport to Castro, Chinatown, Fishermans Wharf, North Beach and Airport. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome visit!”
Reviews.Author: Habermas
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Chancellor Hotel and I love it. The location is excellent â€“ it is central to many sites/areas and not far from transportation. There are many great restaurants nearby. And, on both trips, I have found the staff to be super friendly (actually, all of the service we had in San Francisco was excellent). Also, the room was very clean, which is one of my most important considerations. The room isnâ€™t large, but it was fine for the two of us. The bathrooms have those deep bathtubs, which I love. Although the hotel was renovated a few years ago, it is an older hotel â€“ meaning, if you like things modern and sleek, this probably isnâ€™t the hotel for you. Our room, on the eighth floor, faced Powell Street. Once the window was shut, it wasnâ€™t too noisy. I could see noise being a problem if you stayed in warmer weather. Since the hotel doesnâ€™t have air conditioning I imagine youâ€™d have to leave the windows open. Also, oddly, the windows (ours anyway) donâ€™t have screens, so I think bugs could be a problem in warmer weather. The tv channels are limited and the cost of movies are (I think) outrageous - $16.95! â€“ maybe thatâ€™s standard, but I wouldnâ€™t pay it. Internet if free (yay!), but $10/day if you want to be able to access if through the tv. The hotel provides free coffee/tea, cold water, cookies and apples throughout the day. All of these were much appreciated for quick returns between destinations. However, the coffee was lukewarm on several occasions â€“ maybe it would be worthwhile to invest in better carafes? Anyway, as I said, I love this hotel and I wouldnâ€™t hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Visitors from UK”
Reviews.Author: Ferret70
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in the hotel last week (Feb 2012) and really enjoyed it. Our travel company suggested it and we saw no reason to doubt their choice when we checked the reviews. There are some dodgy reviews but I loved the responses from the general manager! Our experience was entirely positive. We arrived at the hotel more than hours before check in after a 27 hour journey with little sleep. The receptionist was brilliant and found us a quiet room which we could access immediately! All the staff were super friendly and helpful, especially Mao and colleagues in the breakfast room. The hotel has character and the room we occupied wasn't huge, but it was really clean and comfortable. The bath was in need of replacement, but we only showered anyway. Cities are always noisy, but the location on Powell Street was great, and our room was quiet. I wonder if the "construction noise" someone mentioned was actually the cable system for the street cars which run right past. We loved it, the free coffee, the comfortable bed, all the original features in the hotel, and the Sears restaurant next door. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: AlbuquerqueWilly
Reviews.Content: A very comfortable hotel in a terrific central location. I had a room at the back which was surprisingly quiet for downtown. Free internet, pillow-top beds, and full-sized bathtub. I'll come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: hooky79
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for the last 5 nights of our honeymoon. After a long drive from Yosemite we were concerned about parking outside the Hotel to drop our luggage off but immediately upon arriving, the bellboy at the chancellor (Matthew) quickly made us feel relaxed, welcome and completely unrushed. Paid parkiing is available at a location round the corner but we were dropping our hired car off round the corner, either way we werent hurried to deal with the vehicle and were able to check in and relax. This became the general feel for our entire stay. We were given complimentary champagne for our honeymoon in our room which was a nice touch and very much appreciated. The hotel provides free water & hot beverages in reception throughout the day along with free cookies, again this was a nice touch. Our room was comfy and clean and with a fantastic view over Union Square with a huge cupboard for storing luggage and bags etc. The room was without a small fridge but one was quickly provided upon request. The extractor fan was quite noisy in the bathroom and was switched permenantly on but once we worked out how to switch off it didn't cause any further problems. Free WiFi is also available throughout the hotel which is great. We ate in the hotels restaurant for breakfast, their food was delicious and we ended up eating there every morning. The hotels tour operator was very helpful in explaining the cable cars to us and booking us wine tours which we very much enjoyed. The hotel is perfectly located for shopping, restaurants, cinemas and cable cars. All in all we relly enjoyed our stay here, it helped us fall in love with San Francisco. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Once Again Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: ccardnut
Reviews.Content: Last year we booked the Chancellor and the experience was delightful. So we decided to try again and we were not disappointed. The shopping,dining and transportation is readily available. I recommend Chancellor Hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise on Powell Street”
Reviews.Author: SandeeandAndrew
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor Hotel was a great choice for us. The location was perfect for many reasons. 1. Location right in the heart of the city; loved the big city atmosphere. 2. Trolly car stop right around the corner & tour bus stops as well. 3. Many restaurants, CVS stores close by which gave us many choices. 4. The Chancellor Hotel was quaint, very friendly staff & the restaurant in the hotel was excellent with the food & service. The whole stay we were treated as their guests & that is rare these days. When going to San Francisco for the first time I recommend the Alcatraz tour it was excellent. The hop on hop off bus is great but beware that all buses do not have a live person & they suck with out it. Before getting on a bus ask if the bus has the live person & if not it's worth waiting for the next bus especially going thru the city. They give you inside information that you wont get otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Top Dollar”
Reviews.Author: GreedyMessiah
Reviews.Content: Chronic jetlag isn't the best way to enter the towering hustle and bustle of Market St. San Francisco, and on arriving in Union Square, my first impressions weren't helped by my post flight (12 hours via London) state of mind. However, by Sunday, the magnificence of the city had been amplified by this wonderful charming hotel and its fantastic staff. There is also free passes to the excellent Square One gym on nearby Mason, the whole city of course is world class, and there is always something to do there. I also wish to compliment the fabulous restaurant staff, and the scrambled eggs are quite possibly the best in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & a Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: bike12345
Reviews.Content: Great location, very nice room. See background. Older hotel recently remodeled. Our room was small and faced Powell St (cable car line), so there was some street noise even though we were on the 10th floor. Wonderful friendly staff. If you have a car make sure you get a package deal with parking. The structure was a block away, but a great value compared to the up to $50 additional that you can pay for parking at some hotels. Fine location just off Union Square and as mentioned above, right on the cable car line. We did not try the dining room, but the small bar just off the lobby was very relaxed and a great deal with happy hour and a 2 for one drink coupon from the front desk. I would highly recommend this if you are interested in the Union Square area. BTW, if you like Japanese food, try the reasonably priced Maru Sushi, 529 Powell, just a block away.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: redqueeg
Reviews.Content: Myself & my Daughter stayed for 5 nights and loved it, the free cookies & tea/coffee went down a storm with her :) staff were great, spoke with Rory a couple of times asking directions and how best to get to places, nothing was too much trouble. just across the way from union square, cable car stops almost outside the door, a few blocks up from powell st station... easy walk with a wheeled case. wallgreens few doors away incase you need anything, liquor store round the corner if you want a couple of beers to take back. Ate at Sears next door among other places and found the Steak amazing :) rooms spotlessly cleaned everyday (thank you room attendent enjoy the mintballs) if i went back to san francisco without any question this is where i would want to stay. thank you for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint & Charming”
Reviews.Author: rhoward160
Reviews.Content: We enjoy our stay every time. Centrally located, within walking distance from just about anything you decide to do. The staff is fabulous.....always friendly & always willing to go above & beyond to help out. This is a jewel in the middle of the city.....we are so glad we discovered it. What a treasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great, well maintained old fashioned charm”
Reviews.Author: Dragonfly2
Reviews.Content: My young adult son and I stayed here for one night at the end of my birthday weekend, early February. Though a bit more expensive than deals at other boutique hotels in Union Square, the very positive reviews and ratings intrigued me and made me curious. The Chancellor's friendly, helpful staff, cozy charm, and clean old fashioned rooms were perfect. Watched the Super Bowl at the cute hotel bar, with elegant Irish bartender and other guests (all men except for me). Late dinner delivered, free of charge, from a nearby restaurant. Perfect stay! So glad I chose the Chancellor, and look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: hercapo
Reviews.Content: We travelled to San Francisco in August 2011 and stayed at the Chancellor Hotel for a week. All the staff we encountered were very helpful and extremely nice. The hotel is situated in Union Square and is right on the cable car line so getting around the city is a breeze. We also ate breakfast at Luque's restaurant located in the hotel and it was reasonably priced and very good. We asked for a quiet room and it's exactly what we got, we heard absolutely no noise at all. If we ever come back to San Francisco we would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A quiet sanctuary off of busy Union Square”
Reviews.Author: Jen C
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located right in the heart of Union Square, this charming little hotel was steps away from a myriad of restaurants, cafes, shopping options, and all methods of public transportation. The trolley stop is about 10 steps away -- passing right in front of the hotel, on Powell St.; and the BART (subway train) is less than a 5 minute walk. The staff -- from the front desk clerks, to the housekeeping, to the tour desk advisers, to the bartender -- were some of the friendliest people we encountered on our trip. And though the rooms were surprisingly small, the walls were thick and the room was quiet (other than the street noise, which was actually kind of soothing). Another fun perk: free coffee, cookies, and apples 24 hours a day down in the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location - perfect for the first time and repeat visitor”
Reviews.Author: Shona-Charlie
Reviews.Content: We are doing a round the world trip and staying in 5 hotels along the way. This was the lowest star rating but in fact from the moment I booked it until today (which is nearly 1 year on) this hotel has remained consistently as No 10 hotel in SF. Little wonder - it is in a perfect location so close to Union Square and with the cable car stop right outside. There has been lots said about the hotel before including small(ish) rooms, coffee in the lobby etc etc and it's all true so nothing I can add to that. For a first time (or repeat) visitor to the city this is a perfect hotel. We spoke with one member of staff who said that the owners have a policy of occupancy over rates and as a result the hotel is almost always full and they have never had to lay off staff. There are plenty bigger and more expensive chain hotels in the area and beyond but this hotel was a perfect base for us and we have thoroughly enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “great place, great location”
Reviews.Author: Justin R
Reviews.Content: The staff was excellent. We were in our room less than 15 minutes after arriving at the hotel. We had a couple of drinks in the small lounge. We had two different bartenders. Both of them were very helpful. Told us cool places to go for food and drink. The room is small but very cozy. Plenty large enough for a couple on vacation. The bed was very comfortable. The room had a huge bathtub. Now my girlfriend wants one that size at home. Location is perfect for whatever you want to do in the city. We will definitely be going back to The Chancellor.

Reviews.Title: “Good & comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: DorothyUgchelen
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights, the staff were efficient & friendly. The apples, water, coffee & cookies are nice touches. The room was a bit worn round the edges but the furnishings & bed were quite stylish & comfortable. I had an adjoining room & the first night was very noisy, the second was fine. The cable cars go past the front windows so it is not peaceful but it is very well situated, close to Union Square & public transport. I would definitely come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Union Square”
Reviews.Author: lena456
Reviews.Content: Cannot praise this hotel enough. Staff, Location, Rooms all excellent. The Tour desk was first class for information and booking trips and airport transfer etc. Spent 7 nights here and did something different every day. Right by Cable car stop. Was very sad to leave San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfy hotel”
Reviews.Author: castruml
Reviews.Content: We were not really familiar with the area but relied on some of the previous reviews. Most were spot on. My wife and I spent a long weekend at the Chancellor Hotel and were pleasantly surprised at being able to get just about anywhere within the city without having to depend on a car. We were able to get to where we wanted to go in the city using just about every mode of transportation within walking distance of this hotel. The room was small but clean, comfy and well maintained. Would have given it a better rating if the room was a bit larger. Everything in the hotel seemed undersized compared to some of the other hotels I have visited, but that's what gives this hotel it's character. Staff was knowledgeable and friendly. Was a plus to be able to buy tix for the cable car, trains, and buses from the lobby. Being downtown, and hopefully not sounding too insensitive, but be prepared to be hit up for change by the local hobos at least three times on every block. Overall we had a very positive experience and probably would stay here again on our next trip to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay on the Square!”
Reviews.Author: James D
Reviews.Content: I have stayed all over Union Square, and this is a gem! Very quaint and friendly hotel. Rooms with high ceilings, nice bath and great beds. everyone cant stay in a room with a view, but if you can, its a must. The rooms here are much better than the very popular hotel down the street and better than the one across the street. Those hotels have bigger bars and restaurants, but there is something about staying at the Chancellor. You can always walk down the street to the other bar or restaurant. You even get a drink token per day with your stay here. Very nice ;) Only drawback is the spa and pool is at a remote place, used as a complimetary feature with health Club around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value”
Reviews.Author: distractinwanderlust
Reviews.Content: Location is great if you want to stay downtown. It's across from the Sir Francis Drake Hotel (known for the Starlight Room). Safe area as it is a busy one, convenient to downtown and taxis, nice staff, reasonably priced (though I got a special deal through hotwire). It's rather outdated but still pretty cute, plus hopefully in SF you're spending more time outside than inside the hotel. Small bar with decent drinks (price and quality wise). Rooms and bathrooms are a bit small so if you have a large suitcase, think twice. 2 small rollers and 2 backpacks in a queen/king bed room were fine.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: celticolleen
Reviews.Content: I searched quite extensively to find a reasonably priced hotel in San Francisco. Finally decided on Chancellor. I was skeptical because the price was so reasonable, given its location. And I'm quite a picky person so I was prepared to be disappointed. The desk staff was wonderful! There was cucumber water, coffee, apples and cookies in the lobby at all times for guests. We paid the extra $6 a day for valet parking since the parking was already some of the cheapest in town. We went up the elevator to the 14th floor (I had requested a high room at the back as I am very sensitive to noise). We went into the room and was amazed to find that this was a suite! Bedroom, Living Room, and two FULL bathrooms!! The room was immaculately clean and tastefully decorated. The bathrooms had shampoo, conditioner, body lotion and rubber duckies!! The bed was comfortable, there was a small walk in closet, there were extra pillows and blankets in the closet. Small refrigerator, coffee maker in a little kitchen area. Desk in the living room. And a chair and table in the bedroom. Lots of drawers for putting stuff away. And a TV in each room. This meant my husband could watch TV in the living room whilst I read in the bedroom. And the location was right across the street from the St Francis and Sax Fifth. There was a Starbucks at the corner so we could grab breakfast. Union Square at the corner. Cable car runs right out front! I could still hear the cable cars but not very much. Earplugs were able to bring complete silence. This will be my home away from home in San Francisco from now on!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel - room could be noisy”
Reviews.Author: sun20
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location; the room is adequately sized; the facilities have been updated and the rooms have a fresh coat of paint; the people are very friendly and helpful. The only issue I have with this hotel is its thin wall. If you have a noisy neighbor, you can hear every conversation. Several people congregated at a room next to me in later evenings. One night pass the mid night I had to call the front desk to complain. High floors have less street noise; but the shower water tends to be small at high floors.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: f00dmama
Reviews.Content: A great small hotel right in the centre of union square, close to all the great shops ,trams running past outside.I have never been to a hotel before which has a pillow menu or umbrellas in the rooms.the staff were exceptional here as we had to organise faxs and so helpful,wonderful free cookies and coffee in the mornings,great value for money,will have to come back

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: David_and_Jill_8
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor is rather tired looking, we asked for a quiet room and were on the top floor, 15th. Our room was in need of decoration and to get into the room we had to squeeze in and out of the bathroom which was just inside the door. At 3am every morning a strange knocking noise could be heard and at 5am there was a clanging noise which may have been a water or heating system. We mentioned these noises to the management who said nothing could be done. The staff in the breakfast room were offhand and not particularly helpful. My husband had a duvet cover with a hole in it. We booked a tour through the hotel to Yosemite which, for various reasons, was very unsatisfactory. All in all it was a very disappointing stay and we couldn't really recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: martin_ebdon
Reviews.Content: Trying to find a hotel for our stay in San Francisco was a nightmare, I finally settled on the Chancellor Hotel, it was a good choice, itâ€™s a little old fashioned and that gives it character, service was good, rooms clean. Hereâ€™s a tip, breakfast time the hotel provides coffee, tea and lovely soft cookies FOC in reception, that really helped get the day started. Location wise its right on Powell Street, walk to the bottom of the hill and you can get the tram to the piers, the tram does stop right outside the hotel, but youâ€™ll be lucky if you can get on there with a family. Again, down the hill is Macys store with its roof top cheese cake restaurant/cafÃ© which we visited twice LOL. The start of China Town is just up the hill to the right on California Street. There are a couple of eateries nearby on Powell Street, a couple of independents and two Lories Dinerâ€™s one up the hill, one down the hill, all were fine. When it came time to pick up our hire car, Iâ€™d pre arranged pick up one block away at the National garage on Bush Street. All in all it couldnâ€™t have worked better and Iâ€™d stay at the Chancellor again without a moment hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Getaway”
Reviews.Author: leafygirl
Reviews.Content: The room was great--We were upgraded to a better room (at no charge). The rooms do not come with a fridge--but just ask! They were more then happy to get one for you. Huge bathtub and yes---there was a rubber ducky. Great value and location. A little noisy on the Union Square side. Jack hammers at 7 am sharp. :)

Reviews.Title: “Cozy place with great service and super location”
Reviews.Author: ChaiPure
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband on a recent weekend getaway. It's a small place, only about six or so rooms on a floor, and the rooms are small but user-friendly and comfortable. We never had to wait more than a minute for the elevator. The people at the bar and downstairs restaurant and very accommodating and the restaurant is good value compared to other places around there. Their eggs Benedict was supposed to be the house special, but because I'm a vegetarian the waiter offered to make it Florentine and very tasty it was! The bar also has a decent happy hour. The only drawback was our room didn't have a very good view -- maybe a room higher up (we were on the 6th floor) and/or maybe facing Union Square (but then you might have more noise). And it didn't have a fridge. The location is superlative, half a block from Union Sq., the Powell/Hyde cable car goes right past, and a lot of great restaurants and watering holes are within walking distance. One day we walked all the way to Pier One of the Embarcadero and then along the waterfront up to the Powell/Hyde cablecar for the ride back. A long walk but lots of fun. It was very brisk weather while we were there so we appreciated being able to duck out of the hotel and to have a choice of places to go within a three-block radius. While you're there check out the little concierge/gift stand in the lobby. Some very eclectic pieces there and some bargains -- I think the salesperson's mom collects stuff and then sells it through that place. I'd definitely stay here again, and the price was very reasonable given the quality, amenities and location.

Reviews.Title: “Third time was as good as the first two”
Reviews.Author: buck2904
Reviews.Content: We like this hotel because it feels like home, we always get good service and have never had anything to complain about. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “In the Heart of SF”
Reviews.Author: laudette
Reviews.Content: My daughter an I had a fun weekend in SF and this hotel was part of our memorable experience. The staff is so friendly and accommodating. The room while small had so much character and the bed was great along with the best pillows-even a body pillow was available. The complementary teas and coffee along with the cookies and apples made this place feel like home! And of course you are in the middle of everything.

Reviews.Title: “What a awesome week”
Reviews.Author: Rocky49009
Reviews.Content: If you want a great place to stay that is close to everything and transportation too. This is the charmer.. Its a little on the dated side, but...... There is 7 different pillows to chose from at no cost. The staff was outta this world friendly and helpful. The beds were great. The only thing I didn't care for was there was no fan in the restroom but other then that its 8 fingers and 2 thumbs up. Price was great to.. We purchased it on line. They take AAA. If you really want to save money to travel all over purchase a City Pass for 69 buck it also includes you to get into some of the attactions that you would have to pay seperate for.. Have fun!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “SF in January”
Reviews.Author: Paul D
Reviews.Content: This is a great small hotel on Union Square that my wife and I have been coming to yearly for the past few years. It is nice to see the save faces of the staff year after year,

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel in the Heart of Union Square”
Reviews.Author: PamK1
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the Chancellor matches all of our previous stays. We are welcomed at the door by the bellman and front desk personnel who are very helpful. The rooms are small as you would expect in an older, classic San Francisco hotel. They have the deepest tubs and rubber duckies to splash in the bubbles. Free wi-fi is great and faster than most hotels. The restaurant in the lobby is good for breakfast and not outrageously priced for a restaurant in San Francisco. I love that they have coffee, cookies and apples available 24/7 for the guests. Beds are comfortable but only queens, but they are upfront about this and since the rooms are smaller you would find it difficult to have a bigger bed. Great closets, with umbrellas to use if it rains. Just a friendly, comfortable, well located hotel in a fabulous city. We have been coming for over 20 years and still love it!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: simmyseal
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor is an amazing, lovely botique hotel with smallish(who cares..part of the charm,Perfect for couples) rooms that are clean and the bed and pillows are so comfy..just what you need after a big day sightseeing in SF. Many thanks to Wes Tyler and his staff. Special mention to Matt on front desk for his help with the internet station. Great location with so much to see and do right on your doorstep. We will be back and YES we would choose the Chancellor again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Ruwise77
Reviews.Content: We were here last year and I kept meaning to do a review and never got round to it. Watching a film about San Francisco reminded me that I must do this. Firstly before I even arrived The Chancellor had given me a great first impression as we ha booked our holiday for Fleet week without even knowing what it was and were surprised at how expensive the hotels were. Somebody suggested contacting The Chancellor to see if they had any offers or could do a special rate and they obliged. The room was very charming with nice touches like a rubber duck. It is also a fantastic location. However it was the warmth and friendliness of the staff that we most appreciated. We were there when the Giants were in the playoff's for the world series. My husband has always said he didn't like baseball but is a sports nut and so was interested in why the whole of SF seemed to be buzzing. We sat in the hotel bar 1 night to watch one of the games and the bellboy spent the night explaining all the rules to him. We left SF with a Giants baseball cap and my husband is now a baseball fan for life.

Reviews.Title: “Your best choice for this price”
Reviews.Author: wayne234
Reviews.Content: Overall a great place to stay, location, service, accommodation. Everything you need! I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Unique Hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: pennymay
Reviews.Content: We had a suite on the top floor and were amazed at the old architecture that surrounded the room. With the windows closed you could not hear the street noises but it was nice to hear the sound of the cable car going up and down Powell. The location was perfect to shop and to use the transportation system to do lots of sightseeing. The staff at the hotel, from the front clerks to the housekeeping, were very helpful, accommodating and friendly! We will definitely stay at this hotel on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Tzigane15
Reviews.Content: Absolutely perfect location....near to Union Square and also right next to a Tram stop. Cute, characterful room....little on the small side but I was fully expecting this and the room had all the key amenities. Lady on reception the day we checked out was charmless and blunt with me and lacked the friendliness of the lady who checked us in, but I'm from the UK so I'm more than used to this kind of customer services and I was amused rather than annoyed by her (not so sure that someone of a more sensitive disposition would have been as generous as me tho!!). Would definitely recommend the hotel despite this one-off tiny complaint!

Reviews.Title: “OK if it's all you can get.”
Reviews.Author: Happywalkabout
Reviews.Content: It's OK. No fridge, very tiny, pokey rooms. But if it's all that's available you can get by - it is at least clean and good location. We booked a twin room, we got to the hotel early and were told to come back as the room wasn't ready. When we came back but were given a king bed and told it was the last room left, despite having been sent away earlier. They then charged us for an extra cot. That's just not cool - but that's San Fran accommodation for you and I've learnt to not expect much better.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic deal on Union Sq”
Reviews.Author: skm22
Reviews.Content: If you're looking to stay in the heart of San Francisco (across the street from Saks 5th Ave) and want to pay a fraction for what the Westin (next door) will charge you .. then this is the hotel. Free internet, clean/cozy rooms, great service. Cant say enough about the location - Bank of America ATM right next to the main entrance, Walgreens on the same street, multiple car rentals companies at walking distance. Step outside and you're at the door to all the nice shopping places... In terms of the room itself .. our window overlooked union sq from the 15th flr so we had an amazing view though there is a ladder thing spoiling the view (didn't really care too much though). Each room comes with a portable heater and safe. They even threw in an umbrella in case you need one! Room service is quick/efficient and staff were polite. Ive stayed at many 5 stars but this 3 star hotel was one of my better stays.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality. Terrific Central Location”
Reviews.Author: TrinityG1
Reviews.Content: We loved our visit here. We couldn't have been more central, just off Union Square. The welcome was warm and hospitality gracious. Very comfortable rooms, a good bar and the all day coffee available in the foyer was very welcome. We would definitely stay here on our next trip to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Junit1988
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay here for 2 nights Great location easy to walk to everything. Great tour desk man helped us with so many requests even when they had nothing to do with tours! Front Desk where nice. Onething that wasn't great was no room service dinner on Sunday's - Wednesday but not a huge issue as plenty of dining around. Rooms are small but very nice had no problems at all, I didn't know the bathrooms where 'old' when I booked but didnt have any problems with it when I walked in, who spends their time in their room toilet anyway???

Reviews.Title: “Gracious Elegance & Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: alleycat76
Reviews.Content: I stumbled upon this hotel while searching for accommodations for a few of the Executive VPâ€™s from my company. Choices were slim because of 2 very big conferences going on in SF and since one of the VPâ€™s was a presenter, they needed to be within walking distance of the conference venues; which were right around Union Square. I usually put these guys in a Starwood hotel; however, that chain was completely booked; as were all of the other major hotels in the vicinity. I narrowed the choices down to a few hotels I hadnâ€™t heard of before, and checked the reviews on this site. The deciding factor was based on the fact that the manager, Wes Tyler, took the time to respond to the comments (both positive and negative) and also gave his direct contact info. & suggested getting in touch w/him if guests had any issues or concerns. I thought that was pretty outstanding & decided to test it out. Emailed him, let him know I was booking some Execâ€™s there for the first time and asked him if he could please help to make their stay as comfortable and pleasant as possible. He responded quickly and assured me he would make every effort to do so. And he did just that! They all came back and said their stay was great, absoultely no complaints, location was perfect, staff was gracious and the hotel was very charming. Thank you to Wes and the entire staff at the Chancellor Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable in every way”
Reviews.Author: Guy_North_Of_Hope
Reviews.Content: Our three night stay was perfect. Thanks for having the gym facilites near by as part of the package. With everything so close by (good food, a nice variety of bars, live music and the waterfront a short walk away), we can not imagine a better palce to stay in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: danieltt
Reviews.Content: Stayed her for 2 nights. Check in was quick and staff were attentive. Room was clean and very comfortable. Great Diner called Loris just outside the hotel and left, which i ate at every morning. This hotel is situated int he heart of union square. I did alot of shopping in Macys, Westfields, Levis and Nike Store. I also walked up the hil into Chinatown and onto Broadway. You can also get a cab to the Pier to see Alcatraz for around $12 so most of the major attractions are very close. Fantastic base for my first 2 days in San Fran. would definitlet stay there again. Didnt try the food or drink in the hotel as there is so many restaurants and shops nearby. reading other reviews i didnt find the noise of the trams etc a issue. I was facing the main road with a great view into Macys.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic choice”
Reviews.Author: bcm9114
Reviews.Content: Four day stay at Chancellor was wonderful. We love small boutique hotels and this one really fits the bill. Very well maintained, clean, with friendly, helpful staff in the best location. Convenient to cable cars, busses, etc. We used the valet parking and were glad we did. Allow 20-30 minutes for car delivery. Good coffee and cookies and fruit all day in the lobby. Our room was on 12th floor back corner so there wasn't much of a view but we weren't there for the view. A front room would have a great view toward Union Square but might be noisier. Our room was completely quiet. Small, cozy rooms with tiny bath but very well cared for and clean. We would certainly choose this hotel again. We skipped the touristy Sears Fine Foods but it is right next door for those who want to wait in line for breakfast. The hotel breakfast was very good and we took advantage of an offer to purchase a $20.00 coupon for food or drinks for just $10.00. With that, a nice breakfast for two cost only $10.00 plus appropriate tip. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect situation”
Reviews.Author: CazB45
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very comfortable and has all the amenities I would expect. It is situated in a perfect position, the trolley cars pass right at the front door and for a small fee you can buy a three day pass and they'll take you wherever you want to go. Union Square is only about half a block away. We found most things very close by or within very easy reach.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Laurence_and_Trudi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chancellor Hotel for 3 nights in January 2012. The Chancellor is a really nice "cute" hotel, with an excellent location, right across the road from Union Square on Powell Street (a great street with lots of shops, and the Cable Cars going up and down all day!). The rooms are really nice; quite small, but with a quaint and cute feel. Very comfortable bed, with a pillow menu of a full range of different pillows to try! There is a bar and restaurant in the hotel, but we didnt try these as there are so many options all around you on Powell Street. There is a Lories Diner a few doors down for a great breakfast! So, the Chancellor is a good value, nice clean hotel, with an excellent location. We'd stay here again, and we'd recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: becbec123
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor is a nice traditional hotel that seems to have had a bit of a make over. The location is good, very convenient for cable cars, BART and buses to fishermans wharf and most other places. The rooms were very clean and had all the facilities you would want. The pillow menu looked great although sadly didn't have time to take advantage of this! Good location for shopping and also close to China Town.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: irishgirlie2010
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the basis of reviews I had read and was a little nervous as we had never been to SF before and I was worried about location, and some reviews people had left following my booking about hotel being old etc... But I have to say this was a great hotel experience for both my husband and I and I really don't know why some people seemed to comment negatively. This hotel is charging 3.5 star prices with 4.5 star cleanliness, staff, location. We had our iPad with us during our stay at beginning of January and used it all the time no Internet problems (we stayed 6 nights). The location is fantastic, right in heart of downtown, across from union square. We took the Bart in from SFO and the stop was right at bottom of powell street. Perfect. The only slight slight flaw was no fridge, but I can live with that. They had ice so we just filled ice bucket and put our water/juice in here. Well done Chancellor Hotel. I've already recommended you twice this week.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in the middle of San Fran”
Reviews.Author: Emma071
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 3 girlfriends for 4 nights in January. It was a great base for seeing the city. There is a Walgreens just up on the corner, the cable car stops out the front and the hop on hop off bus leaves just down the road. The tour desk in the hotel was very helpful. The rooms are small but modern and well equipped. I would come back again. Ps the candy jar in the rooms is super cute!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, would recommend without hesitation”
Reviews.Author: Larysa23
Reviews.Content: I had booked a road trip across Arizona, Nevada and California and this hotel was recommended to me by a friend from work as the perfect way to regain some comfort into my life after a week of roughing it. She was definitely right. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. I had been in contact with the hotel reservation desk prior to my visit and they answered all my questions without any hesitation and during my visit all the staff throughout the hotel were very pleasant and accommodating.The room itself was very welcoming, clean and comfortable and the little touches like the bowl of sweets and the little rubber duck both made me smile. The hotel is perfectly centrally situated for a visit to San Francisco. I would not hesitate to book this hotel again and would recommend it to anyone planning a visit to SF, especially if you're not so keen on the large, commercial hotel chains.

Reviews.Title: “I Would Definitely Return to This SF Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lynnja
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Chancellor Hotel in SF from December 31st - January 3rd. There were 2 adults in our party and we booked a room with 2 twin beds. We absolutely loved this hotel. Our stay @ the Chancellor came at the tail end of a nearly 10 day trip to the Bay Area so we were looking for clean yet comfortable accommodations. We were very happy that we chose to stay @ the Chancellor. First off, the location cannot be beat. If you are a tourist looking for a good home base in city from which to start your exploration and site seeing, this is a wonderful spot. The hotel is centrally located to NUMEROUS modes of public transit - i.e. the Powell-Mason cable car line stops in front of the hotel, it's about a 5 minute walk to the Powell Street BART station (goes directly to SFO which is approximately 40 minutes away), the Market and 5th area is a cluster for many buses and street cars, etc. It's so easy to get around from here. And please do not think that it'll be noisy in your hotel room given that you're so close to all the action. Our room overlooked the front of the hotel -Powell Street - and I was amazed at how well our window blocked out the sounds of the people, of the cable cars, etc. I was so impressed with the sound proofing of the window. SIDEBAR: A helpful note to 1st time travelers to SF: the city has an impressive web of mass transit. However, unlike NYC where all the city buses are all with the MTA, SF has multiple transit agencies that oversee its public transportation and they don't necessarily cross honor each other's tickets. So the best route is to purchase a Clipper card from a Walgreens or similar retailer as that is card is rechargeable and accepted by all the transit agencies (BART, MUNI, etc.). It is also worth noting that steps away from the hotel is a Walgreens pharmacy and 7-11 (which surprisingly sold deliciously fresh glazed donuts - so good that they rival NYC's beloved Krispy Kreme). There's tons of other shopping near the hotel - Macy's, Sack's Ross, etc. Second, the staff was very pleasant and helpful. They were always friendly and willing to answer all our questions. Third, the Chancellor has the wonderful feel of a boutique hotel without the designer price tag. I myself am not a big fan of the gigantic convention center-esque hotel experience. The Chancellor feels so intimate. The hotel was originally opened in 1914 and the decor is reflective of that era. So though the lobby may not be flanked with flat screen TVs and sleek modern furniture, the property appears to be well maintained. My friend and I did quite a bit of research before booking here and found that the prices of the Chancellor were some of the most affordable in the area. Having now stayed at the hotel, we know that we didn't sacrifice any quality for the price. Fourth, the hotel is clean with comfortable amenities. I do want to caution folks that in a dense city like SF or New York, your typical hotel room will tend to run pretty small. The size of our room at the Chancellor was modest, but we never felt like we were on top of each other. It was definitely a plus that our room came with a walk in closet. The bathroom had a glorious classic bathtub that's perfect for soaking. The room came with free WiFi internet as well. There were also wonderful little perks like free coffee and tea and cookies in the lobby throughout the day. If we had to, one SMALL issue we did have was with how the elevators (of which there are 2) were rather slow at times. And even this was not a big issue at all. All in, we loved our time in San Francisco and loved our time at the Chancellor hotel. We would definitely return to the Chancellor and would not have any qualms in recommending this place to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Location and price point is great, BUT.......Not a hotel if you need real internet”
Reviews.Author: tman12
Reviews.Content: I agree with every other review about location....couldn't be better and price is good. Here is the good... Staff is friendly and helpful; breakfast price is reasonable for a hotel and was good; free coffee,tea and cookies; hotel is relatively clean; complimentary use of gym around the corner (they don't appear to advertise this, but if you ask, they will tell; good bed with nice sheets. Now of the not so good....Internet is free but not adequate to run skype, hotel knows this and says that is why don't charge for it; you have controls for heat in the room,but they don't control the heat, you need to use a portable heater, which they provide. They told me the hotel runs on a boiler and only comes on when hotel is cold (the hallway is warm and my room is cold, so there is heat somewhere); the hotel is old and looks old...old electrical outlets, layers of paint over old stucco walls, old doors. To be fair, you get what you pay for and they deliver what you pay for. I am writing this review in the lobby, because the Internet is way too slow in room.

Reviews.Title: “A san Francisco gem”
Reviews.Author: Maureen N
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel, good value for money and generously gives you the extras: free WiFi, complmentary tea, coffee, fruit and cookies all day, a range of newspapers to read, lollies in the rooms and cheap drinks every evening during happy hour. It is in an excellent location and I would highly recommend it to anyone spending a few days in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reliably good and always improving”
Reviews.Author: paula_leftluggage
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a newly renovated queen room at the Chancellor for 3 nights in August 2011. Due to a busy travel schedule I am only now getting around to writing a review. Our room was small but well-designed and comfortable, with 2 easy chairs as well as the bed and desk. It was very clean. We have stayed here on multiple occasions over about 15 years, and are always impressed with the pleasantness and attentiveness of the reception staff, and the very good upkeep of the hotel. It is also nice that there is a cafe in the lobby and and always a bowl of apples in the lobby. There are newer and fancier places to stay in San Francisco, but the location could not be better, and the reliability of this hotel counts for a lot! Also, very few hotels have 2 comfortable chairs in guestrooms, and one person has to sit on the bed---not the case here!,

Reviews.Title: “Cannot believe the value - wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Wanderingjen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Chancellor Hotel for 5 nights in Dec- Jan 2011-12. It was wonderful. I picked based on trip advisor. I don't know how anyone has ever had a problem with it - it exceeded my high expectations. I cannot really add much to what has been said. Rooms are perfectly adequate in size. Bed, television, chairs and a little room for your suitcase. They're not big, but if you've been to Europe, they're bigger than that. I requested a view of union square up high - was aware i might get a little noise but the windows block a lot out (except for the San Francisco noises you want to hear, like cable cars and soft bugle playing!) and this stopped by the time i was headed to bed. I had a lot more noise on the out skirts of New York. Also the view of Union Square was wonderful, and I loved knowing where I was. I was on the 11th floor but up higher might get an even better view. The quality of housekeeping and furnishings is excellent. For the price I was blown away by what we received. The service from staff was the best I received from our stay. Check in, check out, porter, tour desk, everything was great. Yes the bathroom is small, but I don't know who wants to spend time in their bathroom. I will stay here again in a heartbeat and recommend it to anyone who wants somewhere clean, central, not too expensive and focused on making the experience great for guests. Location cannot be beat. Public transport in SF is incredible. I was able to shop as a young female on my own into the evening because we were so close to the stores and a lot of foot traffic around. Really hope that the Chancellor doesn't change - the price, the quality of service and the rooms are everything I hoped for. Tips: 1. We requested a fridge as soon as we arrived and it was delivered promptly. What a great free service! 2. The tour desk sells MUNI passes - we got our moneys worth as the hills of SF are killer, and sometimes it's very easy to hop on a bus/trolley. 3. The cable car stops basically outside, but at peak tourist time (or at least when we were there) the line up to get on them is insane, so we didn't try to use it. 4. You can catch the BART to Powell St station for $8.10 from the airport - pretty cheap if you're on your own or in a pair. That said, it's about a 7-10 minute walk up a gentle-moderate slope with tourist traffic and lights. It is certainly doable, but I had 2 suitcases so it wasn't a stroll in the park. But if you're able bodied and want to save money, do it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and an ideal hotel for exploring the city”
Reviews.Author: NicolaandChris
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of May and found it a great place for exploring San Fran. It's right on the tram line that goes down to the bay and it's close to restaurants and bars in the union square area. The rooms were smallish but clean and had everything we needed. Loved the pillow menu and the infamous bath duck!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy environment but it got better...”
Reviews.Author: fantasia112
Reviews.Content: Very noisy work in next door building. We got moved from 9th floor to 14th floor within minutes. Got upgraded to a suite in the process. Very professional handling of the situation. We had a good night of sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, excellently located with good sized rooms”
Reviews.Author: Taylor B
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean, of generous proportions and well stocked with hotel amenities. The personalised rubber ducks were a quirky touch, and good for a souvenir upon returning home. Staff were generally helpful, although seemed as if they were preoccupied in some instances. Sometimes staff were caught leaning or playing on mobile phones when guests were seemingly requiring service. The fresh fruit and cookies in the lobby each day were appreciated and make a good morning or afternoon snack. The location of the Chancellor is excellent - right in the heart of Union Square, only 1.6 miles down to fisherman's wharf and a stones throw away from Macy's, Bloomingdale's, Saks's and Nordstrom for any shopping requirements. Just over the hill from this hotel is Chinatown - this precinct is well worth the visit, where cheap eats, interesting shops and traditional culture still abound. Requesting a room at the rear of the hotel is worth it if you are a light sleeper. Additionally, the mattresses are of a good quality, and coupled with the extensive pillow menu, one should get a good sleep in any of the Chancellors room. In all, the price of this hotel, its central location and reasonably attentive staff make this hotel excellent for both families and the business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay!”
Reviews.Author: LauraJayne3
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Chancellor Hotel - I only wish we could have stayed longer! The only downsides - some of which are mentioned by other guests - cannot be helped due to the location of the hotel. Self parking is offsite at a lot around the corner, views are not great for each room and the rooms themselves are on the small side (though decorated wonderfully!) Keep in mind that the hotel is situated right next to Union Square and thus does not have much room. But because of the location, it's a half a block walk to the giant Macy's and shopping centers in Union Square (we could see the big Xmas tree from our room) and just a few blocks from the cable car turnaround and Chinatown. There's also a cable car stop directly outside the hotel. The have a cozy lobby bar, free cookies on arrival, candy jars and rubber duckies in the room and a pillow menu. All the staff we encountered were friendly and professional. The windows opened and we spent part of the evening enjoying a breeze while listening to a gentleman in the Square playing Xmas jazz music! The Chancellor was a charming hotel in a fantastic location for a very, very reasonable price. If we stay in the Union Square area in the future, the Chancellor will be where we stay!

Reviews.Title: “The Chancellor”
Reviews.Author: Anne33388
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff, clean room and a great location. It is not a quiet location but, it is where the action is happening. So you have to weigh your pros and cons. For us it was perfect. Not for families.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: pjbfilm
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here serveral times. For location and value, it is the best in the city. Service is outstanding. Rooms are always clean and nice. Coffee and Cookies all day long.... just the best....

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay In SF”
Reviews.Author: Redlands_CAFoodie
Reviews.Content: Went for New Year's weekend and had a great experience. is this a small hotel with small rooms? Yes. But, the location, price and friendly staff make it a fun place to stay. It has the feel of a European hotel with very personal service. The concern voiced in a previous review about interior noise was not an issue for us. However, I have had the same problem in 4-star hotels so it is not unique to the Chancellor. Taken together, this is a great little hotel that makes a visit to San Francisco quite memorable and I can't wait to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good but beware!”
Reviews.Author: SamVancouver
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 5 night stay which included New Year's Eve. Without a doubt, I agree with fellow reviewers on The Chancellor's greatest asset, which is it's location. If you like Union Square and it's wonderful ambiance and proximity to transportation, shopping and all other wonderful sights, then without a doubt you will not find a better deal. The rooms are very well kept for their age and very clean. However, if you have issues with noise, keep this in mind. Outside noise is not the big issue as the windows keep most of the din at bay but the interior noises like doors closing, toilets flushing and neighbors talking.....you will hear them all and loud. You may be fortunate to have quieter travelers next door, it will make it your stay better. Otherwise, SF is literally outside this hotel's doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in the perfect location!!”
Reviews.Author: FMBChicago
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a unique place to stay in SF this is definitely the place to go! My fiance and I stayed here for the weekend to celebrate his birthday and we couldn't have asked for more special attention. I contacted the hotel manager, Wes a few weeks before to arrange a few surprises for my fiance. They took care of every detail, which helped to make it his best birthday ever! The location of the hotel is great too. You are right in the middle of everything. Parking was easy and we were right next to the cable car stop. Forget about staying at nearby chain hotels, the Chancellor is definitely the way to go. Thanks again Wes!!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected, cheaper than expected of a Union Square location!”
Reviews.Author: Rybas
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised that you can stay in a nice hotel in this price range right in the center of SF. My room was small but adequate, the view from the window quite breathtaking, the breakfast was fine. All in all, a good place to stay for a budget-mindful tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: denyse86
Reviews.Content: The title says it all..... you really cant beat the location of this hotel, it is in the centre of all the action and right by the tram stop. On first impressions I was really disappointed with the hotel, the rooms are very small as is the bar, but I very quickly warmed to its querky nature and weighed up the fact that for the price we paid, the hotel was very good. We were on a high floor overlooking union square which was lovely and quiet. The bell boy was very very helpful not only in bringing our luggage promptly to our room but also spending a long time with us looking at a map and giving us advice on restaurants and bars. He was also very helpful in recommending where we should NOT go, especially at night time. The beds at The Chancellor were super comfy and we really appreciated the complimentary coffee and cookies in the foyer everyday. The front desk staff were also exceptionally helpful when we encountered a problem with a tour that we had booked to Napa valley. There is a huge variety of places to eat in San Francisco we tried Johns Steakhouse for AMAZING steak, The Stinky Rose (which is a tourist trap and seriously over rated), and B44 which was fantastic for paella and spanish style food and lovely wine. If you are looking for a clean, homely place to stay that is simple and not flashy then this is a good option.
