Just beware there is no air con, we stayed in October and were fine but not sure that it would have been quite so good in the heat!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique and Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Berkshire_Ben
Reviews.Content: Steeped with history this charming hotel is set on Union square, a perfect location for exploring SF. From our window we could see SAKs and Maceys, lit my Girlfriends eyes up! Friendly staff, good sized rooms, great customer service and free cookies on reception. If its modern all glass hotels yoou are looking for then you will be dissapointed by the Chancellor, if its charming, small, boutique hotel in a great loaction then you WONT be dissapoinnted! Thansk to all the staff at the Chancellor for making our stay so nice :-)

Reviews.Title: “What a gem”
Reviews.Author: JudyGSanDiegoCA
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel by other reviews. I was a little worried but no need to be. We have stayed in alot of high end hotels & the Chancellor is a very nice boutique hotel. The room is small but it has all you need. The bed is so comfortable & they have great pillows. I always have a problem with hotel pillows as they seem to never be soft & comfortable but theirs are. The real bonus is the ceiling fan. We have a ceiling fan at home & always miss it when traveling. This is one of the only hotels we've stayed in with one. The location is great - a couple blocks from all the shopping at Union Square. It is right on the cable car line to get to Fisherman's Wharf. Also, Starbucks is right across the street. The Chancellor is a very good deal for the price. Staff is very courteous & helpful. We will definitely stay here when we return to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Cherry Choice the Chancellor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bdbc
Reviews.Content: First rate stay at the Chancellor Dec.21-22. Arrived early afternoon and unloaded our bags right in front in their load zone. Bellman very friendly and helpful. Front desk staff very nice and prompt. Held our bags, room wasn't quite ready. We received a free upgrade to a fabulous suite 1502. Warm colors living room, full bath spotless, coffee and refrig. area nice plus. Seperate large bedroom, wonderful queen featherbed/pillows, full bath. Glorious view of Union Square Christmas tree, ice skating rink, decorated Macy's. Fresh coffee and warm bake cookies everyday in the lobby nice touch. Location is fantastic. Will definitely stay at the Chancellor again.

Reviews.Title: “Chancellor: Excellent Holiday getaway”
Reviews.Author: nwebb
Reviews.Content: A trip across the bay to San Francisco, Christmas/Chanukah getaway on Union Square seemed like the thing to do. After studying many hotels on tripadvisor, I picked the Chancellor Hotel, for location, price and quality. It met all my needs, including walking distance from BART. Arrived at 3, had a pleasant evening in town, and we were home by the same time next day. The staff were welcoming and friendly, they gave me my preferred room, top floor rear (decided on because of the noise reported by others) and the room was small but charming. The bed was very comfortable, and there was a pillow menu which we didn't take advantage of. The room did have a slight smell, cleaning fluid? The windows were open, and the smell wasn't too bad; my husband didn't even notice. If it had bothered me I would have asked for another room. Open windows were a plus since we don't like it too warm at night. Loved the green accent wall, the rubber ducky in the bathroom and very nice shampoo/conditioner/lotion (organic no less). Loved the bar and bartender Rory, where we took advantage of a two-for-one coupon and happy hour to have a relaxing drink - Rory was very friendly. Hotel is 1/2 block from Union Square, which was alive with people, ice skaters, music, performers, a giant Christmas tree and the lighting of the first Chanukah candle on a giant menorah. The shops were decorated, Macy's had a wreath in every window. We walked all over. In the morning, Sears Fine Food is just up the block, a famous breakfast somehow I've never sampled. We decided to try that instead of using the 20% off coupon for Luques, found on the hotel website. Luques looked good too, next year maybe we'll try that. Great place for a mini-mini vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: RobAngMichigan
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night after a few nights at Fisherman's Wharf. Great location for Union Sq and downtown. Lots to do and many bars and places to eat nearby. Hotel is older, but well maintained, with great staff. Got the parking package, which incuded parking in a nearby underground garage.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: Pati-chueca
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel, very well located in Union Square, great to go shopping and eating. The rooms are clean, the staff is really polite, in general a good experience. The hotel doesnt have a parking, so you have to first park in front unload your luggage and leave it with the bell boy at reception or bring it already to your room and then go and park the car. The garage is a public one that also serves the hotel, and is like a block away, so this might be a problem for some people, for us it was ok. The rooms are tiny, really little, and as we had lots of luggage, that wasnt optimal, but we managed. The hotel is not new, but well kept and clean. The hotel also doesnt have a restaurant, there is a restaurant there but doesnt belong to the hotel, so if you want, you can have breakfast there and they even will charge it to the room, but is a separate business. I will not recommend it though, because we had breakfast there twice and you have to wait FOREVER to get your food. So if you are staying here, I would recomend you to go the Cafe du Paris that is very close (great breakfast) or next door, there is a great place, a little expensive, but with a wide range of options, very nice food and efficient service. All in all a good place to stay in San Francisco, not so expensive and central.

Reviews.Title: “Decent But Not Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: ColinTheGreat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Chancellor for several nights in mid-December 2011. The hotel is definitely nice and it's in a good location, but I don't think it's spectacular in any way. That is to say, nothing really stood out as being above average. The staff was helpful, the Internet connection was slow, the room was clean. I didn't eat at the hotel's restaurant because the menu was decidedly unimpressive. I'd stay there again but I'm going to check out some of the many other hotels in the neighborhood before I do.

Reviews.Title: “I keep coming back”
Reviews.Author: Jeff D
Reviews.Content: I keep wanting to try a different hotel in The City to try a different experience, but I keep coming back to The Chancellor Hotel for its friendly atmosphere, great location and excellent value. The Luques restaurant is convenient for breakfast or lunch, and there is a cordial atmosphere in the lobby bar. The friendly staff can't be beat for a relaxed hotel stay, and the added amenities are great (such as the pillow menu).

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Mariel S
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights. The staff is really helpful (especially when I asked for directions) and they are really awesome at doing everything to make you feel comfortable. The room I got was very clean and comfortable. I love the nice little touches they put there (like the candy jar) to ensure that you feel right at home. There is no fridge but they do have an ice machine if ever you need to drink something cold. There's also a coffee maker at the lobby so if you need your coffee fix you can get it there (help yourself with some delicious cookies while you're down there too! :P) It was a bit cold in SFO when I went there, so the fan was enough for me. They housekeeping team also did a good job in cleaning everything while I was out sight seeing. The location is very good, it's central to everything. And if you like to shop like me, you'll be grateful that you're smacked right in Union Square. It's quite the shopping heaven if you ask me :P I guess the only thing they can improve on is the wifi connection. My internet was very unstable so I couldn't surf any longer than 5 minutes. If you need to use it really bad though, there's a Starbucks near there. Oh and Macy's also has free wifi. Other than that, I had a great stay here. I highly recommend staying at this hotel :D

Reviews.Title: “Don't just listen to the hype about the Chancellor!”
Reviews.Author: connieamethyst
Reviews.Content: Take advantage of the hype! You'll be proud of yourself for being so smart. Friendly, smiling and helpful staff throughout the whole hotel - Voula, Olga, JeSara, Rory, Karla, Harris, Alicia at the bar, Mao in the restaurant, as well as our housekeeper, and the engineer who got the heat going nicely in our room. We hadn't been to San Francisco in 2 years, but Rory and Alicia remembered us! The rooms are beautiful with very comfortable beds and pillows, flat screen tv's, roomy closet with a safe, and an umbrella to borrow in the case of rain. Bath salts are provided for soaking in the huge bathtub after a day of enjoying the greatness of San Francisco. I'm kicking myself for forgetting to bring home my rubber ducky from the bathroom to commemorate my birthday trip and great stay! The lobby is cozy, with delicious cookies and coffee available throughout the day. We had breakfast at Luques twice, and it was very good. Our waiter Mao used to live in my hometown - small, small world. We had an especially good time with him. This location is absolutely excellent. Cable car a few steps from the front door. Great shopping in Union Square a few steps. 24 hour Walgreen's a few steps. Chinatown just 3 or 4 blocks. At the tour counter in the lobby, be sure to get your Muni pass for unlimited rides on the city's great transportation system including cable cars, buses, and streetcars. Great bus routes and the F-line streetcar are quite convenient to the hotel. An e-mail to the wonderful Mr. Wes Tyler prior to my birthday visit last week resulted in an unexpected upgrade to a 2-room suite on the top floor, with a view of Union Square, as well as welcoming gifts in the room - a birthday card, a picture frame, champagne and flutes. So thoughtful. So gracious. Wow and double wow. San Francisco is wonderful, and I look forward to many more visits. I use the word great many times in this review. This hotel, the city and its people deserve all the "greats" I give to them. And I'm so grateful to tripadvisor and fellow travelers for helping me to find this gem of a hotel. If a clean, cozy, charming older building with beautiful rooms, modern amenities, dedication to service and a great location appeals to you, you're home here. It's 5 stars in our book. I won't consider staying anywhere else in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Better than ever”
Reviews.Author: lizone
Reviews.Content: Well, I'm back again and this place just keeps getting better each time. The lobby has been refurbished since I was here last . A new look but the same wonderful service from everyone I encountered. We requested the same room as our last visit and that was arranged and also requested a fridge in the room and that was waiting for us as well along with a nice welcome gift. Took advantage of the pillow menu and the bed was just right. Spent one day walking absolutely everywhere and a soak in the very deep bath tub was just what I needed. Once again we ate breakfast in the restaurant each day and loved it. This place is perfectly located and is really good value. Looking forward to our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an amazing location.”
Reviews.Author: MOTAtascadero
Reviews.Content: Our family of four really loved this hotel. We chose adjoining rooms, one with a queen bed for us and the other with twin beds for our girls. What a perfect arrangement. The rooms were smaller than we are used to, but they were totally fine....especially for the amount of time you spend in the room. The bathrooms were small, so there really was no room for two people to be using the sink/mirror at the same time like in other hotels. Not really a big deal for us. We were in rooms 1200 and 1201 and had great views of Union Square. My girls and I loved hearing the city noises, but my husband was bothered by it a bit. All of the staff was great, especially Jesara at the front desk who helped me a ton with reservations, etc. We requested a fridge in our room and it was there in record time. The valet parking worked well, as long as you remembered to request your car 25 minutes or so in advance. The only complaint was trying to find the right temperature for the rooms. It was often cold and hard to get to warm up with the wall thermostat. We did use the inroom portable heaters, but they made the room too hot. Again, not that big of a deal, but it was a bit of an issue. I would stay here again and again and again. We went in early December 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Staff is horrible.”
Reviews.Author: 2plank
Reviews.Content: Our first impression- Olga (per her name badge) at the check-in counter provided some of the worst customer service I've seen yet. She was rude, moved at glacial speed, and never once smiled or said thank you. The room was small but well decorated. The bathroom was clean but needed some updating. The hotel's only restaurant- our last impression, reaffirmed the title of our review. The staff was pleasant but borderline incompetent. The restaurant was empty, yet my wife actually got up, walked out to the main lobby and poured her own coffee from the welcome desk because the staff ignored us for 15 minutes. When our food arrived, it was decent, with the exception of the bacon with looked to be about 4 days old. Needless to say, we won't return.

Reviews.Title: “Still a Fan of the Chancellor Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mailgirl
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at the Chancellor Hotel. I was just as happy with my time here on this trip as I was before. Since this was a longer stay, I had a chance to take advantage of the hotel bar and restaurant. I had breakfast at Luque's twice and the service was prompt and the prices reasonable. It's nice to not have to look for a place to eat before heading out for the day. It's also nice to be able to hit Happy Hour at your own hotel before heading to a show. While it's not a large hotel, it gives you more of that feeling of going back to your own apartment at the end of the day than that sterile feeling you sometimes get from a larger property. It's not unusual for me to get tired of a hotel after a few days, but that did not happen at the Chancellor. It's in a perfect location when you are using public transportation to get around. Same as last time, all the employees I came in contact with were friendly and helpful. I asked for a refrigerator this time and it was very handy to have. It was brought up to the room as soon as I checked in and I didn't have to wait around. Everything in the room worked and my room location on the side of the building was very quiet. The bed was comfortable and I had no problem falling right to sleep. Again, I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to someone looking for a hotel with a great location, good price and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location, and experience”
Reviews.Author: SunSnorkelTan
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Chancellor Hotel and had a great experience. The rooms were small but very clean and well maintained. The fact that you could actually take a bath and soak was a bonus after a late night on the town. Most hotel bath tubs aren't very deep, this one was perfect. The room decor was fresh and modern and the furnishings in good shape. My only complaint was our too-soft mattress and my sore back in the morning. The front desk told me if we were staying longer they could have added something to our mattress that would have made it firmer (next time!). Breakfast was a good value and very tasty. The bellmen were very helpful and everyone we dealt with provided excellent service. We normally stay at the Hyatt on the Embarcadero, but for the price and overall great experience we'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: DWBKY
Reviews.Content: Have stayed several times in the Union Square, but this was the first time at the Chancellor. Lots of character. Rooms are well equipped, wireless was good (and free!), good bed, ceiling fan, LCD TV. Windows open to take advantage of great weather. Ate breakfast at restaurant not once, but twice. Great food and awesome service. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great once again”
Reviews.Author: dragonlady2411
Reviews.Content: This is our third stay in San Francisco and the second at the Chancellor Hotel. On our first visit we stayed at Fisherman"s Wharf, which is fine, but prefer the Union Square area. We were able to check in just after 12, which was a bonus and the check out time of 12 is also very generous, and it allowed us to pack leisurely and then leave our bags at the hotel, as we had a late evening flight. Having stayed in many English and European hotels, we find the room size here fine and we certainly weren't falling over each other. The bed is large and very comfortable, the closet large enough to both hang clothes and store some of our luggage, and there is the ususal TV, desk, table and chairs. The bathroom is very compact, but has everything you need, including a deep, long tub. The toiletries provided were plentiful and of good quality. I especially appreciated the free wifi. My husband would have liked to have a kettle in the room but we understand that this is not possible, and I found the coffee provided in the lobby to be the best I've found in American hotels. The location of the Chancellor was excellent for shopping, transport and dining and within walking distance of many other areas. For the price we paid, we are very happy with what this hotel offers, and would recommend it to anyone visiting San Francisco. Wes Tyler, the manager, responds to any correspondence quickly and was able to honour our request for the room we wanted and to have a fridge.

Reviews.Title: “The most fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: RMS83
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! A little small in size but we were hardly in the room. The hotel is located on Powell street, right in the heart of Union Square. The shopping was just fantastic with Macy's just across the street and restaurant and cafes all a few minutes away. We didn't bother with the breakfast in the hotel as there was a great breakfast cafe next door (can't remember the name though) and Starbucks was right across the street. Another charming thing about Powell street is that the tram runs through this street so it was very interesting to see it every time it went by. We loved that the hotel had free flow of coffee (not so good) and cookies (awesome!) which we enjoyed. Overall a lovely hotel and would surely return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location off Union square.”
Reviews.Author: charlottetate
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for a week in The chancellor Hotel in room 1408 which was a suite consisting of two rooms one with a nice bedroom area and bathroom. The other consisting of Another bathroom and Lounge area. The hotel was just off union square .The only downside was the view from out windows was off the back of the hotel. We did not eat in the hotel but The bar and restaurant looked nice, Staff in reception where always happy to help. There was free coffee and cookies in the area which was good. There was a nice cocktail bar called harry Denton Starlight bar and also scalars Restaurant which was good. The cable cars were very close but often full. I would stay at this hotel again as a great location for all San Francisco has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: travellingwoman2222
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located. Although the rooms are small, they are big enough to fit your luggage bags as each room has a little walk in wardrobe that can fit all your luggage. I found this place to be quite comfortable. The price is great for the excellent location! A short walk to Chinatown, Fisherman's Wharf and all the major shopping centers.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for price, comfort and LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: jreidvt
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable rooms; friendly, helpful staff; a cable car right out the front door. Center of the shopping district, easy and fun ride to the waterfront and other sights.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in this price range”
Reviews.Author: Eduardo M
Reviews.Content: Perfect. Clean. Very well located and with a friendily and professional staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very good service, nice room”
Reviews.Author: patm82
Reviews.Content: You can't beat this location, it's right next to the famous cable car. Room size is adequate and it was clean. Nothing to complain at all. It's not the cheapest hotel, but reasonably priced for it's location and standard.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT START TO OUR TRIP”
Reviews.Author: William5290
Reviews.Content: We where a group of 16 on a 2 week tour of the USA from Australia. this hotel is in an excellent location. the staff were more than helpfull getting our group into there rooms early,bar on site was great, bed and room facilities were excellent all our group had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem! Excellent Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: Adhitia H
Reviews.Content: Great location, Union square SF. almost all destination are walking distance from there, close to public transport, cable car just steps away, hop on hop off bus just a block away. I would say this is a hidden gem, room was excellent, old hotel but they maintain it well. Pillow menu is remarkable!, plenty to choose from. Service was great, quick and full of smile. receptionists are very helpful during our stay. I had a bit of situation with my missing luggage in the airport. Seems they know what they are doing.. they managed and keep monitoring my luggage arrival via airline delivery service. Concierge service was excellent!, they arranged my airport transfer straight away without hassle, giving a great tips about travel timing, etc. One downside: the bar/cafe area is a bit dark and not inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, somewhat small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Travellel
Reviews.Content: Chancellor Hotel on Union Square in SF is located just a block away from the Union square and 10-15 min walk from Chinatown. The hotel is located in an old building, but all the facilities are in good working condition. The lobby is smallish but cozy. Service was excellent. The rooms are quite small for the price, and there is no coffee machine.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel plumbing through my bathroom”
Reviews.Author: mollysouthisland
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was great and you could walk easily to most places. Unfortuntely the street trams weren't working for the week which was very disappointing. The hotel is very tired and needs money spent on it. The hotel pumbing sounded as if it went through my bathroom, I kept the toilet seat down as it sounded as if there was going to be an explosion!! The walls were thin and I could hear people talking which was annoying at times. It was great having access to the computer in the lobby. I wish I was told there was free coffee in the lobby and you could help yourself at any time, discovered this two days later. Would prefer to have coffee making facilities in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great vintage hotel in the middle of the City”
Reviews.Author: ka0z
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here throughout Thanksgiving weekend. Staff was really accomodating and helpful with all the requests we had. Location, as already described by many others, is excellent. We found it great that we could take the cable car to the BART station, was really convenient for our airport ride. Room was nice, ours was located on the 12th floor with view of half Union Square. We really liked the waredrobe room and the provided amenities. The TV does not really have a good selection of programmes but we did not stay in the room too much. The only downside that the room is a bit noisy but earplugs will help. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect end to the honeymoon Nov 2011”
Reviews.Author: dave_monaghan
Reviews.Content: This was one of our favourite hotels and locations on the honeymoon, its quite an old hotel and I loved the decor and general look inside, room was perfect, big, very big, great view of Union Square, its an ideal location for all you wanna do, tram cars, shopping, the bridge, alcatraz, they kindly gave us a bottle of champagne as it was our honeymoon, what more could we ask? It was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Babara W
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a three night stay. This hotel was great. The staff was friendly. The rooms were lovely and our Double Queen room was big and roomy. We traveled with another couple who were also extremely satisfied with our choice for a hotel. From the moment we checked in we felt at ease and relaxed in our surroundings. Location, location, location, was great. We loved San Francisco and we decided that, San Francisco is our future home.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, excellent location - slightly retro!”
Reviews.Author: Love_flying
Reviews.Content: This is a good value hotel for the location - very close to the BART from the airport and right next to Union Sq. It's not luxurious but is very clean and the staff are very friendly. The hotel provide coffee and cookies in the lobby free of charge. Wifi is also free - something that can't be said for other local hotels including the Westin next door where we had to pay! Overall - if your looking for clean and close to public transport and shopping without a huge price tagthen this is for you. There are (as other reviewers mentioned) a lot of homeless people on the streets but I didn't feel threatened and personally view this as a reflection on the lack of a welfare state in the US and therefore an issue in most US cities you visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Noodlie066
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at the Chancellor during our stay in SF. Our room was quiet, the bed comfortable, and room decor was tastefully done with marble topped furniture. There was some paint chipping in the bathroom and deglazing on the bathroom mirror. The flush lever on the toilet was a little awkward in that you needed to tip down the toilet lid to access it. These issues with the bathroom were minor. The from desk staff was pleasant and the location of the hotel is close to public transportation and good restaurants. We had a pleasant dinner at Scala's Bistro which is right across the street from the hotel. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location. Would Stay There Again”
Reviews.Author: Ian2176
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in September 2011. Hotel has an excellent location on Union Square close to all tourist attractions, which are in walking distance. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms were a bit small, but that didn't really matter. After reading other reviews on here we requested a room on a high floor at the rear in order to get a quiet room, which we got. Rooms at the front probably get noise from the passing cable cars, but you can't hear them at the rear. Had breakfast in the hotel restaurant which was good as was the service - and for a reasonable price. Would certainly recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic !”
Reviews.Author: AlisonandJoe
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to SF and the Chancellor. We raved so much about the hotel to my sister and her husband we decided to take them back with us. Hotel is in absolutely fantastic location. Union Square is central, full of atmosphere and facilities. Every sort of transport available within a short walk .. we used BART, F Streetcar, Cable Car and Muni Bus to name a few. Rooms are on the smaller side and bathrooms are small but for the price you pay for this location who cares? We certainly didn't spend much time in our room. Weather very warm when we arrived so slept with windows open. As we'd asked for rooms overlooking Union Square it was noisy to some extent but nice to lie there listening to the city though I don't think we'll ever get used to the fire engines screaming through! No problems sleeping though. Bar staff serve lovely cocktails and gave great recommendations as to where to eat and the restaurant serves amazing breakfasts. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: TravellerBrussels
Reviews.Content: The biggest selling point of this hotel it's location, so central for everything you need in San Francisco, with the cable cars right outside the door. OK, the decor in the rooms is a little dated and there is no air conditioning, but when you take into account the price it's well worth it. The staff were all so very friendly and helpful which really made for a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, comfy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jenny W
Reviews.Content: It is a cute little hotel with small, but comfy rooms. Its a bit noisy but its in the heart of the city so you have to expect that a bit. The bath room was rather small, but for the price and location you can look past the smaller rooms and see the quality you are getting!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the money”
Reviews.Author: JoeR11
Reviews.Content: Others have already mentioned the shortcomings of this hotel in the their reviews - no A/C, hearing noise through walls, small elevators, etc. so I won't belabor the point. These are all true and my advice is "If you want five star , spend the money and get it". However, if you want a good clean hotel for a good price in a great location, this is the place for you. Our San Francisco vacation was wonderful partly because this hotel was a perfect home base for us. It is steps away from the cable car stop, starbucks, Sears restaurant, and just generally in the middle of everything. We bought a week 'muni pass' at the concierge/gift shop downstairs and it was great way to get around (works on all cable cars and busses but not BART). If you drive your own car I don't think this would be the best place for you as I saw no parking nearby. But is was great for using public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “All about the location”
Reviews.Author: MazCA
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews (and responses!) here we weren't sure what to expect, especially after arriving and dropping off our bags with a less than friendly receptionist. However, when we did get to our room we were pleasantly suprised. It was nicely furnished and a good size. It was quite warm, but we knew there was no A/C - it is a nice old building. We opened the windows, obviously it was fairly noisy being right in the city centre but it didn't keep us awake. Breakfast at the restaurant downstairs was very good. Although the staff didn't volunteer any information when we approached them subsequently they were helpful. The location is great - short walk to China Town and North Beach, right on Union Square with a tram stopping outside so you can get around everywhere really easily. You can buy a MUNI transport pass in the reception - its good value and the staff at the kiosk were brilliant. This is a great place to stay if you're visiting San Fran for the first time and want to be able to get around easily. The only realy downside is that its quite expensive for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, no air-con, WiFi is fair (but not the best)”
Reviews.Author: elodTlv
Reviews.Content: Location is great. I knew there was no air condition in the room but didn't expect I would feel cold at night. There is an electric heater in the room, but it was too small to have any significant effect. You get 10% discount for breakfast, but you can find cheaper options outside the hotel. This hotel was top rated in San Francisco. I found it to be decent and good, but not sure I understand the enthusiasm of other reviewers. I found nothing special except the location and the reasonable price. WiFi was available in the room, signal was fair (not strongest) but speed wasn't the best (failed to upload large files). The WiFi login screen is a bit annoying (especially on mobile device).

Reviews.AuthorLocation: La Canada Flintridge, California, United States
Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Joyce C
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Chancellor Hotel. We could not have ask for anything more. The room was comfortable and nicely furnished, the staff was very friendly and very helpful and the location was excellent. The travel desk was very helpful, arranging transportation and giving directions. There were eight of us in our group and the hotel put us on our own hallway so we were all together. I will definitely choose the Chancellor Hotel for my future stays in San Francisco

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Perfect Location.”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoErin20
Reviews.Content: Great location and friendly staff! We paid $178 on a Saturday night and the rate went down to $109 on a Sunday night. They held our bags when we came too early for check in. Room was really nice. Bathroom was small but functional with a cute rubber ducky on the shelf. Also, loved the jar of candy in the room. All those little details were fun and unique. The hotel was pretty quiet - we didn't hear anyone in the other rooms. Free wifi, 1 block from Union Square, clean room! Overall excellent value!

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel with clean rooms in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: nicolegal78
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the hotel. The rooms are very clean and comfortable with ceiling fans - which is a nice addition. The location is amazing and very close to Union Square, yet the rooms are quiet. There are nice touches such as rubber ducks and HBO in the rooms. This is a great value hotel in a super spot.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and size”
Reviews.Author: Carol S
Reviews.Content: An older, well-maintained hotel very near Union Square and on the cable car line. The rooms are tastefully decorated for calm; the bathroom, well-equipped. Staff is professional and friendly; I felt welcome and safe. I stayed on the 7th floor and was amazed at the quiet; I sometimes heard sirens, but not regular street noise. Coffee and cookies available at all times. Nice restaurant. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shea09
Reviews.Content: I visited The Chancellor in November of 2011. Let me start by saying the location is awesome. Right across from Union Square. The Powell cable car stops right outside the front door, making a trip to Chinatown or Fishermans Wharf an easy 10-15 min trip The hotel itself is very old, but also very well kept. The front desk was very helpfull and pleasnt. The rooms are a little on the smallish side, but very comfortable. They have a pillow menu. If you dont like your pillow, you can get a new one. They have a small restauraunt and bar in the hotel lobby. The front of the hotel faces the front street and can get kind of noisey, so if you are a light sleeper, i suggest getting your room on the backside of the hotel. Overall I give this hotel a 8.5/10

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location though pretty loud”
Reviews.Author: JBI747
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a recent mini-vacation to San Fran. We were very happy with this hotel. It is conveniently located near union sq. And the bart. The Powell st. Cable car literally passes by right outside the window. The hotel itself is old, but the owners have done a good job to keep it clean and add character. The rooms were small, but nice. I think my only 'complaints' were that our room on the second floor was really loud (though that's not really the hotel's fault) and the shower heads are really low (had to awkwardly duck in the shower, but no big deal) The cookies in the lobby were great and the bed was super comfy! The staff was very friendly as well. We'd have no problems staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great union square hotel”
Reviews.Author: bindy30
Reviews.Content: After reading the great reviews on trip advisor we choose this hotel for our first visit to San Francisco. It is centrally located and near the union square and market St shopping area. We walked to the ferry building for a yummy breakfast. If you want a nice expresso coffee visit blue bottle coffee company in the ferry building well worth the wait. The chancellor hotel staff were so friendly and helpful. We stored our bags overnight whilst we visited yosemite park this was no problem. We also needed to send a 15 page fax to Australian customs regarding a bike bag we were sending home this was done at no charge by the hotel. We loved the cookies, fresh fruit and coffees in the lobby and the candy jar in our room was a nice touch. Don't expect massive rooms as you are in central San Francisco but really it doesn't matter as if you are like us you will be out all day exploring the city. Great hotel will be recommending to our friends!

Reviews.Title: “Mick & Mary(Dublin,Ireland)”
Reviews.Author: clonmel147
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Chancellor Hotel for 11 nights it was our second time to stay @ this Hotel & it is in great location, easy to go on Day trips,walking or going for a morning run along the bay , so easy to get to Bart station,Muni and cable cars,etc.We asked for a high ,quiet room and it was perfect. It would be nice if there was less furniture in the room and perhaps a fridge would be a good idea.Staff very friendly and helpful . Nice to meet a fellow countryman @ reception.....Rory. We'll return again hopefully

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with a cosy feel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Rossmore99
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights here which was a return visit from 15 years ago. It hadn't changed and was still a charming, quietly efficient hotel with lots of character. It's incredibly good value and retains a sort of family-feel that is the complete opposite of the big faceless, characterless chains. There is something quite romantic about hearing the clang of the bells of the cable cars going past which constantly reminds you where you are - with the potential of a view into the bay - which I have had each time. I was quite put out when I returned after a two week trip to find I could not get a room at all. Serves my right for not booking well enough in advance.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joswizzle
Reviews.Content: Me, my husband and our friends recently spent a few days in San Francisco at the Chancellor hotel. We were really pleased with the service we recieved from this hotel, not only is just off the top corner of union square but the free cookies, Tea, coffee and apples were wonderful. It may not be a 5* hotel but the location and the service second to none. My husband left his MP3 player in a drawer in the hotel, when we went back 2 weeks later the staff had stored his MP3 carefully and were able to retrieve it easily. The cost of this hotel is great compared to other hotels in a similar (or worse) location. Next time we are in San Francisco we will be staying there and will be recommending it to all friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great location”
Reviews.Author: Peng-Wai
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Chancellor Hotel for five nights and I must say it was one of the most enjoyable hotel stays I ever had. When I checked in, I asked for a room on the higher floors but none was available as the hotel was fully booked. I was given a room on the 5th floor facing Powell Street and was told by the front desk staff that she would move me to a higher floor once a room was available. Two nights later, I moved to a room at the back of the hotel on the 12th floor, where it was a lot quieter than on the 5th floor. Kudos to the front desk staff who not only arranged for me a room on a higher floor but also had my luggage moved while I was out attending a conference that day. Although the room was a little small, I found it was cozy and clean. The bed was large and comfortable and I slept well. There was no air-conditioning in the room and no need for it since it was cool enough when the windows were opened. Complimentary wireless internet worked without any problems. Hotel location is great: The hotel is next to Sears Fine Foods where I had breakfast; it is within walking distance to all the retail shops and department stores; less than three minutes walk to the cable car stop where I took the cable car to Fishermanâ€™s Wharf; less than five minutes walk to Market Street where I took the F Line to the Ferry Building and Embarcadero; ... and less than one minute to free coffee and cookies down in the lobby. I will definitely stay here again the next time I am in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Nancy D
Reviews.Content: We love this small hotel. It has everything we love about a hotel this size and price--great linens, great bath amenities, friendly staff and GREAT LOCATION.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Loaction”
Reviews.Author: Jim S
Reviews.Content: This was a return visit for us and the hotel was just as good as we remembered. Staff was great and location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Right in Union Square - Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: marod01
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in Sept 2011 and would recommend this Hotel. Staff were very friendly and helpful,especially on the tour desk. We were on the 5th floor facing Powell St and didn't notice the noise. (probably because we were tired from all our sightseeing adventures during the day). Room was small, but pleasantly decorated. Would recommend the pillow menu, fantastic!! The Coffee/Tea and biscuits in the lobby were great to come back to in the afternoon. The Chancellor's location is superb. Would stay again if going to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice”
Reviews.Author: LittleCesar
Reviews.Content: Very well located in Union Square. They have a small room, but very nice and clean. The staff treat you with respect and are often helpful. We used to have breakfast at Sears, the next door restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, friendly, pretty”
Reviews.Author: jrewing88
Reviews.Content: Pretty hotel. Very nice. If i must say something negative, the breakfast wasn't fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great mid-market hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Leroy252
Reviews.Content: The chancellor makes use of a good location and offers decent accommodation in the heart of San Francisco. The room was quite small and had no view, but this was never the reason we chose this hotel. We wanted a place to explore (I take the same view when in New York) and on this front it serves its purpose. The basics were all well covered and the hotel was clean, the beds were comfortable and the staff friendly. The concierge recommended a wine tour that was easily the highlight of the trip. So overall, we left happy. If you want a decent hotel to explore the city, you could do a lot worse.

Reviews.Title: “6 day business stay”
Reviews.Author: Daniela K
Reviews.Content: Fantastic stay at Chancellor hotel! Extremely friendly staff, quiet and very convenient room! Amazing downtown location. Great complimentary fitness and swimming one block away. I highly recommend this hotel for City and business travelers!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Annie-and-Jeff
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in town for a concert at the Warfield and stayed at this hotel the night of November 1, 2011. All I can say is Kudos! The hotel was nice, with clean rooms and very comfortable beds (love the pillow menu) and an absolutely terrific location, but what really stood out to me was the staff. Apparently, they were short handed on housekeeping staff that day, so there was a backup in getting rooms ready and getting people checked in. I can't say enough about the professionalism, patience and courtesy exhibited by the front desk staff in dealing with the backup. Every member of staff that I ran into was so nice and polite and a pleasure to deal with, but I just thought the front desk staff (and the short handed housekeeping staff) deserve a special shout out. Can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Smaller, Dated Rooms and Decor”
Reviews.Author: QuinnA
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the loaction of this hotel. Right on Powell Street and Union Square. Plenty of nearby shopping and dining options. If you have a car, the off-site parking is a bit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “A Union Square treasure”
Reviews.Author: 505022p
Reviews.Content: Our recent three day stay at the Chancellor in San Francisco was a delight by any measure. Conveniently located with easy access to Union Square, Cable Cars, BART and a host of other attractions, it was always a pleasure to return to the hotel at the end of our busy day. We were a short taxi ride to the magnificent Opera House, a short BART trip to Harding Park to see the Champions Golf event. Fisherman's Wharf was easily accessed via the Powell/Mason Cable Car stop just across the street from the Chancellor. The cookies and coffee in the lobby were well utilized by us and our travelling partner couple. We shall return! Tony Southwell

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: jmarc23
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Chancellor Hotel recently. We were able to check in earlier than the 3:00 p.m. check-in time and were given a complimentary bottle of champagne and a nice card wishing us a happy anniversary. Prior to booking the hotel, I read a lot about it, so I was aware that there was no air conditioning and to request a room at the back of the hotel, to avoid the noise of Powell Street. We were given Room 1509, a corner room at the top floor, in the back of the hotel. While the view wasn't spectacular by any means, we appreciated being able to keep both windows open without the noisiness of the street. The room was small, as expected, but with a large walk-in closet so that you could maximize what living space you do have by stowing your things away. The room was updated with newer decor, furnishings and electronics, but since it is an older hotel, it was only slightly rough around the edges (wall, window, older bathroom). The hotel offers a cute pillow menu, which we didn't take advantage of, unfortunately. The bed was a little stiff for my liking, but my husband had no problem with it in the least. There is an adjacent restaurant (which we never used) and a tiny bar where we shared a drink and watched a football game. The tour desk was helpful in providing us MUNI passes, information regarding booking a rental car (we decided against it in the end), maps and brochures for area attractions and securing a limo for the ride back to the hotel. The most important thing, however, was that it was very clean and comfortable and of course, in an excellent location off Union Square, near all the shopping and dining you could want and across the street from Starbucks (bonus!) and a few doors down from Walgreens (when your feet and back are dying for Advil after a whole day of climbing hilly streets). If you are looking for an affordable, clean, safe and centrally located hotel while staying in San Francisco, with a bit of old charm and a cute little ducky to perk up your bathroom, you cannot go wrong with the Chancellor Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good location, very noisy, expensive parking”
Reviews.Author: salit_11
Reviews.Content: the location of the hotel is grate a lot of restaurants and shops near, the room was clean and comfortable and nice decorated. the cable car in front of the hotel makes a lot of nois and the rooms on the street side are very noisy. The cookies, coffee and tea in the lobby throughout the day is great.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: listershaun
Reviews.Content: I booked The Chancellor in early 2011 for my honeymoon in September. I emailed Kevin, the reservations manager, to check availability, and see whether I could book a 'special' room for the occasion. He promised he would sort it, and when we arrived we were very happy that he had given us a room with a view of Union Square, and high enough up to not be affected by the noise. A man of his word, and we were very grateful. The hotel itself, well, we couldn't fault it. It is what it is, an old style hotel in a fantastic location, with nice staff, even the lady and gentleman in the kiosk were brilliant. Our room was clean, and plenty big enough for the two of us, and the aforementioned view was just awesome, especially at night. I have to say that it was an absolute bargain too, and I can see why it is such a popular hotel, far better than one of the stuffy 'upmarket' offerings elsewhere. All in all, we couldn't fault a thing, I'd like to thank Kevin and all the staff for excellent service from start to finish, and for the lovely gift which was left for us. We couldn't have asked for better on our first trip to San Francisco, in fact, or first trip to the States. I would highly recommend staying here, and I hope to return in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure to return to the Chancellor.”
Reviews.Author: WillyRandom
Reviews.Content: We got in late in the evening. The rooms were exactly as I requested. It seemed as if they had been freshly painted, but maybe that is just because the place is so clean. The beds are quite comfortable. The downstairs restaurant is a real "plus" for breakfast in the morning. It has become a real home away from home for me, and the staff-- many of whom I now recognize after having stayed for 4 years-- thanks to TripAdvisor-- are great.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing central spot”
Reviews.Author: Jojomartin1971
Reviews.Content: We have just got home.... I could have done with another few days here , hotel was beautiful full of character and charm, we had a pillow menu ! the bed was so comfy and the softest bedding , we could see Macy store and union square from our window , the tram ran just past the hotel for a very romantic journey down to the warf .... Already planning to go back to San - Fran an amazing place with wonderfully warming people x

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: David F
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in a good location. Clean rooms of a good size. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Third stay”
Reviews.Author: leegin
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Chancellor several times in the last seven or so years and have returned because it is a nice hotel and a good value. I was not going to write another review but reading the absurd review by "fedeanddelsman" prompted me to do so. Nothing in that review is even remotely true. The hotel is immaculate and well maintained. The rooms are small but that should be known going in. We will stay there again the next time we are in SF--probably next year.

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST HOTEL EVER”
Reviews.Author: fedeandelsman
Reviews.Content: IT WAS HORRIBLE. We went to san francisco to have some great time and it wasnt great at all. The people where mean. One of the receptionist guys even insulted my son. If you go to that hotel you will regret. The bedrooms were not comfortable at all, they were dirty, small, a lot of noise. And the restaurant was awful. It was so horrible that I dont want to return to San Francisco ever again. You suck Chancellor Hotel on Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good value for Union Square”
Reviews.Author: facls
Reviews.Content: We booked the Chancellor based on Trip Advisor reviews and the rate, which was the best we could find in Union Square. Still expensive, but better than similar hotels in the area. The hotel is old, but very well kept and clean. The staff was always friendly and helpful. The rooms are indeed small, but we knew that going in and we barely stayed in the room anyway. It was quite clean, as was the bathroom. I was surprised at how stuffy the room could get during the day. I guess we got an unually warm week in SF. The ceiling fan was enough to cool it down, though. I also knew that there was no AC, so I can't blame the hotel for this. We had a high room with an Union Square view, and had no problems sleeping at night. Location is superb. It's a block from Union Square, right next door there's a great breakfast at Sears Fine Foods, across the street there's a great restaurant called Scala's Bistro, and a 24 hour Walgreens on the same block. We only used the valet on the last day, to go to Napa Velley and then travel south to LA, and had no problems with it. If the lack of AC is not a problem with you, then I'd recommend the Chancellor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: heyshoowhah
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel in a great location. Rooms were comfortable and staff very friendly and helpful. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Judy L
Reviews.Content: Visited San Fran in August and found this hotel to be accommodating and in a great location- good value for the price! Trolley and bus stops were nearby and Chinatown was within walking distance. Wonderful restaurants nearby, and found all staff to be most friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great reception, perfect location, reasonable value”
Reviews.Author: ourholiday
Reviews.Content: This hotel lived up to the expectations Tripadvisor reviews had raised. We have no hesitation in recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: SHEPHECJ
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Chancellor, the location was excellent. The gent at the tour desk was very helpful and gave us very detailed information about where the many sights were and what transport routes to use. I can only just repeat what the great reviews have already said, which are spot on! I would recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic business trip”
Reviews.Author: LittleCityFarms
Reviews.Content: I was pretty sure I was going to love this place when I booked it and I was not at all disappointed. I prefer hotels with character and this one had a little historic charm, lots of modern amenities, and tons of class. When I walked in the windows were cracked to provide fresh air (what a change of pace!) and the room felt breezy and light. I suppose one could complain about the street noise but you can't really chose to stay on Powell St. and complain about the trolley's bell can you! It didn't keep me up. The staff were extremely helpful and I couldn't have felt more at home. I suppose the rooms might be small--I lucked into a free upgrade to a suite and it was spacious and lovely. Can't wait for my next trip back!

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: CallieCo8
Reviews.Content: After much research, we decided on the Chancellor Hotel for a 3-night stay for family from Ohio (their first trip to Northern California). Everything we had read about the hotel was spot on. The rooms were clean and nicely remodeled (the bathroom is small but workable), coffee, tea and cookies were available from early morning to late evening in the lobby, breakfast at their restaurant was very good and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We had booked three rooms on one floor; however, one room was not ready and my husband and I were moved to another floor. For our trouble, we were given a gift certificate to be used at the hotel's restaurant. The location is fantastic -- right on Powell Street where we could pick up the Cable Car and head for Fisherman's Wharf, walk to Union Square, is close to shopping and great restaurants. We were assisted with transportation to Pier 33 for an Alcatraz tour, told about a great pizza place just a half a block away and answered the many questions we had about local places to eat, shop, etc. There was a book on their table in the lobby that we inquired about -- wanted to find out where we could get it for my brother-in-law. One of the staff told us how much it was and went out to purchase it for us while we waited for our car. Cannot say enough about our great experience here. My husband and I will be staying here on our next trip to San Francisco -- highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Best 3* hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Flighty31
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Chancellor was everything we hoped it would be having read many other reviews. The location is superb right in the heart of the action and very close to all the transport links. The rooms are reasonably small but have everything we needed and they use the available space intelligently. Who wants a long walk to the bathroom anyway? There is no air conditioning but you do not need it. When we were there in August and were told that we had picked the hottest week of the summer and it was fine, the ceiling fans were more than adequate. I requested a fridge for our drinks which was quickly provided at no extra charge. What I think makes this hotel great is its character and all of the many small touches that you would maybe not expect. Such as free cookies, coffee and popcorn plus a pillow menu. If I was being uber picky (to give the review some balance) I would say the bell service personal did seem uninterested and did not match the other high levels of service we received from all the other staff. To summarise, this is the best 3 star property I have ever stayed in and if I return to San Francisco I cannot see myself staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Cute and historic”
Reviews.Author: skycwgrl
Reviews.Content: What kind I say that everyone else hasn't said before?! This hotel is quaint and has a wonderful location. It is centraled located and is a great value! I would highly recommend this property!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to Tripadvisor, no Surprises-- Just a Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Daniel D
Reviews.Content: Based on TripAdvisor reviews, my wife and I chose the Chancellor Hotel for our stay in San Francisco. We were not let down. This is a wonderful hotel situated in the heart of San Francisco. Major attractions are just a walk away or easily accessible by cable car, bus or light rail; so this is the area to be in if you are planning on walking or using transit to see the city. As others have mentioned, the rooms at the hotel are not the biggest, but they are clean, tastefully decorated and always look sparkling when we returned from a long day out on the city. Those things are important to us. In closing, if you are looking for a clean room, great location and competitive price, the Chancellor Hotel is an option you should look into.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jen m
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chancellor for 3 nights in October. The location is fantastic with a view of Union Square, close to shops, restaurants and all methods of transportation. The price was very good and the rooms were clean and a nice size. It was my husbands 40th birthday and they left a card and bottle of wine which was a nice touch. The only thing I would recommend is, if you prefer a quieter room, to request a room on the back of the hotel. Union Square can be noisy until quite late, but with the window closed it was not too much of a problem. The hotel staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful to us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SharonAJ
Reviews.Content: We booked this on recommendations from friends based on the location and value for money and it does tick those boxes perfectly. We got a great rate and all e-mail correspondence was quick, effecient and helpful. The rooms are "cosy" as they say on their website and a bit of a challenge if like us you have lots of luggage - but you're not in the room much and the benefits outweigh that issue. Staff are welcoming and friendly and you are well placed for Union Sq, the main tram stop and shops. Sears, just next door, is great for breakfast and there is a handy food store on the corner. We did request a high floor at the back of the hotel and noise wasn't a problem. A good base if you are on a budget but still want to be in the centre of the city.

Reviews.Title: “I left my heart.......!”
Reviews.Author: marmar1963
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here, after a week in Las Vegas. Beautiful old fashioned hotel, staff very helpful & friendly, rooms spotlessly clean & very comfortable. It was lovely to have windows that opened in a hotel! It was surprisingly quiet at night, which I didn't expect. Extras...lovely Chancellor rubber duck, Pillow menu, Tea, coffee, cookies & fruit in reception. All in all great base for a trip to SF. People have mentioned about the room sizes, but they are fine, enough room for a comfortable bed/bath for two people.

Reviews.Title: “It was as good as you all said.”
Reviews.Author: AucklandRose
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in early October, and chose the Chancellor because of the T.A reviews and comments. It was every bit as good as the reviews suggest.We liked the very friendly, approachable front-desk staff, the room was comfortable and very clean , and the location was superb.We had breakfast one morning in Luques,and were happy with the meal and service. We really liked the coffee and biscuits in the lobby, and the little bar had a great "happy hour." I think the Chancellor markets itself very honestly. It is certainly not a flashy chain hotel , but that was fine with us!We loved being in San Francisco, and if we ever get the chance to return we would be happy to return to the Chancellor.

Reviews.Title: “You're best bet for SFO!!”
Reviews.Author: ccsaltlake
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at The Chancellor the 1960's when I would come with my family often for our summer vacations. Coincidentally, so has my husband!! We wouldn't think of staying anywhere else. Not only is it because of the PERFECT location, but the staff, price and value. Walk out the door to the best shopping and dining in California. Hop on the cable car to soak in the city. Union Square is my favorite spot in San Francisco and at The Chancellor, you are 10 steps away. Chinatown is around the corner and if you are in town for a ballgame at AT&T Park you can even walk there if you're up for it, cab fare to the park is about $10. The rooms are small but functional. Be prepared for very small bathrooms, but that's a minor compromise for the overall advantages of the hotel. You're bed choices are either one queen or two twins, no king beds. Street side rooms face right on Powell where the trolley runs, but we always request an upper floor and the noise never keeps me awake. If this concerns you, request a backside room. I happily recommend The Chancellor for your visit to San Fran!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sarbel_135
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chancellor Hotel for 4 nights. We found everything to be perfect for our stay. The staff were extremely friendly, the room was really nice with little extras such as coffee and cookies in reception, bottle of wine and chocolate on arrival and even a rubber duck for the bath! Although the room was a little small (we had just been to Las Vegas where the room was huge) it was very clean, tastefully furnished and well decorated. The room was a bit too warm, but there was a fan in the room and we kept the window open - yes there was a lot of traffic noise but you are in an excellent central location so this is to be expected and you do get used to it. As mentioned, one of the positive aspects of this hotel is the location, extremely well placed for transport (cable car, street cars, taxis etc) and for resteraunts, bars and sightseeing. We did the trip to Alcatraz which was good (pre book before you go as it gets really busy) but the best activity we did was to hire bikes (expensive but worth it) and cycle across the Golden Gate Bridge to Sausalito - which is a beautiful place. We're not mega fit, but had a fantastic day - and you can come back on the ferry which give you lovely views of the bridge. Would definitely go back to the Chancellor if we returned to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “hot hot hot”
Reviews.Author: amandatravels_11
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed here during a conference at the Moscone Convention Center. It was a very busy weekend in SF, there was a marathon going on right across the street. Perhaps this explained the outrageous room charges! We have traveled extensively to NYC and other expensive cities, and never before have I felt so ripped off by a hotel room rate. Good: The Chancellor is in a great location right at Union Square. There is loads of shopping, you can walk to the Ferry Building, lots of public transport nearby. Not so good: The Chancellor has been "renovated" but still felt dingy, especially the bathroom, which felt downright old. Although the linens and comforter were nice, the bed was lumpy. Bad: No air conditioner. I know this is made clear on their website, and I thought it would be ok, seeing how SF gets into the 50's at night. However, the windows only open about 6 inches (there is a safety mechanism so they won't open further), so there is really no fresh air in the room. The fan only circulates the hot air that is already in the room. Thus, at night, the room didn't cool down at all and was uncomfortably hot and stuffy, I would not stay here again, unless the room rate was 150 or less. The coffee is nice, but if the hotel really wanted to be standout, they might consider offering some sort of breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly placed”
Reviews.Author: oscar0734
Reviews.Content: It's central position is great for shopping and eating out which is just as well as there is no restaurant ,just a small bar and the free coffee in the lobby. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the staff pleasant and helpful.Just one irritation though as we booked an important early morning wake up call which never came!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: Kamaile M
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during the Nike Women's Marathon and it was the perfect location. I was literally across the street from the start line and close to restaurants, shopping and two Starbucks. I requested an in room refridgerator which was so convenient to store water, gatorade and left overs to eat later. I also requested and got a room on a higher floor so I would have no trouble sleeping since I'm a light sleeper. I really liked having coffee, hot tea, cookies and apples in the lobby. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a nice clean room at a fair price.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay at union square!”
Reviews.Author: 3rdyrrunner
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable room at union square...no AC. Great location. We did not eat at the hotel nor use the complimentary gym but both looked great.

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: Robin F
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor is ideally situated on Powell street, with a cable car stop right on the corner. Given the great location, it was also comparably priced. The staff was courteous and very helpful with information on getting around the city.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: mimi200608
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to San Francisco...Chancellor Hotel was convenient and comfortable. An older hotel with character. We asked for a quiet room....we were on the 8th floor facing the other buildings.....but it was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mija1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the recommendation of a friend who prefers a smaller hotel to the chains. As many have commented, the rooms are on the small side, especially the bathroom, but they are representative of hotels of The Chancellor's era. It's not glitzy, but it has a lot of character (and no, that's not a euphemism for something else) and old school charm. It was immaculately clean, had a very nice flatscreen TV, and the beds were comfy. Even though we were facing Powell Street, the street noise did not disturb our sleep (request a higher floor). The location --diagonal to Union Square -- is excellent for shopping, cable cars, and theaters.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: sdoutre
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location of this hotel. Right off Union Square and close to everything. Room was small but clean and updated. Nice sheets and a good bed and pillows make all the difference! They have fresh cookies in the lobby and free tea and coffee. Staff is friendly. Very easy check-in and check-out. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: FeelingBeachy13
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel based on ratings, and although it was a bit expensive for my budget, I splurged because I wanted a decent hotel in a safe area that included parking since I didn't know the area at all. It was hard for us to get to the hotel by car - traffic, construction, delivery trucks, one-way streets - had us going in circles for an hour trying to get parked in front of the hotel to get checked in. You have to check in before you can get your parking pass. Very frustrating! We checked in around 11am on a Wednesday and to our surprise (and delight!) our room was ready - so we were able to get settled right away. The rooms were small (but we knew they would be) but the bed and linens were clean and comfortable. We faced some sort of noisy air conditioning unit, so it was a bit noisy when windows were open, but we didn't mind as it was a constant hum and we have noisy fans at home. The windows could only barely be opened. The fan was sufficient for our night as it wasn't too hot (be sure not to accidently turn it off like I did with the light switch!) We immediately purchased our Muni passes from the tour desk in the lobby - very helpful! - and jumped on the trolley just steps from the front door of the hotel. I was pleased with how convenient it all was once we got our car parked. I felt safe walking from the trolley to the hotel late at night, and back and forth from Parking Garage. The only thing truly disappointing to us was the cold coffee in the morning!

Reviews.Title: “Very cute hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: Gr8greta
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in great location. Friendly and courteous staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot!”
Reviews.Author: Susan B
Reviews.Content: Amazing location! Very friendly and accommodating! Rooms small but very clean and comfortable! Would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: joe a
Reviews.Content: great location and price...have stayed multiple times...restaurant breakfast better than sears next door and much less crowded...very quiet despite location on busy powell st....would recommend highly..

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location”
Reviews.Author: nornirish_voyager
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights on our California / Nevada road trip... I only wish I could have stayed for longer! We loved the Chancellor. It has a feel of a lovely old hotel with a lot of heritage. It isn't one of the glitzy modern hotels but it it is classy, comfortable and friendly. Its location is perfect, right in the very heartbeat of SF. We were able to get a cable car straight from the Pier to the hotel, and every shop you could possibly imagine was right under our noses. The coffee & cookies in the lobby were a really nice touch, thank you! The irish barman was very friendly and genuine... one of the few who actually deserve a tip!!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Bob1NZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights and found the Chancellor matched the positive recommendations we had read. The location was great for a holiday in San Francisco. The room was very well set up. The availability of complimentary tea and coffee 24/7 in the bar and apples in the lobby showed an interest in customer welfare. The staff were all very helpful. Overall this was a most pleasant stay and for southern hemisphere travellers represented great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Richard B
Reviews.Content: The location could not be better. The staff was very friendly and the room was very clean although somewhat small. The closet was very large walk in which was nice. I would not eat in the restaurant again. There are complimentary cookies and coffee in the lobby which was a nice treat. The location was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “very good 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: pinoy99
Reviews.Content: Arrived mid-day, room not yet ready (was told half hour wait) so bags were put in storage. Needed a quick lunch, had to choose between Scalaâ€™s Bistro across the street or Sears next door(look another for review). Back to the hotel to checked in â€“ got high floor, room-facing Powell St.(requested in advance thru email which was responded promptly). Found a bottle of wine and small box of chocolate on the cocktail table â€“ nice touch, thanks! Room has 32â€� flat tv on top of dresser with a marble? top. Next to it is a table/chair with lamp (with a/c outlets) and telephone. Chairs are on each side of the cocktail table by the window. There are end tables with lamps on each side of the queen bed-one with a clock radio. Pillows and bed were very nice and comfortable. Ceiling fan produced enough circulation â€“ vibration/noise is noticeable at top speed but thatâ€™s not the preferred setting anyway. Noise from cable cars, construction (Stockton & Post) and everything else going on (Powell/Union Square/HVAC of the building across the street) is on a medium high level with the window in full open position. I could not close it fully as the room gets too hot for our taste. Although, I think the noise level will be much better when the road constructions are over. Bathroom size is fine, the only really complaint is how close the potty is to the door. Wi-Fi signal was very good and VPN connection worked properly â€“ for free! Closet has iron/board and a safe big enough to fit a 15.6 laptop with plenty of clothes hangers and an umbrella too (came in handy for a few rainy days/nights). The Icebox is nicely hidden inside a closet by the elevator. The elevators are quick and seem to handle the traffic very well. Hotel is central to all public transit â€“ cable car at Powell, buses at Post, Sutter or Stockton. I believe BART is a short walk as well. Muni passport can be bought at the tour desk. Hotel is practically next door to major shops â€“ Saks, NM, Macyâ€™s, Bulgari/Tiffany, Uggs and more. Ditto for different restaurants/bars. Only used the hotel restaurant for breakfast (3x) â€“ food was very good with great service â€“ with 20% off for conference attendees. There is a small bar by the lobby where the free coffee is (didnâ€™t particularly liked the flat taste/flavor), but has very good selection of tea bags. On several occasions, the thermos for coffee or hot water ran dry, although they were replenished quickly. There were also free cookies and fruits available for guests. All the staff seems genuinely friendly, from the front desk, bellhop, tour desk, restaurant wait/help, maintenance & maids. Normally, there will be staff(s) that are indifferent but not at this hotel, at least not the ones we encountered in our 6 nights stay. The hotel is a very good (4.5) 3 star property. If/when Iâ€™m in the city/Union Square, I will definitely consider staying at Chancellor again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - a couple of minor complaints”
Reviews.Author: stdublin
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Chancellor in September 2011 for four nights. The hotel was great although I would not stay in Union Square again if I was to return to San Fran. The rate of homelessness upset me and it appears to be more evident around Union Square at night. However we were NEVER EVER bothered!!! I simply preferred Fishermans Wharf or even Nob Hill but that has nothing to do with the Chancellor and is just my observation. The hotel itself is nice and a perfect location if you want to be in Union Square. The rooms are small but well designed and really clean. Although the walls are paper thin so just hope you don't get noisey neighbours! The concierge was very helpful with organising tickets and shuttle buses. I even heard him helping other guests to try and get sold out alcatraz tickets. He really seemed to try hard to accommodate. The free tea, coffee and cookies somewhat makes up for there being no breakfast but sure there are pleanty of places around to grab breakfast. Our only complaint during our stay was the bar. The barmaid appeared to have some friends in the bar one of the nights which actually drove us out of the hotel for the evening. They were so loud and obnoxious that we left to get a drink elsewhere. When we came back they were still there and had only gotten worse. We were glad we left. It also made us not want to go back the following night.

Reviews.Title: “What a Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeffh383
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to say a big thank you to Wes the manager for having such a wonderful hotel. It was so charming and the room we had overlooking Union Square was wonderful. Your staff are so friendly and knowledgeable which was of a great help to us. We thought that Matthew your bellboy was such a lovely person. So lovely!! You made us feel very welcome with your champagne and chocolates in our room when we arrived as we were on our honeymoon having just got married in New York 3 days prior to arriving. The room was so comfortable and we loved the touch with the candy jar and the bottle of wine in the room. I couldn't resist mentioning to you when you were stood behind the reception desk that you had a great hotel and fantastic staff. The location of the hotel is fantastic!! Keep up the good work. We will definitely be using your hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: straveler57
Reviews.Content: In the heart of Union Square. The rooms are small but very clean and comfortable. If you are looking for 5 star, this is not it, but the price also reflects that. I would highly recommend this hotel and would stay there again in the future. That staff was superb and all were very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: teentripper
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I I stayed for 4 nights and totally enjoyed ourselves. Hotel staff was really helpful. Room was wonderful. Cookies and coffee in the lobby great. Easy walk with suitcases to BART so didn't need to taxi from airport. Didn't hear a thing from neighbouring rooms. Eventually had to shut the window to block out downtown noise but fan made that possible. Tried breakfast in the hotel and at Sears next door. Would give a pass on both next time. Even though the decor was interesting at Sears, it was definitely not worth a 1/2 hour stand in line for a very basic Denny's breakfast. Highlight of the trip was a Segway tour with City Segway and Alcatraz.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in a Great City !”
Reviews.Author: Vij77
