Reviews.Content: My wife & me spent the last 4 nights of our 3 week west coast vacation @ The Chancellor & were not disappointed - I don't know why a lot of people write negative reviews as the Hotel is exactly what they write on the tin. Rooms & Bathrooms are small but have been designed well & serve every need. The tea, coffee & the tasty cookies in the Lobby are a nice touch. The Rooms in particular & the Hotel in general is very clean. The staff - Reception & Housekeeping are efficient & smiling all the time. Michael, the guy who runs the small travel kiosk in the Lobby is extremely helpful. Forgot to mention about the location which is excellent with some great eating & shopping joints just a stone's throw away Now the litmus test - would we stay @ the Chancellor if we went back to SF & the unanimous answer from both us is a big YES !

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KellyanneJake
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel that is so central! Check in was fast and hassle free. The staff were very welcoming and helpful whenever I spoke with them. The room my son and I had had two twin beds and he loved the large bath! He also loved the jar or lollies!! The hotel was just a stones throw from Union Square, Macys and Market Street Shopping. There were some great eateries close by, Walgreens on the corner and StarBucks just over the road. We utilised the off street parking facility and they too were really friendly and helpful. In the evening cookies welcomed us in the lobby and tea and coffee are also available. Gracia was the lady that serviced our room on the 13th floor and it was always perfect. I had such a hard time trying to find a modern, affordable, central hotel in San Francisco and am so glad I found the Chancellor! It is terrific. I cannot fault it. You do hear the sounds of the city but once we closed our windows it was not an issue at all. I highly recommend this hotel and this city!! We had an amazing time!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: bhavana_praveen
Reviews.Content: I went through the reviews on trip advisor and planned on staying here I was dissappointed ,the rooms are tiny ,there is no air condiion , the fan was not perfuming well, because of which we had to keep the windows open and it got really noisy, apart from the hotel being centrally located there was nothing more to look out for. The bathrooms are tiny too.We even tried upgrading we were just moved from 3rd to 11th floor but it didn't make much difference .

Reviews.Title: “Top location, clean and very comfortable room.”
Reviews.Author: Meloby
Reviews.Content: Excellent location - very central for tourists. Outstanding room condition, including super comfortable bed and fresh new looking linen. Clean fresh bathroom facilities. Great breakfast service.

Reviews.Title: “great value, great euro-style accommodations”
Reviews.Author: beth h
Reviews.Content: Understated elegance in minimalist euro style. Small, but who needs more when you're there to see the sites and eat great food. Only things missing are in-room coffee and air (unusually warm SF week made room stuffy and only way to cool was to open window to street - even this urbanite couldn't sleep with the noise). Everyone was exceedingly helpful, especially Matt. Wish NY had locations this nice at these prices - truly amazing value.

Reviews.Title: “Good but to hot”
Reviews.Author: jmannz
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs aircon the rooms are to warm to sleep.The hotel is almost boutique style as it is quite small the other problem is parking there is a small area outside to park and unload your bags but if this is full you cannot double park as there are trams lines that cannot be blocked.they charge $36 to valet park which to us was the only option as not to sure where the self parking garage would be. The hotel is clean and modern and has a nice feel about it.We enjoyed our breakfast in the retaurant plenty of choice on the menu.The rooms are small but big enought to be comfortable as long as you travel light Apart from my two issues I enjoyed my stay at the chancellor recommend if it is cold weather and you have no vehicle!

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RLS1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Chancellor for five nights during my first trip to San Francisco, and I couldnâ€™t fault this hotel! The location was excellent and the staff were friendly. We stayed in a twin room on the 14th floor â€“ we had requested a high level room to avoid street noise, which paid off as we werenâ€™t disturbed by this during our stay. The beds were really comfortable too, with a choice of pillows! San Francisco was having a bit of a heat wave during our stay, but the lack of air con wasnâ€™t a problem as the ceiling fan was more than enough to keep the room cool. We enjoyed the free apples, cookies, tea and coffee in the foyer, and the free WIFI! We ate breakfast in the hotel one morning, which was delicious. We also ate at Sears next door a couple of times, which I would highly recommend. Overall I had absolutely no complaints about this hotel and would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great location just off Union Square”
Reviews.Author: shortperson
Reviews.Content: This was probably the smallest hotel room we stayed in during a California road trip, but it was in the city, the location was excellent, and it was very quiet! The room size was akin to New York, so we weren't surprised - though the oversized lampshade that kept getting bashed by the curtains was probably the wrong thing to have in there! Nevertheless, there was plenty of suitcase storage in the closet - we had two big suitcases and two backpacks with us. The bathroom was fine and the room itself was comfortable and well decorated. We went in September, so no airconditioning did not bother us, but I guess it might if it got hotter. The in-hotel restaurant was OK - we had breakfast there one morning, but to be honest, Sears next door was better value and better food. Valet parking was a godsend for us, and most of the staff in the hotel were very helpful. This was a great location for the three nights we were there. We did walk to Fishermans' Wharf, which was a long walk, but a trolley bus home helped there! But it is one block back from Union Square and all the shopping you could need.

Reviews.Title: “Great location just off Union Square but perhaps a bit pricey for the size of rooms”
Reviews.Author: jckelly09
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location a stones through away from Union square and the cable car to Fishermans Wharf is across the road. The rooms are tastefully decorated but are fairly small and don't have air con which are typical of the age of the building. Parking is a block or so away and is 33 dollars per day although there is a guest parking zone outside for luggage drop off/pick up. We had a fault in the bathroom and whilst maintenance were sent up immediately we didn't get an apology and the problem wan't fully rectified.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: K1980G
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 5 night stay at The Chancellor hotel with my lovely daughter. What a wonderful time we had in this fantaastic city and in a very comfortable and friendly hotel. We enjoyed the complimentary cookies, apples, tea and coffee on our return from a long day shopping and sightseeing. Our room was a decent size with a fairly small bathroom (big enough for a short stay though) and a big walk in wardrobe. We were on the seventh floor at the back of the hotel so lovely and quiet. There is also a pillow menu which is worth trying and an ice machine on each floor. There is a restaurant in the hotel where we enjoyed a good breakfast. They also serve other meals although we didn't try them. We enjoyed cocktails in the small bar and happy hour was between 5.00pm-7.30pm. Next door to the hotel there is a very nice restaurant called Sears where we enjoyed breakfast - they make great pancakes! We also had dinner there on several occasions which was also very good. The location is perfect, close to shops, cable cars, trams, restaurants and all the sights. We really could not have chosen a better hotel for the location and price and can recommend this hotel for a great stay in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: deelicious
Reviews.Content: We have arrived home today after a fantastic 3 week trip to California. We arrived at the Chancellor to stay for 3 nights before flying back to the UK and we were really are glad we chose this hotel. All the staff work so hard and are always at hand if you need anything. A very special thanks to Wes Tyler the General Manager who arranged a nice Wedding Anniversary surprise for us on our arrival. This Hotel is so well located for everything you need. Eating, shopping and getting about on all the transport is all on the doorstep here. On check in we arrived early but no problem they took our luggage off us and stored it away which allowed us to go off and look about. The complimentary beverages and cookies in the lobby were also something we looked forward to when we returned after a long day out and about. The room was very nice and had a nice big bath so i could have long soak before getting ready for a night out.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in a fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: Teganw
Reviews.Content: I arrived after 26hrs traveling & was greeted at check in by Voula, who was friendly, efficient & sympathetic to the fact I just wanted to get to my room. I can't tell you how long it took - I was in my room before I could look at my watch! I loved the furnishings, bed was the most comfortable I've had in a hotel & the pillows were so comfy! Loved the umbrella in the wardrobe but San Fran gave me no reason to use it! Located in Union Square - fantastic! Cable car stop outside was great for returning from a long days sightseeing! Also walking distance to Powell St muni station where I caught muni to At&T Park & Golden Gate Park.

Reviews.Title: “Chancellor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: John P
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is described as a boutique htel, but I would just call it traditional and tired. Very quiet, no atmosphere, and right on the main st with plenty of noise and buskers outside the window until midnight !

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodations at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: jlandarose
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and the staff was extremely accomodating. The room was average size for an older downtown hotel. The location could not have been better. You are in the heart of dining, shopping and many attractions. The value is outstanding and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Like Always”
Reviews.Author: Ryan T
Reviews.Content: This hotel by far is the best in the area for the money, you cant beat the charm of the hotel and the rest of the staff actually like to work here. I've usually only stay at four diamond and up property's and this one deserves one.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL...GOOD LOCATION...DECENT PRICE...and NO BEDBUGS!!!”
Reviews.Author: BamBam637
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had stayed here for 4 nights for our vacation in San Francisco. We did a lot of research before hand including for bedbugs and we are glad we had picked this hotel. Chancellor Hotel is not the best of the best; however, itâ€™s not the worst either. Location was good and the price was decent. PARKING: If you drive here, parking in SF is NOT free; $29/night PLUS tax, which I thought was ridiculous with the tax. Chancellor hotel will have complimentary cookies, water, apples, maps, tea and coffee in the lobby all for FREE! SERVICE: The staffs here were nice and friendly. The tour desk guy was really helpful with info about places to go and how to get there. Our room didnâ€™t have a fridge, we call and requested one and they brought it up to our room right away at no charge. BEDROOM: The bedroom is exactly like what you see in the pictures. Itâ€™s small but cozy. If you can take advantage of the pillow menu, I suggest you should. I had forgotten about it; therefore, some nights I couldnâ€™t sleep on their pillows (the fabric makes too much noise). The room has no air condition, but a ceiling fan. They also have free Wi-Fi, a flat screen TV, closet, umbrella, a safe, and an ironing board. BATHROOM: The bathroom was small but decent. I didnâ€™t like how the toilet paper was right against the wall on top of you. You have to actually twist your back around to get it. They should have placed it on the wall in front of you (near the towels) instead of on top of you. That was a disadvantage for me. We had stayed in a remodeled room but my bathtub didnâ€™t look like it was remodeled at all. The paint had peeled off and you will see paint holes in your tub. LOCATION: You will find lots of shopping places and restaurants right outside of Chancellor. Chancellor is near a lot of the popular attractions like: fisherman wharf, Chinatown, Lombard St, etc. The cable cars are right in front of the hotel so itâ€™s very convenient to go to these places. You can buy the Muni pass right there at the tour desk to try it out. Some of the farther places like the Golden Gate Park, GG Bridge, and Palace of Fine Arts were better off if you take your own car. The cable cars donâ€™t go to these places. Waiting for the Muni buses will waste a lot of time and they are always full. We drove instead of taking the buses and were glad we did. HOUSEKEEPING: Everyday cleaning lady always cleaned our room. She gave us extra soap and towels, which was nice of her. NOTE: There will be plenty of homeless people everywhere you go including right outside of Chancellor Hotel. But donâ€™t worry because Chancellor is located where there are lots of people around you so you wonâ€™t be alone, kind of like being in New York. We even came prepared with pepper spray just in case, but never even use them. At night this place is pretty quiet, you could barely hear your neighbors or the street noise so I thought that was good about the quietness. Overall, a 4 rating was right for the Chancellor Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to lay your head”
Reviews.Author: jfull1965
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 3 nights at the Chancellor. As a matter of fact I am writing this review from the SFO airport while waiting for our flight home. This was a fine lace to stay if you are looking for lodging in the Union Square area. We got a rate of $145/n. after tax it was about $165. Although the room was small, but I understand this is normal for SF in the $ range, it was very clean. I never saw one bug or dust bunny and the bed was also very comfortable. I would definitely stay here again. The Chancellor is right on the PowellandMason / Powell and Hyde Cable car lines. Hop on and your in Fisherman's Wharf in 15 minutesor walk a short distance to Market St.and hop a streetcar and ride that way. Definitely by a"passport" the Muni pass. We bought the passport foe 3 days / $21. It gets you on allMuni buses and cablecars. Cablecar rides without are $6 each way.

Reviews.Title: “The Sounds of the City”
Reviews.Author: Nedzer
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed on the fifth floor facing busy Powell Street. Although, I did not hear noise from the neighboring rooms, the noise from outside the hotel was unbelievable. I checked the windows twice to make sure they were closed. It sounded like the street was running right through the room. The windows are not double paned and they are useless in blocking out noise. I felt like I should tip the street musicians on Union Square since it sounded like they were playing in my room. Powell Street is very busy and the noise did not diminish all night. There is no air conditioning and the evening was quite warm. I thought I would be saved by the ceiling fan. In theory, this would provide some cooling air and some white noise. However the fan was so poorly mounted to the ceiling, that even at the lowest speed it shook so badly I was certain it would fall out at any moment. Further it had a noisy and irregular rattle that added to the general cacophony. I would suggest that future guests insist on a room away from the street and check out the ceiling fan before settling in. Other than the noise, which as you can gather, was a big problem, I liked other aspects of the hotel. The location is good, and the price, considering the cost of other comparable hotels was quite reasonable. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. The room was clean and the bathroom facilities comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Just good enough”
Reviews.Author: IntrepidinMontreal
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the Chancellor Hotel is its location. We stayed there 3 nights and walked down to Powell and Market St. to catch the bus towards Embarcadero/Ferry Building. (We came back on BART to test the subway. TIP: cheaper to pay Bart $1.75 than the $2 bus fare.) We also got on the 38 bus that rides out west on Geary Ave. The central location also puts you in the heart of shopping action, many stores within a 3 block radius. We wanted to try Sears restaurant next door for breakfast but the line was too long, so we took out from Starbucks at the corner of Powell and Sutter. At the opposite corner, there is a drugstore to pick up beverages, snacks and other conveniences. Our two best meals were at Slanted Door (Ferry Building) and Empero Taste on 42nd St. near the Golden Gate Park. We tried Fino Ristorante in Andrews Hotel on Post Street â€¦ but it turned out not so fino. Back to the Chancellor Hotel. Overall, we were satisfied with the room for the price we paid. We had two twin beds in a very small room that also included a desk and chair, flatscreen tv on a bureau of drawers, and two more chairs around a small â€œcoffeeâ€� table. I was put off by the poor lighting in the bedroom; you have to turn on all the lights to see properly. Fortunately, with all lights on, it was adequate. I laughed at another readerâ€™s comment that the closet was larger than the bathroom. True! Actually, we had to keep closet closed at all times (losing the use of the full-length mirror on the door) because of the horrible odour. It smelled like 1864 in there. The bathroom could use some design tricks â€“ one skimpy towel bar to carry six towels (2 sets of towels) was not wide enough to hang used towelsâ€¦ Why not install a pivoting towel bar on the wall? Only one short hook on the back of the doorâ€¦ Why not install a double hook? Hardly any counter space, certainly not for two people. The best thing in the room was the bed linen â€“ pillows and duvet. Sadly, the same could not be said of the bed mattresses, which sagged in the middle. There is no a/c in the small room, so fortunately, we didnâ€™t need it. If you go in months hotter than Sept, you may want to find another hotel. Such a small room without a/c can be claustrophobic. In the hotel lobby, you can do web check-in for your flight boarding pass. Very handy. While not the best hotel experience, other hotels were charging $20-40 more per night for about the same quality. So overall, Chancellor Hotel was good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel in GREAT area!”
Reviews.Author: geewalt
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor is quite a find right at Union Square. I did quite a bit of research before deciding on The Chancellor. For the price it was perfect. There are lots of high end hotels around it, but for comfort and value this can't be beat. The hotel: very clean public areas, very friendly staff. My room was still being cleaned when I arrived so went and grabbed a bite and came back. Very friendly bellman retrieved my stored luggage and escorted me up to my room. NOTE: I was impressed with the elevators. There were only two and I was staying on the 13th floor, and they always arrived promptly and moved quickly. The rooms are small but comfortable and nicely appointed. I was traveling alone so the smallness didn't bother me as much as if I had had my wife along. The closet was HUGE. Lots of hanging space with safe, ironing board, umbrella and portable heater all inside with still lots of room for my luggage to sit on the luggage rack. I agree with several reviewers that you should request a high floor. It can get noisy, especially the cable car bell that dings constantly. And there is no A/C, but the open window and ceiling fan keep the room cool (and I was there during a SF "heat wave": 80 degrees! Location is fantastic. 1/2 block to Union Square with shopping and dining galore. I walked the neighborhood and found tons of restaurants, both chains and independent. Scala's is right across the street who's chefs were both on Top Chef. I just ordered a takeaway margarita pizza and it was delish. Transportation is easy to secure. The SF MUNI system is very efficient. While there is a cable car stop right out the hotel door, by the time it gets there from it's origin at the base of Powell street, it was always full. I did catch it early one morning around 8:30 and it wasn't bad. Walk about 2 blocks and you can catch a trolley car to Fisherman's Wharf. The trolley cars are old restored trolley cars from various cities. The city name is printed on the side. I rode one that was from Milan, Italy and still had signs in Italian. They literally are "museums on wheels." And BART line is right there as well, which you can take to and from the airport. I also rode it into Oakland to go to a Rangers/A's game and it was great. Anyway I ramble. Bottom line. Great hotel in a great location for a great price. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: dreamer2012
Reviews.Content: Great location, very friendly yet efficient staff. Breakfast is a nice change: its reasonable, quick and you can order exactly what you want. Nice change from buffet breakfasts. Room was clean and overlooked the street. No noise from neighbouring rooms but street noise was audible if windows left open. Not a large or a pricey hotel but felt very safe. If I ever get to go to San Francisco again, at least my choice of hotel will be very easy: this one.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel For The Price”
Reviews.Author: Carolind
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chancellor Hotel for 4 nights and had never been to San Francisco before. The hotel itself is right on Union Square so is good if you are wanting to get onto transport or tour buses. There are trams right out front and the tour buses all line up outside Macy's across the road. The hotel itself was nice - while we were there they were re-painting the lobby. The hotel style is sort of like the old victorian style buildings so don't expect modern or sleek at this hotel (not in a bad way). The roooms were tiny - probably the smallest rooms I've ever stayed in but I hear this is normal for San Francisco, especially if you're on a budget. The rooms were clean and tidy, the bed comfy and they had a pillow menu which we didn't use but I thought was a great idea. The bathroom was even smaller and the thing I found funny was that the closet was almost bigger than the bathroom. I would prefer a larger bathroom than some closet space as I just leave my stuff in my suitcase when I'm at hotels, but that's just my opinion. We only went to the bar for an hour or so one night and it's really small so it's not really designed for if you're looking for a night out. There was a market a couple of blocks away from the hotel where we were able to buy beer, toiletries and general stuff. We asked the concierge where we could eat - we aren't foodies so we generally look for averaged priced restaurants, nothing fancy. We were advised that there was a pizza place a few blocks away that was good. As we had spent the whole day travelling to San Fran we weren't looking forward to the hike up the hills to find this place and as we stood outside we noticed right next door a place called Sears Fine Food. After looking at the menu this is exactly the place we were looking for. Reasonably priced food - steaks, pasta, that kind of stuff. The food was great we ate here for dinner twice and breakfast twice. I have no idea why the concierge didn't tell us there was a restaurant right next door. We also used the concierge to book a hop on hop off tour and a city. We are usually the kind who likes to explore on our own but as we only had two days here we wanted to get the most out of the two days. The hop on hop off wasn't worth it. They were meant to loop around ever 15-30mins and we got off to look at the crookedest street and we waited over and hour for them to come back, in the end we rang the tour company to find out if they were going to come back for us! They did come but it was annoying because it took precious time from our schedule. In saying all this, this was nothing to do with the hotel itself. All in all a nice hotel and one of the cheaper around San Francisco. I would probably not stay here again, but only because we aren't "city people" and would most likley visit the outer suburbs of San Francisco if we return.

Reviews.Title: “Best recommendation”
Reviews.Author: Ursula l
Reviews.Content: For many year I chose this Hotel And was never disappointed about the service, location and food. Staff is well trained and could not be friendlier. Mrs. Ursula Lederer.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: norgenvaaz
Reviews.Content: Union Square is a brilliant location if you wish to stay near the city centre. Close to all forms of public transport and get a travel pass if your there for a few days and it gets you on most forms of public transport (except the BART) so it's easy to get around and you then get a choice of which form of transport you want to use - use them all! Hotel is satisfactory and all was good just the room was quite small as they could have got rid of a couple of items of furniture which would have made it a bit more roomy. But we don't see that as real problem as you only sleep, shower and dress in the room so it was fine. I would say it was above average for our needs but not very good but as there is nothing in between we've given it the very good tick of approval.

Reviews.Title: “Nice classic hotel. Great location and staff.”
Reviews.Author: JMfromTO
Reviews.Content: Nice central location in Union Square. Above average staff. Matt in the lobby was very helpful and friendly. Rooms are a decent size (this is a city hotel, don't expect suburban sized rooms). Clean rooms and nice beds. Got a good deal for a 3 day stay. Had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Linny_1975
Reviews.Content: We're about to check-out of the Chancellor after a 3 day stay. The location of the Hotel is great, near Union Square on Powell Street. From the BART station it's a few hundred meters up the hill. The rooms are a bit small, but it was large enough for us. Very clean, nicely decorated, a LCD tv and everything works fine. Beds are good. There is also a safe in the room. The only thing that was not so great was the view when we looked out of our window: we were looking at another wall at the fire exit (room on 2nd floor). The hotel is also very quiet, not enough noise. Breakfast is not included, so you have to pay if you want to have breakfast in the hotel. We had breakfast in the hotel all 3 days, it was very good!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Elliott22
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor is a basic, clean and friendly spot in a perfect location for visiting the core of SF. The rooms and bathrooms are small but clean and the service personnel are very eager to please. It's also next door to Sears Restaurant; a great 3 mael a day restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “It is, what-it-is...”
Reviews.Author: Mim E
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor is not a 4 or 5 star quality hotel (more like 3.5 star), but it is exactly what you are paying for and it is reliable and well worth the 170/night we paid. I would not stay there for business. The rooms are quintessential late 1800â€™s small, but they have been nicely maintained and newly painted, carpeted, decorated and surprisingly quiet. They feature flat screen TV, full bath with cute amenities, new windows (very nice in SF) and a giant closet! It is great for couples looking for an affordable hotel in Union Square. The only complaint I have is the bed. Although not completely uncomfortable, they are hard; just a step up from a kid mattress; springy. The lobby is outdated and the bell station is static, but the front desk on top of things, courteous, friendly, informative, helpfulâ€¦ everything you would want to be greeted by. There were a lot of younger couples and singles, but completely appropriate for any age. It is not a party hotel. If you are on a budget and want the Union Square area, I would definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “we Love This Place!”
Reviews.Author: chriskoh7770
Reviews.Content: My partner and myself stayed in Chancellor Hotel for a week during our summer holiday in the States recently and I've only good things to say about this boutique hotel. I picked this hotel from the fantastic reviews from other travellers in Tripadvisor. There is no regrets thereafter. From the moment I started making reservations, the manager, Wes Tyler has been very very very helpful. As we have driven in from LA, we had done a lot of shopping along the way and one of the purchase was a Tumi luggage which we have ordered in Carmel and to be delivered to Chancellor in SF. So i wrote to the hotel informing them that this luggage might be delivered even before our arrival. One of the reservation officers Kevin Vossen responded to my mail and said he has contacted Tumi and has been told the luggage will arrive in a few days time. It is really nice of him to take the initiative. They also took good care of our luggage when we were away for a few days (we went to vegas). And during those few days during our absence, the stuffs we ordered from Amazon were delivered to the hotel and were delivered to our rooms the moment we came back. There are several big hotels around Chancellor but I love the personal attention given by small boutique hotels. The rooms are beautifully furnished. The bed is very very comfortable and they also has a pillow menu. When we checked in, there was a bottle of champagne and a box of chocolates welcoming our arrival. On the second checked-in, there was a photo frame, with a bottle of champagne too. The frame is a very nice momento from the hotel and It is now sitting on top of my study desk :) The location is fantastic, right in the middle of Union Square and within 10mins walk to Chinatown. Taking the cable car was no hassle at all and all there are tons of shops like Macy's, H&M, Gap are all within 5mins walk! There is also a Victoria Secret beside the hotel. It is also a very centralised location for taking cab everywhere. We joined Dylan's tour and the pick-up point is just around the corner. There are many restaurants in the area so food is not an issue. As we are from Asia, we missed asia food after 2 weeks in the states and we found 2 very good thai restaurants there! We had a really nice time in SF and the hotel we stayed played a big part to our fantastic vacation. We hope to go back again and will definitely go back to Chancellor for sure.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous, fabulous”
Reviews.Author: fluff
Reviews.Content: thanks Wes and all your staff for another wonderful stay. once again everyone was gracious and helpful to the max.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit”
Reviews.Author: BeakerRX
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Chancellor. This time we stayed for 5 nights and were not disappointed. The Chancellor is so convenient to everything in SF. It's location is right on a stop on the Powell Street cable cars and only 4 blocks from the Powell St BART station. We took the BART train from the airport and its about a 5 minute walk from the station. This visit was for our anniversary and the hotel had a bottle of champagne, chocolates and a gift for us in the room when we arrived. The rooms are very comfortable and you MUST take advantage of the pillow menu. This is THE hotel to stay in in SF if you want great service, nicely appointed and comfortable rooms, convenient location and very good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Harveysgirl
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I spent 8 days at the Chancellor and had a very pleasant stay. I was very skeptical and worried when I read some of the reviews about small rooms, no air conditioning, thin walls and no coffee maker in the room. I was worried for nothing! We had the best nights sleep ever! The room was just perfect and suited our needs, with a large walk-in closet that included extra pillows, an extra comforter, safe, hangers, ironing board/iron. We were able to put everything away! No need for an air conditioner. We were on the 11th floor facing Powell Street, had a good view of Union Square. We kept the front and bathroom windows open, plus the ceiling fan going and most nights had to close the window because it got chilly in the room! We weren't bothered at all with noise outside because by midnight it was pretty much quiet. The bathroom was small but not overly small and there was plenty of space to place toiletries, so not a big thing. Some reviewers complained of thin walls so I came prepared with ear plugs just in case, but I never even unpacked my earplugs! It was so quiet on our floor and we never heard anything! The hotel is old but with character, the staff were nice and did their job, they are not there to entertain us and were always helpful when needed. We had breakfast in the restaurant 3 times and by far was the best value and best breakfast that we had in San Francisco. Our waiter on our 1st visit to the restaurant started out slow but managed to redeem himself in the end. The all day fresh cookies and coffee in the lobby was better than having to make a mess in the room trying to make coffee. The small bar always had a crowd and we enjoyed the 2 for 1 drink special! And the best part? LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!!! Could not be beat! Oh and the rate we paid was crazy good! We would definitely stay at the Chancellor again and would recommend it to others! In the end do your research and decide what is important to make your visit comfortable and if the Chancellor does not suit your needs then it is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value!”
Reviews.Author: immortal_ca
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our honeymoon in California and spent 4 nights in the Chancellor Hotel. We thought it was great, the hotel staff were very helpful and friendly. You are greeted by a friendly porter man at the entrance who will take you bags up to your room. The hotel offers complimentary cookies, popcorn, tea and coffee and access to a computer and internet, although there is free WIFI in all rooms. Yes the rooms aren't big, but ours was certainly more than adequate, we had an ensuite with a walkin wardrobe. There was a safe, an iron and ironing board, extra pillows and duvets. The bathroom was fine, perhaps a little dated looking but clean. We had a good sized flat screen TV and some complimentary water and sweets. The bed was also comfortable which made a welcome change from the overly soft beds we experienced on our trip up from LA. The location is definately the best thing about the Chancellor. Your a stone throw away from Union Square, and there is always some event on in the Square. Opposite the hotel is the stop for the Tram line also. Right next door to the hotel is one of SF oldest restaurants called Sears which is a must visit especially for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, comfortable and good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Al_and_Daz
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Yes, the rooms are 'cosy' but in a city like San Francisco there's so much to see and do that you'll not spend long in your room anyway. Stayed in one of the infamous low level, front facing rooms and I have to say the double-glazing works a treat and the room wasn't at all noisy. The free tea and coffee in the lobby is a nice touch. I only used the restaurant for breakfast but found the food quality to be good and reasonably priced. The staff in the restaurant were particularly helpful.

Reviews.Title: “GreatlLocation in a fantastic City”
Reviews.Author: Tom R
Reviews.Content: The hotel was perfectly nice, big room. Great location close to all the shops and the cable car station.

Reviews.Title: “THANK YOU FOR A WONDERFUL 2 WEEK STAY IN YOUR LOVELY HOTEL !”
Reviews.Author: sevillafan
Reviews.Content: I chose the Chancellor Hotel after reading all the positive reviews on TA and was not disappointed. Everything was just as described. I booked directly with the hotel and the communications were very prompt and helpful with our requests. I stayed with my grandson in a twin room on the 7th floor. We could see Macys and Union Square from our window and hear the cable cars go past. It was perfect for us and the sounds from the street were not a problem, even with the window open. It added to the charm of the hotel and this great city. I can't praise the staff enough, from the ladies when we checked in to the the lovely May who looked after our room for the two weeks. Special thanks to Mike who was so helpful when I needed to send a fax at 2.30AM, due to the time difference in England. All the staff on the front desk were so polite and helpful no matter how often we asked for advice, We bought tickets for a 49ers game from them and the seats were great. We booked a trip to Monterey from the tour desk. That was very handy. We didn't make use of the gym option as we were so busy with other things but it's a great free extra if it's your thing. The free wi fi was a bonus, especially the free use of a PC and printer for when we had to book extra baggage to take home our purchases from the shoppers paradise that is SF. This is the first holiday ever that I only used one cab !! That was when we arrived from SFO to the hotel. Between the fab hotel location as so much was walking distance, and our 7 day Muni passes we must have covered most of the city . Apologies for this review being long ! It bugs me when I've read the negative comments as they mostly mention things that people should be aware of when they book this hotel' or are not about the hotel directly. Keep up the good work Chancellor, You will def be my hotel of choice if I get the opportunity to return to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in SF”
Reviews.Author: Triniflyguy
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for two nights. We took the BART from SFO and alighted at the Powell St. station and walked about 10 mins to the Chancellor. There is also a cable car dropoff/pickup point opposite the hotel which provides easy access to move around the SF area such as getting down to Fisherman's wharf. The hotel staff is friendly and the room is very comfortable, despite its small size. There is no air conditioning but the ceiling fans were surprisingly good at keeping the room temperature comfortable. The location is also ideal for nearby shopping and there's also 2 walgreens nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, good value, but not a fan of Union Sq”
Reviews.Author: ChrissyF123
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay in the Union Sq area because I had stayed in the area once before and thought it would be convenient for the airport, BART, restaurants, and sight seeing. I choose the Chancellor because it was a good price ($145 a night + tax) and had gotten written up in the NY Times for its bedbug prevention strategy. Coming from NYC I am super paranoid about bedbugs and a lot of hotels in SF have bedbug reports, so the Chancellor gave me piece of mind in that regard. And the hotel itself was fine, but nothing too fancy. I also appreciated the fact they let me check in early (around 11 am), even though I hadn't requested early check in. But I must say I was NOT a fan of Union Sq this time around. Maybe it has gotten worse since my last trip, or maybe it was super crowded because it was a holiday weekend, but it was absolutely mobbed with tourists, to the point where it was difficult to walk on Powell St from the BART to the hotel. It reminded me of Times Square and that is not a good thing -- like most New Yorkers I typically avoid Times Square like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in beautiful SF”
Reviews.Author: SML1969
Reviews.Content: Soundless nights (in a busy street) are great. There are a lot of bus stops nearby, heading to everywhere in SF. Good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly, comfortable and worth the money”
Reviews.Author: iagray206
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for union square and shopping. Very professional and friendly staff. Convenient tour desk who were proactive in ensuring I was taken care of for airport transfers, activities etc. Room was small, but pleasantly furnished and very clean. Hotel itself is older but charming. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Great location!”
Reviews.Author: mcproost
Reviews.Content: With just a few hiccups (room request not fufilled right away and initially unfriendly front desk worker - but we think she was new b/c she didn't know much ...) everything turned out great. The rooms were great. Bed comfortable and with the windows open and the fan running - we were comfortable all night. AC-schmasy. :) I would definitely recommend either requesting a room high up (to avoid noise) or a room to the back of the hotel which was much quieter. Our first night they had us on the third floor facing Powell Street (when I asked to be high and back) and it was noisy. However, they moved us the next day and everything worked out. Yes, the rooms were small BUT we've stayed in MUCH smaller rooms in Europe. Our rooms fit our luggage and our snack bag just fine. We never felt crowded. The front desk gave us FANTASTIC restaurant suggestions and easy to understand directions to the tourist sites. The location cannot be beat! And the price can't be beat for the location. Website gave perfect directions to get to the hotel. All in all - great stay for us and we would definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “A good experience, and a perfect location for our purposes”
Reviews.Author: Peggy v
Reviews.Content: We knew nothing of the Chancellor other than reading positive online reviews, and decided to take a chance. It more than satisfied our hopes. We loved walking right out the door to the cable car stop (and could purchase ride passes at the hotel), and being so near Union Square and places to eat. My husband loved being so near Walgreen's and it's 24/7 icees! We used Lorrie's shuttle service both ways and were very satisfied with it as well.

Reviews.Title: “Overall an excellent position to take advantage of the many attractions in San Fran.”
Reviews.Author: Emuchick
Reviews.Content: There is a cable car stop at the door and a short walk to other Muni transport as a quick and cheap way to get around. The hotel was clean and staff friendly and a spot of trouble with tickets bought for the red bus was quickly and efficiently dealt with. Easy walking to major shops to browse and plenty of varied eateries nearby. The only gripe I really have is that there were no tea/coffee making facilities in the room. They do supply free tea/ coffee and cookies downstairs but when you are tired after walking around all day and have had a shower you don't feel like dressing again to get a late night cup of tea. We bought a jug and a couple of mugs fairly cheaply (around $20) and made our own early morning and late night teas. Overall a good experience and one I'd recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Union Square”
Reviews.Author: funfamilytime
Reviews.Content: Close proximity to shopping, restaurants and cable cars. Clean and comfortable rooms, albeit quite small. Friendly, helpful staff. Excellent value for the location. Others have already written great reviews ... that's how we came to choose The Chancellor Hotel for our trip!

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable stay..”
Reviews.Author: rzrbktraveler
Reviews.Content: Rooms were comfortable and well appropriated. Front desk staff was very accomodating with a room change at check in (traveling with family member). Lovely housekeeping staff who checked in on us making sure we didn't need anything during our 5 day stay (we recycled all linens/towels). Enjoyed breakfast every morning in onsite restaurant with excellent wait staff. As has previously been reported, location is great and access to various sites is easy to obtain. Muni passes are available at concierge which allows you to be ready to go exploring. Am an extensive traveler and was very pleased with The Chancellor.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it, central in union square, good room and services”
Reviews.Author: Guyonatrip
Reviews.Content: Pulled up outside and it didn't have a large frontage but everything else about this hotel was great. Good room and services. Great location for food, shopping and the trams. Enjoyed it and will be back. Now in hawaii for some sun

Reviews.Title: “Ethical and Honest”
Reviews.Author: Christine U
Reviews.Content: In addition to the nice, clean accommodations, excellent location, complimentary coffee, tea, cookies and apples, this hotel is staffed with people of integrity!! When I realized on my way to the airport that I had left all of my jewelry on the desk in my room, I was panicked. My jewelry consisted of 5 gold, diamond and gemstone rings and a pair of gold earrings. The value was considerable, but the sentimental value was even higher (including my father's wedding band). I called the hotel immediately and they assured my that the housekeeping staff would be made aware of this and they would return my belongings via overnight delivery service (at my cost of course...no problem since it was my fault). The package arrived to my home the next business day!! Everything was there and I was thrilled!!

Reviews.Title: “Happy in SF”
Reviews.Author: ScubadiverNy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a pleasant surprise. It was right in the heart of Union Square and easily accessible to other points of interest by cable car or trolley. The room was a bit small, but I knew that going in and adapted quickly. However, it's more comfortable that a cabin in cruise ship. I was also impressed with the cleanliness and the "ambiance and charm" of the hotel. When I return to SF on business, I hope to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really Enjoyed!”
Reviews.Author: JAZ65_11
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor has a great location! Took BART from the San Francisco airport, got off at Powell Street, and walked right up the hill (4 blocks) to the hotel. No car is needed, since SF has excellent public transportation, assuming you pack light. Even the cable cars are right out the door. Lodging reservations were correct and there's a computer to use for plane check-ins (the desk staff will help if needed). Loved the lobby coffee and free local papers in the morning. We also enjoyed breakfast twice at the convenient in-house restaurant Luques. The corner twin-bed room was cozy and comfortable, with a good-size closet, and the bed linens were spotless. Having different metabolism, one of us needed all the covers on her bed, and the other needed just the first layer on hers. The ceiling fan was a nice touch, and we were high enough that street noise wasn't a problem even when the windows were open (earplugs not a bad idea, though). We were very pleased with the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: disneyfan1002
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. Right on the trolley line, which gives you great access to all downtown attractions and not far from Fisherman's Wharf. Very clean room, just a tad small but the bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was spotless.Complimentary newspapers, coffee, cookies and fruit each day too.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, comfortable & welcoming right in Union Square!”
Reviews.Author: QtownTraveller
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Chancellor for three nights this past August. Tired from a week on the road to get there, the staff were friendly and helpful from the get go. Check-in was quick and easy. Self-parking is secure and very close (one block walking) to the hotel. You can't beat the location of the Chancellor - so many cool neighbourhoods within walking distance, or an easy ride away on the cable cars or bus. Rooms may seem small, but who spends more time than sleeping in their room while visiting this awesome city? I would recommend the Chancellor to anyone! I suggest buying a multi-day transit pass for affordable and easy exploring while in San Fran!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price for 1st time in San Fran”
Reviews.Author: snackaddict
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights, location was great and super close to cable cars/transit and shopping nearby. Check in was easy, they even had a parking in the front just to park the car temporarily and unload. Room was decent, with only the bathrooms smaller than expected, but it is an older hotel. When we first arrived in the room, there was a musty smell but after we got the fan going it was fine. Did not get a chance to try their pillow menu, but the choices were interesting. We were on one of the higher floors facing the back of the hotel, so luckily we didn't hear too much noice as other reviewers had mentioned. Had breakfast mainly next door at Sears Restaurant- really reasonable and good food. Overall for the great location and price would definitely go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Not too impressed”
Reviews.Author: Christa90
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights (8th and 9th August) at this hotel. Our room was clean and functional, but, as an end corridor room, it suffered from the fact that its entrance door was set at such an awkward angle that the entrance area seemed cramped â€“ so that, for instance, you could not enter the bathroom unless the entrance door was shut. When we stated that we had not been pleased with the room on leaving, we were merely asked whether we had asked for a replacement on arrival, which we had not. We would much rather that a hotel simply gives us of its best unprompted rather than waiting for the stimulus of complaint before yielding up a fair deal. The rooms on the internet, which had lured us in, looked a lot better. We do not think that we got a fair deal. The breakfast arrangements in the restaurant were rather workmanlike. Food was brought and the waiting staff seemed to be constantly checking to see when they could clear away. We had some excellent breakfasts in our hotels in the States, but this was not one of them. Everything is separately charged and the quality is barely adequate, so that the quality to price ratio is poor. The Chancellor is not a bad hotel, but I would not rate it as a good hotel and would not rush to return.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: CJ1920
Reviews.Content: We arrived in San Francisco after four days in Vancouver and a week cruising in Alaska. We were left slightly scared by the taxi driver who portrayed the city as a murder hotspot but found it to be one of the best cities we have visited. The hotel room seemed a little small when we first arrived, but if we kept it tidy there was no issue with space. It was clean and had all the facilities we needed. The location is unbeatable, right on Union Square and opposite Saks - the tour bus (if you choose to take one) stops almost across the road. We had a drink in the bar one night and picked up some useful city tips from the bar staff. We both appreciated the use of the computer by reception - free internet to check emails was a nice extra.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't praise this hotel enough-Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: sarah5320
Reviews.Content: This hotel receives excellent review after review for a reason! First the location is fantastic, right on Union Square on Powell Street. All the shops you could want on the door step. Fishermans wharf is a pleasant 30 minute walk away straight down Powell St. Alternatively if you don't fancy braving the hills then the Cable cars stop right out the front door. A taxi cost less than $10. We walked to te wharf there and back every day for 4 days and enjoyed the walk. Next the rooms are great, very comfortable bed, pillow menu with a choice of a dozen pillows. All the usual room amenities tv, iron, safe, toiletries, rubber duck, ceiling fan. We were there during the height of summer and didn't need any air con, the ceiling fan was more than sufficient. Also noise was not an issue as some other reviews have stated. As we were on honeymoon we even received a bottle of champagne, chocolates and even a photo frame as a present. The hotel bar is great for cocktails and Rory the bar tender gave us some fantastic recommendations for restaurants. Scala the Italian across the road is very good. We also ate at a plae called First Crush which was a few blocks away and very good too. The coffee, cookies and popcorn available in reception all day every day is a lovely touch. They don't have coffee making facilities in the room but it is no bother nipping down for some. This hotel is amazing value and I would definately stay here again without a second thought! Thanks to the Chancellor for kicking off our honeymoon in style.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: jeanettemh
Reviews.Content: I spent 9 days in SF on a mother/daughter trip. No need to rent a car. This hotel is on the cable car line and only a short walk to the Subway. Union square is right outside the door. Great value. Staff was great. Food was great. Would stay again on a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mutleydoggy
Reviews.Content: We, a family of three adults and one child (9) stayed here for three nights in August, we requested and got, a double room, with a large bed and a twin room with two singles which were connecting. Our bed was extreamly comfortable. Our room was just down from the lift but we never heard any noise. Check in and out was quick and easy, the lobby was plesently decorated, we brought three day MUNI passes from the lady at the tour desk in the lobby, these where $21 each including children, the cable car lines run directly outside the hotel. We ate a really good meal at Sears next door and enjoyed listening to the city at night with the window open, would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hotel! Very clean and perfect location! LOVED IT!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TriciaTravels
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great! Very clean, friendly staff, and the location could not be any better! Just a random fyi -- stay away from a district called Tenderloin, it's not the safest place I've ever been. Other than that the city was great fun and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: lutherkins
Reviews.Content: The chancellor is an older boutique hotel so the rooms are fairly small and there are things that give away it's age. However, it was comfortable, clean, and the staff was friendly. One complaint: the fan in our room made an annoying noise if you put it on the top speed. The hotel does not have air conditioning so I was concerned about sleeping at night due to the temperature; however, at night the temp drops enough that we didn't need the fan on full blast. The location was awesome! You can catch any type of transportation within about 2 blocks of the hotel. One thing to note though is the street noise. It didn't bother us at night because we kept the window closed, but it would have been a problem with the window open.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel, Perfect Location, Perfect Vacation”
Reviews.Author: LyndsJM
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at the Chancellor Hotel for 4 nights while on vacation. We chose this hotel solely based on tripadvisor reviews ( as per usual for me ) We were greeted by smiles and friendly staff, and even though we arrived around 1130 our room was ready when we arrived. I had emailed the hotel and requested a room on a higher floor on the backside as some reviews said it could be very noisy. We had room 1505 and I had no problems with noise. There aren't rooms on either side so we didn't hear anyone else at any time. The only noise we heard was from the ice machine which was on the other side of the shower. ( No big deal ) At night, as we were facing Union Square, it was quiet as long as we had the window closed. We ate breakfast in the hotel one morning, it was good! Our waiter was hilarious and the food was really good, and a little cheaper than other restaurants in the same area. For the price the hotel was perfect, the hotel was awesome the staff was great, not single complaints here! It was really nice to have the pillow menu, they have... 8, 10? on the menu that you can chose from, that was a really nice added touch. A few recommendations... The hotel is walking distance to the Wharf, Ferry Terminal and all the touristy spots. It took maybe.. 30? 45? minutes to walk to the Wharf, but is a beautiful walk. You can walk through China Town to avoid the hills if that's easier for you. When you arrive you get a package, there's a $5 off coupon for Bike and Roll bike rentals. We rented our bikes from there for $27, other places were a bit more expensive ( up to $35 at some places) I would definately recommend biking from the Wharf over the Golden Gate Bridge and into Sausilito (sp?) The ride isn't to bad ( a few hills ) and beautiful views of the bridge along the way. Riding over the bridge is just something you need to do, it's a great fun experience and a beautiful ride ( my bf even proposed while we were stopped on the bridge :) ) I would also recommend walking to the Ferry Terminal and buying fresh bread and cheese and having a picnic where you can find a spot. The ferry Terminal has awesome shops and restaurants that you shouldn't miss. All in all, San Francisco is a wonderful city and the Chancellor Hotel is the perfect place to spend your vacation. Oh.. if you're a sushi fan.. hit up Maru Sushi, just 2 blocks up.. best sushi I've had...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, will definately be back!”
Reviews.Author: Jenny B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and it was fantastic. The room was very clean and beautifully decorated. The location is perfect for acessing all areas of San Francisco (as long as you don't mind the steep hills). We found Sears next door was delicious for breakfast. I loved San Francisco and this hotel added to the pleasure of our trip, I highly reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: jodaly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Chancellor hotel about a week ago. San Francisco was the last leg of our road trip and we wanted to stay somewhere comfortable with a good location. We picked the Chancellor due to the very affordable room rates and reviews. We were not dissapointed. As soon as we got there, the staff was friendly and helpful. We valet our car which is a little expensive ($30 a night) but we are in a city and this is the way it is. We were aware of this. We checked in on the highest floor because I had heard it can be a bit noisy. Our room was small, very clean and fit our needs perfectly. The room does have a huge closet where we were able to store our luggage and belongings. The bed was very comfortable! E very morning I went and got free coffee in the lobby which is offered all day. This hotel is very warm and inviting. The only complaint I have, which is not the hotel's fault ,was there is construction going on on Powell St so if you want your windows open, it is all you hear. Generally speaking, we did not spend much time in the room and at night the construction was finished. Wonderful Restaurant across the Street. Delicious Italian!! We did use the cable cars but to be honest, it is great for the experience not if you are on a time schedule! Being that it is "tourist" season, most of them were usually packed and it was tough to get on. By the last day, we decided to take cabs. (which arent easy to get in this city either) Overall, great experience, would go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tiny room - but who spends time in the room anyway??”
Reviews.Author: nelidee
Reviews.Content: Great location. We could walk almost everywhere! Would recommend it. When we first arrived we were greeted by the stench of urine outside the door. But that happens in San Fran, we got over that quickly. The staff were polite and courteous. I loved that the hotel (and everyone else in san fran) gave a sh** about the environment. We were given a plastic bag in the hotel room to collect recyclables, and encouraged not to renew towels. The bed was really comfortable, and the room was surprisingly quiet given the busy location. Yes.. I think I would stay there again. The small room really didn't matter. We were literally only there to sleep, shower and change... San fran has too many awesome things to see and do (and eat!)

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Sierra_Coll
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved this hotel. The staff were very friendly and eager to help. Cookies and fruit were supplied daily in the lobby. We were on the 14th flour up above any possible traffic noise. With our window open every night we were serenaded with a saxaphone which only added to the atmosphere. The room was big enough for two with a fridge and a great walk-in closet. The Chancellor even has a pillow menu, which I was happy to try out. We would highly recomend this hotel for anyone to stay in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfying experience”
Reviews.Author: Tatun
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend..Due to alte arrival, called the reception adn they could not have been more friendly and accomodating. I understand some rooms may face the back walls, but ours was facing the busy Powell street, and it did not fail to impress us that once the windows were closed, the noise was almost totally blocked. The lack of A/C was no problems at all as it was cold in the city, and there was a ceiling fan available as well. Bear in mind that it is a building almost 100 years old, but rooms have renovated and modern/boutique look...Great services at the reception and by the concierge..A great touch was the always available coffee and tea pots in the lobby...And the location!!!!!!!!...That in itself is worth the stay...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, excellent pricing, wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: DrmnOfMaui
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location!! The Chancellor Hotel is located conveniently in midst of Union Square with easy access to shopping, dining and transportation. Hopping on a cable car nearly in front of the hotel was not only a fun event for the kids, but the perfect way to reach Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 33 to Alcatraz, Ghirardelli, China Town and so much more. The staff was always friendly and extraordinarily helpful (particularly the bellman!), and yes the cookies were in the lobby and they were warm. No, there is no air conditioning, but a nice ceiling fan made up for that along with windows that open wide to the street below, plus August is usually cool with foggy days and evening. While I enjoyed the sounds of the city late into the evening, my husband was frustrated with the noise and had trouble sleeping. I've read that a request for a high floor on the back of the hotel may eliminate this problem. The room was appealing with a comfortable bed, and the candy dish made the kids smile. The hotel is lined with old fashioned fire escapes and I was heard to quickly proclaim "NO!" as my 12 year old daughter asked "Is that our balcony and can I go out there??" Luques was marginal... pricey for Dennys-like fare, I would not return. My recommendation is to try Honey Honey Crepery just down the street and around the corner. Charming hotel at a wonderful price in a very desirable location. My hotel of choice for trips to SF! To read more visit: http://livlifetoo.blogspot.com/2011/08/san-francisco-tourist-union-square.html

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: Rob1065
Reviews.Content: Location was great right at Union Square and the cable car to Fisherman's Wharf ran right in front of hotel. Staff were friendly and rooms were clean. The free coffee & cookies in the lobby was a nice touch. The water pressure in the shower was the best I've ever had in a hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “This is a wonderful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lkinney
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took a well needed vacation to SF and chose this from reviews on this site. It is perfectly located - 1/2 block from Union Square, walking distance to Powell St. BART station, and the cable car runs directly in front of the hotel. The hotel itself is small but wonderful. Staff was very helpful, from front desk, to room staff, to the tour guide at the booth in the lobby. The rooms were very nice, clean, and comfortable. The giant king bed was great after a long day of seeing the sights. Wireless internet access was FAST - (we took two laptops and were uploading pics faster than at home). Our room overlooked Powell street and the street noise was perceptible but not loud at all - kind of added to the ambiance. Also - the bathtub was full-sized and DEEP. You could fill it up and soak after a day of walking the hills and it felt great! There is also a Walgreens around the corner and a Starbucks nearby, so you can pick up anything you forgot, grab a snack or a coffee, at any time of the day or night. Very helpful on a tourist trip. Overall, we loved the hotel, loved the location, the price was just right, and we'd be happy to recommend this hotel to anyone. We will definitely come back here next time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, perfect location!"”
Reviews.Author: Bookdaft
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. This was our first trip to San Francisco and The Chancellor was the perfect location for sightseeing. It is right on Union Square so lots of good shopping and restaurants. The hotel is full of character and the staff very friendly and helpful. Our room was average size and though it was a little worn around the edges, everything was clean. It is a city centre location so expect a little noise, but it wasn't any more than we expected and we were never very disturbed by it. We loved the complimentary tea, coffee and cookies in the lobby in the morning and usually grabbed some on the way out to start our day in place of breakfast. On our last day here we discovered that if you go up the little spiral staircase from the lobby there is a tiny lending library just outside the bathrooms, nice touch! We only ate breakfast once in the hotel restaurant, it was nice (kinda hard to screw up scrambled eggs too much) and the prices what I would expect in a hotel. We'd recommend walking a couple of minutes up hill to the next block and eating in the diner, great prices and great breakfast. Also, don't miss out on a piece of decadent cheesecake from the Cheesecake Factory on the roof of Macy's. Great views of Union Square from here too. Highly recommend the night-time tour of Alcatraz island too, it was one of the best tours I've ever been on. Can't thank the attendants of the tour desk at the hotel enough, they were very patient with us and helped us book a great day tour along the Pacific Coast to Monterey and Carmel. Our Scottish accents were obviously a challenge but we got there in the end!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Claire A
Reviews.Content: Kicked off a 2 week holiday with 5 nights here. It's a perfect location, right on Union Square, and the rooms were comfy, cosy and had plenty of space for the 2 of us. There was a bottle of cava waiting in the room on arrival and free coffee and tea available 24 hours a day in the lobby. I would definitely recommend this hotel for first trip to San Francisco. It's really central, easy to get around from and trams run past from early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Colleen47
Reviews.Content: Chancellor Hotel was in a good location. We followed some of the reviews and requested a room on an upper level on the backside. We were not disappointed. People were very accommodating and polite. We definitely will use this hotel again. Superb location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great staff and perfect location !!!”
Reviews.Author: Eddie A
Reviews.Content: San Francisco was the 1st stop of our vacations in US and we were really very happy from our hotel's choice. Chancellor is located in the center of the city, where you can find all the shops, trasportation (the cable car pass in front) and night life after sunset. Union Square was a safe place to walk even after dark. The hotel was very clean and quiet, the rooms not large like Las Vegas, but very confortable , with a large wardrobe with safe, free WiFi, TFT TV etc. The Ice Maker in every floor was perfect for our morning iced coffee. The vallet parking useful and almost the same money with self parking. Don't miss Sears Fine Food for breakfast, just right to hotel's entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Newlywedsontour2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chancellor for 4 nights as part of our tour of California. We had read lots of reviews prior to arrival and were keen to see if it lived up to our expectations. Oh and it did! A fantastic little hotel that had the most amazing location. Right in the heart of union square, close to cable car stops, shops and restaurants. We drank at the bar once during happy hour and it was nice. We had free tea & coffee everyday which was perfect. The rooms were on the small side but were perfect as let's face it, all you do is sleep there. You're out the whole day sightseeing!! Didn't eat at the Chancellor but it smelt good. We had breakfast at Sears next door (yum yum) We would definitely come back to the Chancellor, an excellent hotel in the heart of union square!

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of the city by the bay”
Reviews.Author: AcemanAndSpam
Reviews.Content: Generally speaking, excellent value. The room was small but comfortable, and the bed exceptional. The small bar provided reasonably priced beer. The restaurant is good quality, but rather over-priced, which is par for the city. As for noise, depends what you like. I quite appreciated the ring of the cable cars, but the bugle player on Union square needs shot. Friendly staff, always willing to talk about the baseball, which is on in the bar. The location cannot be beat. If you want to pay through the roof for the big name places across the street, be my guest, but for most people, the Chancellor is as good value for money as you'll get in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “No hesitation in recommending this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: CatherineBath
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We had ainterconnecting rooms, though overlooking busy street they were very quiet. Ice maker further along corridor for my G+T. Very clean and such comfortable beds. Staff very friendly and helpful. "Bar" a bit soulless so we didn't use it, but free coffee and tea in lobby available at all times to compensate for none in room. Discovered after a couple of days that the restaurant for breakfast had better food and cheaper than diners nearby, though not as much fun. Very central location on Union Square which was a very pleasant place for people watching at all times of day, and right next to tourist bus stops. Don't be put off by lack of a/c. We were there in a heatwave and didn't even need the ceiling fans. Note could be long queues for buses for particular trips- well worth going over Golden Gate Bridge.If full , better to wait for the next one- liely to follow soon after. Alcatraz tour great, also tram ridesand the "Science Museum " in Golden Gate Park had a great aquarium. Easy to catch regular bus back int town. Japanese Tea garden very over-rated , similar to free municipal botanical gardens in UK.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Clean, and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jlsatud
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Chancellor. It's right off Union Square, close to lots of shopping and public transportation. The rooms and bathroom are small because it's an older property, but everything is updated and clean. Everyone at the front desk is helpful. We booked through Hotwire and were NOT treated like second class citizens, like has happened in other places. I really appreciated that! Although we didn't take advantage of the service, they had a pillow menu on the bedside table which is fun and different. It's a good idea to get a Muni pass so that you can use the cable cars, street cars, and bus routes because there are a lot of hills between Union Square and the other tourist spots you'll probably be visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel & staff”
Reviews.Author: Travelandenjoy
Reviews.Content: I really loved this hotel as it s in the middle of everything, yet the room is so queit. The staff are amazing and always there to help you. Free coffee all day. A very nice bar & restaurant offering good food at very good prices. I Will definitely book this hotel if I will be in San Francisco again. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Great, Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Bea_2010
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in San Francisco as part of our honeymoon. The Chancellor was a solid contender. The rooms were clean and quiet, the staff friendly and the location wonderful. We walked to Fishermans wharf to the Financial District and back (there are trams for those not inclined to tackle San Frans hills : ) ) Happy hour was good value, drinks were well made and the complementary popcorn a bonus. As it was our honeymoon there was champagne and chocolates on our arrival which was a lovely gesture. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location!”
Reviews.Author: MaryJo72
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor Hotel is situated on Union Square and close to everything. The cable cars are in front of the hotel and you can go anywhere from here. The hotel was very nice and clean. In the lobby free coffee and tea 24 hours. The staff extremely nice and helpful. My room was on the second floor and was nice and quiet. Not too big but I didn't need more space for my four days visit to San Francisco. Breakfast good and healthy. When you check in you receive a discount for breakfast. Value for money for this hotel on a first class location!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: paula-from-nz
Reviews.Content: A very quaint hotel built in 1914 or thereabouts. This means the room is a little smaller than most. We had two single beds which were very comfortable. The room had a large wardrobe with a safe and a bathroom with a shower and bath. I loved how they'd kept the vintage hotel feel but had modern amenities. Of particular note were the apples and cookies at reception along with tea and coffee. The room had a jar of sweets/candy and in the bathroom were earbuds and cotton wool balls which you never usually get. Great location too, 1 block from Union Square and on the Cable Car line. Next door is a Walgreens and across the road is a Starbucks. Would definitely recommend this hotel. Also there was a book exchange on the mezzanine floor near the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “it was great”
Reviews.Author: dorothy c
Reviews.Content: Tina at the front desk was awesome............always helpful , always friendly. Bellboys.......I know that is not there proper name were very friendly and kind. Bar area comfortable. Nice touch with the candy dish in the room. The Tub...........AWESOME.......so deep for a real good soak in a big tub after a long day of walking in San Fran. Thank You.......

Reviews.Title: “Good stay did the job”
Reviews.Author: PaulSHarris
Reviews.Content: We used reviews from this site to book our stay at this hotel and they were pretty bang on, so we knew what to expect. We had coolish weather and ended up with a room not facing Powell St. which worked out well, we both wear ear plugs at night any ways so noise was not a issue but might be if one is not used to it. The character of the hotel was evident and we appreciated that, no problems with elevator waits that sort of thing. Check in went pretty smooth, but I must say we got lucky I believe because I was able to get a parking spot pretty quick for the unloading of our bags, this could be a issue for sure if you had to circle block. I drove to the parking garage myself easy just around corner and from there its a valet service so if you have a valet key, bring it. The small lounge in the hotel was nice to use on occasion, and the complimentary cookies,coffee,tea, and papers were appreciated. The restaurant in hotel we only went to once for breakfast so sorry not much info there,we also requested a fridge for our room and got that at no charge. Overall we were happy with our stay, with the high price of parking in the city the ability to stay right down in Union Square was wonderful for us, this was our 3rd time in S.F. and the first time we stayed close to the square, very safe. We also might recommend for people that sleep in a king bed at home, getting the twin option might be the way to go by know means the hotels fault because there is no space but queen beds are a little lacking, pillows and bedding are very nice. Check out was easy but again I recommend a early start on the day if driving as traffic heading out of town is minimal, and be warned depending on what time you drive into S.F. it can be very busy at tool booth, so plan accordingly. Check out Sears Diner next door, as well as the places in Little Italy, lots of great food. Dont stand and Union Station to get a cable car too busy in summer get up early and have a fun ride to Fisherman's Wharf before people get out there, enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable and Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: charris714
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Chancellor for 3 nights in early August. It was a great choice for our first trip to the city--the staff was helpful, the location is excellent, and the rooms are well-appointed. There are also many unique details that make this hotel memorable: the pillow menu, the adorbale rubby ducky in the bathroom, the free coffee tea and cookies in the lobby (at all hours), and the super comfy bed. The rooms are quite small, but the closets are large enough to hold all of your luggage and serve as a dressing room, so we never felt too crowded. The front desk staff was very helpful, and we enjoyed meeting fellow guests at the bar. One of the best breakfast joints in the city is located right next door (Sears), and there's also a Walgreens on the block for snacks and other necessities. This is not a luxury hotel--and it's not priced like one--but it is extremely comfortable and charming. If you're looking to stay in Union Square on a budget, this is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “OK for an overnight”
Reviews.Author: triptots
Reviews.Content: The hotel worked well for us because of its location near union square and the BART system. We arrived late and checked out the next morning. Additional pluses were the free wifi, nice staff, good beds and price. Down sides were the absence of air conditioning and fridge/mini bar, lots of city noise, tiny bathrooms, peeling paint and a lobby that needs a remodel.
