Would not recommend this hotel unless, like us, your stay is only for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Well price rooms in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: chaddd
Reviews.Content: We arrived into this hotel with some expectation due to the tripadvisor reviews and we were not let down! The location of the hotel is best asset of this hotel being just a few footsteps from union square. The rooms are above average with renovated rooms areas and an average bathroom .. we did not spend much time in San Francisco. Overall, for the price of the hotel with this unbeatable location.. I would return in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “love the location”
Reviews.Author: skysydney
Reviews.Content: small hotel in great location next to union square - rooms are small but adequate . Free internet in reception , breakfast was fine and inexpensive . Best discovery was SCALA italian eatery accross the street - best food ever :)

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Averagejo2020
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading the reviews on trip advisor and I can saftely say I've not been disappointed. The Chanceller is in a very central location in the city, great for shopping with department stores and higher end shops minutes away. Acsess to public transport is good, cable car right outside and buses jus on the corner. Our room was 704, quite compact for an American hotel, more like something you would find in England with dark wood furniture and marble worktops but functional. The only thing which let's this room down was a lack of a view, a billboard obstructs the view of union square. Maybe the rooms a little higher are a bit more lucky? Free wifi helped me plan and navigate the city as well as keep friends updated with our holiday progress from my iPhone. Also the hotel app came in handy with deals and a good list of places to eat out in the area, a very nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: SBW2009
Reviews.Content: This was our third hotel on our honeymoon and was the only one that made us feel totally special. Everything about hotel was outstanding, although there is no kettle in rooms there is a tea and coffee station in the lobby which is always well stocked with cookies and popcorn in the evening! Can't wait to revisit!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied guests”
Reviews.Author: PicaboCanada
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed here last week in a room on the 10th floor facing Powell Street. We chose this hotel because my husband and I had stayed here about 7 years ago. The location is great. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. When we arrived, there was a box of chocolates and a bottle of wine waiting for us in the room (the wine in celebration of my mother's birthday). We ate breakfast in the hotel restaurant every morning. All of the staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms do not have A/C, but there is a ceiling fan and we found it more than adequate for the current temperatures. In fact, we turned it off at night because it was too cold. I highly recommend this hotel for people who want a clean, comfortable hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you read is true - this is a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: stephrouthier
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our honeymoon, 4 nights of which was spent in SF at the Chancellor Hotel. Our impressions are very like a recent, previous review - upon checking in, we were informed that we were upgraded tot he best suite in the hotel - room 1502, on the top floor, with amazing views over union square. We had a sitting room, 2 full bathrooms, 2 TVs (not that we used them!), fridge and coffee making facilities, a pillow menu, and an awesome fire escape that we could sit out on in the evenings and just listen to the music drifting up from union square, admiring the views. We were given a free bottle of champagne and a picture frame as a special honeymoon present, which was a lovely touch. All staff we met were extremely friendly and helpful (special mention to Matt - you were great, always anticipating needs and so helpful - thanks :) But really, everyone was great. We had breakfast a few times in the dining room, and enjoyed that each time, and also enjoyed the bar for a drink before heading out each evening. The location is perfect, right on union square, right beside a cable car stop, and just down the street from a major transport hub, with MUNI bus, BAST and street cars very plentiful. All in all, this part of our honeymoon was our favorite, due to the fact that SF is such an amazing city, but especially because of how great the Chancellor is. Thank you for making our honeymoon so memorable; we will definitely be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Price/quality relation”
Reviews.Author: Lucas001977
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel with a very good location (just steps from Union Square). The room are clean and the staff very helpfull. Not a luxury hotel, but we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to cable car”
Reviews.Author: 4traveleyes
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor Hotel is a great place to stay. Located on Union Square, you are close to restaurants, shopping, and the cable car stops right outside the hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful. They recommended several restaurants, which we tried, and they were good choices. The room was quiet, comforable, and well decorated. We enjoyed sleeping with the windows open. After returning from a long day of sightseeing, we always found cookies and coffee/tea in the lobby. The Chancellor is the hotel we will stay in during our next visit to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and cozy.”
Reviews.Author: BWWblaxx
Reviews.Content: The Union Square location is perfect for those seeking the modern area of town. If you ignore the sea of street beggars, it gives you an ideal start to the city - the cable carts go by right in front of the hotel and the steep, narrow streets surround you and invite you to start exploring the city. The piers are a 20 minute ride away. The Chancellor stands as an older building. You can tell the character and old time San Francisco features still show in its structure, but the renovations give it the right balance to a modern environment and comfortable stay. The receptionists couldn't have been friendlier and accomodating from beginning to end (don't forget to ask them what the hot spots are and how to get around, they have great tips!). The rooms were cozy and comfy - I never noticed the lack of A/C, the building itself was cool enough. I must put emphasis on the bed, it was just soft enough and the quiet environment made it extra nice for a good night sleep. The room had a combination of older furniture and modern appliances. Although it is not a city to spend much time at the hotel, I would come back to the Chancellor in a heart beat - always glad to come and rest in a comfortable hotel that is both modern and full of character.

Reviews.Title: “Three times is a charm!”
Reviews.Author: Claucat
Reviews.Content: This is our third time staying at the Chacellor and we just love this wonderful, privately own charming hotel. To begin with you could not ask for a better location, steps from Union Square on Powell street. The rooms are small but comfortable and clean and have been renovated since our last stay. The restaurant serves a very good breakfast for a fair price considering we are talking about San Francisco. Everyone from the reception to the waiter is extremely friendly. I know I will be back here again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Quite, Quaint, with a Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: MrsWillis
Reviews.Content: Centrally located and the Concierge service is commendable. My co-worker and I only had one day in the city and we arrived at around 4 pm...we were able to catch the last hop-on/hop-off tour bus of the day thanks to the help we received from the hotel. The hotel didnâ€™t seem to have a great selection but the pub next door was AMAZING! Donâ€™t worry about going to the fancy restaurant across the street...the wait was far too long.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: OntarioSam
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor is an older hotel so rooms are a little small but adequate. Magnified makeup mirrors for the ladies and nice deep bathtubs with a rubber duckie to keep you company. Walk in closet that will hold your clothes, suitcases and still give you room to change in it! Great location for the shopping area and on the cable car line. Front desk staff are very nice and have cookies and apples available in the lobby to snack on. Very quiet hotel throughout the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Rshap_05
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor hotel is a perfectly located hotel in San Fran. 1/2 block off of union square and right across from the Powell St. Trolly car. The negatives are that the rooms are quite small (at least the one we stayed in) and have no AC. Which normally should be fine for San Fran, but we happened to be there during an unusually warm week and the room got pretty stuffy and hot. For the price though, this hotel is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good rooms”
Reviews.Author: cutieperth
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights. The location is great, right beside union square. Rooms are good, not huge but big enough. Didn't really have any encounters with the staff but the one I did have was great. We had breakfast in the restaurant a couple of days, it's convenient but I'm sure you could find much better value and service close by. I did love that the fitness facility was a gym around the corner. So rather than a small fitness centre in the hotel you get a fully fitted out gym. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: felinesStockton_CA
Reviews.Content: We were just there for overnight, some sight-seeing and a nice dinner which we try to do periodically (economy permitting). This was our first time at The Chancellor but not our last. The central location to downtown is a major point, plus it's CLEAN, quaint and cozy. We loved the "pillow menu" and the entire staff was friendly and helpful. Valet parking parks our vehicle and we walk, taxi or cable car everywhere. Also, in the AM they have wonderful coffee in the lobby you can help yourself to before breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel dated, weird guest!”
Reviews.Author: suz09Uk
Reviews.Content: There is nothing wrong with the Chancellor Hotel but there was nothing to rave about either. The location is excellent and the staff very friendly. The rooms were fairly dated, small and not a great view out, and the walls far too thin. We could hear everything that was going on next door. The girl in the room next to us was very strange, came out of her room and just stared at us when we were going out. She looked out of it and was in a right state with her clothes all dirty. We could also hear her shouting and crying in her room and the next day she has put loads of black bags outside her room!! Not sure if she was a tourist or a local just using the room. We werenâ€™t sure what to make of her and I know it was probably a one-off incident, but she didnâ€™t help to give us a good impression of the hotel. I read that others travellers were offered better rooms, so if maybe staying in one of those rooms you would have a better experience at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: goehringw
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my son on a California trip. Our room ( two twin beds) was located on the back side of the hotel. It was very quiet and comfortable. The hotel was clean and well maintained. No A/C but the room was plenty cool. The staff was nice. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Tman6487
Reviews.Content: Chancellor Hotel has a great location, right on Powell street by Union Square. It is VERY easy to get to from SFO Airport, take BART to Powell Street station and walk 4 blocks to hotel. The hotel is older but nicely renovated and well kept. The rooms are small and the walls are a little thin. The Powell line cable cars are right outside and can be a little loud if you have the window open. Powell Street can be very busy too. We were on the 6th floor, street side and the noise was not too bad. The couple in the room next to us did keep us up one night arguing about naked pictures on her cell phone, but other than that the noise did not keep us awake or wake us up. The beds and pillows are very comfortable. The bath room is pretty small but the tub/shower is good sized and the shower head worked great. The desk staff, cleaning staff, and door man were all very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Stay - We Can't Wait to Return!”
Reviews.Author: LornaMoore2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chancellor for 3 nights from the 14th - 17th of July. We were greeted by a really friendly bellboy/conceirge called Matt who couldn't do enough for us - he was great. Restaurant recommendations and bar recommendations were all spot on from him. We arrived at the room and realised we'd been upgraded to the best suite in the place with an incredible view over Union Square. We had our own sitting room, 2 bathrooms, 2 televisions, coffee perculator etc etc. It was exceptional! The staff had also given us some champagne and flutes on ice, a rose wood photo frame and some local chocolates to enjoy. Very generous and we were very touched at how thoughtful the Chancellor Hotel had been to us. The hotel is in an abosolutely perfect location and all of the staff were curteous and helpful whenever we had questions. The rooms themselves are in a lovely condition as the hotel has just gone through a refurbishment. All in all we would highly recommend the Chancellor and will stay here again when we return to San Francisco! Oh and an extra that is just so nice is the free tea/coffee and delicious cookies that are freshly baked throughout the day! It's worth staying there for those alone :)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel- amazing location”
Reviews.Author: Awesome__x
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great but the location is the main selling point- directly om union square. The only drawback is that there is no breakfast or fridge supplied which means dining out which is very expensive but the complimentary tea & coffee in the lobby is great! I would definately recommend this hotel. after visiting fishermans wharf I would advise staying on Union Sqaure rather than the Wharf

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: rich n
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, old but very clean. Not the Ritz, but a good value for the average Joe. See Alicia at the bar for great drinks and better dining recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Broadabroad99
Reviews.Content: I chose the Chancellor as I was a solo female traveler. I felt safe and secure whilst there. The hotel is close to many attractions, and those that were further afield, were easy to get to as the hotel was close to transport!!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: tofutti
Reviews.Content: We have no complaints about this hotel, it was in a great location, rooms were clean, lifts worked etc. Was very reasonablly priced and would stay here again next time we are in san fran. Have free wifi, cable tv etc.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: travellingrules1
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a trip of California, having stayed in many hotels during our visit this was by far the best. The location was perfect in everyway, the rooms were ideal (clean, well presented and amazingly comfortable beds!) and the atmosphere of the hotel was generally excellent. Probably our only complaint was with some of the front desk staff who we found at times were abrupt and unfriendly especially during check - in (at one point a member of staff found his mobile phone much more interesting than helping us out). However this is a trivial point in a generally brilliant hotel.. and a lovely staff member called Rory made up for what others lacked :-D

Reviews.Title: “So Glad I Found You”
Reviews.Author: Bourke
Reviews.Content: Great location, older hotel with smallish rooms - but very comfortable beds, everything is wonderfully clean. The staff is friendly - the bartender personable. The parking garage is just around the corner. This is the type of a place I have been looking for my occassional overnights in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Old & new SF - a perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: andrewTee
Reviews.Content: A client put me up here; I hadn't heard of the place. Unusual property; small lot but high-rise (even for developed Union Square), eg around 14+ floors but less than ten rooms per floor. Essentially this is an older property that has been meticulously renovated, so you get that taste of old San Francisco along with cutting-edge furnishings. The room was not large but well laid out; it offered classically styled dark wood furniture and the now de-rigeur down comforter on the bed. Completely comfortable and spic & span, nothing seemed dirty or grungy or old or broken. The setting is spectacular; overlooks Union Square. I had a great view of the square and cable cars dinging by. Since there are no taller buildings next to it, I'd guess that nearly all of the higher-up rooms have views in different directions. Whereas most hotels clutter their rooms with signs trying to sell you stuff, this one had a few tasteful notes about things that were free: wi-fi, and incredibly a menu of about a dozen different kinds of pillows, available to borrow for the asking! Ran into many enthusiastic (20's ish) young people in the halls and elevator. Sole gripe would be the lack of an in-room coffee maker, though I've noticed other SF hotels don't offer that easier. I guess they're considered tacky but I find 'em handy. Will certainly stay here next time I visit the City. A real find.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, great price and a perfect service”
Reviews.Author: Mikedollard
Reviews.Content: The hotel was exactly what I expected, perfect location, great service would go back in a heartbeat. I have been to the city twice now and cannot think of a more ideal location. Every request I made was fulfilled and more. Just brilliant

Reviews.Title: “We won't be going back to this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: venom_sprite
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were staying for one night. When we arrived, it took an hour for valet parking to come pick up my car from a "no parking" zone out front where I was told to leave it. I was quoted 3 different prices on valet and given multiple excuses why the pricing was different when I showed them the website quote. Service was not friendly, AC unit in our room busted. Overall, the hotel itself was OK, but I wouldn't return because of the lack of friendliness with the staff. We seemed to be more of an inconveience to them than anything.

Reviews.Title: “Only Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: DevonJohn
Reviews.Content: An efficient check-In, Welcoming receptionist and a helpful and honest Management was a good start to our 4 night stay. OK the rooms are not large but we were told that before we booked. They are kept beautifully clean and the beds are to die for.The best nights sleep that we had for the whole holiday. The location and proximity to Union Square is an added bonus as is the Cablecar stop right outside of the hotel. The hotel bar did close a bit early for our liking, but the complimentary bottle of wine in the room made up for it.However, we found a fantastic Bar just down the road on the right hand side which I can recommend. It is straight out of the 30`s , I think it is called the Golden Lounge. The little present for the ladies was a very nice touch, the chocolates had bloomed a bit but were very palatable. Breakfast was excellent in both quantity and quality as was the seemingly permanent availability of some of the best coffee I have tasted. Service could not be faulted, if anything a bit too attentive but nice all the same. In all I can honestly recommend this Hotel for a stay in S.F. and I would have no hesitation in re-booking when and if we return.

Reviews.Title: “Oozes Charm”
Reviews.Author: Passepartout56
Reviews.Content: This place simply oozes charm. I have stayed here three times now and I have never been disappointed. Rooms may be on the small side but they have everything you would want. Some nice touches are the free jar of sweets on the dresser, the pillow menu and the rubber duck in the bath! Very conveniently located for cable cars, Union Square and some brilliant restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chelle868
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a great location, there staff were friendly and the lady behind the bar was really nice, just wish the bar opened earlier! Our stay didnt include breakfast but we did eat in the hotel once and enjoyed it. The rooms were clean and the beds very comfy! We had to change rooms because the people in the room next door argued all night and were throwing things at the walls! This obviously isnt the hotels fault so wouldnt let it put me off staying again as the staff were really nice about it and put us in another room straight away.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in the heart of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: futgal
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here on our first trip to San Francisco. Union Square location is great, it is walking distance to shops, restaurants, Chinatown, muni and cable car lines The hotel staff was wonderful, polite, and responsive to whatever we requested. We had a room with two twin beds. We asked to have two chairs removed which we didn't need. This gave us plenty of extra space. Also, room was located in the back of the hotel which made it very quiet. We had lunch at the hotel restaurant, delicious. Considering that it is in the central neighborhood of San Francisco, this hotel is a great value. Most of the other hotels in the area seem overpriced. The service and accommodations at the Chancellor are top quality. We will definitely return to the Chancellor Hotel and we highly recommend it to everyone visiting the city.

Reviews.Title: “Best ever”
Reviews.Author: kokoo82
Reviews.Content: Chancellor Hotel is simply great, clean room, nice breakfast, great value and the people who work there are helpful as well. It's maybe 100m from union square, you have nice restaurants within 5 minutes walking, access to a gym thats pretty good. They do have free internet, although its pretty slow, but for the two of us, this was just a great experience. One last tip: don't pay for parking, as you can use the rental company parking for free...

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've stayed at, don't be afraid of the small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: ragamoffyn
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a little over a week at this hotel with my girlfriend, and we loved it. I was worried because of what I had read about the small rooms and thin walls, but everything was fine. We were in a twin room, and although it wasn't the size of a luxury room at a high-priced hotel, neither was it claustrophobia-inducing. It was just enough room to feel comfortable without wasting space, particularly because the huge walk-in closet gave us a place to put all of our luggage and newly acquired merchandise. The thin walls weren't a problem, either. I'm very irritated by noise coming from other rooms, and though now and then at The Chancellor I could hear a snippet of conversation from the neighbors, it wasn't enough to bug me. Plus, they have white-noise machines and fans available, which masked any noises the neighbors might have made at night. (I didn't hear them making any.) The free, all-day cookies and coffee were a pleasure. The staff was also very friendly and enjoyable -- they even excused me for losing the umbrella provided with the room because I confessed to doing so. Note that in the summer, you will likely need to keep the windows open, and if you are on the front side of the building, you will get a lot of street noise at night. The tradeoff is that you also get a great view. We sacrificed the view for one of the quieter rooms higher up and in the back, and we didn't hear a thing from the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location and rooms”
Reviews.Author: meredith022
Reviews.Content: It would be hard to find a better location than this one, in the moderately priced range, near Union Square. The room was a reasonable size, and quite comfortable. Staff were friendly and helpful. Other reviewers had noted the lack of aircon - but it wasn't a problem for us, and the heating worked just fine. And try Sears next door - good (and judging by the queues, famous) for its breakfasts, but we were tired and had a lovely evening meal here one night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in a great city !”
Reviews.Author: LovingLifexx
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights whilst visitng California. The Hotel was ideally situated in Union Square and easy access to cable cars, attractions and The Shops!!! We had a great time. San Fransisco is an amazing place. The Hotel was lovely and clean, the bed really comfy, we could see Macy's from our window , it is situated in an area that buzzes with activity, the staff were friendly the price was great value for money. The rooms were not affected by the sounds of the city. If we are ever lucky enough to go back, I would be more than happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrauniC
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel could not be better. Right on Union Square. It is extremelly convenient. The hotel is a bit old fashion, but this did not disturb us at all even if we normally like modern hotel. The room are very clean, the staff very friendly, the price reasonable for what you get in SF. I have nothing bad to say about this hotel. i would definitively recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “No better place to stay, anywhere, anytime!”
Reviews.Author: Retired Educator
Reviews.Content: From beginning to end, our recent stay at the Chancellor Hotel in San Francisco was absolutely wonderful. Being that this was our fifth stay at the Chancellor, we felt an immediate â€œat homeâ€� sensation as soon as we walked into the lobby. It was like seeing old friends again. The warm welcome we received from Susie and Matt, in particular, was comforting after a long, trying day of travel from the east coast. Our room on the fifteenth floor overlooking Powell Street was fabulous. Being able to sleep with windows open in June was quite a treat for folks from North Carolina. Each night we went to sleep to the sound of cable cars and street musicians. This was quite a delightful experience and added to the charm of the nationâ€™s most beautiful city. During our stay, we enjoyed several drinks at the hotel bar and several breakfast meals at Luqueâ€™s Restaurant. Allysia and Rorie made fabulous cocktails and were always a joy to converse with during televised sports events. Mao and Yesmie were terrific hosts in the restaurant and helped us get each day off to a great start. Our accomodations were immaculate, a testimonial to the great housekeeping staff of the Chancellor. They always went over and beyond expectations to make sure we never lacked for anything. Part of our visit to San Francisco included the opportunity to see the defending World Series Champion Giants, while taking advantage of the Chancellorâ€™s baseball package. The seats were incredible, located nineteen rows above the Giants bullpen in field level seating. We were able to take great photos of Tim Lincecum and Brian Wilson as they warmed up before entering the game. What made an exciting baseball game even better was the Giants victory over the Minnesota Twins. We do love our Giants, even though it is sometimes difficult to follow them on the east coast. We will never, never, never consider staying anywhere but the Chancellor when we visit San Francisco and hope to be able to do so in future years. Until next time, thanks for everything Wes and staff!!!

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: auntjudy325
Reviews.Content: beautiful location. few block walk to china Town. Across from Francis Drake hotel. All large department stores with a two block area. Plenty of restaurants. Good one in hotel for bkfst or lunch. Room small and bathroom small, closet big but location great. Staff was outstanding. You could take cable car to Wharf but we took taxis - cheaper. Got hotel from priceline and that also made it a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: iandsmith
Reviews.Content: Locality close to Union Square gives this place an edge on many others as this is the main shopping area in San Francisco. It's not a new establishment but it's well maintained. Though others have lamented the smallness of rooms we didn't find it so because, in addition to the fact that there are two large beds in the main room, they have another room where you can store all your luggage and hang your clothing so that they don't clutter the space you mostly use like happens in other hotels. There's a writing desk and internet access (free, ask at desk for password). My only gripes were that you couldn't make a cuppa in your room, but that's common to the majority of hotels in America, and I felt that some of the staff were a bit lacking in skills. It seemed that some of the senior staff were excellent but others could have been more efficient and friendly. Parking, just around the corner, was very convenient, bearing in mind that you're in a major city. Overall, if you're looking for a good hotel in a prime location, I would suggest this one is a definite possibility.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as advertised”
Reviews.Author: Trvlr2011a
Reviews.Content: If you want to shop in SF, look no further. Hotel is on Union Square. Hotel is exactly what I was looking for. I like staying in five star hotels just like anyone would, and this hotel is not a five star hotel. But, if you are generally an easy going, non high strung person not irritated that something is not 'perfect' and brand new- this is a great hotel on Powell St. where the cable cars run and close to everything we wanted to do. Room is smallish but so what- all I did was sleep there. How much room beside the bed do you need? Bathroom has a shower, sink, and toilet. They all were clean and functioning. What else do you need? Breakfast was convenient and tasty. Bottom line: if you don't need a five star hotel in SF then you don't have to pay for one and can still have a great room at a great price (with add-on parking I would suggest). Loved the uniqueness and boutique feel. Keep doing what your doing Chancellor. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Cannot be beaten on location”
Reviews.Author: Alough
Reviews.Content: Location location location. Extremely clean. Comfy beds. Nice linen & pillows. 'Boutique' covers description of decor but still old fashioned. Lovely service at breakfast. San Fran weather is unpredictable so lack of air con a non issue. Bathroom was dated but spotlessly clean. Would defo recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in great location”
Reviews.Author: tigermark82
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an incredible value considering the price, location, quality of the rooms and service. The only drawback was it can be pretty noisy, but that is more a function of the neighborhood. I actually found the trolley bells kind of relaxing. The rooms are small, but it was just me and my fiancee and we do not require a whole lot of space. Parking is a short walk away and around 30 bux a day which is pretty competitive. If I go back to San Fran, and this hotel is around the same price, I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the two of us”
Reviews.Author: mistervegas1966
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor is a great place to stay in San Francisco. Although the rooms are small, it was just what we needed for the two of us. The Hotel is very well kept. It is walking distance to many restaurants, but I would recommend getting the Muni pass for public transportation (buses, trolleys and cable cars). They sell them at the concierce desk at the Chancellor, but you have to pay for them in cash. The cable cars run right in front of the Hotel, and take you right down to Fisherman's Wharf. Make sure you go to Chinatown while you are there. And, of course, don't forget Alcatraz. We had breakfast one morning at Luques, and it was great. There is always coffee, cookies and apples in the lobby. Finally, make sure you ask about the duck in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonable price, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Limegreenpeach
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our three night stay here. Location was right on the cable car line and easy access to bus and BART trains. The room was simple but had a great view and was clean and cozy. We had a great walk-in closet which was really useful for storing our luggage. We also appreciated the little things such as free cookies and coffee, pillow menu, and very friendly staff. We requested a corkscrew our first night and it was delivered almost immediately. The staff also held our luggage while we explored the city on our last day since our flight wasn't until 10pm. The rate of the room was very reasonable, especially compared to the other hotels nearby. It was 100% worth the cost to have such an awesome location. From here we went to the Golden Gate Bridge, Golden Gate park, Haight St, Fisherman's Wharf, North Beach, and many other locations (all by public transport!). One note, you can hear the cable car going by until about 12:30am and Union Square is a pretty bustling place. However, the noise was really not bothersome or even very noticeable to us. We were on the 11th floor. I highly recommend the Chancellor if you are looking for a great location, friendly staff, and a comfortable room! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay at union square.”
Reviews.Author: Jerald475
Reviews.Content: Our stay here has been great. Friendly staff, clean room and the convenience of it all is what made the trip. It's seconds away from the trolley stop and union square it across the street. Small note if you've never been to San Francisco. Union square is extremely busy and noisy even at night. We stayed on the 8th floor and had the jazz musicians on the square put us to sleep while the trolley's bell and brakes wake us up! Not the hotels fault but should be noted if your a light sleeper. The area also seems to be much safer and less homelessness than any other part of town. A great charming place that I would definitely stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Great first time, B team second visit 2 weeks later”
Reviews.Author: Sheena C
Reviews.Content: I was going to give this hotel a glowing report after staying 3 nights prior to a cruise to Alaska. My 80 year old father joined us for the last night. Everything about it was good, from the check in to the rooms and most definitely the location. In fact we raved about it to fellow passangers on the cruise. We decided to stay the one night back in San Francisco after the cruise before flying out to Honolulu and booked it through the hotel. However...................... we arrived at 9.30 am to a very surly welcome by the two gentlemen on reception. I won't mention their names but I am sure if the management is remotely interested they can check on 14th June. The rooms were not ready which is absolutaly fine as we did not expect them to be. We left our luggage in storage. We returned at 11am as we were to meet some old friends there. My father asked if there was any indication of when rooms would be ready and was told again, "check in is at 3pm" and that maybe, maybe by 2pm. We returned at 2pm as Dad was flagging. He was given his room but in a rude and unhelpful manner. We asked for our bags as there was nobody to get them despite the two gents and no other customers just 1 meter from luggage room. Eventually I asked them to call the porter who came. We helped Dad up to his room and returned to the lobby. Now this is not a large area. We sat directly opposite the front desk on one of the two sofas, used the computer behind the desk and waited, and waited. These two gents knew we we were waiting to check in. People came and went, a lot of laughter and chitchat went on. Eventually the shift changed. They avoided any eye contact. There was no hand over, it seemed, to oncoming shift. Eventually at 1545 I approached one of the the new team and she seemed surprised and said the room had been ready for sometime and was an upgrade to a suite. I was very annoyed as I got the distinct impression that this was done on purpose. We were tired and fed up and I do realise that the rooms have to be cleaned ect but it was like checking into two different hotels on each visit. It is a great little hotel but how easily poor customer service can influence our impressions of a place.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: ajssw19
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at the Chancellor Hotel and found the location to be fantastic. It really is in the middle of everything which is great for sight seer's. As previous reviewers have said, this is an older hotel and the rooms are small by American standards although they are nicely decorated and are comfortable. Our room was facing over the front of the hotel on the 3rd floor and because this hotel is on Powell Street it was very noisy outside. We also had noise issues with people in the next room - you can easily hear people talking. I recommend the hotel for anyone wanting a central location at a reasonable price but you should expect that you're not going to get an amazing night's sleep unless you get a room at the back of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We love it and we'll be back for sure”
Reviews.Author: malena63
Reviews.Content: The service is Supreme, the employees are just willing to help you all the time, the people at the front desk excellent, the housekeepers very very polite, the hotel couldn't be better, I recomended this hotel always. Congratulations Magdalena Groover

Reviews.Title: “San Francisco Gem”
Reviews.Author: HollywoodUk
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not particularly imposing on arrival, but the staff were fantastic. The room was great and the location unbeatable. Breakfasts were just perfect and again staff were brilliant. The longer we stayed here the better it was - we were sorry to leave. Cable cars run past the front door, Union Square with Macy's (and the Cheesecake Factory - great food and vibe) within minutes on foot, and all tourist attractions (and there are many) accessible by cablecar, on foot or by one of the excellent tour buses.

Reviews.Title: “Like Staying with an Old Friend”
Reviews.Author: 2011ChgoWanderer
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for the Chancellor Hotel long before staying there based on the great customer service I received during the reservations process. and I was not disappointed when it came time for my stay. From the beginning to end, everyone I talked to was always patient and helpful with my many questions, in particular kudos to Kevin who went above and beyond to take care of my last minute changes and reservation worries. Yes, the Chancellor is an older hotel. Yes, the rooms are small. No, it may not have all the fancy bells and whistles that other nearby hotels do. But what it does give you is a homey, cozy, comfortable place to call home during your stay that will be the perfect end to a long day of running around. And their attention to detail in many ways will leave you feeling like you truly matter to them as a customer...after my second night, housekeeping realized I was always pulling the comforter down to the end of the bed and made my bed that way every day after that . Try Luques at least once for a great omelette and stop by the Tour desk for maps. On my first day they gave me the perfect map to help me find my way around town and thanks to them, I didn't get lost once which is amazing for someone as directionally challenged as myself!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and good value”
Reviews.Author: stokie1980
Reviews.Content: We stopped here for four nights at the start of our honeymoon. The hotel had left us a bottle of sparkling wine, some chocolates and a picture frame as a present. The room was spotless, tidy and a reasonable size especially if you're not planning on spending too much time in it. Location wise its just up from union square itself and close to all the main shops and the trams run right outside the doors. Staff are friendly and the free tea, coffe and cookies are a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: AScotsmanAbroad
Reviews.Content: This was probably the smallest room I stayed in on my recent California trip but proves that size isn't everything. They crammed a lot into the spotless room - desk, armchairs, small table as well as a nice flat screen TV - but it never actually felt cramped in the room. Huge closet as well. Bathroom did feel a little bit cramped and the shower head was only about 5'5"" but these were minor things in the grand scheme of things. Location is ideal, staff were excellent and the off-site parking is only a block away. Pretty good value for the location too - the parking package was decent value too, given the cost of parking around there. I've stayed there before and if ever back in San Francisco will certainly stay there again. My only real gripe - and it's a general one rather than too specific to the Chancellor - is that when you are paying that amount for a room (any room), I always feel you should get breakfast included. You do get a 10% voucher for one breakfast but that's nothing really. Maybe it's just me. Still 5 stars, though.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Tell Anyone About This Little Gem ...”
Reviews.Author: WMD_Traveller
Reviews.Content: What a perfect, fairly priced, nicely modernized, charming, conveniently located, clean, and professionally-staffed beauty! Very knowledgable concierge staff. Great happy hour value. Many public transportation options easily accessible (cable cars, F-Line trolley cars to Financial and Wharf districts, easy 3-block walk to BART station to, e.g., SF Int'l. Airport (easy ~35-minute ride $16 RT). In the very heart of the shopping district. Also an easy walk to Chinatown, Little Italy ("North Shore"). The Chancellor is a perfect find. Don't tell anyone! LOL P.S. buy the 3-day public transportation pass from the hotel concierge for a mere $21. Forget about needing a car in San Fran!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travels_0505
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as the first stop on a recent US trip so it was the first place we arrived at after a 14 hour flight. Although there wasn't a room ready yet they held our bags and did everything they could to accommodate. When we returned and were finding it hard to stay awake on the comfortable couch in reception they were able to soon arrange a room. The only negative that I can think of was the staff speaking loudly outside our door one morning but as it was to another guest I find that understandable. I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “As good as the last time”
Reviews.Author: tritonkid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cancellor some 8 years ago and enjoyed the stay. Little has changed at this hotel. The service from all staff remains very good, the room we had was pleasant. The location of this hotel was ideal for us in that it is central with good transport links to other parts of San Francisco. Would we stay there again? Yes we would. We like it and at the price it represents very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “I like it”
Reviews.Author: local_yokal69
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a meeting which was at the drake. paid half the price and really like the room. It is small but very clean. If I was not by myself it would have been a problem as I like to have sleeping space. Can't beat the location. Would not hesitate to stay here

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: DTM555
Reviews.Content: Context: 30s professional couple on honeymoon, first time to SF. Rating reflects our expectations for this class/price of hotel. Hotels in SF were relatively expensive compared to LA/Vegas, particularly in Fishermanâ€™s Wharf area. We plumped for this one as was just inside our budget approx $170/night. Room was small but clean and nicely decorated, traffic noise acceptable. Complimentary bottle of bubbly and chocs was a nice touch. Perfect location for shopping and everywhere else in SF is walkable or bus-able so no complaints really.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a couple of days in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: apc9
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, good value and comfortable room. Stayed for two nights here after arriving from London. A great location for seeing all the sights.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: thetruth74
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff. They even helped us to find a nice restaurant to eat pizza. The housekeeping staff was awesome (Susan) they even left a "thank you"-note for the tip. The room was without AC.... you don't NEED AC in San Francisco!!!!! It was just fine! The hotel is a good "base" to start your shopping trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location off Union Square”
Reviews.Author: amaroneUk
Reviews.Content: We were staying in San Francisco for 4 nights and booked the Chancellor following the Trip Advisor reviews. We had booked directly with the hotel and prior to our visit got an e-mail from the hotel confirming our booking. As we were arriving following a transatlantic flight we asked for a nice but quiet room. On arriving at the hotel I must admit my first impressions were not as I had expected and was a bit worried when I saw the sign warning about dust and noise as they were doing renovations. After checking in and having our luggage taken to our room (I noticed a previous comment about not having a bell boy but we had no problem) , we had no view as we were at the back of the hotel, however very quiet as we had asked for. The rooms at the front I would imagine could be noisy so you can't have it all ways. The rooms are small compared to other modern hotels and the bathroom was small and a little bit tired although clean, however we were out sight seeing all day and only came back to go to bed. We did not notice any dust or noise regarding renovations during our stay. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and there was a computer with internet access at reception which we were able to use with no problem at all. The location is great being adjacent to Union Square and close to shops and cable car. We didn't use the restaurant but there was coffee and cookies available in reception all time- great for a coffee first thing in the morning or later at night. If you want a mod con all singing and dancing hotel don't go to the Chancellor however this is a great centrally located hotel with friendly staff. We had no car so cannot comment on any parking facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable bed I've ever slept in (including home)!”
Reviews.Author: Jan_Saussey
Reviews.Content: Most people consider location and cleanliness important. But If you also want a really comfortable bed and great showers, Chancellor Hotel can deliver! You even get a choice of several pillow types. The beds are heaven, and the showers strong, refreshing and always hot. Our room was quiet (we asked for the back area) and we found the location superb.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of renos going on, but a lovely stay.”
Reviews.Author: Allisonr30
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at the Chancellor. The hotel was so central to the city and lots of great restaurants, shopping and tourist attractions! The room was small and there was a lot of noise though the walls from other rooms, however we enjoyed out 2 nights here. The staff in the restaurant and bar were very friendly, we enjoyed a very entertaining happy hour att he bar! Breakfast in the restaurant was fast and delicious! Free tea, coffe and snacks in the reception area was much appreciated on our 6.30 departure morning- as was the tour desk which helped us to book tours and airport transfers! Free wifi was great!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great stay”
Reviews.Author: Stiina
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel because of other tripadvisor recommendations and weren't disappointed. The rooms are not spacious, but you have everything you need. The breakfast is good and reasonably priced. We loved the rubber duck on the rim of the bathtub!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: grvdggr71
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for several nights while attending a business conference. Location is awesome - right in the center of town. The nightly rate was very affordable, especially in light of the conference in town and the location. Rooms were very clean, though small (expected in a downtown hotel). We did get a little bit of street noise in our room, but it was very minor and did not disrupt our stay at all. Beds were comfortable, and the pillow menu was a very nice touch. Would not hesitate to stay again, for either business or leisure. NOTE: There is no air conditioning in the rooms. The hotel is very up front with this on their website and in person. Given the weather in SF, this is generally not a problem, and the ceiling fan and window (which opens) alleviates most cooling needs. Again, did not detract from our stay in any way.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean, reasonably priced, quiet, well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: justlistennowisaid
Reviews.Content: Choose the Chancellor after good reviews on trip advisor. It is superbly located, mere minutes from Union Square itself and with tram stops literally outside the hotel. The hotel is relatively basic in itself - there is no on-site gym, and the bar and the breakfast area are all self-contained with no natural light and so I didn't use those so don't know if the food or drinks are good or good value. The rooms are a good size, the bathroom is decent enough and the hotel is pretty quiet given its location. There is a tour desk on the ground floor that will give you maps, information and make bookings for you. The staff are efficient and functional in their interactions. Free wi-fi is available and there is a PC available by reception where they will let you print things for free too, so very traveller friendly. They have a small "library" space on the 2nd floor for travellers to leave books and pick up those that have been left. It was in the process of being renovated and probably needed it as it does look a spot tired but is clean despite that. A good stay for the price and the location.

Reviews.Title: “i was here three years ago - still great as ever”
Reviews.Author: julieannboo
Reviews.Content: lovely small hotel in union square. it has still high standards as it did when i last visted back in 2008. the lady at the tour desk is MAGIC. very helpful booking tours and giving us advice on muni bus ticktets to buy. the rooms are small for america but not too small if that makes sense! the bathroom is small and there is a bit of a step - so look when entering. there is a big wardrobe almost like a small room with a safe in there. in the lobby behind the front desk is a computer that you can use. great hotel - would recommend everytime.

Reviews.Title: “Our third stay and not our last...”
Reviews.Author: EileenPerthWA
Reviews.Content: We were again lucky enough to stay at the Chancellor from May 2nd -5th. This time my daughter and son in law joined us and were equally as pleased. I have been raving about the Chancellor for the last few years to them, so now they can see why!! The weather was in the high eighties and picture perfect every day. The fact that there was no air conditioning did not bother us at all. We left our window open until we went to bed and the put the ceiling fan on, and that was perfect. Alisha in the bar makes great margaritas, and I made sure I got to Happy Hour every night just to have one! What else can I say, the best location, the best staff, run by the best manager, that is why it is so good. Thankyou all once again. We will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT HOTEL IN A GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Creyton
Reviews.Content: This was my fifth stay at the Chancellor and I couldn't have been happier. This meticulously maintained, comfortable hotel is at the heart of San Francisco on Union Square - ideal for business, sightseeing, shopping. It's become a home away from home (LA) for me and I recommend it heartily. Staff always helpful and cheery, breakfast good, happy hour terrific. What more can one say?

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location - Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: richlcfc
Reviews.Content: Great hotel to be used a base for visiting San Fran. Staff were all policte and room was clean. Location is amazing as right in the heart of San Fran. Lots of places to eat, drink and sight see on your door step. Would definitely reccomend and would return if we go back to San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in great location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Nightingale010410
Reviews.Content: Not a very big room, comfortable & big enough for us (we were out sightseeing all day), plus a big closet....recently redecorated so it was tasteful, neat and clean. We stayed on the 14th floor, excellent location on union square. Great value - and the price even dropped to $108 on our 3rd night (mid week)! The signs said they were renovating but we didn't notice any dust or noise. Right on Union square - easy to pick up all public transpo.....

Reviews.Title: “Location was perfect”
Reviews.Author: littlerosepetal
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel. Staff were fantastic and very helpful. Rooms were fine, nothing fantastic but comfortable and clean. Location was excellent!! Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodations in prime location”
Reviews.Author: sofiez
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chancellor for 4 nights. This is a historic hotel, steps around the corner from Union Square, close to dining, cafes, tour bus stops and cable cars. While it might lack some of the pizzaz and modern touches that other area hotels might offer, this hotel is still preferable. The room was smaller, but clean and quite comfortable. The bedding is always crisp and clean. The bathrooms are older, but very clean. We booked a couple of months in advance, quoted a CAA membership and got a great deal: $125/night! The lobby always offers fresh tea/coffe/cookies/apples. All in all, I would totally stay there again and highly recommend it (unless you're really picky!!)

Reviews.Title: “A superb experience in a historic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Cunajo1
Reviews.Content: Had the great pleasure to enjoy four days in the care of the historic Chancellor Hotel. The Chancellor offers superb service, faultlessly maintained interiors that retain their original form and structure, and comfortable, immaculately fresh accommodations. The Front Desk personnel sets a standard rarely met elsewhere: friendly, helpful and crisply efficient, they strive to ensure that your stay is a pleasant, productive one. Fresh cookies and coffee are dispensed gratis 24 hours a day, and - uniquely - a fully equipped, Internet-ready office is provided free-of-charge. Located on the Powell Street boundary of the famed Nob Hill, the Chancellor is (quite) literally steps from Union Square, with an impressive â€“ almost overpowering â€“ array of World-class dining and shopping options at your fingertips. Were this not enough, the Hotel itself ups the ante by offering two superb dining options, in addition to an intimate sports bar. For superior quality and an equally superior experience at a surprisingly reasonable price, The Chancellor Hotel, San Francisco should be among the first considerations of any discerning traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further”
Reviews.Author: kelmar81
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews and different hotels on here we decided on the Chancellor. Why we loved it Service was amazing - staff was ALWAYS willing to answer questions, give suggestions or directions. We were never a hassle to them. Tour desk operator "Michael" I believe, was great...very helpful all the time. Gave us detailed directions which made us comfortable. Yes the room is small as most say but the hotel is almost 100 years old and unique.... what do people expect? It was perfect size for us.. not sure how much space people really need in a hotel room. The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean Downstairs restaurant food was good. We ate breakfast twice and enjoyed it both times Location location location... so close to high end shopping or hop on a cable car and go to the warf. Either way anything you may need is very close by... loved it! I also really enjoyed the pride the staff have of the hotel, it says a lot about the behind the scenes of the hotel. I also really enjoyed reading the managers responses to people comments...says a lot that he reads them all. We will come back to this hotel again one..... thank you to the entire staff!

Reviews.Title: “I would return to Chancellor Hotel in a NY minute.”
Reviews.Author: TroyHoward
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here in March, 2011. What a bargain!! Cozy room and good mattress. Every staff member went out of their way to be helpful. Fantastic location from which to stroll or catch public transportation to other parts of the city. I felt very lucky to get the hotel I did for the discounted price I found. We got a rooom overlooking Union Square and were not affected by nearby cable cars. I asked the manager to give us a room he would give to his family. Guess he has good family relationships.

Reviews.Title: “An Absolute Gem....”
Reviews.Author: kintyre08
Reviews.Content: Just back from an amazing trip...stayed at this fab little hotel tucked in beside Union Square in the heart of San Francisco, chose it because of the great reviews i had read and DEFFO was not dissapointed..rooms are spotless and bed real comfy and had no problem sleeping even tho buzy streets round about...staff were helpfull and they have a great wee booth in the hallway where you can get tickets for any trips or tram passes and the lady is real helpfull....take a shuttle bus from the airport as it will leave you right at the door..also tram stop is right outside hotel....fab fab fab...hope someday to be back at this lovely hotel....x

Reviews.Title: “Gr8 location...small rooms...but fantastic stay in Gr8 city”
Reviews.Author: blondelinda
Reviews.Content: This hotel is highly recommened on this site, and I can see why. The hotel is extremely well priced for the location. Its right on Union Square, where all the great shopping and restuarants are. Cable cars run right past the door We arrived around 10.30 am but our room wasnt ready. We checked our bags and went off for a few hours for some exploring and and lunch. We returned around 1pm and checked into our room. The rooms are very small and tight, even by a big cities standard. BUT we didnt spend much time in the room so it wasnt a big deal. The room was tastefully decorated, but you should be prepared for not too much space. We where given a room overlooking union square which was really nice. The check in staff where really helpfull with dining recommendations and car rental enquiries. This is a great base for getting around the city. We only had 2 nights but we stayed midweek and got a great rate of $125 a night for this hotel. That was a bargain for a hotel in this location of this quality There are many many great restuarants close by, but Sears next door is excellent and famous enough for its brekfast that is has lines out the door for half hour or so! It was so good we went and ate one evening for dinner which was excellent. When we are back in San Fran we would definatley stay hear again , we where very impressed

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Does exactly what it says on the tin!”
Reviews.Author: Geebls5
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights on our honeymoon. Read all the reviews beforehand and expected a 3* hotel in an old building with small rooms, but in a great location. And that's exactly what we got. Was a bit disappointed with the room initially as ours was facing inside the hotel to a fire escape and was so dark we had to have the light on during a sunny day. Did consider asking if we could swap, but my wife (typical Englishwoman!) did not want to cause a fuss so we stayed put. In the end the room was fine and we were out exploring most of the time anyway so it was no big deal. Didn't visit the bar and restaurant as there is so much choice locally, but all the staff were friendly and helpful. It was our first visit to San Francisco and we loved the city - so much to do and see, we could have stayed a week and cannot wait to go back again one day. If you want a base at a reasonable price in a great location, then I would recommend The Chancellor, just don't expect The Ritz or Vegas size suites as you will be disappointed! p.s. Loving the Managers feedback to some of the reviews on Tripadvisor. Good to see a human touch with a bit of humour, rather than the usual corporate robotic hotel rep's comments. Keep em coming and keep up the good work Chancellor!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Mufcnumber18
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. Helpful staff. Overall can't fault the hotel and everyone working in it.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaRenee
Reviews.Content: Wow! The Chancellor met and exceeded all my expectations! We loved the historic charm, comfortable room, location, view of Union Square, friendly staff, and on-site Luques Restaurant. Definitely go for the restaurant gift card as it's worth it for breakfast and/or lunch (and their staff is so friendly! We loved Mac...I think that's his name). For lunch--order the house-made chip as your side--deliciously crispy! Nearby, our favorite restaurant had to be Uncle Vito's--a local Italian joint just a short walk up Powell (a friendly Chancellor maintenance man recommended this). Right there on the Powell line, we opted for the 7-day Muni pass, which we certainly got our money's worth out of by riding cable car, street car, and bus (works for subway/underground rail too, but we didn't use that). To get to this awesome hotel from airport, I highly recommend using Go! Lorrie's Shuttle. $15 per person, make reservations ahead of time, and easy pick-up. Chancellor hotel tour desk has $1 off discount coupons for your trip back to the airport using Go! Lorrie's. Other recommendations: enjoy the sounds of street performers and special events in Union Square by having your window open. Makes for a nice breeze, too! We loved our stay here, and given the opportunity, will surely come back. There is so much charm to The Chancellor. I could tell that from day one upon my friendly greeting in the hotel lobby and once seeing the infamous yellow rubber duckie waiting for us in our bathroom. Too cute! Thanks for making our honeymoon memorable! Also--I loved seeing the transformation of the new chandeliers and fresh coat of paint in the lobby--looks even more beautiful and inviting!

Reviews.Title: “Its a good hotel for a 3*”
Reviews.Author: zoe025
Reviews.Content: I think I had too high expectations after reading the excellent reviews. It was good for a 3*, but is definitely still 3*. The room and bathroom are small and there is no one to take up your bags etc. We were on the 5th floor which had a bit of street noise. However it is clean and pleasent. I think we paid slightly too much for it (perhaps because we went through trailfinders), but it is in a great location on the tram lines (which are great fun).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location-easy access to transportation and shopping.”
Reviews.Author: Melnej
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel because of its charm (glass doorknobs on wooden doors, small library, cookies available 24/7). It was a bit noisy with the cable cars right outside and people playing instruments on the street but that really just added to the charm and never kept us awake. Free coffee, too, that was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Get Away”
Reviews.Author: ccardnut
Reviews.Content: We live in the east bay and decided to spend a couple of days in San Francisco and take in the sights and a show at the Orpheum. Took Bart to Powell St and walked to the Chancellor Hotel. The hotel staff is very friendly and well located. We enjoyed our stay and would recommend it to anyone..

Reviews.Title: “Cannot fault this hotel”
Reviews.Author: v11rah
Reviews.Content: We bought a room with a $25 food voucher wich could be spent at the restaurant or bar. This worked out a good deal. We stayed here twice and got a room with front view both times. Yes the rooms are small, however i could not tyell that when i was asleep. When awake we were quickly able to access all areas of the city du to the close proximity of the cable car. We enjoyed our stay here, the room was clean and the staff helpful. San Francisco was great Can't wait to go for another four of five days and I would stay here for its value for money and old time appeal.

Reviews.Title: “I reconsidered...”
Reviews.Author: tjserapiglia3
Reviews.Content: I was too quick to review. After a bad night sleep i gave an unjust review. Not fair. This hotel is fine. Yes small bed but other than that great location. Good food right next door and great shopping all around. Easy to get to Bart/Muni. I got this hotel through Hotwire and I was unaware about the "No king beds" After looking at the web site of the Hotel I knew I was wrong on my previous review. Enjoy the location and the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Pubic hair on bathtub plug squashed in with hardened soap from previous guest. Nice room but when I asked about s”
Reviews.Author: Aluson
Reviews.Content: Good location. Bathroom is disappointing. Underside of plug was full of hardened soap and pubic hair. Shower pressure was terrible. Asked duty manager about shower pressure. He said I was drunk. Sorry Mike but I could still count and options ranging from 'trickle' to '3 streams' on the 'massage' setting were pretty bad even for a basic hotel. If you're all about location would recommend. For comfort - think again if you like hot showers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: volfaninnc
Reviews.Content: Great location and the staff was very friendly and helpful. We liked that it was an older hotel with personality and charm. We opened our window and that kept the room from being warm. The room size was fine for us - bigger than what I thought it was going to be based on other reviews. I loved the deep tub for taking hot baths with the bath salts they provided and of course the rubber ducky!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice experience”
Reviews.Author: vildvittra
Reviews.Content: Chancellor Hotel is a very nice hotel. Since I was on a business trip, what I mostly appreciated was the fact that the rooms where comfortable and quiet and the bed was very cozy. You will truly be well rested after staying here. That the hotel has good internet was also helpful on a business trip and had a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money, great location, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: beansfc
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by how good this hotel was considering the price we paid! The location cannot be beaten - right on Union Square with the cable car on the doorstep. It allowed us to easily explaore all of San Fran. While the rooms are small (as most are in America) they were modern and comfortable - partcularly the pillows and linen which were of an excellent quality. We had breakfast in the restaurant one morning and it was good. The staff were friendly and we loved the cookies provided in reception each day. All in all this is a great hotel for a great price - don't expect Hilton or Marriott standard but for a third of the price this absolutely does the trick. If I am ever in San Fran again I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ELKing2U
Reviews.Content: We are checking out of the Chancellor today, and have enjoyed a wonderful stay. Not often do I take the time to submit a review, but this hotel is so special I really felt the need to post the many positives. This hotel may be a 3 star, but the service and attention is that of a 5 star. The staff is very courteous, professional, and so very congenial. Thank you Oscar, for your attention and assistance during check-in. I wish I could remember names, but suffice it to say that everyone, and I mean everyone, treated us with the same courtesy and respect, this includes everyone at the front desk, tour desk staff, the bellmen, the restaurant/bar staff, and housekeeping. They were all well-trained, and it was evident that my satisfaction was the goal. Kudos to all. A special thank you to the Wes Taylor, GM, who took the time to personally answer my questions, and made a special holiday even more memorable. Thank you for your kindness, Mr. Taylor. There is absolutely nothing that needs improved upon from my our experience. The service is fantastic, the food tasty, the rooms clean and comfortable, and last, but not least, location, location, location! This gem of a hotel is an excellent base for any activity, with all municipal transportation within easy walking distance. The Chancellor will forever be a 5 star establishment in our minds. Thank you all again, and we will be repeat guests.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD value for money”
Reviews.Author: BzyBeeDK
Reviews.Content: Expecting the worst but proven very wrong by the small, intimate hotel in the heart of San Francisco; so central yet very quiet during the night much to our delight. Loved the neighbourhood, the local diner, the free coffee/tea and we warmly recommend the Chancellor!

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: curtis80
Reviews.Content: I usually hate to stay at 'old' hotels. I was pleasantly surprised. GREAT STAY here, the renovations are magnificent and made it feel like a much more expensive hotel. Free internet, complimentary access to a very nice gym a block away. Loved the character and feel of the rooms. By far the best value and location....I would stay here over the more expensive Marriott's down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel prefect location Great Value”
Reviews.Author: gbrose27
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in prime spot. Charming boutique Hotel, Really helpful staff. Front desk recommended great restaurants all over city. Value for ammnenites and location has to best tops in the city. Like staying at the Westin St Francis for 1/3 of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: siobhanxxxx
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here one night, but overall we had a great service and the staff were very friendly. Wifi in rooms was free and very useful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: Superb location on Powell St to catch cable cars & close to city shopping. Room & bathroom was small size and a bit cramped after 4 days. Staff were generally good and friendly. Only issue was with reception or behind-the-counter-staff - definitely an issue with efficient or contentious customer service - we had two issue where they were just plain incompetent and did not perform their duties, or just did not care. Concierge and tour facilities were good and helpful A good choice for breakfast although some items a little on the expensive side. We would stay there again but may look a a different hotel in the same location

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable hotel rooms”
Reviews.Author: PlatinumNZ
Reviews.Content: On Union Square so right in the location for any tourist visiting San Francisco. The staff are very friendly and do try hard to make your stay pleasurable. The rooms are compact (common for San Fran) but all you need for a few nights. The bed was comfortable and the room nicely appointed with a nice chair and desk. I had breakfast in the restaurant which was very nice and not overly expensive. The one thing I didn't like was that you couldn't control the heating in the room. This was controlled by reception and couldn't be turned off even when the room became an oven. Fortunately the room had opening windows. I was in a top level room so didn't have any issues with street noise. The free wifi worked really well and a nice added benefit. Overall, I would recommend this hotel as good value for money in prime location. Easy to carry your bargains back to your room after shopping at Macys!

Reviews.Title: “A great Location (right in the heart of the city)”
Reviews.Author: more-botters
Reviews.Content: A must, you must have breakfast in Lori's Dinner, the waffles are great and coffee dam good. There is great local restraunts on Chestnut Ave. Great hotel, clean comfortable, rooms are not as big as other hotel we stayed in the passed, but this is a city hotel and you have to expect this. Me and my husband were on are honeymoon and they gave us champaigne and photo frame and it was really nice touch. The staff are great .

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and pleasurable stay”
Reviews.Author: Facemaker01
Reviews.Content: A comfortable cosy room in a fantastic location. The Chancellor was built in 1914 and this would be why the rooms are smaller than the other hotels we have stayed in. (with the exception to New York) The rooms are decorated tastefully and the bed was comfortable. Breakfast at Luques as well as Happy Hour were pleasant. I would like to see the decor of the bar/restaurant echo the architecture & age of the building, something to add a little more character and set it apartment from other boutique hotels. Standouts were the fresh cookies every afternoon/evening, as well as the tea/coffee cart near the bar area

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: NanookLondon
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at the Chancellor Hotel, we got a great deal on the rate a few months in advance and we were not disappointed on arrival. Staff were friendly and helpful, the room was lovely and really tastefully decorated, we were on the 11th floor and had a good view over Union Square. The amenities were great with free wifi in rooms, but also a computer in reception with printer both free to use - ideal for printing boarding passes etc. There was also coffee, tea, cookies, apples and newspapers everyday in reception. The location was great and far preferable to the Fishermans Wharf area, it was very easy to explore all over the city and beyond, as the hotel is very close to the subway, cable cars, buses and BART stops. We took the BART direct from SFO to Union Sq (Powell Station) which took 30 mins and the station is a 5 min walk from the hotel so its very easy and cheap to get to the hotel on arrival, not worth waiting for/paying for a cab unless you have a huge amount of luggage. I'd venture a little further out from the immediate area around Union Square for meals in the evening, as with most city centre areas things are over priced (although Colibri Mexican restaurant on Geary which is just round the corner from the hotel was very good), try Polk St and Sutter a short walk away or Chinatown. All in all the Chancellor really contributed to an absolutely fantastic trip to San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: TXFergie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chancellor Hotel on Union Square and had such a great experience! It was clean and the staff was absolutely wonderful...definitely would stay there again! It is small but keep in mind this is a hotel that was built 100 years ago...they just didn't expect the room sizes that we have nowadays. It was perfectly fine for me and the hubs but then again we spent very little time in our room. The location was perfect...we enjoyed shopping on Union Square and catching the trolley was easy when it was running. We did purchase passports (7 day tickets for the public transportation) but noticed no one really looked at them. We ended up walking ALOT or taking a taxi when we didn't want to walk. Sears Fine Foods is right next door to the hotel and that was our favorite breakfast place!! Get up early though cuz they fill up fast! The staff at the Chancellor was wonderful...very professional. They were also very kind and left a bottle of Jasmine tea and a nice picture frame for us as a special little touch.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, Small room”
Reviews.Author: JJB
Reviews.Content: My second visit to San Francisco and still like it. We picked this hotel because of the good reviews here and its very reasonable price. Cable car is at the doorstep and there are numerous great restaurants and shopping outlets nearby. We did not eat at the Hotel, though the menu looked good. Instead we have had breakfast twice at Boudin 5-minute walk down the street at Macy's and dinner at Sears Fine Food next door. Both are absolutely fantastic. The hotel room is really small, though very clean and comfortable. We were given a room on the low floor (3rd or 4th) but we could not hear anything from the street (with windows opened). The bathroom is tiny and what came out from the shower head were nothing more than water powders. You certainly need patience, esp if you have long hair. Pretty understandable though for old buildings. The free in-room WiFi was great. For its price and convenience I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Lucky_Eddie
Reviews.Content: Based on TripAdvisor reviews, choosing the Chancellor was a no-brainer. So I did, easily, on-line. In the meantime, a relative who visited SF 30 years ago had great memories of a hotel and went to check out which it was. You guessed it - this one. I'm sure a lot has changed since. Including the rubber duckie, which now carries an I-pad and cell phone. But a lot hasn't changed - it's clean, friendly, efficient and well-run. Our preferences for a quiet room were fulfilled perfectly - top floor, in the back. No view but good protection from street noise. Not perfect, but you'll never get country quiet in the middle of a city. Actually, we could hear the clang of the cable car over the general (low-level) noise. This was cool - a frequent reminder of the great city we were in. Yes, the room was small, especially the bathroom. However it somehow didn't feel that small. My wife loved the mirrors all over the bathroom (including a magnifying one) that made it feel bigger, but also was great for checking out her hair from all angles. And the room itself seemed to be set up quite efficiently. Maybe the high ceilings also give a sense of more space. Didn't hear any noise from other rooms or the hallway. But then, things were built a lot more solidly a century ago. One neat thing you should take advantage of: they have a big selection of specialty pillows you can try out for free. A big surprise was the restaurant. We had an excellent breakfast there a couple of times. This is a city of good food, albeit a bit pricey. The hotel restaurant gave quick service with quality food at prices below the other nearby places.
