We stayed seven nights, giving us time to check out the ins and outs of SF, not just the major tourist trophies. In that time, we could not think of a single complaint in the Chancellor. (Okay - just one: the wireless internet was abysmally slow.) If we return to SF, there's no question the Chancellor will be our first choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: georgeybaby
Reviews.Content: initially i got off on the wrong foot with this hotel. we arrived early (2 hours before check in) but were told no rooms were avaliable yet. i was so tired from jet lag and had an upset tummy that had been bothering me for days, i looked like death warmed up, all i wanted was a place to rest and a shower. in the end our room wasn't even ready at check in time. my husband went to the desk to repeatedly check on the room status and in the end the front desk lady had to go to find the cleaners herself to check if the room had been done. my husband said to them, give us any room please, we really just need to rest, meanwhile i'm just about asleep on the lobby lounge and asking to use their bathroom every half an hour (which requires a key pass) and other people checking in after us got rooms before us (and as far as i know, all the rooms are the same). now i KNOW that check in time means check in time, but many other times when we have travelled, if we have gotten there early, and the room is not ready, we get the response of 'the room allocated to you is not ready but if you would like the same type of room on a lower floor/different view/whatever we can give that to you'. i was REALLY hoping this was the case as i seriously just wanted to walk out in front of a bus at high speed i felt so crappy. but it was not to be! however, once in the room, the room was great. clean, fresh, housekeeping was great, internet adequate (sometimes very slow), view was nice (looking towards macy's) and as it was our wedding anniversary they left us a nice bottle of wine and some (wierd fruit) chocolates and a card, which was nice. we also got a $75 card for the in house restaurant which covered 3 of 4 meals for us, AWESOME! check in aside, this hotel was great. i would still stay here again. i think it was alot of bad timing and circumstance that we had an initial poor experience. any other time i would have been happy to dump luggage and toddle off to have a look around. by the end of the trip i felt much better though. and i fell in love with san franscisco. do mr toads tours (3 hour tour) and check out the haight ashbury district for vintage shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Chancellor Hotel in a great location! Rooms are very small especially bathroom.”
Reviews.Author: HarmonyGirl88
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor Hotel was in a fantastic location, can't complain about that. A little noisy at night on a Saturday- was woken up by drunks on the street at around 3am when we had a flight to catch early next morning... probably a homeless guy, he kept shouting the same thing over and over- was very annoyed but nothing anyone could do. Don't expect a 4 or 5 star hotel, rooms are VERY small although comfortable. Bathroom is teeny tiny and you won't feel like you are anywhere luxurious. I think the rooms are newly renovated. What did it for us with this hotel was the location. I would have rather stayed at the Marriot across the street but that's my personal preference. A friend recommended this hotel to us so I booked it. I like to go on vacation and stay at big, nice hotel rooms, especially not feel like I'm using the bathroom at a hostel. I understand this hotel is very old so I didn't expect anything luxurious. The service was good. Cute Japanese lady was very knowledgeable about everything you need to know about the city- including tours, bus fare, airport service etc. Had dinner across the street at Scala (delicious! and great service). And Sears Fine Foods next door- awesome breakfast! YUM!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: L0ve2Fish
Reviews.Content: STAFF: Fabulous service from Kevin on reservations. Everyone we encountered was genuine, helpful & couldnâ€™t do enough to help you out. CHECK IN: was seamless. ROOMS: quaint, compact and well appointed. Walk in wardrobe very practical. LOCATION: fabulous â€“ right on cable car line, near shops and restaurants. CABLECARS: we made great use of a 3day MUNI pass, clocking up 9x cablecar + 8bus + 3subway rides (not that I was counting). FOOD: make sure you visit www.eotrading.com for exceptional Asian tapa type food with great atmosphere. AIRPORT TRANSIT: we had pre-ordered Lorrieâ€™s Shuttles $14pp. You could easily take the Bart for $8.50pp as the 500m walk uphill isnâ€™t too steep, however if you have a few bags the shuttle is the way to go. You can get a return shuttle to the Airport for $11pp using brochure coupons. SUBURBS: Walked pretty much ALL of SFO. Golden Gate Bridge is a must. *Fishermanâ€™s Wharf â€“ tourist scene with great views of Alcatraz & Golden Gate bridge. Crab meal specialities. *Castro - gay/lesbian scene with some interesting shop displays & bars! *Haight - equivalent of Amsterdam / hippy scene (without the drugs). *North Beach â€“ Italian. *Cow Hollow â€“ upmarket speciality stores pampering for you and your pooch - including dog bakery / grocery stores! We would recommend this hotel to any visitor or business traveller. A home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: herbnurse
Reviews.Content: The room was a bit warm. We kept the window open during the night and that helped a bit.. the bed was very comfortable, clean. MANY choices of pillows. Matt the bellman was exceptional. He recommended 3 restaurants and they were incredible. The bar tender was terrific. Great cookies and coffee in the lobby all day. I would definitely go back again but make sure we have a room that does not overlook a building. Small issue in comparison to what issues I have had in my travels. VERY convenient to union square, the trolley, the busline and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “The Chancellor is our home away from home & I wouldn't consider another place to stay in San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: Maniladuck
Reviews.Content: I love the Chancellor and it's staff. We have been visiting San Francisco about twice a year, consistently, since 1990 and Chancellor Hotel is our home. Being on Powell Street and Union Square is a dream. We walk everywhere and I'm more familiar with the city streets there than I am at home. Shopping and eating is the best!! I love Susan at the Tour Desk......she's like part of our family and goes out of her way to help with anything we need. Matt has been a pure delight and also is part of our family and so helpful.......many, many times standing out in the pouring rain to hail us a taxi. The staff at Lute's have also become familiar with us and are so very cordial and accommodating. We also love stopping by for a cocktail before going out for the evening. During our late Summer to Fall stays we've appreciated the ease and help with the Giants packages also. Our rooms are perfect and I make sure I get the large walk-in closet for plenty of room to store my acquired "treasures". The most perfect touch is the rubber ducky....my daughter has collected every one I've taken home, noting date and occasion on the bottom of each. They are quite a conversation piece as they are all proudly displayed on shelves. I also appreciate the Clippership Membership with the free night's stay as a bonus. The only request I seem to have is better lighting in the bathroom with an updated mirror. I realize the fixtures are very old, but it takes quite a while for the bathroom mirror to clear after it has fogged up from the shower. I appreciate everyone......front desk and room staff, included. Everyone is very friendly and makes us feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good for the price”
Reviews.Author: ndc121
Reviews.Content: Pros Price Location Room service prices are ok Clean Friendly staff Cons Free Wifi hardly worked Valet parking is provided by a 3rd party and takes at least 20 minutes No on site parking Tub slow to drain Double room had twin beds that were very short (for people less than 6 foot) Smaller rooms

Reviews.Title: “The Chancellor was friendly, convenient, and perfect for a visit to SF spent on the go.”
Reviews.Author: foxhunterbear
Reviews.Content: We found many positive reviews of the Chancellor on Trip Advisor.com and, along with the price, this enticed us to skip out of the conference hotel (Nikko) and try this family-owned hotel. The location cannot be beaten being just a few steps north from Union Square and across the street from a cable car stop. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We especially enjoyed the bartender/server in the small but well-stocked bar. There seemed to be some local regulars that stopped in and despite the small space, it was a lovely place to have drinks before heading out to dinner. The drinks too were incredibly reasonable in price which brought us back each afternoon. We ate breakfast two of our three mornings and enjoyed delicious omlets and eggs benedicts for again a very low prices compared to other hotel breakfasts. The rooms were small (to be expected in an old hotel), not alot of excess space to move around in but it was clean and quiet. As we were on the go alot, this simple place to come back to from a day out sightseeing, shopping, and conferencing was just fine. Be sure, if you are used to chain or luxury hotels, the Chancellor might initally make you think you are going to be roughing it but rest assured, you'll enjoy your time there. We definitely will be staying there on future visits to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and value”
Reviews.Author: SittingbourneOwl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 weeks ago, fantastic location of Union Square, booked thru Trailfinders, staying 5 nights but only paying for 4. Check in was very efficient and quick, stayed on 5th floor with a Powell Street view, didn't find it noisy , great view of Union Square saw the Chinese New Year parade. Room was on the small size, maybe needs a lick of paint, but it was still good, bathroom was definitely bijou but it had the deepest bath I've seen! Staff were very friendly, even the overnight front desk staff who I bumped into every morning when I went running, the lobby didn't seem crowded, didn't use the bar and restaurant, but the gift shop was very helpful, it is where you can buy Muni ticket and also book your ride to the airport. Now the pluses, bed and pillow menu was very tateful, papers are free from the lobby, as is the free tea/coffee/hot water, cookies and apples, a very personal touch that wouldn't happen in big chains. Location was great for exploring the city, 5 mins walk to Chinatown, don't bother with Grant Street and the tacky shops, for a real taste of Chinatown , walk thru the Stockton Street Tunnel and then the hustle and bustle of market shops hits you. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Chancellor hotel - good location, clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Renata1947
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal via Trailfinders and this hotel was recommended by a friend as well. Good choice! We were very happy staying there (4 nights). The staff was very helpful and the 24 hour hot drinks a nice welcome after a cold day/night outing. We could see Union Square and Macey's from our window and Saks was across the road. The cable car stopped right outside the hotel. Public transport and streetcar within walking distance as well as the hop on hop off bus. Very happy with our stay

Reviews.Title: “Classic boutique hotel and a great value.”
Reviews.Author: oldteacherFl
Reviews.Content: Just what we needed! Great location, easy walk for us seniors to Union Square, Westfield Mall (be sure to sample the Bristol market there), and anything else you might need. Cable car to Fishermans wharf and Ghiardelli Square is right out the front door. Excellent bellman service, very nice low-key lobby, not as overwhelmingly ornate as some others nearby, but nice, and properly staffed. Free coffee and tea and cookies 24/7 in lobby area. Two very nice and quick elevators. This is an old hotel but rooms have been remodeled in recent years and we were very pleased. Ours had a large closet, very good bed, decent TV and usual amenities. Room service and maid service was excellent. Free business center in lobby. The hotel has a feeling of dignity about it, and clearly works to exceed expectations. A good value and we will definitely come back anytime we visit SF.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem in the Center of it All”
Reviews.Author: Cyndy305
Reviews.Content: My husband called the hotel when we changed planes in Las Vegas, and asked their advice re which restaurant we should choose for dinner that evening. They helped us make a good choice and they called and made us a dinner reservation. My luggage didn't make our connecting flight, but when we returned to the hotel that evening, my suitcase had been delivered and hotel staff put it in our room -- it was waiting for me there instead of downstairs at the front desk. Front desk was professional, helpful and competent. Soda, water and snacks were available for a reasonable price, and there were ice machines on every floor. The hotel feels classy and refined, with lots of brass and glass. Classic and tastefully understated decor. I rearranged the chairs in the room to give us a little more space -- but everyone says the rooms in SF are always tiny. Our room was small but not tiny. The bed was very comfortable. I didn't realize that they didn't have king beds, but the queen room we had (for a very reasonable price) was more than adequate. Great mattress and pillows. We didn't feel cramped. We are average sized people. If you are larger, you could request room with two twin beds and possibly put them together for a king? The bathroom was small, but very nice, and had a HUGE tub (no jets). They provided bath salts and I took advantage of a nice hot bath after we returned from walking all over SF for most of the day. No A/C, but we didn't need it. You can request a high or low floor, and you can request a "quiet" room. We were on the 10th floor on the back. It was perfect. We had a great view and no noise from the busy street on the front. This hotel is on the cable car line which runs up and down Powell Street. Very convenient. Just walk outside and there is a cable car stop -- you're on your way. The breakfast offered in this hotel was outstanding. Lots of great choices. I had New Orleans Eggs Benedict -- fantastic and fresh! Good coffee and service. Affordable and reasonable. Next door to Sears Inn, which has great swedish pancakes. Easy to get a cab to and from this hotel -- cabbies knew where our hotel was just by providing the name. I can't think of anything negative about this hotel. A great place to stay: great room, happy environment, very convenient location, safe area, close to great restaurants, stores and nightlife. All at a very reasonable price. You don't need to go through all the blind bidding on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, Great location, Comfortable room, and linked to a full gym”
Reviews.Author: S-J-M_93312
Reviews.Content: I had an excellent stay at the Chancellor. From the moment I arrived the staff was welcoming and very helpful, and every staff member I encountered during my stay was very polite. The Chancellor was located perfectly for me. A couple blocks from the conference I was attending, right on the trolley car line, close to many restaurants, and a block from the gym that they are connected with rather than having a small workout facility on site. The gym was a nice bonus, as it was close and the staff there treated me like I was one of their members, getting to participate in group excercise classes as well as have full access to the rest of the workout equipment and the pool. The room was comfortable, and I was able to get a good night's sleep each night, and enjoyed trying out some different pillows from their pillow menu. Staff was helpful with giving directions to anywhere I needed to go and they recommended a great restaurant upon request.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!!!”
Reviews.Author: chimakuni
Reviews.Content: I am a hotel snob! I was leery of staying at the Chancellor HOWEVER, it was one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. The staff - fantastic. The location - could not have been better. The atmosphere - great. We had adjoining rooms, facing Powell Street, on the fourth floor. I was concerned about the noise level from the cable cars - no problems. We were actually able to go out on the fire escape and watch the Chinese New Year's parade. The shampoo, conditioners and soap were replenished every day. They had souvenir rubber duckies to play in the (huge) tub with and then bring home, gratis. Sears, the restaurant was right next door, and their desserts (dinners, too) are not to be missed. The hotel's restaurant was very nice - we had breakfast there twice - Mao was a wonderful waiter. If you are traveling to San Francisco - do yourself a favor and stay at the Chancellor Hotel on Union Square. You will be so happy you did.

Reviews.Title: “All Good”
Reviews.Author: MikekNZ
Reviews.Content: Things that I look for or expect from a hotel are: Location Location Location, Clean well equipped rooms, a reasonable price. In all cases the Chancellor delivered which is great. Spent 10 nights here back in December, Christmas season which is a great time to be in this area. Having never been to SF before I didnt really know where to stay, was attending a conference at the Moscone centre so somewhere around Union Square made sense. The Chancellor is an old hotel, and one thing old hotels usually have going for them is Location, as they were there first. As such the location is great, for a tourist couldnt be better. So close to Union square, cable cars, shops and the like, I caught the train in from the airport and its a 5 min walk away which is very convenient. For me its probably as far from Moscone as you would want to be walking anyway but no problem. There is a mountain of stuff nearby, ranging from a walgreens nearly next door to fine dining, entertainment and shopping. I was on business so it wasnt really a choice, but if i wasnt I would imagine there is a choice, do i stay here in union square or down by fishermans wharf. Having been there, i would say union square is a better choice - its easy enough to get down to waterfront be it cable cars or buses or whatever, but there is more stuff around and happening at union square in my opinion. The room was not big, but I have been in a lot smaller, I was slightly horrified when I saw it was on level 3 initially due to potential noise, but my room was at the back with a stunning vista of some air conditioners and a wall. Saying that, I could care less about the view more about noise, and apart from a slight hum from said air conditioners there was none so that suits me grand. The bathroom was fine and it had a bath and the provide bath salts which is a nice change. I actually quite liked the look of the room, it was sort of older styled but was quite nice, had a desk to work at and a nice large lcd tv. The lobby is small, and somehow pretty cluttered with a lot going on, they offer free cookies an apple bowl, and tea and coffee all free, which was nice. I didnt really have a lot of opportunity to interact with the hotel staff to much, so cant really comment on them or the bar etc, although the bar did seem to be busy at times so must have been ok .. A couple of points that were not so good. 1) The wireless internet, its free, which is great, problem is , in the mornings and evenings its slooooooow you get time outs in webpages let alone trying to use something like Skype. There is no option to pay for a better service so your pretty much stuck if you need to do some work. From time to time I was there during the day and during the day it was fast and good, so clearly an overloading problem . Ironically, I could get a very strong connection in my room from another hotel which was also free (The Inn) and it worked a lot better so used that most of the time in the evenings. 2) It wasnt a major, but when first checked in and saw it was level 3, enquired about perhaps a higher room (before i knew it would be quiet) and got a strange semi snide comment about if you book through expedia, you should expect a cheap room . Sort of second class citizen thing, which was weird, in my case it was booked for me, so I had no idea what we paid so was a little miffed and not a great way to start. In the end no matter, but perhaps keep it in mind if you book this way. Overall, a couple of minor points in an other wise good stay, would look at other options when I come back - more for variety than anything else, but wouldn't have a problem staying here again .

Reviews.Title: “Great Price & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Crossmen
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Chancellor Hotel for 6 nights during a convention at the Mascone Center. The Hotel is old but well maintained. At $156 a night in San Francisco I must say it was well worth the money. Plus.... Very small but comfortable rooms, very clean. It you like the old style soaking tubs, you will love this hotel. It's a 15 minute walk to the convention center with plenty of restaurants and jazz clubs within walking distance. Cons... If you are traveling with more than one person, the rooms are very small. Might be a little uncomfortable. The Internet connection is VERY slow. I could not keep a VPN connection while trying to do work. Tips.... If you are coming from SFO, you can talk the Subway to Union Square and just walk up two blocks. Very convenient. Plus you can save on the $50 cab fare from the airport. The Cable Car stops right in front of the Hotel. Can take you into Castro or China Town. There is a great Italian Restaurant directly across the street called Scala. Also a block down the street there are two Thai Noodle shops. Great Noodle soups...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LovedParis
Reviews.Content: Love tht it was right on Union Square, and on Powel Street. 4 blocks from the BART station. We had stayed right off of Powell a few years ago and found the other hotel noisy and were unable to sleep. This room was quiet, and yet we were even more conveniently located. The bar was great - happy hour specials that we weren't expecting in San Francisco. they even gave us 2 for 1 drink coupons, and discounts for the hotel diner. Didn't have time to eat there, so I can't comment, but our stay was great - rooms were clean, and as I said, can't beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “An Overall Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Rahulm80
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great location with a friendly staff. The cable cars run right in front of the Hotel and Union Square is across the street. They offer off site parking for a rate lower than the norm for SF. Hotel was extremely clean, rooms, lobby, dining area, everything. We only stayed one night so we didnâ€™t take much advantage of things other than the lobby and our room. Con: We stayed in a room with one king size bed, it might as well have taken the entire room up. It was quiet small and cramped. Those with small children may find this to be a slight issue. The walls were a bit thin also, we could hear the tv in the room next to us late at night. All in all a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: ebwhyte
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor Hotel provided a truly unique stay in the city. The location could not be beat. My husband and I were both born in San Francisco and he has lived there on and off much of our lives. This hotel reminded me of the old Victorian we lived in on Haight Street. The hotel is housed in a wonderfully old building that is loaded with charm. The lobby's ceilings have that beautiful detail found in Victorians; the rooms have high ceilings with exposed fire deterrent piping; the bathrooms have large old tubs; absolutely homey. I felt as if I was in my sister-in-law's guest suite in the old farmhouse that her and her husband restored. I loved it! As other reviewers have mentioned, the room and bathroom were on the small side. My husband is 6'4" and about 220 and he had to adjust to the small toilet. However, the room has everything you need or could want. The soap, lotion, shampoo and conditioner were of good quality. The rubber ducky was a fun treat as was the jar of mints and other goodies. The staff was extremely helpful. We had dinner reservations and needed a taxi. The valet/bell staff literally spent at least 40 minutes out in the rain trying to hail a cab. The hotel bar was a fun hotspot for happy hour. The room service was prompt and delicious. Also, please remember that this hotel is located in downtown San Francisco. With the windows open in the room, you will hear the sounds of the city. However, we had a room facing Powell Street and with the windows closed, you could not hear a thing! This also means that you likely pay for parking. We used the valet service and had no problems. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...great staff...great location....great price!!”
Reviews.Author: Nicola W
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at the Chancellor Hotel..and to us it was everythng that all other reviews have said, so I wont repeat myself too much..well try not to!! Great location, in the heart of everything and right outside the cable car stop. Personal and friendly hotel, rather than a big chains, I can not fault any of the staff, Alisha behind the bar was amazing, giving us local recomendations of restaurants and bars, a wealth of knowledge of local places rather than touristy ones. She also helped us source some wines they sell from a local off licence, even calling ahead to ensure they had them in stock. She was fantastic!! So much so that on our last night we enjoyed her company so much we did not even make it to dinner!! Bell Boys also great, giving us more advice and help. Rooms were great, ample room for us, but I know that in the US you probably may think them a little small, bathrooms a little tired but quite possibly the best shower I have ever had. Little touches in the hotel, make this stick out....umbrella in room, sweets in room, pillow menu and the tea and coffee was great to get you going in the morning. Be sure to pick up all the local maps, they have great discount vouchers on the back, including the one behind the bell boys desk has a 2 for 1 wine tasting voucher at the wine collective at Fishermans wharf. A great escape from the rain for a few hours!! All in all a fantastic hotel that I would not hesitate to recomend to anyone, thank you to all at the Chancellor to making our trip to San Fran amazing!! Nicola & Mark

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the low price scare you, GREAT hotel.”
Reviews.Author: skrdina
Reviews.Content: This is our 4th time staying here and we'll be back again. The staff at this hotel takes pride in its hotel from the nice gal in the front desk to the sweet housekeeping lady offering extra towels to the cheerful waiter in the morning. Always consistent. Always clean. Best location. On my last visit I had a small situation and had to deal with the hotel manager. He was very kind and went out of his way to please me. Would definitely go back and highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “It was a great night at the Chancellor hotel with my husband!”
Reviews.Author: ingridlissete
Reviews.Content: I loved staying there the room was very cozy i wanted to sleep for days, we had a nice romantic stay and the breakfast was killer eggs benedict were the best!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: AChic
Reviews.Content: We received great customer service! The location was perfect! Cable car runs in front of the hotel. There are so many stores and restaurants around it. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS.....VERY COMMON AT THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: dandfbud
Reviews.Content: So we gave this hotel every chance to redeem themselves. When we approached the front desk about bed bug bites that appeared after a single night's stay it was clear that it was not the first time they had dealt with this problem. They turned the room upside down, and gave us another room for the evening....we had no choice but to stay there. When we looked at the bed bug website - the financial district in San Fran basically had one big red blotch over it and seemingly every hotel had dealt with it. As for this place the higher level front desk person had close to zero customer service skills, and the manager never came to speak with us. I would absolutely tell anyone looking for a hotel in San Francisco to carefully research the area and the specific hotel. We had to dry clean or wash everything in hot water when we got home - vacuum all bags and put as much as possible in a hot dryer...it was a nightmare. Plus bites took a couple of weeks to heal. We choose this hotel for the location and price...but got what we paid for....especially bad service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: FloridatravelerTampa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently locatec near Union Square. The street car stops almost in front of the hotel. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The bed was very comfortable. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “No need to hesitate - book your stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Vik_travel
Reviews.Content: Long story short: This is an amazing hotel! Book first, and ask questions later (seriously). Just to clarify, I got this room for a fantastic rate ($75 on Expedia.ca), so my review is coming from the perspective of someone who paid a very decent price for this hotel. PROS: +Awesome location: Everyone mentions this in their review, but I'd just like to reiterate what an amazing location the Chancellor is located in. Close to EVERYTHING, including Union Square, cable cars, food, shopping etc. You seriously can't do any better than this when it comes to staying in SF (Fisherman's Wharf is only about 10-15 mins away on the cable car) +Very, very clean: The housekeeping staff does a great job cleaning your room, and overall the room was very well maintained. (although the bathroom could use a slight refresh; no biggie though) The housekeeping/maintenance staff are also EXCEPTIONALLY nice. Can't say enough good things about them. Very polite, asked me how my day was etc., and were SUPER fast when I had a few things that I needed (phone wasn't working, requested a fridge and white noise machine) +The Pillow Menu: The Chancellor offers a "pillow menu" which has at least 8-10 different pillow types you can request - including pillows I had never even seen or heard of before. Definitely worth trying out if you're staying for a few days or longer +Not noisy (really!): A few reviews mentioned that the rooms tended to get a bit noisy at night time with all the traffic and all that. I slept with the windows open, and my room was facing Powell Street - and I slept like a baby (although maybe my 18+ hour sightseeing days kind of exhausted me as well!). A little tip: the hotel has some white noise machines which really help, so don't hesitate to request one of those. +Other pluses: A few things which I found useful: 1) There isn't really a gym in the hotel, but they do have an agreement of some sort with a full-sized gym ("Club One Health Club" if you want to Google it). It's literally a 5 minute walk away from the hotel (Mason & Sutter), and it has everything you'd need. I think it's a great idea, since most hotel "gyms" usually consist of 2 treadmills and a few free weights. This gym was great, and the staff there is nice too (tip: take your hotel card & one piece of ID with you...lockers w/ locks are provided) 2) Safe is included, as well a heater (not really sure when you'd need that in San Fran!) Oh, and including an umbrella in the closet was also a nice touch. 3) Mini-fridges aren't really included in the room, but you can request one without any problem 4) Great channel selection on TV: Didn't watch much of it, but they had all the useful channels (at least to me), including CNBC, CNN, ESPN and all the other good stuff. 5) Tour desk is staffed with a great lady (sorry, forgot her name!), but you can book everything through her (or at least get some info) - and muni passes are available from her (DEFINITELY get the muni pass if you're staying for longer than a day or two) 6) Can't forget the almost-famous rubber ducky in the bathroom ;) DEBATABLE: +/- Room temp: I went during January, and the weather was picture perfect (22-24 degrees Celsius, sunny all day). However, I DID notice the room was slightly warm during the afternoons when I came back to change clothes or something. There is a ceiling fan which helps, and you can open the window all the way. But honestly, I don't know how bearable the room would be in the heat of the summer. The hotel DOES NOT have A/C. Not really a big deal, but if you're going in the summer and absolutely NEED the A/C, then you may need to think twice. CONS: -Wi-fi Internet: Wasn't AWFUL, but it wasn't very speedy during many times. For some odd reason, the best wi-fi reception I got was in the bathroom (don't ask me how I know this :P) -Front desk staff: The staff is "pleasant", but honestly I did not find them particularly engaging. There was one particular woman at the front desk in the afternoon who was pretty stiff. I asked her how to get to the gym, and she rolled her eyes at me like I was bothering her or something. And when I got to the gym, the guy at the front desk said that guests need to bring a piece of ID with them - something the lady at the front desk didn't mention (luckily the staff at the gym are very nice, so I was able to slip through). Another gentleman at the desk, who I think is the supervisor/manager (young-ish looking guy) also didn't really seem to go out of his way to engage with people at the front desk. Not really a big deal, but kind of blemished the otherwise great hotel OVERALL: The hotel definitely made my stay in San Fran (which is an awesome city, btw) a bit more memorable and tension-free overall. Apart from the few slightly negative "cons", I wouldn't ever hesitate to give this hotel a second chance or to recommend it to someone else. I just hope the front desk staff can be a bit more consistent in their customer service so they don't tarnish the reputation of this otherwise amazing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Price”
Reviews.Author: timmytichi
Reviews.Content: this was a hidden gem. Located just up the block from Uniton Square this small hotel fit the bill. great rate, great location. Rooms are samll but who spends time in their room while in San. Fran. Had 2 twin beds , stayed with a friends so space was tight but not a problem. Comfortable beds, choice of pillow , free tea and coffee. This was a perfect spot, I highly recommend. For the location and price you can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: czilbo
Reviews.Content: Chancellor in Union Square has a perfect combination of wonderful location and excellent service.Rooms are a little bit small but absolutely comfortable.The only negative point is that they don't include breakfast and this would be great.

Reviews.Title: “They do everything right!”
Reviews.Author: barrytunes
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small, but the hotel makes up for it with exemplary service. EVERYONE on staff has a positive attitude and does everything possible to accommodate concerns or requests. Traffic sounds were occasionally an issue at night (trucks beeping, emergency vehicles). Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly placed hotel for those wanting to explore the city”
Reviews.Author: WarmCargo
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor was one of 7 hotels we stayed in during a recent trip across California, and this was without doubt the best of the bunch. It's by no means a 5 star hotel, but for the price I don't think they could be beaten. The hotel is right on Union Square with the Powell St cable car stop right outside. The rooms are nice, the bathrooms clean and functional, and the room we had included a large walk-in wardrobe. For those that like to stay connected, the hotel has fast free wifi available with solid signal strength. The staff are very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable about the city. We will definitely be staying here again the next time we're in San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “great stay in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: AchyFeet
Reviews.Content: found it on Expedia with a nice package rate. It is not a boutique per se since the decor is a bit old and some paint on the wall in our room is chipped. But they paid attention to the important things such as cleaniness, nice linens, sound proof window(our room was 5th floor over Powell), comfortable king bed. I slept thru every night. The staff is courteous and accomdating. It is also nice to have a little shop at the lobby where you can get small necessities(such as the muni pass, without standing in line at the Cable car booth). And of course you can't beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel but beware of poor treatment if you book through Priceline...”
Reviews.Author: nreitter
Reviews.Content: I stayed just one night (for business) at the Chancellor. The location is excellent but that is where the excellence ends. I was treated like a complete second class citizen because I booked through Priceline &, assumably, received a discounted rate. The man loudly & distainfully said "since you booked through Priceline all we have for you is a twin bed". Really? I'm a 38 year-old business traveler, not a 10 year-old at a slumber party. Anyhow, I asked if the two twin beds could be moved together to make a larger bed & he flatly said "no". When I got to my room I had a lovely view of a cement wall & ventilation system. The room was fine. Nice flat screen TV. The bathroom had some sort of fan in it that did not seem to be able to be turned off so I had to sleep with the bathroom door shut. Also, it had a white shower curtain that seemed worse for wear to me. I ordered a side of pancakes, 2 scrambled eggs & a small orange juice for breakfast & the bill was $20-- ouch! Would've been ok except it wasn't any sort of special OJ-- just regular boxed stuff & the pancakes, I'm almost certain, were the "add water" box/mix kind. They were dry & chewy. Anyhow, i doubt I would stay again & I certainly would not stay if I am a Priceline user. You WILL be treated poorly.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: SmileyGirl_77
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Chancellor was awesome! Upon our arrival, I found a bottle of wine and a birthday card - what a way to start the weekend. The hotel staff was friendly/helpful, the hotel is located within walking distance of many stores, resturants, and the trolley, and it is such a cute boutique hotel. Don't forget to take advantage of the pillow menu!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location on Union Street”
Reviews.Author: gouroudesmers
Reviews.Content: Great location on Union square. Old Hotel but well refurbished. Rooms are small but very clean, bed is good. I was on the 13th floor, not oriented on Powel street, so it was very quiet, no noise at all. I guess if your room was on the 1rst floor, oriented to Powel street, the noise of the stret and of the cable car is probably high. There is a parking for your car just one block from thye hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is the only place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: kitingirl
Reviews.Content: Stay here every year when we go to SF for shopping/sightseeing. Excellent location within walking distance of best stores, cable car line, and short walk to get the trolley. Hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. Restaurant is OK, but not fabulous. A little pricey for the quantity of food and sometimes the service is not as attentive as it could be. In other words, go across the street to Starbucks and have a bagel and coffee, or next door to Sears for the little pancakes.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in the Heart of S.F.”
Reviews.Author: Athena222
Reviews.Content: What a surprise. I've stayed at downtown hotels (Union Square) for business, spending hundreds each night. The rate here was totally reasonable, and location can't be beat. The desk folks let us check in at 10:30 a.m. (due to an early flight from the East Coast) and were very friendly and accommodating. The room was on the small side but perfectly adequate. Though it's an historic hotel, all bathroom fixtures were modern. The bar was very welcoming, with a great bartender. All staff were helpful in helping us figure out how to negotiate the city via public transportation. The only downside was paying $29 a day for parking, but tha't par for S.F. Wish the hotel had been able to negotiate a discount. All in all, a terrific, affordable, friendly place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a top location”
Reviews.Author: Lysh09
Reviews.Content: Fantastic little hotel with an old world and homely feel. The hotel has obvioulsy been refurbished recently and the decor has been well chosen, it was nice to have a hotel with a bit of character rather than a sterile chain hotel. Our room was very comfortable and spotless, we also appreciated the large safe so we could fit laptops etc in our room, rather than putting them in a hotel safe. The location can't be beat, great restaurants and shopping right at your front door. The cable car also stops right outside and takes you directly to Fisherman's Wharf. The price was very reasonable as well, we got a deal for $95US a night which I was very happy with. We also stayed over New Years and were pleased with the hotel security, each guest was given a wrist band and you weren't admitted to the hotel without it.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel - superb value and service”
Reviews.Author: gerbilsontour
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 days whilst at a conference at the Westin Union Square. This hotel was great and really good value. It is small and private and homely rather than ultra modern. My room was medium sized but large enough with a nice desk and tele and large walk-in closet and good sized bathroom with full bath. The bed was large and comfortable and there was a great pillow menu. being at teh back my room was quiet. There is no aircion but there is a ceiling fan. There is no tea/coffee making facilities in the room but they provide free tea/coffee/biscuits/apples in the reception bar all day - this was fantastic as instead of having meetings standing in the very busy lobby of the Westin I could invite guests to come and meet with me at the lovely quiet small lobby of the Chancellor. Internet is also free at this hotel. They are happy for you to order food to eat in your room from nearby cafes - so when I arrived late on a saturday night I had a nice delivery pizza. There is a small restaurant in the hotel that offers good value simple meals (sandwiches etc). Good value cocktails during happy hour (5pm - 7.30pm). All the staff were very helpful. There is a shuttle bus to the airport for $14. A very nice home-from-home stay with great service, great value for money and a great location right on Powell Street on Union Square. Why pay more at flash chains when this little gem offers so much!!

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere and location plus top service!”
Reviews.Author: SFadmirer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times over the years. It is not very large, but has a very comfortable atmosphere, is clean and in a great location right next to Union Square. Service by all staff members is superb, even if you have unusual requests. This is my regular place to stay in SF, even though I stay at four star hotels elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in best location”
Reviews.Author: Italiandreamer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights after completing our California Coastal Road Trip. We arrived at 1500 hours but only 1 room out of 4 ready however they let us leave our baggage and we helped ourselves to their free tea/coffee and fresh cookies which is available 24 hrs a day from the bar/reception area. Our rooms were ready within 30 mins so not a major problem and the porter took our bags up for us. We were all allocated rooms on the 9th floor so heard no traffic noise at all for such a central spot. Room was not huge but adequate, very clean and freshly decorated. Bathroom was very small but was clean with great shower with plenty hot water and toiletries/towels provided. Bed was extremely comfortable with a choice of pillows offered to order. Complimentary bottle of wine given in room and jar of sweeties too. The concierge Susan was very helpful in organising sightseeing trips and shuttle bus for us to the Airport at a very good price. After wondering around SF this hotel was definately in the best location in a very safe neighbourhood overlooking Union Square. Exceptional quality for the price paid (GBP 80 per night) considering how good the hotel was. Far better choice of restaurants and close to shops and nicer area than Fishermans Wharf which is noisy and very touristy and not where I would choose to stay. Would recommend the Chancellor to anyone either business traveller or tourist alike.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tshaw9
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Chancellor for nine days 4/13th December. What more can I say fantastic, great staff, great location, great little bar with great Happy Hour, room and bathroom a little on the small size but very comfortable and clean, even got used of the street noises in night. Overall a very pleasant hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Nice Price, Great Location, Super GM”
Reviews.Author: Belle-Lettrist
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Chancellor Hotel. The location in Union Square is stellar and makes up for the fact that the hotel is in need of a gentle makeover. The hotel has a wonderful history, great location, nice architecture, fabulous rates, and great bones, and needs only some small improvements to make it more comfortable for the business traveler. However, as someone who is on the road for work at least a couple of times a month and stays in all kinds of hotels, I can't recall a more responsive, hands-on, accessible General Manager than Wes Tyler.

Reviews.Title: “Great find, we loved the Chancellor Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hapacouple
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a great hotel near Union Square, try the Chancellor Hotel. This was our first trip as a couple and after hours of research on the internet, my boyfriend came across this great deal. $100 a night which included parking! The parking is a bit inconvenient, especially in the rain since it's a couple blocks away....but it's hard to find a hotel of this quality with parking included! My boyfriend requested a room with a view of the Union Square Christmas tree and boy, did we have a great view! The service is excellent, very friendly, very helpful and they have cookies and other treats our during the day along with "make your own tea" which came in handy when it rained. We actually visited San Fran back in December 2009 and I'm only getting around to writing this review now. We had two different rooms (the second room was better, sorry, if I remember which rooms we had, I will definitely update this review). The reason for the two different rooms is we checked out one night to stay in Calistoga. The hotel was nice enough to hold our luggage for us ( no charge, we just tipped the front desk people). The hotel is kitty corner to Union Square, so we walked there to take pics of the Christmas tree during the day and in the evening. The hotel is also very near a lot of shopping...it was too cold to shop for us! The rooms are a bit old, but the furniture has been updated. Our bed was soooo soft and comfy. We had free internet in our room. Both our rooms were small, but just the right size for us. There were two elevators in the building, so no long waits. We didn't try the hotel restaurant since we had a list of restaurants we wanted to try. Although we decided when we make it back to the San Francisco area we'd probably stay outside of the city (since we're not shoppers, we didn't care for too many of the restaurants in the area except for Dot's True Blue Cafe and to save a little money), if we do decide to stay in the city again, it would definitely be here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel; loved the location”
Reviews.Author: Wood501
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here on our way to Fiji & New Zealand. Well positioned rooms with nice decor the bathrooms were a little dated but plenty of hot water and good pressure. Fantastic location just off Union Square with the cable car running right outside the front door which takes you directly to the Wharf. Friendly staff that were very helpful. Can't comment on breakfast or the food served at the hotel as we chose to eat elsewhere. I am a fussy customer but if visiting San Francisco again I would stay here.

Reviews.Title: “If your going to San Francisco, be sure to”
Reviews.Author: Howard-Moon
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located near Union Square the hotel is well situated to take in all San Francisco has to offer with either nearby public transport (trams directly outside and main bus routes within a few blocks) or within reasonable walking distance. The hotel is a little dated and not sure whether this made it â€˜quaintâ€™ or in need of a bit of modernisation. The bathrooms although functional had the feel of the facilities in my Grannyâ€™s house. However, not withstanding this, the room was large enough and clean and served our needs more than adequately for our short stay in San Francisco. As mentioned by others the free tea and coffee facilities in the lobby were a nice touch and free internet access also in the main lobby was also useful. Staff also excellent and very helpful We stayed for three nights on a stop over to New Zealand and managed to take in a lot of the local attractions. Easy access to the main sights either by walking or public transport â€“ a short walk to Chinatown (albeit up some of the hills), tram down to Fishermans Wharf, local bus (No 5) out to Golden Gate Park and a 15 minute walk to the Ferry building for the start point of some of the tours. City Tour (from Ferry Building) takes in most of the local sights and includes trip over the bridge to Sausalito for lunch â€“ ferry back past the â€˜Rockâ€™ and then last trip out to Alcatraz (in the dark - very eerie and atmospheric) Segway Tours â€“ takes in some of the backstreets and a chance to have a bit of a tear up on the pier Top Tips : Shuttle bus from the airport $30 as to $60 in a cab Get the trams back from the Wharf terminal as opposed to the 'Cannery' terminal which can get very busy with long queues Plenty of Restaurants within easy walking distance of the hotel off Union Square â€“ so no need to venture too far in the evenings

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel, top location”
Reviews.Author: Eekthecat88
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the Christmas break. Great location on Union Square. Cable car outside and next to the restaurant Sears. This hotel is old and not one of your newer chain hotels but has character and everything you would need for the right price. We followed advice on trip advisor aand asked for a high floor room as you will hear the cable car bell on lower floors. We didnt use the restaurant but the tour desk was run by a super efficient woman called Susan who was very helpful. Staff were nice and cleaning staff very efficient. Stay here you want excellent location for a great price. Pillow menu option was a nice touch. Free Wi Fi Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: 1stDiamondGirl
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor was the perfect place for a week-end Christmas get-away. Great rates included free parking. Wonderful, nicely decorated room with a view of the Christmas tree in Union Square. Cable car access across the street, fabulous food and shopping within walking distance. Really great front desk, bellman and cleaning staff. What more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Old Hotel Charm”
Reviews.Author: criticul
Reviews.Content: My only criticism was that because we booked through Priceline, we were given twin beds. Made the romance focus of our trip a tad challenging.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location”
Reviews.Author: Carlau
Reviews.Content: We loved the Chancellor, lovely hotel with old city feel. The room was comfy, nice bed, massive closet enough room to keep two suitcases in and lots of space to hang clothes. Bathroom was quite small but we didn't find this an issue. Sweets left in a jar each day in the room was a nice touch and the free cookies in reception were yummy. Tram stops right outside hotel, although we walked a lot, walking distance to China Town. Lots of nice bars and resturants in the area, lovely little pizza resturant on the corner which was open til late. Hotel close to lots of shops and mall and main train station close by which takes you straight to the airport. We felt the hotel was a great choice. Only negative and no reflection on the hotel itselfs but there are a lot on beggers in the area but we did not feel unsafe as area is very busy at night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great value for money - lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: USAFAN_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Chancellor for a short part of our 3 week honeymoon. This hotel was lovely, it had great character and the staff were very helpful. The rooms were clean and quiet and we were a short walk from everything in San Francisco. As it was our honeymoon, when we arrived in our room we found a bottle of champagne and some chocolates. I would definitely stay at this hotel if we were to return to San Fran and would certainly recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable!”
Reviews.Author: WillyRandom
Reviews.Content: Great value in the hub of shopping San Francisco! Delightful staff. Pleasant room service. Nice old bathtubs. Small rooms, but that's part of city life for me. The internet speed is a bit sluggish, but it is free. I love supporting good independent places like this. My only regret is that they usually have two night minimums, because I'm usually just up for an overnight when visiting my family in Monterey Bay.The rooms on Powell Street are noisy because of the trolley cars. I always request a back facing room on an upper floor.

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable four night stay.”
Reviews.Author: serengeti49445
Reviews.Content: My fiancee' and I decided to leave our cold Michigan December winter and fly to San Francisco for a four night escape. We loved our stay at the Chancellor Hotel. Such a wonderful location, friendly staff, great food in the restaurant and those delicious cookies and coffee in the lobby. We were originally assigned a room with no view, but after requesting a change we were immediately accommodated. We have stayed here before and we will stay at the Chancellor again. Thanks again for everything!!! Happy New year, Joe Piziali

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Vbg
Reviews.Content: Our French family wanted to visit San Francisco so we booked 3 rooms for 2 nights. The room rate was great for San Francisco and included free parking half a block away. You cannot beat the location on Union Square. The rooms were stylish, clean and very comfortable with a choice of pillows. A family member forgot some clothing in the room and they arranged to have it shipped. We will no doubt stay at the Chancellor again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Very Comfy Beds”
Reviews.Author: Ohjustpeachy
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is as good as it looks, right at Union Sq with cable cars passing outside, the bart/muni within one - three min walk and major shopping stores within one! The rooms are NOT at all tiny, they comfortably sleep two with room enough to accommodate suitcases, shopping etc. They come with free wi-fi, modern flat-screen tvs, plenty of green tea toiletries, bath, shower, in-room safe, large closets, pillow menus, and in our case we were presented with a card and complimentary bottle of bubbly to help celebrate. It's the small touches that count and this hotel has them all. Free tea, coffee & cookies are available in the lobby all day, there's a starbucks on the corner if you prefer something else. Chinatown is about four mins away, there's so much to see close by that we walked everywhere. I wouldn't hesitate to use the hotel again or recommend it to friends; it's clean, warm, charming, staffed with helpful & friendly people and reasonably priced. What else do you need??!!

Reviews.Title: “Oustanding value in a lovely city”
Reviews.Author: Johnnio
Reviews.Content: We started our US/Europe trip here and it was a great city to start in and the hotel was a bonus as well. It is in the middle of the city but is quiet and efficient and friendly. Close to Macys and Bloomingdales, but not too far from anywhere. We did a lot of walking: to Haight/Ashbury, North Beach etc and it was always a pleasure to return to the hotel where the service was discreet and helpful. We ate breakfast in the dining room whre the food was very good and affordable. Great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “So close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: imasecretagent
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at The Chancellor for 4 nights and found the hotel to be fantastic. However, we didn't spend much time in our room! The beauty of the hotel is its convenience to the transport, the shops and all of the action of Union Square. You will not believe how close you are to everything - brilliant!! It is NOT fancy. In fact, it is quite dated so don't expect to find a modern suite or a large room. We stayed in a twin single room and it was comfortable for the 2 of us and we found the free WiFi throughout the hotel to be one of our favourite features, as we spent a lot of time after the day's/night's activities chatting to friends back in Australia on our laptops for free. The bathroom was quite old and small but clean and functional. There was a huge walk-in wardrobe which allowed us to get our luggage out of the way. The beds were comfortable and there's even a pillow menu. My only concern about the room is that there is no air-conditioning which for us travelling in winter wasn't really a problem. However, we couldn't sleep with the window open due to the degree of street noise and we slept with the fan on even in December to get enough cool air circulating in to sleep comfortably. I imagine on a warm night this could be a problem. Overall though, small criticism for a really great hotel experience for an amazingly good price. By the way, breakfast in the hotel is sensational! We are yet to have a better breakfast in the city and it was good value. The happy hour cocktails at the bar are, likewise, excellent! San Francisco is an amazing city - enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: jennobrn
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located near various transportation options. It was perfect for hoping on and off the cable car. We had a room overlooking Powell St., it was a little noisy but exactly what we had expected. If you must have it absolutely quiet to sleep don't stay on that side of the hotel. We enjoyed listening to the city below. Room was clean, small (but large enough for the 2 of us), nicely decorated. Staff was friendly. Would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “It Is A Treasure”
Reviews.Author: gavve60
Reviews.Content: My 3rd stay here and it is a perfect fit. Stayed for 5 nights and this time was placed at the front of the hotel which I thought would be noisy. However once window closed there was only the faint noise of the cable car which if you on union square is a lovely sound. I like that you are in the centre of everything and able to use transit to get to all areas of the city and then be able to return to your cosy room at the end of the day. For a solo traveller the rooms are roomy and as stated the closet is very large. The bathroom is small and adequate and has lovely green tea bath products. Pillows and bed is very comfy and as stated the hotel is historical so the hallways are a little tight . Staff are very friendly and will store your luggage if you have a later flight so you can explore more. Free access to printer and internet in lobby. Had breakfast in restaurant one morning and was scrumptious. I was contemplating trying a different hotel on this visit. I am glad I didnt!!!

Reviews.Title: “Delightfully, charmingly,adorably perfect.”
Reviews.Author: AZGoddess
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd stay at The Chancellor, and it was just as amazing as my first visit! It was my birthday weekend, and we were welcomed with a lovely bottle of wine in our room. The decor is so pretty, and the location is ideal for holiday shopping. So nice to recognize a few of the employees from 2 1/2 yrs ago. That shows to me that management treats their people right, and it shows in their treatment of their guests. I highly recommend The Chancellor to anyone wanting a romantic getaway hotel location!

Reviews.Title: “Swell time on our anniversary...”
Reviews.Author: Marc019
Reviews.Content: We liked this cute hotel. Our room was "smallish", but spotless, featuring a very comfortable bed, plenty of pillows(hurray!), and enough room for two people to move around. We selected this hotel online, mostly because it featured discounted parking and was right on Union Square. We don't regret our choice. The only downside for us was the spotty availability of hot water for tea in the lobby. We missed having a microwave or a coffeemaker in the room to make getting hot water more convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and well located”
Reviews.Author: loobs40
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights as part of our honeymoon and we were delighted to find chocolates, a present and a bottle of wine waiting for us when we checked in ! We had a room on one of the higher floors (17th perhaps ?) and we had a view of Union Square from the window. The location is fantastic, with the cable car running to Fisherman's Wharf, just outside the hotel door and large department stores such as Maceys within five minutes walk. The bed was extremely comfortable and the decor and furniture in the room was tasteful. Some may think the rooms are on the small side, but maybe because we are from Europe and have different expectations we found the room size perfectly adequate. We enjoyed a drink (or was it five?...) at the small bar on the second night and found Rory the barman to be a perfect host. We ate breakfast most mornings in the hotel restaurant and the service was good. The hotel offers some dicount vouchers for both the restaurant and bar when you check in. Suzy on the Tour Desk was extremely helpful and pleasant. Overall we really enjoyed our visit to San Francisco (see my review of green Dream Tours also) and we intend to visit again, but for a longer holiday. I will certainly book the Chancellor again.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy in the city!”
Reviews.Author: RVanslot
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed over Thanksgiving weekend! My husband booked the trip. I had some reservations about the hotel because, it was quite inexpensive. But, then I read the reviews which, were very positive. The hotel is in the heart of the CIty, on Union Square. Eventhough, it was very busy on the street, once you walked in to the hotel it was quiet, clean, cozy, and welcoming. Everybody that worked at the hotel was very helpful, nice, and unpretentious. The pillow menu was a really, unique and nice touch as was the, rubber ducky. The decor in the rooms was simply chic. The bed and pillows were very comfortable! The walls were a little thin but, we slept just fine! I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful View, Great Serivce, and Excellent Value!”
Reviews.Author: ndbrad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chancellor on the first night of our Honeymoon from Philadelphia. We arrived, the bellman took our bags from the car to the room, and we took advantage of the valet parking (it was only $5 more than self-park). When we got to our room, the hotel had left us with champagne and chocolates to help us celebrate! The room itself was great â€“ a nice view of the city, a choice of 13 varieties of pillows, and a concierge that helped us with spot-on directions to multiple city locations (including suggestions for city viewing). The bartender, Rory, was really friendly and helpful â€“ giving us great suggestions for dining destinations in the Napa Valley. We had breakfast in the hotel the next morning â€“ great as well. Given the value and location of this hotel, we would stay here during our next visit!!

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels”
Reviews.Author: moniclio
Reviews.Content: A great hotel, no unnecessary frills, but full of thoughtful details. I loved the simple and elegant room decor-very tasteful. They had a "Pillow menu" and some of the best quality sheets I have ever slept in a hotel. It felt like home. Great location. Excellent service. This is what i would call a "Minded hotel", making sure all your needs are met. When ever in SF again, this is my home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Hesitate to Stay at the Chancellor Again”
Reviews.Author: Mailgirl
Reviews.Content: I booked the Chancellor Hotel when I decided to add 2 more nights to an already planned trip to San Francisco. I contacted the hotel directly and received a great rate. I had a corner room on the 12th floor that overlooked Union Square. I had read the reviews of the Chancellor on here and was hoping it would live up to the hype. It did. I did not run into any employee who was not friendly or helpful. And they had answers for every question I asked about the hotel and the area. My room was very nice. The bed was comfortable and I really liked the tiled bathroom. It's not a modern an new place, it's quaint and historic. I expected the room to be on the small side, but there was plenty of room to move around. And the closet was so big, you could change inside it! And in there was a safe, an electric radiator, an umbrella, an iron & board and extra bedding. The first day I arrived, it was pretty warm. I just opened the window and turned up the ceiling fan and the room was quite comfortable. I even slept with the window open and the street noise did not bother me. The free wi-fi was a plus. I did not go to the restaurant or bar. (only because I was not there too long)

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Everything close by!!!”
Reviews.Author: Allison062
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location with the cable car out the front. Yes, the room was compact, but it was clean, tidy and comfortable. Who wants to sit in a hotel room while on holidays anyway!!! Great service in the restaurant and bar, a tour booking service and the staff were very obliging. And those homemade cookies in the foyer were delicious - a lovely touch to a great hotel. Take a trip to the Napa Valley from here - fantastic wines. Would definitely recommend and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Chancellor Hotel - a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Nathan076
Reviews.Content: We can recommend the Chancellor Hotel to anyone wanting accomodation in a convenient location that is functional, clean and efficient. Communication with staff before, during and after our stay was simple and effective, and they seem to want to assist in any way possible. Breakfasts in the restaurant are delivered promptly and there are sufficient menu options to keep one's interest for the duration of your stay. I believe that rates are competitive for this location in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location,price and service”
Reviews.Author: jwj0909
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, and the price is great for downtown San Francisco. The room is smallish but not a problem at all. The ceilings are high and it has a ceiling fan. The bathtub was large and comfortable. The bed was great. I found the sheets uncomfortable(scratchy)the first night, when I mentioned it to the front desk they were changed and I was very satisfied. It is very helpful that you can rent a car and/or buy a MUNI pass all in the hotel lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - the hotel "does what it says on the tin!"”
Reviews.Author: JKPUK
Reviews.Content: First class location in heart of San Francisco. Rooms adequate in size but certainly not large. Standards of cleanliness were OK. Staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value and Top Hotel in San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: CardinalsLady
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a five-night stay at the Chancellor and found it absolutely perfect. I am astonished at the review that said she had a horrible bed - we had one of the BEST beds we've ever slept in at a hotel. The location is perfect for access to Union Square, the BART, the cable cars, and there are lots of wonderful restaurants in the area. The entire staff was very helpful, remembering us by name, and doing everything they could to be of assistance (making dinner reservations, looking up BART departure times, getting us a cab, etc.). They provided a mini fridge to our room upon request too. Some may comment on the smallish room and bathroom, but we found it to be more than adequate - and about the size of nice hotels in Europe. If you want to pay extra to say in a suite, fine - go for it. We didn't need air conditioning in November and found the overhead ceiling fan and open windows more than adequate. And our room (909) was incredibly quiet. NO street noise other than the occasional cable car. I can't say enough good things about this hotel and I will definitely recommend it to all of my friends - and should I ever return to San Francisco, this is the only place I'll consider staying. The Chancellor made my trip to San Francisco absolutely wonderful. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MadaleineB
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel, great location in a safe, CLEAN area near everything from great restaurants to shopping to public transit to tour starting points. The room was lovely & very clean. Room Service for breakfast (on my birthday) was wonderful. We asked the concierge for a restaurant recommendation and he seemed to know minute details of nearly every place in the city and we ended up at a great French place 5 minutes away. Would definitely go back to the Chancellor!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Corey71
Reviews.Content: You can't put a price on the history of the Chancellor hotel and surrounding area. The cable cars run right in front of the hotel and you are in easy walking distance of Union Square and tons of restaurants and rental car locations. Starbucks across the street is handy as well. Very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Bad Beds!”
Reviews.Author: tabbi_traveler
Reviews.Content: On our Babymoon to San Francisco, we had a fantastic time considering I was 28 weeks pregnant. You literally cannot beat the location of the Chancellor Hotel, but be prepared for horrible beds and rude staff. The lady in the lobby (can't remember her name) who helps you with attractions was the best though! It was a mixed bag, but considering the price and value I'd stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location, Wonderful Staff, Will Definitely Stay Here Again!”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaQuinn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chancellor Hotel on Union Square for 4 nights. Everyone we encountered was very helpful and nice. We always felt safe and comfortable. Here is some more helpful info: 1. Close to the MUNI and the cable cars, so the location is very convenient. Plus, there is a Border's right next door for Seattle's Best Coffee (and there is free coffee in the hotel lobby, too!) 2. There is a place right in the lobby of the hotel that you can buy a MUNI passport at, and you can also get an airport shuttle there for just a few dollars more than the BART, and it is a much more comfortable and convenient ride. 3. The young lady at the front desk printed out our boarding passes for us - and she was happy to do so! 4. The cute yellow duckie in the bathroom was too cute! And the bath salts and deep bath tub were a plus - they helped soothe my aching calf muscles after walking up hills in Pacific Heights lol. 5. The food at Lucques was delicious! Everything was very fresh and cooked to perfection. I recommend the breakfast burrito - YUM! 6. We were greeted EVERY day by someone whenever we came and went from the lobby- we felt like royalty. 7. They have a pillow menu, but we didn't need it. We slept like babies on the pillows that were already on our bed.

Reviews.Title: “Always a favorite”
Reviews.Author: sjstoddard
Reviews.Content: We enjoy San Francisco on an occasional basis and over the past several years have made the Chancellor our "home". The rooms are not huge, nor is the lobby breathtaking, but the stay is always comfortable, the beds "heavenly" and the staff as good as any we've ever experienced. To us this is a real find, classy, convenient, and... in light of it being in downtown SF, affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: cyraxote
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nearly perfect. Any time you leave home, youâ€™re bound to run into some hassles, but the Chancellor does an excellent job of minimizing those hassles to the point of invisibility. I donâ€™t really trust any of the negative reviews Iâ€™ve read; I think these people had a bad day or just have an axe to grind. I corresponded a little with Wes Tyler, the Chancellorâ€™s manager, after we made our reservation. He was extremely pleasant and, when we arrived, our room was exactly as we requested. We had a room on the front of the 13th floor; we didnâ€™t realize until the 3rd day that the window was slightly open, but we had no trouble with noise before that and no trouble with temperature after closing it. The ceiling fan was more than sufficient for cooling (and Iâ€™m extremely sensitive to heat when sleeping). One caveat: because of the size of the bathroom and the placement of the toilet, larger persons might have difficulty getting comfortable on it. Iâ€™m 6â€™3â€�, 275 lbs, and I felt a little like a bear on a tricycle. Itâ€™s not a complaint, really; more just something to be aware of. In addition, since this is in the news quite a bit at the moment, I am happy to report that there are NO BEDBUGS! A sign in the room asks that tips for the housekeeping staff not be left in the rooms; however, tips are welcome (and deserved), but the front desk will provide an envelope for your tip at checkout if you ask for it. We didnâ€™t try the hotel restaurant, but we had three good meals at Searsâ€™ Fine Food, next door, and one at Loriâ€™s Diner, half a block up Powell. The cookies always available in the lobby are excellent, especially the oatmeal-cranberry cookies. The Tour Desk in the lobby sells Muni passes and can arrange rental cars and transport to and from the airport. [We also recommend Mr. Toadâ€™s Tours (mrtoadstours.com) and Jay Giffordâ€™s Victorian Home Walk (victorianwalk.com; starting point is a half-block from hotel). House of Nanking (on Kearny St.) will change the way you think of Chinese food.]

Reviews.Title: “Great value for union square”
Reviews.Author: RickvanG
Reviews.Content: Great 'budget' hotel, early booking price $99 and an excellent base to explore the rest of San Fran

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: beaglemomCalifornia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a two-night stay at the Chancellor, We usually stay at the Orchard or Orchard Garden, and wanted to try someplace different. The Chancellor is exactly as advertised on the hotel's website, and I got a great rate by booking early through the hotel. The rooms were very quiet, but there is street noise (even on the 14th floor) -- wear ear plugs. We enjoyed happy hour at the hotel bar each night, and met other travelers, as well as locals who stop by after work. I appreciated all the nice touches like large bath towels, bathroom nightlight, and bath salts. What really makes the Chancellor stand out are the wonderful employees. They even accommodated my request for a late check-out. We had dinner and breakfast across the street at Scala's and I actually preferred the breakfast. The Chancellor is my new "go to" hotel in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to get back to the Chancellor”
Reviews.Author: johnryan13
Reviews.Content: Fact: Just loved this hotel and the staff's' positive attitude. Fact: Have travelled the world (now retired) and the Chancellor is up there among the very best. Fact: You cannot buy a level of guest service such as we found at the Chancellor: it's either there at the core of their philosophy or it's not: and we were lucky to meet this kind of smiling service. Fact: Right on Union Square, free tea, coffee, and cookies all day AND night. Fact: I use a walking stick, and was helped by the 2 bellboys Matt and Kent so often. The night Manager was so helpful to me. Fact: Ms. Susan in the Gift Shop and Tour Desk went out of her way to accomodate us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very clean and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Antonia2424
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i stayed here for a week in September. Our room was modern and very clean. All the staff we met were very, very helpful. Every day, no matter what time we left our room, we always came back to a very clean room with fresh towels etc. I would like to take this opportunity to say thank you to all the maids, hope someone enjoyed the bottle of wine i left. The location is fantastic. If i am ever lucky enough to go to San Francisco again this is where i would stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value & location”
Reviews.Author: iridevail
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor hotel is a quality property, conveniently located with easy access to public transportation, China town, North beach, and the water front. The service was top notch, the restaurant was good, the room was clean & updated. And the price was very reasonable for all that was delivered by the Chancellor hotel. Next time I visit San Fransisco I plan to book my stay at the Chancellor and I would recommend this hotel to others as well.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small hotel in perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: kenrichfamily
Reviews.Content: This was a great find. The location is the best and the hotel is very comfortable. If you expect granite in the bath, a state of the art workout room and a wonderful mini-bar look else where but if you want a comfortable bed with down comforter, 24 hour complimentary tea/coffee and cookies and the most wonderful location in San Francisco all at a super reasonable rate....this is the hotel for you. The rooms do not have AC so we slept with the window open but were at the back of the hotel so it was quiet. The only slight negative was not so great water pressure in the shower. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Top value, perfect location, best omelette”
Reviews.Author: ozjasmine
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in mid Oct. I booked this hotel due to the good reviews here but I was skeptical because it's quite cheap, so I didn't expect much.
