It turned out to be such a good experience! Room is small especially the bathroom, but it has everything we needed. The staff were very friendly and helpful. And we love the location best! It's so convenient: we walked to shops and if we wanted to go further, cable car and bus stops were just meters away. we had breakfast every morning in the hotel. It's really good value and excellent service and food. The omelettes were the best (we didn't realise that at the time, but after trying a few more in other cities, we knew). My husband asked me to rave about the omelettes if I wrote a review. :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: jen2951
Reviews.Content: Only stayed for two nights wish it could have been more.The hotel is in a perfect location very close to Union Square , the trams and the Bart.The staff were extremely helpful and even when the loo broke at midnight it was fixed within 30 minutes , very impressive.The rooms are not huge but there is a large walk in closet to store luggage so no problem there.We did not meet the Manager Wes Tyler but he ensured our stay was perfect nothing was too much trouble and we would definately stay here again if we visited San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eimear99
Reviews.Content: I have just returned fro a 4 night stay in the Chancellor hotel in San Francisco. I booked it on the basis of reviews that the hotel got and they don't lie. The location is second to none, right on Union Square surrounded by fab shopping and restaurants. Yes, the rooms are a little on the small side, but that is the only negative. The beds were so comfortable after a long day sightseeing.The staff were really helpful. There was free internet access in the lobby and free apples,coffee and cookies. We had breakfast one mornimg and it was lovely but we ate out all other times.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great service, good location near public transportation”
Reviews.Author: sunewlsu
Reviews.Content: The room is small but comfortable and well furnished. My room had a large walk in closet and two luggage racks so there was no need to stumble over suitcases even though the room is small. No air-conditioning so my husband attempted to sleep with the window open the first night. Powell St. is very noisy all night long. We learned to open the window early to cool the room and then use the ceiling fan for comfort with the window closed to sleep. No problem with noise that way. Pay the extra $10 per day for the food and drink credit and you will receive a card with $25 per day to spend in the hotel restaurant and bar, Luques. Breakfast is excellent and better than Sears restaurant next door which is famous for their breakfast. Also, you won't have to stand in line to get in. We will stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms Average but Great Value and Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: evenstar944
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Chancellor for 3 nights and overall had a very good stay. We requested a quiet room and were put on the 14th floor in the front of the building. The room was quite small but cozy. The bed was queen sized and for the most part comfortable. My husband did not sleep as well as I did, but he is picky when it comes to beds so I can't fault the hotel. Thankfully the room had a ceiling fan because the room did get a little warm. We slept with one window open and the ceiling fan on which worked well at night. They also offer additional fans if needed. Even though we were on one of the highest floors we could hear traffic noise and trolleys (drawback of being in the middle of Union Square) and although this did not interfere with our sleep it might be a problem for light sleepers. I would recommend for those who need absolute peace and quiet to request a room on the back side of the hotel.The room was tastefully furnished with a decent sized flat screen TV, a small desk, small coffee table with chairs and two night stands. The bathroom although small was adequate. I did feel that it could have used a bit more counter space. There was plenty of hot water with good water pressure. The following is just a minor issue but my husband usually uses the body wash and shampoo supplied by the hotel rather than packing his however we both found that the body wash supplied had an very unpleasant scent so he wound up using mine. We were happy to see that there was a safe supplied in the large closet. They did have an iron and ironing board however my husband found that the iron was a bit old and did not work very well. Although breakfast is not included there is a restaurant in the hotel where we would have breakfast for reasonable prices. The hotel can't be more conveniently located. We come from New York City and I am positive that for the price, location and condition of the room and hotel that it is a great bargain! The location of the Chancellor in SF would be equivalent to being around Herald Square or Times Square in NYC however, in NYC one would never be able to find a hotel that is as clean and comfortable for the price and location without it being a roach motel. So although the rooms are average, the price and location make the Chancellor a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Courteous responsive housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: cbthomp
Reviews.Content: My wife and I failed to empty a drawer when we checked out....called housekeeping. They had the items. They were mailed, priority mail and we had the items in three days. This was an incredible response, given that service employees now days often don't seem to care. Rooms are a bit small but Chancellor is a tremendous value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Friendly Staff and a clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PEH12
Reviews.Content: We based ourselves in San Francisco over our 2 week trip and used this hotel as our base to travel to other locations. Over a 2 week period we checked in (and out 4 times) staying for 2 x 3 nights and 2 x 1 night periods, so got a chance to sample 4 different rooms, check in staff etc. On each occasion we could not fault the staff. As we were flying domestically (and we're from the UK) the Hotel also stored our main luggage for us so we could pack carry on bags for the internal flights (Thus saving us around $120 we would have paid by checking luggage into the hold). We asked for the quieter rooms at the back and we were given these on all 4 occasions. There is very little difference between the rooms. The rooms are a good size and include a desk and chair and also 2 other chairs and a table so not as small as you would imagine reading some other reviews! The bathroom is small but is actually bigger than our one at home so no complaints there! The bathrooms were clean and practical with hot and cold running water and a powerfull flushing toilet. The shower is over the bath and is perfectly functional and does what it should do!! We arrived on a Thursday when it was a hot day (25C - double it and add 30 for F !!) and found the room overnight to not be unbearably hot with the windows open and the ceiling fan on we had a good nights sleep! Jetlag was our biggest problem sleeping - but can't blame the hotel for that can I? We had breakfast quite a few times in the hotel and weren't disappointed. We also had "Bar" food in the evenings during happy hour and again the food was very good! All in all we thoroughly recommend this hotel, I was going to mark it down 1 star as I wanted to see Wes the General manager (Love his replies to other reviews) but luckily saw him walk past me in the lobby on our last day - he didn't notice me but great to put a face to the comments!! This hotel is bordering on a 4 star, in fact I would give it 3.75 rating if there was such a thing, if you are looking for a high standard, clean, execellent location and value for money hotel then this is the place for you, and its a breath of fresh air from the sterile chain hotels. Thanks to all the staff but especially Rory and Alicia who made us feel very welcome and can you let me know who wins the "Pumpkin" competition and which numbers tally up with which staff member - we voted for 1 and 5.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at the Chancellor”
Reviews.Author: nebraskamom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Chancellor in September for 5 nights, and I can't say enough good things about the hotel! We loved everything about it! We had a room on the 15th floor facing Union Square, so the view was spectacular. The room itself, though somewhat small, felt spacious because of the high ceilings, and was decorated very tastefully. We loved the flat screen TV! The bathroom was spotlessly clean, and I loved how bright it was. I've been in hotels where the bathroom lighting is so dim you can't see to put your makeup on, but not here! Everyone working here was cheerful and pleasant, and went out of their way to be helpful. And of course, the best part of the Chancellor - the wonderful location! Definitely the best location in the city! Would I stay here again? Without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is ok, great location"”
Reviews.Author: CositaBerlin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near Union Square in San Francisco. It has the charm of the good old days and is a bit shabby and worn out. Everything is a bit small, even tiny. The room itself has been small but ok, the bathroom was way too small. One is not able to turn when the door is open. The bathtub was tatty, not to speak of the shower curtain. The room had a closet were we could store our luggage. We did ask for a quiet room which we got according to the receptionist. It was not quiet at all since our room was facing the air conditioning unit for the whole house. The staff itself has been obliging. The only and absolute plus of the hotel is its location. You couldn't be nearer downtown San Francisco

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could want”
Reviews.Author: TedSManchester
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on the basis of the many excellent reviews on here and the very human management responses to any negative reviews. We stayed for 3 nights in September 2010 and it met all our expectations and more. Very helpful staff, great location, very central. Cofee, fruit, cookies and lemonade in Reception. Some one earlier described the reception/lobby as a living room and that is quite accurate. Yes the rooms are on the small side especially for our North American cousins who seem to prefer to sleep in more spacious rooms but ithas verything you need and represents great value. ( Go stay in the Westin if you want to sleep in a football pitch ) Very nice breakfasts at reasonable prices in Luque's , the house restaurant. We would definitely return and recommend to others. Loved the pillow menu.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Salpi82
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chancellor in San Francisco mid October this year. On arrival, the front desk staff member who checked us in (Rory) was so helpful. He gave us tips on what to do, where to see and eat at (all excellent recommendations). We were also very pleased with the other front desk staff who were lovely and very helpful. Although the rooms are quite small, they were clean. The all day, complimentary tea/ coffee and cookies were also a treat! The location was excellent with great food options close by, and the tram literally just outside the front door. Overall, a good experience!

Reviews.Title: “Lobby is like your living room on Union Square”
Reviews.Author: TuckerCA
Reviews.Content: Booked one night at the Chancellor after reading all the positive reviews and walking past it (to get to Sears for breakfast) for years. A good choice - it was clean, it was pretty modern in terms of amenities, the shower was hot & strong, the bed was comfy, and the cable worked. Loved the free wifi option. Rec'd a nice 2 for 1 voucher to the lobby bar with check in, so I had to give that a try - and it was during my second glass of merlot that I realized the lobby was just like a living room. The bartender knew many of the guests and asked how their day went. The reception area offered cookies & fruit, and the comfy sofas offered a good view of the eclectic SF pedestrians. It's right off of Union Square and the shopping opportunities abound. Loads of decent restaurants within walking distance. A bit of a hike to/from BART, but since it was the only exercise I got during this last business trip, it was fine. (I may not have been as pleased if it was raining!) I think I'll stay here again on my next trip...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tinamenashe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came from Israel for a 3 day stay in San Francisco before a wedding. The hotel is clean, the staff is excellent-helpful with every detail needed. There is free coffee, cookies and apples 24/7-just a small friendly part of the general friendly hospitality. The location is perfect- we really loved this hotel and the price was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Cosy Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AjayP
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed here for 4 nights at the end of september for our 10 year wedding anniversary. We were on a road trip down to LA via the big sur and needed a good start in San Francisco to set us on our way. Booked with trailfinders and were very pleased with the hotel choice. Good service all round, checking in was a breeze , lovely room with a view of Union square , comfortable bed , small yet adequate bathroom. Shower was powerful and considering that it was very warm during our stay the lack of air con was not a problem as the fan above the bed was nice and cooling. Loved the free tea and cookies in reception. Didnt have breakfast in the hotel as sears is next door and heard that they cooked a lovely pancake sandwich so ate there every morning and i wasnt disappointed. Quite a few places to eat nearby in the evening. if you get up early you can get onto the trams before they get busy . Wait at the stop up the road opposite outside starbucks. All in all a fantastic start to our holiday and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small but friendly and a great location”
Reviews.Author: rosiepDorset
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights at the end of our holiday, having chosen the Chancellor because of the favourable reviews and got a great deal through Expedia. We were not disappointed. The staff were very friendly and extremely helpful (thinking to direct us to the local Alamo garage to return our car saved us at least a couple of hours getting to and from the Airport). Our room was on the second floor and was a bit small with no view but we were expecting the size from other comments. It was still extremely comfortable, and had a very useful walk-in closet where we could store our luggage. The location is fabulous, we have stayed in San Francisco before and Union Square is just the best base to explore the city! We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “End of the line”
Reviews.Author: Rex1702
Reviews.Content: Having taken a long leisurely road trip from LA to San Francisco via Death Valley, Yosemite, Big Sur and the like, a few days in San Francisco staying at the Chancellor was the perfect end to a wonderful holiday. Everything about the hotel was excellent, the only downside was having to catch an early morning flight back home, but even at 6am the coffee and cookies in reception helped no end.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: vinzdagama
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel in a fabulous location in SFO. Bang next to the Union Square, this is a great place for a short stay in the city. Great kick off point for sightseeing as well as for some nice eating options. Rooms are unfortunately a tad too small but then you would just sleep over during a short stay. Breakfast at the hotel restauarant has some good options including some great Omlettes. A fabulous all American diner is also close by. Do plan for a 40 min ride to and from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: blueglenn1954
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights on our honeymoon. It was east to find only being a few blocks up from Powell Street BART station. First impressions were of a 1st class clean, well managed hotel. Check in was simple and the receptionist made us feel welcome , and gave us directions to our room, she offered us the services of a bellboy but we did not need him, nothing was forced on us. When we entered the room we were immediately impresseed with the clenliness and quality of the fixtures, decor and bed, they even left us a bottle of wine ! We were on the 12th floor and really enjoyed the views over Union Square, especially at night when all the lights were on. The street below can be noisy but the window effectively shut out that noise so we got a good nights sleep. If we return to San Francisco we would certainly stay here again, we would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous location, excellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: janiem_10
Reviews.Content: My parents celebrated their 40th Wedding anniversary recently and went on a holiday to San Francisco. They stayed in The Chancellor Hotel on Union Square and can't speak highly enough of it!! They were upgraded to the penthouse suite, which they absolutely loved! They said the location was fab, very central, and the staff were excellent - very efficient and friendly. Would highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “The best!”
Reviews.Author: Benjii
Reviews.Content: Not allot to add that hasnâ€™t already been said on the Chancellor that hasnâ€™t already been said before. We stayed at the Chancellor first back in 2008 in a suite (complementary upgrade) so when we were coming back at the end of September we looked again but the rates were a little over budget as we were spending a total of 3 weeks touring California. The General Manager offered me the same rate I could get a much lower rated hotel so of course I took his hand off! And that about sums the Chancellor up really, theyâ€™ll bend over backwards for their patrons. Itâ€™s obviously not just for return customers either as the first time we were given the suite after we couldnâ€™t get a standard room with a requested â€˜good viewâ€™. This time around we got room 1500 on the top floor, a standard room with a killer view of Union Square. I was glad to get a standard room as Iâ€™m aware most of the Chancellors negative reviews relate to small rooms? By European standards Iâ€™d say it was above average in size, loved the dÃ©cor and the bed was really comfortable. We arrived to the surprise of a bottle of wine and a gift in the form of a photo frame-nice touch. Can safely say that the weather was unseasonably warm when we arrived (three figures at times) and we never felt hot despite the lack of air conditioning. I did want to try and meet Wes on this visit and commend him on the good work he and his team do but unfortunately never got the opportunity. But Iâ€™m sure heâ€™ll read this as he seems to have his finger on the pulse of his customers. Having stayed in a standard room the Chancellor is probably my favourite hotel in the world, it was like coming home on our return, Iâ€™ve stayed in bigger and fancier hotels but itâ€™s the customer service, and little touches that really set them apart from the crowd-oh and of course the location isnâ€™t too bad either!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: craigmmorq4
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Chancellor Hotel for 2 nights. Got a good deal through Expedia. Check in was easy and I had requested a high room facing the action and I got my request. Rooms are modern but VERY VERY small. Nice decor and clean. One big problem is that there is no air conditioning in the hotel and when we were in San Francisco it was very hot - we couldn't really sleep on a night the room was that hot. We asked for a fan twice and eventually we got it - but that didn't help. The hotel is in a great location but it's very noisy in the morning so no good if your a light sleeper. The free coffee, tea, cookies & apples are great and the breakfast is really nice (Orange juice is so good - would love to know what kind they use!)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - fabulous location!!”
Reviews.Author: Toni1012
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a terrific location - right on Powell Street at Union Square. The cable car runs straight past the door. The rooms are small but perfectly functional and have everything you need. They're clean, and have great pillows!! The staff are more than happy to help with anything you may require.

Reviews.Title: “I Can't Find Anything To Moan About!”
Reviews.Author: Stabler12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chancellor for 9 nights on our trip to San Francisco, and had a great stay there. The Chancellor doesn't blow you away with anything amazing, but there is absolutely nothing here that is sub standard. The staff are wonderful and extremely helpful, the rooms (if a bit small) are nicely fitted out, and the beds are REALLY comfortable. There is a friendly bar that serves anything you want, and cookies and apples are left out for the guests to take when they want. My one moan was going to be no gym, but on arrival I found that all Chancellor guests have use of a very good gym one block away. A lovely stay in a perfectly situated hotel. I would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: joshaurora
Reviews.Content: I stayed five nights in September as part of attending Oracle Openworld 2010. As such, I was interested in a hotel that was close to SOMA. My room was on the third floor and was very nice. The room was more than large enough for my needs. What I liked: by far, the walk in closet was really, really helpful; the bathroom had cotton swabs--nice touch; the room was so quiet that I never heard anyone else except once, quite amazing; service was great--I got exactly what I asked for, usually quite quickly; real bathtub; variety and number of pillows; very friendly hotel staff; free coffee in the mornings was quite tasty; the fitness club was great!; ventilation was good, even on hot (80's F) days; What could have been better: shower pressure was too low (probably Californian regs); no ethernet connection in room; I got the hotel through the Oracle convention and the rate was pretty good relatively. While I would not personally pay the going rate, I would recommend the hotel unreservedly.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: continuitygirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and had a wonderful time, the staff could not be more helpful and really made my stay there. The location right on Union Sq is perfect as it's very close to the shops and restaurants and has great transport links. My room was on 13th floor and was lovely, I've seen complaints on here about the room size, but I do not know why the room was the perfect size and the bathroom was lovely and not too small either. This hotel is fabulous and I would stay here again / recommend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: VancouverBertle
Reviews.Content: As you guessed, primo location! Everything about this hotel was perfect for a typical San Fran boutique hotel. The ONLY issue you may have is the very, very small rooms. Maybe 12 X12 with a bathroom that you must enter in the direction you wish to face because turning around might be ifffy......BUT none if this posed a problem for my daughter and I. Rooms very cozy and nicely decorated. Comfy beds. Staff very, very pleasant. We were out and about most of the day so room size didn't bother us. I felt the regular prize ($200 per night) was steep for such a small room but watch for deals on Expedia, we got for $125 and my sister leaves next week and got it for $99. San Fran is amazing...just go with the location (there are areas like the Tenderloin that you definately DO NOT want to be in). The small room size is a good exchange for price and location

Reviews.Title: “Customer service is excellent; perfect location”
Reviews.Author: zztip
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival the reception staff were excellent and helpful. They ensured we were well looked after. Susan, at the gift shop/kiosk, was also helpful and very friendly. We had a room that was on the 8th floor, quiet enough from the street noise, when the window was closed. No a/c but good ceiling fan in room. Found the beds very comfortable. In the lobby there was always coffee/tea, great fresh cookies and apples. For an older hotel, it was kept in wonderful condition. Price was very reasonable as well.

Reviews.Title: “2 star hotel with some nice 3 star amenities”
Reviews.Author: flash54
Reviews.Content: This is a nice comfortable hotel with a very reasonable price in an excellent location. The lobby staff was friendly and helpful, and it only took a few minutes to check in and out. There are two elevators and they are fast enough that I rarely had to wait long for one. The room was a good size for the price, but be warned that they only have rooms with one queen bed or two singles. I had one with two beds and I don't mind a single. The photos I saw here on Trip Advisor are accurate. Decor is nice, but in my room paint was chipped in a few places and in the bathroom a white coating had started to peel off in places, revealing the original green tile beneath. Try to get a room away from the Powell Street side - the view is nice, but the street noise can be a bit annoying. Fortunately, it quiets down after midnight. As for amenities, this had a few that are usually reserved to more expensive hotels. For instance, there were often cookies and apples in the lobby. There is a pillow menu (that I wished I tried) with lots of choices if you don't like the supplied pillows. There is a nice big umbrella in the closet. A well-equipped fitness facility around the block and across Mason Street is free to hotel guests. I wish it was actually in the hotel - but hey, this is not the Westin. If you like to swim laps for your exercise, the fitness center even has a nice indoor lap pool - wish I'd brought a swimsuit. I had breakfast in the hotel restaurant a few times, and that is very good. Try the homemade corned beef hash. All in all, an enjoyable stay. I have been coming to San Francisco for the past few Autumns, and next year, I think I'll stay in the Chancellor again.

Reviews.Title: “great location, clean with very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Andrea G
Reviews.Content: An old fashion hotel but rooms are large and exceptionally clean especially the bedding and I like the variety of pillows, Love the tea/coffee, home cooked cookies and apples available free of charge in reception. Staff are really friendly and you are in the middle of all the attractions if you are reasonalbly fit/healthy you can walk to many of the main sight seeing venues over the northeast side of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: DaFairy
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed in the Chancellor Hotel in January 2010 for 4nights, we were doing the California coast for 3weeks. This hotel was everything we wanted and more. Value for money, comfort, location location location, the staff were so so helpful. The beds were the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in EVER! There was a range of pillows to choose from, never even heard of such a thing! The Hotel is right beside the Chinese quarter, right across the streets from all the main shops Sacks, Macys, more more more. There was a lady in the lobby each day who can help you with sight seeing trip and more. I made a blunder while booking our day trip to Alcatraz, before I went out to San Fransisco, we were very disappointed but she managed to get us into a slot for one of the days, we were so thankful as we would never have got to see it, its a must see. She was so helpful, and gave us great advice on what to see & what not to see. The bar is small but fun, we met some other travellers there and had great fun. The main enterance is not great, could do with a re-furb but the room was so cosy clean and very well decorated. There was complementary coffee/tea and cake in the afternoon. The breakfast was excellent but at an additional charge, but seeing that we paid â‚¬35 per person per night in a city center location we were not complaining. There was a Irish guy at Reception who was really friendly, Rory is his name. Great help. Overall, for comfort, location and price this hotel is a must to stay in San Fransisco. You only sleep there and the beds if we could would have taken them with us... they were so cosy. Many thanks to all the staff there for making our stay so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a city break - super comfy room - great location”
Reviews.Author: LondonTravellerVW
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for a city break when you want a little more comfort and luxury during your stay. Our room was spacious with a separate closet where we could store all our luggage. The bed and pillows (you really do get to choose from a fancy selection of posh pillows) were super comfy and the location was great for exploring the city - just off Union Square. Also close to lots of restaurants. The bathroom is pretty basic (not as nice as the room itself) but it has everything you need and was very clean. The brief interactions we did have with staff were a little odd but they didn't disturb us and when we requested the pillows for example, they delivered them quickly. The only aspect of the room I didn't like was the proximity to the air conditioning/ kitchen unit down below. Our room was on the back so we didn't get any street noise but the humming from the machines did initially disappoint me - I was looking forward to a returning to a peaceful room after a day out in SFS. I have to admit after the first day, I didn't notice the sound any more and I am sensitive to noise. They also supplied us with a white noise machine. This made lovely rain sounds which meant I could fall asleep without any worries. I do think they should include a breakfast in the price but for convenience sake, there is a paid restaurant downstairs in the hotel lobby. I wouldn't recommend this unless you just want a quick refuel. It's a depressing place to start your day. For a tasty breakfast you can head just next door to Sear's fine foods which has a great atmosphere and much much yummier food. I have rated this hotel average because there was no good option and 'very good' was a little too generous.

Reviews.Title: “A slam dunk great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: rbet
Reviews.Content: As an ex-travel agent, I've stayed in many hotels. The Chancellor ranks right up there for value. Only people impossible to please would be dissatisfied!! Great location, nice rooms, great service! We had previously stayed down at the Wharf, but strongly preferred this location instead.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the centre of things”
Reviews.Author: che777
Reviews.Content: Great location by Union Square and all the attractions of the City centre, Chancellor has a period charm to it and is a great choice for tourists with cable cars running right by the front door. Rooms small but adequate, lifts slow but that fits the ambiance. Staff very welcoming and very helpful. Would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel. Will be best with some investment !”
Reviews.Author: Clauvadazz
Reviews.Content: As in top 10 of Tripadvisor, we picked this hotel for couple days. I like the room as very comfortable from the pillow to the bed or the bathroom. But not happy with the size, very small. Location i will say it is good but the area is noisy, very noisy actually. It is on the powell street and many many cars, trolleys as well. The staff here were helpful, attentive. But some of the hotel facilities need to be upgraded : for example : the bar and the restaurant. Bottom line, it is a good hotel, need some maintainance in some common areas but the room is good. Will recommend !

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: SorrentoSun
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and have to say a very comfortable experience. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful - our room was spacious and had modern decor. The location is excellent - very central. My only snag was the cost of breakfast in the restaurant - a little expensive I'd say - would have been nice to have had some deal as we were staying there for 5 nights. However would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at The Chancellor for comfort”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryABEil
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to The Chancellor and we enjoyed it as much as the first time. The beds are very comfortable, room cleaniness was perfect. The staff were very very nice and helpful and you are so central. I have to say though that the thing that sets you apart from being a 4 star hotel is NOT having the "kettle" in the rooms...This would make for a perfect stay. We have already recommended this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Happy”
Reviews.Author: ukmaus
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Chancellor last year. Very quirky and reminded me of an English B&B! Very nice family-like atmosphere. Free computers to check emails very useful and free coffee and cookies a nice touch. Good location - the windows were quite old fashioned which meant we could hear the cable car ding all day - we didnt mind this though! The food court down the road in the shopping centre was handy for coffee, cake and quick dinners from bristol farms (like whole foods supermarket)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Crayon755
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Chancellor for 8 nights in Sept. Great hotel for the price, great location. We enjoyed late night meals at the bar as well as breakfasts in the restaurant. A noisy ceiling fan was fixed the same day. We were in #1304 with not much of a view but enough sounds of the city to remind us where we were! Yes rooms and baths are small but with walk-in closets for the luggage and adequate internet access. The room was always clean when we returned. The pillow menu was a nice touch! No A/C so we kept the ceiling fan on and the window open - very comfortable. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: paisleyss
Reviews.Content: The hotel and location was great. Rooms are older, but are very well done with lots of little extra's. Love the pillow choices and bath salts. Only improvement would be the a/c. We were never sure if it worked. We left the windows open, but if it was hot it might have been an issue. We will def. stay here again. Thanks, Laura

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Stay Here Again!”
Reviews.Author: plmille2
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I visited San Francisco for the first time and stayed at the Chancellor Hotel. Upon arriving, the service was excellent and the room was spotless. Don't let the reviews about small rooms ruin your decision about staying here! I have never stayed in a hotel room that felt more like home than this one. Listening to the city sounds at night when our window was open was amazing, and made us really feel like we were part of the city. You could hear the trolley bells below. The noise never bothered us, especially since it stops around 8pm! You can't beat the location either. The hotel has a visitor desk where you can buy transportation passes and other novelties. For those with children, there is a very family friendly restaurant next door that serves breakfast, lunch and dinner all day-- and it has good food! With just a quick minute walk to the trolley/bus stops, the Chancellor will definitely have our business again when we visit the beautiful city next year!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: LittleG82
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chancellor Hotel at the end of a 3 week honeymoon in California. We had stayed at nicer hotels on our trip but the Chancellor hotel definitely had many advantages over other hotels in San Francisco. Advantages: - Excellent location in Union Square, easy access to other areas of San Francisco. - Bar on site - variety of nearby bars and restaurants - Friendly staff - clean -Complimentary tea, coffee and cookies - Free Wi fi in the rooms Disadvantages - No air con, the rooms got quite warm and the busy road outside meant that it was noisy at night time with the window open. - No complimentary breakfast - Bedsheets had the name of the hotel scrawled on in pen, this wouldn't have bothered me if it wasn't made with it visible at the top of the bed! I think that house keeping could perhaps take a bit more time to ensure this wasn't visible. - Small rooms

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location - loved SF!”
Reviews.Author: Anderida
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel as our first base in SF to San Diego road trip. Booked thru Trailfinders and our main contact Ryan could not have been more helpful. Everybody at Trailfinders was knowledgeable and helpful and would highly recommend! Ryan came up with draft itinerary and we tweaked the hotels using TripAdvisor and we were not really disappointed. All recent reviews for the Chancellor are about right! Perfect location - hotel not luxurious - in fact a little tired - but staff were friendly and we are very comfortable. We asked for a quiet room - we are very light sleepers. Room initally allocated was on the 2nd floor at the rear but dark and quite noisy due to aircon units on neighbouring buildings. Were moved to a much lighter room on 9th floor by very helpful and understanding receptionist. Still some aircon noise but would be fine for most "normal" sleepers! Would consider hotel nexttime and would recommend. We didn't eat at the hotel but ate for 3 nights in Scala's just across the road which was excellent (do book first if pos)! NB booked car thru Alamo via Trailfinders for our departure day - they are very handily located for Union Sq (there are other hire firms nearby) and despite the perceived nightmare of driving in central SF it was very simple to get out of town heading south (towards Monterey) using their directions and satnav/GPS which would highly recommend (about Â£20). Car (auto VW Jetta) was reliable and easy to drive.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with the great location at the reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: IlgasPlaukas
Reviews.Content: Rooms are pretty small, however clean and have everything you might need. Service is outstanding, great location. Bar needs to be updated badly, but with all the restaurants and bars around it's not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and City”
Reviews.Author: txangel60
Reviews.Content: I loved San Francisco and the Chancellor Hotel. I would stay here again. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean but small (which didn't matter we were hardly in the room). The trolly ran in front of the hotel and the bus was just a few blocks away. Be sure and get a bus pass, it pays for itself quickly. You can purchase it right in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Sunworshiper54
Reviews.Content: We chose the Chancellor Hotel as it had good reviews with a good central locaton and weren't disappointed. Although it was right on Powell Street and a bit noisy at times due to the trolleycars etc. we found the room very nice and the beds and pillows very comfortable. The room and bathroom were kept very clean and the rubber ducky in the bathroom was a cute touch. We found the staff very friendly and helpful especially Susan at the tourist desk.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Blondie1348
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here in August and had a lovely time. The hotel is in a great location right near Union Square. The room itself was nice, with comfy beds. The only thing i would say needs updating is the communal areas as they are a little tired, but definitely nothing to put me off staying. The concierges were very helpful and the complimentary cookies were yummy! The hotel was very reasonable in comparison to others and would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cookiecherub
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 2010, great location in Union Square. Really comfy hotel, clean and friendly too.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for budget business trip”
Reviews.Author: Tarpon_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Old fashioned altough super well located (union square), afordable rates for a budget constraint trip and a great staff that is super available to help you out. Rooms are clean, decent size. I would recommedn if you are travelling on a business trip that those not requires you to bring a client for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable and friendly stay”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_MumSydney
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at teh Chancellor. It has a great position near Union Square, it feels very safe area. The staff were very helpful and friendly, the room was clean and quite spacious. The hotel does not have AC but you can open in the windows and SF does not get too hot. There were several personal items such as lollies in the room, lemon juice in the foyer and a small library of books on the 1st floor. The free internet and the use of the computer in the lobby were much appreciated. Enjoyable stay

Reviews.Title: “Just as good as I remembered! Kudos again!”
Reviews.Author: Parrotthead
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chancellor during the first week of September for four nights. I had stayed there three years ago and had a superb experience. My second stay was just as exceptional. This little gem of a hotel runs like a well-oiled machine. Every staff person we encountered was lovely, efficient, friendly and well-mannered. We stayed in Room 1203. I had asked for a high floor room facing Union Square which was acommodated. After the first night, I mentioned to Rory at the front desk that the bed was not quite as comfortable as I had remembered it being during my previous stay (in a different room). We returned to the hotel late that afternoon to find that a foam topper of some sort had been placed on the mattress. Problem solved! The valet parking was easy and convenient and well worth the cost. $29 I believe. Allow 30 mins. for your car to be brought around. Well worth the value and convenience, since SF is a terrible parking city. The cleanliness of the room was exceptional each day. I can't say enough about this. The linens and douvet are very nice and the pillows are extremely comfortable. I cannot say enough about what an outstanding hotel the Chancellor is. As evidence of this, check out the piece in today's (9/9/10) NYT, the Chancellor and Wes Tyler, the GM are featured, in a piece about bed bugs. You will see how seriously he takes the management of his hotel. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: onedogcity07
Reviews.Content: My college aged daughter & I stayed here in Aug. We LOVED the location - a few min. to Market St, w/in 10 min. walking to Chinatown & a 20 min. leisurely walk to The Ferry Building (for your foodies). LOTS of shopping & restaurants in Union Sq. As everyone mentions the room is small but it reminded us of the boutique hotels we've stayed at abroad. We took the advice of others & asked for a quiet room in the back; it was quiet enough that we slept w/ the window open. The front desk staff was consistently friendly & informative. As we had arrived at midnight, we chose valet parking. For valet parking, you leave your car at the front entrance & give the car keys to the front desk. Of the 4 nights we stayed, there was only 1 night where we had to wait 1/2 block away in order to leave our car in the front due to many other people checking in. Also as the cable cars travel right in front of the hotel, you need to be aware of them. At the midnight check-in I reminded them that I had requested a mini-fridge; their service person was just leaving the room as we got there. Oh, the wireless is also slow. We will definitely stay here again on our next trip. We didn't eat bkfast in the hotel but did enjoy the Swedish pancakes next door at the Sears Fine Foods; we shared the plate.

Reviews.Title: “Not amazing, but good all together.”
Reviews.Author: BrittanyS3
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for large rooms and extravagant rooms, then this isn't the place for you. It was an older building, but nicely furnished. It's a little more on the expensive side, because it's located in the midst of union square. A wonderful location for those looking to take buses, cable cars, and taxis. They have a nice restaurant too.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Chancellor”
Reviews.Author: gmhaggis
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth stay at the Chancellor over the past 5 years. Still doesn't disappoint. No problems with a late, after midnight, check-in. Room not huge, but more that adequate. Same with bathroom. Maid service excellent, with room and bathroom always kept clean. This is not a modern chain hotel with all mod cons. More of a boutique style hotel - a bit old fashioned, but clean, comfy with a homely feel. Some welcome bonuses included the Macy's discount card, hotel bar 2for1 drinks voucher and the free wi-fi available throughout the hotel. In addition are the free coffee and cookies available around the clock in the lobby area. Considering this hotel is in the middle of down town, right on Union Square, room rates are more that reasonable. Note that this hotel does not have in room AC. This did not turn out to be a problem. There is a multi speed fan hanging from the ceiling, and the windows can be opened. My only suggestion for improvement would be the addition of an in-room fridge and tea/coffee making facilities. Would definitely recommend this hotel and this would still be my first choice on any future visit to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in SF!”
Reviews.Author: Stulf
Reviews.Content: It is right at Union Square, within walking distance to Market place (Bart, Tram, bus).Many restaurants, shops, etc around. Cable car in front of the hotel, but our room was quiet. Nice and clean rooms, very nice and helpful staff. I can only recommend the hotel, if you want to stay in downtown SF!

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensice and exceeds expectations”
Reviews.Author: hopoidos
Reviews.Content: Of the thre SF hotels I stayed in on this trip The Chancellor was the cheapest and, by some way, the best. The location cannot be bettered for being at the heart of the city; cable car, buses and downtown city life on the doorstep - indeed right outside the fire escape balcony view I had. Of course it's therefore noisy and in a heatwave the room was warm - efficient ceiling fan but no a/c. But city centres are noisy and heatwaves unusual. In the room, wi-fi and local calls free. Small and welcome seating area; solid furnishings; excellent bed and pillows; large LCD TV; ; small free extras a plenty inc. coupons (2 for 1 drinks for example); small services kiosk in lobby. Didn't eat there but Lori's Diner across the road is cheap and simple. The service was warm and there was a cheerful atmosphere and bags of personality about the place, which is independently owned. I was only sorry I didn't spend more than two nights at this excellent hotel as its location and value of money cannot be matched if on a vacation break in SF.As has been noted, it's just 5 mins walk up from the Powell St BART - ideal and economical for SFO and other poiints around the Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms, very clean, great value!”
Reviews.Author: mizzles
Reviews.Content: Here you go 1) DON'T FORGET to have a drink right across the street at the Starlight room at Sir Francis Drake Hotel which has a spectacular view of the city. 2) love the always flowing free coffee in the lobby 3) make sure you get your macy's coupon and 2 for 1 lobby drink coupons from front desk 4) rooms are small and not really elegant 5) rooms are clean and smell nice 6) lots of nice little extras here and there (cotton balls, q-tips, umbrella, rubber ducky) 7) couldn't get the AC to work but no prob just opened the windows 8) solid maid service

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: kwong77
Reviews.Content: After spending four nights at the Chancellor, we would definitely recommend the hotel. We arrived at SF, taking the BART train to Powell Street and walked up to the hotel. It's not far at all, but it is uphill...may be after a long flight, travelling with young kids or a lot of luggage I'd probably recommend a taxi or shuttle bus direct to the hotel. It is literally a stones throw away from Union Square, our hotel room overlooked the square. The hotel is smaller than it's neighbours (The Westin is on the next block), but it is a charming hotel. The rooms are adequately sized, modern & clean with complimentary sweet jar topped up every day (quite a cute touch). The hotel provide complimentary tea, coffee & biscuits within the reception area. The staff are very friendly and only too happy to help, even providing us with a route map to our next destination. On check-in the hotel provide a free one-way pass on the Powell Street cable car which passes right outside the hotel, plus discount off breakfast and 2 for 1 beverage (one voucher). We didn't eat at the hotel, as we always prefer to explore the surrounding area...Louries (a novelty American diner just for the experience is on the next block), try the small noodle shops in Chinatown (delicious tasty food for very little money), the Thai cafe off Powell Street, Cheescake Factory above Macy's and for something different try the Supperclub. Most places of interest are nearby or easily accessible by public transport from the hotel. If we return to SF, we would definitely stay at this hotel...it ticks all the boxes for a city break without breaking the bank.

Reviews.Title: “best bed ever”
Reviews.Author: sifab
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close union square, the shopping heart of the city, and in front of Lori's diner (SO fracking good!). Bedroom is confy, nice and clean and the king size bed is just perfect! Never slept better!

Reviews.Title: “another great stay at the Chancellor”
Reviews.Author: Sundae1966
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chancellor for the second time. It is one of the best things about san fran. The rooms are small (as expected as it is an old hotel!!) but well set out and a great feel. The rooms and hotel have character. Our room was on Powell Street and amazingy quiet. We love the bar - met a great barman on the Sunday night and the hotel staff are really friendly. We used the gym around the cornr which was fine. The service was a bit slow at breakfast but nothing to really worry about. A few healthy options non the breakfast menu would be good. The hotel is in a great spot and we love coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Super location and great service”
Reviews.Author: Kippur
Reviews.Content: At the Chancellor you can just step out directly onto great shopping [Macys, Nike Town, Tiffanys etc], great cafes and restaurants and the trams. The metro is also only 10 minutes away. The rooms are compact [as reviewed] but comfortable enough. The reception staff are very welcoming and helpful and there is also a concierge who can arrange tours and travel passes. There is parking for hotel guests a block away which they will direct you to upon arrival. Coffee and tea is available for guests to help themselves to near the bar area.

Reviews.Title: “*FAB Central hotel* Avoid Conceirge*”
Reviews.Author: amybabe1
Reviews.Content: If your are looking for a hotel in the hear of the action- this is the place for you! It is write in the middle of Union Square - so much so I left my partner in thhotel room whilst nipping into H and M, Maceys etc just a minute walk away. Staff on front desk are great and helpful and complimenatry 24 tea and cofee and cookies are great! The food in the restaurnat is amazing with exceptional service. However the concierge was very forceful and made us purchase a 3 day tram pass for $20 each. The problem was we couldnt and didnt use it because it was so so so busy. Over 1 hour queues! The room was clean and comfortable and the pillow menu a real treat! We personally didnt like San Francisco, it was freezing cold 54F in Summer, lot of homeless begging you for money (not nice at night), very busy and waiting times for restaurants, toilets(about 30 min) the tram made it least pleasurable! We have visiited many mancy cities and this sadly at the bottom of the list. We certainly have not left our hearts there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Only one complaint.”
Reviews.Author: howweoperate
Reviews.Content: We had read numerous reviews before booking, so we were aware of the small room size and lack of air conditioning (which did not bother us). The only complaint we had is that the beds were very, very uncomfortable. For this reason (and this reason alone) we would not stay here again. Our experience at the Chancellor Hotel was otherwise quite positive. We were able to check in early. The room decor is nice. The customer service is outstanding. The hotel serves a good breakfast (and you can have it delivered to your room at a specified time for a small charge). The hotel is right on Union Square, and the cable car line. Close to shops and many restaurants, and a ~ 30 minute walk to the Fisherman's Wharf area. Aside from the beds, this is a great find and worth the price you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value and service”
Reviews.Author: Vacationmatt
Reviews.Content: Very reasonable hotel for the money. An older but very comfortable and clean hotel. Very good location on union square - we had a good view out over union square. Breakfast wasnâ€™t included â€“ we bought ours in the hotel restaurant â€“ reasonable choice and price. Free cookies and tea/coffee in reception was a nice touch. Staff were always friendly and helpful. The room was comfortable and had several nice touches like the jar of sweets and the pillow menu where you could choose from several different types of pillow! We wanted to eat at the Italian opposite but it was packed â€“ recommend getting there early or booking ahead. Would recommend a hop on hop off bus tour â€“ we didnâ€™t and ended up walking miles. Also the trams can be tricky to get on, as the chancellor is only a couple of stops from the turnaround the trams were always full when we tried to get on them.

Reviews.Title: “Our second stay here, and we'd come back again”
Reviews.Author: angelaki
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay here, and our first choice when we returned to San Francisco. As before the staff were amazing and the rooms are lovely and clean. We'd requested a quiet room and been given one at the back of the hotel. Unfortunately we then ended up with the same problem we'd had during our last stay - one of the buildings at the back has a powerful extraction system and it makes the whole of one side of the hotel vibrate and hum. As a result we spend the first night awake, although the staff were willing to move us at 3am there were no other rooms available. We were moved to one of the middle rooms that overlooked the Square for the second night and that was a lot more peaceful - traffic noise is easier to ignore than the constant humming is. I do wonder how anyone else puts up with it. As others have said, the location is ideal for visiting Union Square, it's also less than 10 minutes walk to Market Street. The free coffee and cookies are great for a first breakfast (and then you can pop out for a larger one later on in the morning! The best thing is the location and the helpful staff, the worst is that humming in "quiet" rooms.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location on union square with lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: jayne444
Reviews.Content: on union square so good location, use the valet parking if you are driving, parking in san francisco is a nightmare if you dont know the city, front desk very helpfull, rooms small but comfortable, lots of places to eat nearby, the only change I would like would be have coffee in the rooms not just in the lobby but this is a minor gripe, free wi fi was a bonus, we would happily stay there again

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay, right in the centre of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: yogspiers
Reviews.Content: Great service, great location. Highly recommended. You can even choose from about 7 types of pillow!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Daltry
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days while we explored San Francisco. It's in an ideal location for everything and I don't think we couldn't have picked a better hotel in a better location. The room was lovely and very clean, the staff helpful and friendly and it was very convenient to have a restaurant serving breakfast in the hotel. Another bonus was the free wifi in our room. It was pleasure to come back to the hotel each night after a fantastic day looking around San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TravelerfromCO
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for a long weekend to celebrate her birthday. The hotel is very conveniently located and its easy to get every where you want to go in the city from Union Square. I had requested an upper floor room with a great view and the hotel met every request. We were on the 11th floor and had a great view of the city and you could even see the barges out on the water between the buildings which I thought was great. They provided a bottle of wine and box of chocolates for my friends b-day which was a great touch. The staff was exceptionally helpful and nice (front desk, bar staff and concierge). The rooms are exceptionally clean and very quaint with a historic hotel feel and comfy beds. They aren't large but the 2 twin bed room had plenty of room for the 2 of us especially with the huge walk-in closet for your luggage and were very well appointed. The bathroom was very cute and they provided great bath products and of course loved the little ducky which I took home. I would recommend this propety to anyone looking for a great place to stay in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Older Hotel - with a few issues”
Reviews.Author: blueiii
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay right in the heart of San Francisco, but don't want to pay the highest hotel rates, then consider staying at the Chancellor. The cable cars run right outside of the hotel and the staff is friendly and attentive. This makes up for the somewhat worn interior, narrow hallways, and small rooms. They have done a great job of maintaining the building's original character, but the trade-off is a smaller bathroom (which was up a step in my room). The staff however made up for the inefficiencies. When I needed some leftovers reheated for dinner, the bellboy took my food back to the kitchen and returned it to me on a tray complete with linen napkin, silverware, glass of ice water, and a fresh-baked chocolate chip cookie on the side. (The cookie cabinet in the lobby is always full - you gotta love that!) The concierge desk also arranged my transportation back to the airport and was very on-top of the entire process so that I didn't have to worry about making it there on time. For an old grande dame in San Francisco, the Chancellor is holding up well.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: brydie2905
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a superb location. Little frills but the service and room was superb. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: HKWYorkshire
Reviews.Content: We managed to get a really good price for this hotel and so don't know if we would have been so enthusiastic if we had to pay full price. It was in a great location convenient for walking to all the sites in San Francisco. The staff were so friendly and helpful and the room was quiet, spacious, clean and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & room, parking a little tricky”
Reviews.Author: WATrooper
Reviews.Content: Got a last-minute deal, so for the money I paid, the location and room were both great. Room comparable to a standard 3/4 star hotel. Parking was a little bit of a hassle, as there is no on-site parking and we had to park our car in a garage a block away because we took advantage of the discounted parking offered by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and style.”
Reviews.Author: CheInMia
Reviews.Content: Staff was great. the hotel is a good enough size so you see the same staff daily and they remember your faces & greet you with a smile. Had delicious breakfast in the hotel's restaurant every morning. there's a small kiosk that helps you with local excursions, directions, and general recommendations that we found helpful. The hotel was centrally located amongst shopping, public transportation, restaurants, etc. The hotel is very compact though. The elevators, hallways, rooms & bathrooms are all very tight, not much room to pass others -especially with luggage - but it did not bother me a bit as the hotel is clean & decorated in good taste. We only rented a car for 1 day to explore Muir Woods - totally worth it. In a city like SF there is no need for a car otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: royuk_7
Reviews.Content: On a two week fly drive package arranged by Trailfinders Iâ€™ll be reviewing all of the hotels on our vacation in California between SF and LA, so if anyone is interested they can follow the thread. Flying in from London Heathrow we arrived at San Francisco on the Monday afternoon of Labor Day right at the start of September. The weather was lovely and the road from the airport was very quiet, the cabbie said itâ€™s not normally like this! Our first destination was three nights at the Chancellor Hotel, Powell Street, Union Square. Wow! What a lovely hotel in such a fantastic location, just a very short walk to the main Union Square and right on one of the cable car lines. Being from England I donâ€™t fully understand the concept of â€˜blocksâ€™ we donâ€™t use that term, but perhaps half a block to the square? Whatever itâ€™s very close. The people on reception are very helpful and friendly and on our check out day they advised us on the best option for collecting our hire car. The office was only on Oâ€™Farrell but they got us a cab there because of our luggage. Ok our two rooms didnâ€™t have a coffee maker but we always bring our travel kettle and tea bags, so we purchased some milk from a store just a few yards away. And there were flasks of complimentary coffee available on the ground floor near the bar area, with cookies and popcorn also. We had breakfast in Luques on two mornings and loved it there, and the other morning we ate pancakes in Sears which is right next door...delicious! The first evening we didnâ€™t really eat much as it was around 3-4 am in the morning on our UK time, so we felt a bit spaced out. The next night we had takeout pizza and the last night we ate at the Cheesecake factory on top of Macyâ€™s. This had great views over Union Square. All in all we loved this hotel and loved SF, what a fantastic place! On Thursday morning we picked up our hire car, got upgraded to a seven seater Chevy Uplander and started our journey to Yosemite View Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Good location with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Epp79
Reviews.Content: The rooms are a little old fashioned/ quirky but the staff are friendly and helpful and the location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I had booked a hotel nearby”
Reviews.Author: hogwild12
Reviews.Content: There's nothign really bad about the Chancellor to say. I just know know if i would rank it in the top 10 hotels in SF on trip advisor as i've stayed in better hotels just about everywhere. The goods: Location - next door to the famous pancake house and right off Union Square. What i didn't realize until i got there, is there are at least 10 other hotels just off Union Square too. Price - It's cheap compared to other hotels in the area, although i personally wouldn't have mind spendign a few more to stay somewhere else. The bads: The room is very small. The hotel hallways have that "old hotel odor" I would recommend this hotel for travelers that want to stay near Union Square at a bargain, but stay away if you like your nicer hotels with lots of room and extra soft beds.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL BUT STAFF LACK PERSONALITY”
Reviews.Author: BEXY54
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the first week of June and we were provided with a very nice upgrade in room.The hotel is perfect for Union Square,Macys etc.However the service at breakfast time was very poor and slow on numerous occasions(dont have the toast).The staff although efficient were not particulary friendly and the bar is a waste of time .

Reviews.Title: “Great Time At the Chancellor”
Reviews.Author: bjkelley
Reviews.Content: The location is the best - right on the cable car line, across from Union Square, close to BART (short walk). Everyone at the hotel was very pleasant and eager to please. Rooms are very clean, though somewhat small. We had a very pleasant stay and yes, I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best small, affordable, delightful hotel in San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: NandJ2
Reviews.Content: We love staying in small hotels that are centrally located. We had been told that the Chancellor was a great small hotel. We will be telling others the same. It has just about everything a small three star hotel has in Europe and more. The bedding was lovely, the amenities in the bathroom were great and the service was as good as it gets. It also had a save in the closet. We hesitate to praise the hotel too much for fear of not being able to get a reservation when we return.----"A three star hotel with a five star location."------so true!

Reviews.Title: “Another good review for the Chancellor...”
Reviews.Author: tymetraveler222
Reviews.Content: We booked the stay, eat and park package at the Chancellor Hotel. We chose the valet parking option, which is an extra $7 a night. Check-in was quick and easy, and the front desk staff was always friendly. The lobby itself is nice, but I think they need to replace at the least couch! It just looks old and tacky. There is a computer (behind the front desk-off to the side) guests can use, and there is about a 20 minute time limit, if someone else is waiting. There is also another small desk/concierge area, that also sells common items and snacks etc. The parking garage is located nearby, and whenever we wanted our car, it was there in front within 5 minutes. We only got it out twice during our 5 night stay. Location-simply cannot be beat. Right in Union Square, across the street from a small park, and the major shopping venues like Macy's. There is a Walgreen's 2 doors down for any items you may need. Several restaurants within a short distance. Public transport is either right there at the front of the hotel, across the street or down a block or two or three. The hotel is on a slight hill. The restaurant located in the hotel is excellent. Small. Very friendly, professional waitstaff. Very clean. The food was excellent. We were full and didn't need to eat lunch at all. Nice decor. Our room: we were on the 15th floor, which I had requested. It was very quiet, we NEVER heard anyone in the hotel close a door, walk by our room, nothing. The rooms are small. But the huge walk in closet more than makes up for it. We had a queen bed, which was comfortable. The linens are very decent. We asked for and got our extra pillows. They have a menu of like 15 different kinds of pillows. 2 nightstands, each with its own lamp. Alarm clock/radio. One drawer in each nightstand, as well as an open area under. Ceiling fan. Two chairs, and though they are OK, not the kind you are going to stretch out in and be comfortable for any length of time. A table between them with a silver tray with a dish of candy (peppermints, etc.), an ice bucket. Very nice desk with chair. A couple drawers in desk. 3 drawer dresser with TV on top. The closet: LOL. Loved it. Safe and iron/board in here. 2 luggage racks. Plenty of hangars, ask for more if needed. Extra blanket and pillow on top shelf, which extends length of closet. More than enough room to hang all your clothes (bring some of your plastic hangars from home), stash your several pieces of luggage, dirty clothes bag and still move around. I stashed all my shoes on the top of the safe, they were out of the way and off the floor. Umbrella provided. Full length mirror, I think.....! Bathroom: Deep, old cast iron soaking tub with your very own yellow rubber ducky. You can take this home, they want you too. :) Good water pressure, several different types of flow. One sink, large mirror, small shelf. Toilet. Wastpaper basket. Very nice towels. Nice bath products. Hairdryer. Everything worked well-lights, plugs, TV, remote, hairdryer, safe, alarm, locks, water pressure, iron. Like many if not most hotels in SF, this one does not have A/C. It was warm in our room most of the time, though we had the ceiling fan going all the time. We opened the window, which opens a whole 3 inches or so. Now I do not know if you are suppose to, but guessing not, we got the bolt out and were able to open the window all the way. We felt much better with the air blowing in. We also bought a small fan at Walgreen's, though I sleep with a fan on, and it was originally meant for that purpose, but had it going all the time, also. Though we heard all the city noises with the open window, we didn't mind. We closed it when we went to sleep and when we were gone, of course. You can still hear sirens, loud yelling from the street, whistles, and maybe the Cable Car clanging, but it never bothered us and I am a very light sleeper. We loved our view of Macy's and the park. Checkout was just as quick and friendly. The concierge is nice and helpful, though we got some short answers from her. We chose a different tour company than she suggested and she didn't say one word about them. I was left stammering some sentence, I felt like I had to appease her. But I just thanked her and walked away. We took one taxi, and they had it arrive in 5 minutes. We never used the evening bar area. We did get coffee though, and it was OK. They also had hot chocolate if I remember correctly and it was very good. Very happy with our stay, and with the price paid. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent price - there are better properties nearby.”
Reviews.Author: pbansen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chancellor for a night based on good reviews on here. It's a smallish, 15 story hotel at Union Square. Room rate was good - competitive for the smaller, independent hotels in this area of San Francisco. There is terrific food and shopping nearby and the hotel had a package that included off-site parking in the room rate. It is clearly an older property - the rooms and common areas reflect the age of the hotel. Our room was small, but nicely furnished. Good flat screen TV, comfy chairs, even a window that opened a little. Bathroom was very, very small - immaculately clean with nice toiletry products. The king bed was disappointing - two twins put together with one of those 'joiner' strips - boo. You should at least get an excellent quality bed at this price point, but this one was lacking. There are some excellent and recently renovated properties in the same neighborhood that are a lot better value even at a slightly higher price. The Chancellor is definitely not in the top echelon when it comes to delivering excellent value for dollar spent - it's a budget hotel that looks and feels like a budget hotel. There are others that provide much better accommodations for only a little more money.

Reviews.Title: “An incredible trip in an INCREDIBLE HOTEL!!”
Reviews.Author: Marshalynn
Reviews.Content: First let me say that we found the Chancellor at Trip Advisor....thank you!!! When we arrived everyone was very helpful...but the best was seeing the location.....right outside our door was the cablecar!! Across the street was Union Square!! (Doesn't get better...yes it does!!) Two restaurants that we learned about from Trip Advisor...one was next door to the Chancellor and the other was across the street. (I have bad knees, so this was wonderful). The best part of the hotel was....EVERYTHING! The only bad thing....and it really wasn't so bad...the room itself, was lovely...clean big fluffy pillows...great shower.....just a little small. Still, if we were to return to San Fran it would definetely be to the Chancellor Hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay!”
Reviews.Author: glamourprincess
Reviews.Content: We booked Chancellor based on the good reviews on TA. We had a very pleasant stay at the hotel. We were given a room facing the back, and it was very peaceful and quiet. Exactly what we needed after a long journey. The room was on the small side, but was of no big problem to us. The walls are quite thin so we could practically hear the neighbors phone conversations, but fortunately there was low activity around us so we were not that bothered and the bed was very comfortable so we slept well during our stay. It's not the most modern or glamorous hotel in SF, but we had everything we needed and it felt fresh and clean, and it's great value! Loved the free WI-FI! Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Bathtub Ever!”
Reviews.Author: marycorrigan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chancellor for 4 nights and had a great experience. The staff was very friendly and helpful. You can't beat the location, we walked from the BART, and took the trollies and buses the whole trip (I highly recommend getting a MUNI Passport) it allows you to get on and off the buses/trollies at will. We had a delightful room in the front of the hotel, it was a little noisy but we expected this being in the location we were in. The beds are great, the rooms were clean-I can not rave enough about the tub! I am a tub person, I love to soak in the tub and did so every day of my stay. The rubber duckie was a cute touch. Free Wi Fi is nice (sometimes the signal is slow). THe hotel provides free coffee/tea service 24/7 with cookies and apples on the side. Sear's restaurant is right next door for fantastic pancakes(get there early on the weekend they do get a line out front.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Tourist Location”
Reviews.Author: alinjlin
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I plus our 3 adult sons (24-32) spent two days at this Hotel in mid May this year. We were given adjoining rooms on the 12th floor overlooking Powell Street and the famous cable car line. The rooms were well furnished and clean but with no coffee or tea making facilities, these were downstairs in the reception area and meant a bit of a hike if we wanted coffee in the room. The fact that the rooms were adjoining ment we could circulate between them without having to go out in to the hallway though. The Hotel provided a rollaway bed for one of our sons which made their room a bit of a squeeze and we were told that they were phasing them out but it meant not having to pay for a third room for the 5 of us. We found the staff very pleasant and helpful and the reception area had nice settees with a large bowl of fruit and a breakfast bar beyond which we did not use. We had picked up a hire car from the airport and used the multistory car park in Sutter Street which the Hotel has an overnight arrangement with. Be careful though, the car park is a little difficult to find and we heard one couple complain that they had used the wrong park and had been charged the full overnight rate. The proximity to the Powell and Mason Line enabled us to see most of the city very easily using the day pass which I think was about $20. Don't forget to visit the Cable Car Museum which is a real revalation as to how this ingenious system works. San Fransisco is a city worth another visit, as is this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, helpful staff, nice touches, tiny/noisy rooms.”
Reviews.Author: stokes007
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in June 2010. They have no a/c, which is standard in this part of the country, so you sleep with the windows open. It was perfectly comfortable (we didn't see the FIRST insect, it was cool and breezy)...but it was noisy, because we had a room fronting Powell Street, directly off of Union Square. If you stay here, and you certainly should, just ask for a room on the back side of the building, away from the street. Aside from that, our only complaint was the size of the rooms - since its just two of us, and didn't spend a lot of time in the room, it was just fine. The bathrooms are VERY small though - the kind where you almost have to stand in the shower to shut the door, because the toilet is in the way. Again - just fine for us. And we're average sized people. But they're definitely smaller than average (its a historic property). Room was terribly comfortable though - and their pillow menu was really cool. We sampled two, and I may even buy myself a buckwheat pillow now. I slept like a baby. Very comfortable bed as well (including the standard pillows). They had lovely relaxing bath salts along with the standard shampoos, etc. SPECIAL TOUCHES: The front desk staff routinely gave us easy bus directions and great maps to help us out. We also arrived on our anniversary, and the hotel left a bottle of sparkling wine (Napa) and some truffles in our room. The cable cars stop DIRECTLY in front of the hotel, and the F-Tram line is a few blocks down the street. We used the city bus system mostly, and several lines stop within a block or two. Its location on Union Square makes it an easy crossroads for transportation and shopping is great. Several restaurants in the area as well. We didn't eat the hotel restaurant though, so can't include that in the review. Hint - there's a Borders a few doors down, and they have hot breakfast sandwiches and lovely pastries with their Seattle's Best coffee, for much less money than the local restaurants. In sum - ask for a room away from the street (and a high floor perhaps), and if you don't mind a smaller room, this makes a GREAT home base for exploring San Francisco. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Chancellor!”
Reviews.Author: fujido
Reviews.Content: My first trip to the Chancellor was in the early 1960's with college friends. I always remembered the huge deep bath tub and great location and promised myself I'd return some day. It took a long time but my husband and I visited in May 2010. Our room was a bit small, but very clean and elegantly modern. Service is outstanding and friendly and they are responsive to individual needs. My husband walks with a cane and he was told he could park our car in front of the hotel in the loading zone as often and as long as he needed to. The same staff person even recommended a tasty Indian restaurant we both enjoyed when we tired of the (delicious) tourist spots. We loved the Thai prawn salad in the in-house Luques restaurant and had the best martinis in the Luques bar every evening. When we wanted to visit the Japanese Garden in Golden Gate Park in the rain, there was even an umbrella hanging in the closet for us to use. And that bath tub was just as fabulous as I remembered! We will never consider staying anywhere else--you get so much for the money and feel so well taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value.”
Reviews.Author: FalkirkMurph
