Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in this hotel and found it to be very acceptable. It was a fairly small, narrow hotel and the rooms were not that big, but all that you wanted. The rooms had a safe, ironing board / iron, and even had an umbrella supplied. To be honest we couldn't fault the hotel apart from the restaurant not opening in the evenings, but there are plenty adjacent. The tour desk was very helpful in explaining the transport system and what was available.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Sue63_10
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel due to the previous comments and ratings from other travellers. It was the best possible choice for us. The location could not be improved as it is very handy to all facilities, shopping, on/off buses, trams etc. Our room was made available early and we were very, very happy with it. Rooms were well-appointed, bedding was of an excellent quality and beds were very comfortable. Tea/coffee/biscuits were always available in the foyer area. The restaurant was great for breakfast and lunch. Chinatown was just a couple of blocks away and a great variety of other eating placeswere all nearby. Several laundromats were just a few blocks away on Post Street. We would definitely return to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, fabulous people and decor”
Reviews.Author: Janellelizabeth
Reviews.Content: We have been visiting the Chancellor for about 5 years and have always appreciated the retro feel of the building and the location. We were very pleasantly surprised to return and discover that everything we had enjoyed had improved! The decor of our room was lovely and we had a large walk-in closet that gave us much more room than we had anticipated. All the people who worked there from the front desk, to bell-person to housekeeping cheerfully and graciously helped make our stay fabulous. You can't beat the location!

Reviews.Title: “Good base for touring SF”
Reviews.Author: Sophdoph86
Reviews.Content: After arriving on a long flight from the UK we were glad to arrive at the Hotel and be swiftly checked in. Our room was on the 15th floor and had clearly been recently refurbished. The room was small but had everything we needed, good free wi fi and good storage space. The bathroom was very small and needed updating. The shower head is very low! The lobby is small but has a decent little bar, which is reasonably priced. Cookies, apples and tea/coffee are all free and this was a great little extra. We had $25 room credit included in our rate and we used this in the Lucques restaurant for breakfast. The short stack pancakes come highly recommended! Excellent location, easy to use the cable cars and we found that most sights were in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shastabob
Reviews.Content: Very nice early 1900s hotel. Lots of charm. Clean well-appointed room. Comfortable bed. Friendly & helpful staff. Fantastic location -- right on cable-car line in Union Square. Very quiet except for some brief loud clanging sounds in the middle of the night from street below. We were lucky and got upgraded to a two-room suite. We did not use any of the amenities (except the free wi-fi) but there were many. We were on the 14th floor with a pretty nice view. We will stay there again. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: whitetornad0
Reviews.Content: The Chandellor hotel was so wonderful!! The location is fantastic. We used all modes of transportation to and from this hotel. Cable cars, Bart, bus, lightrail...it all worked out great. We asked for ajoining rooms in a quiet location and got just what we asked for. If you are interested in or don't mind twin beds, ask for room 1206 - it's awesome. It is at the end of the hall..very quiet...and has a window in the bathroom that you can open...loved it!! ALL the staff was excellent. Ask for directions, restuarant choices, etc...free coffee in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Location and value”
Reviews.Author: JAG458
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for a conference at the moscone center. It represented one of the better, if not best deals, in the union square area. It made getting to the conference a nice walk and plus there were shuttles to nearby hotels from Moscone if needed for my conference. The room was small (it is a redone old hotel afterall), but it was clean, nicely put together with good amenities (comfy beds, flat screen tv, free wifi). Others mentioned issues with noise from the street, but although we were on the 3rd floor, we were facing the backside, so what we lost in view (we had none of any use) was made up for with quiet. Would definitely recommend for the right price,.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: jenniren
Reviews.Content: I'd e-mailed the hotel about booking airport transfers and they recommended Go Lorries who picked us up promptly as arranged. Always nice to get off to a good start. CHECK IN - smooth and efficient and we were allocated a room on a high floor as requested. Reception staff were very helpful and very happy to offer directions when asked. The only irritation was with the tour booth lady who jumped on us before we could get to the lift and thrust leaflets in my hand trying to sell tours/bus passes etc. I told her we'd take a look, but had already booked a couple of tours online to which she made a face and promptly grabbed them back. Quite amusing really, but it did put us off approaching her again for a couple of days, although I must add that when we did she very efficiently arranged our transfer back to the airport. ROOM - our room was very well furnished, spotlessly clean the whole visit and the jar of sweets was a nice touch. As mentioned in many previous reviews they're not huge, but considering the extremely reasonable cost not really a problem. We were only staying for 4 nights so didn't want to fully unpack and therefore found it quite difficult to fit both cases in, but again a minor problem which we managed to get round. The bathroom was very small and did feel a bit cramped, but again spotlessly clean and for a short stay quite adequate. FOOD - we only ate in the hotel restaurant for breakfast on our third day as we were usually out early for tours. The food was very well cooked and reasonably priced, but the waiter although very efficient wasn't particular friendly - just going through the motions would be the best description. LOCATION - very central with easy access to the cable cars. Particularly good if you like to shop - not really our thing so no reflection on the hotel, but we would probably opt to stay on the Embarcadero if we visit again. OVERALL - we very much appreciated the complimentary coffee and cookies in reception, especially when going off at silly o'clock for the tours. Also the free WiFi in our room. Extras like this lift The Chancellor a notch above most budget hotels. As I've said in previous reviews, it's all about expectations and this hotel more than met ours.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great room, great location”
Reviews.Author: lkreporter
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Chancellor Hotel and it was great. I booked my room with an online service. When my sister and I checked in, they had us in a room with one queen bed. I then asked if there was a room with two twin beds. They told us they didn't, but immediately offered a suite at no extra charge to give us more room. We thought with the extra room we could get a rollaway bed then. When we saw the suite, it was more than perfect. Each room had its own bathroom, television only one had a queen bed and one had a couch and table. They even had their own doors to the hall The rollaway bed fit perfectly in the couch/table room after reaaranging the furniture. It even had a fridge. In the end we wound up with two little mini rooms. No sharing of bathrooms - bonus. The room was clean, quiet, and stylishly decorated. The bathroom amenities were even nice - loved the body lotion in particular. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. The location was perfect for us shoppers as all the stores were withing walking distance. Even the cable car was only a five-minute walk away where it turns around. I would highly recommend this hotel and I actually booked it because others rated this hotel so highly on this site. I was grateful for the reviews. That's why I felt compelled to write a review on the hotel myself.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and quaint!”
Reviews.Author: pinkiebunny
Reviews.Content: Chancellor is a great hotel! We stayed here for 2 nights, and overall the location was centralized and safe for us, just two young ladies traveling alone. It's our first time visiting SF, and getting from the airport to hotel was a breeze with the Lorries shuttle service, as recommended on their hotel website. Room was great, and the bathroom is perfect! Water pressure and temperature was just right, and you know you can't get water pressure right at MOST hotels. Bathroom was small, but the space is wisely used, and the lighting is great for make-up. There is even a rubber duckie welcoming you in the bathroom. Beds are comfy, and you can even choose your own pillow from their 'pillow menu' if those are not up to your standard. There is a closet big enough to haul 2 luggages in there, with room left for walking space or even setting up an ironing board. Location wise : just 1/2 block away from Union Square, and 2 blocks down from Market Street. This makes the location very centralized yet not overly crowded and noisy. Borders is just next door, and 24-hour pharmacy Wal-greens is just round the corner. If you are taking the BART, it will be a slight up-slope walk from the station to the hotel, but a rather leisure one. Cable car stop is just right in front of the hotel, and there is 2 Starbucks nearby! Getting to everywhere was a breeze! The staff are friendly and helpful, and the lady running the gift kiosk (you can get Muni passes from her as well) was also very kind and patient. Would recommend this hotel to anybody visiting SF for the first time.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in the city.”
Reviews.Author: Rudydugan
Reviews.Content: My stay at The Chancellor was outstanding! It is a fantastic old historic building that holds it's charm and character well. Yes, the rooms are smaller. Yes, the floors creaky in spots. Yes, you can occasionally here the folks in the next room. IT IS AN OLD BUILDING! If you want new, shiny, fancy perfection, don't stay here. If you love old buildings and history, this is the perfect spot! The staff was excellent. My bed was excellent, as was the huge tub! I WILL stay here again when in San Francisco! Thank you Chancellor, you made my stay comfortable and complete!

Reviews.Title: “The icing on our holiday cake.”
Reviews.Author: babydinosaur
Reviews.Content: We finished our road trip here and having travelled over 3000 miles this was far and away the best hotel we stayed in. Firstly it transpired that we were going to arrive a day early. We thought about finding somewhere else to shack up for the night before deciding to try our luck at The Chancellor. Not only did they squeeze us in but when we arrived they had managed to juggle things so that we had the same room for our entire stay. We even got a small discount! As we had requested upon booking we were put on a high floor (luckily the top) and had cracking views over Union Square. The room itself although slightly on the small size fitted us and all our rubbish in comfortably. Nice tall ceilings and quality furishings welcomed these weary travellers. Thoughtful little touches such as the personalised rubber duck and the jar of sweets made you feel that the staff genuinely were pushing the boat out to make your stay special. Another plus that we hadn't yet encountered on our trip was the kiosk in the reception where we were able to seek help on all things SF and touristy! All the staff were great and just themselves, rather than being just faceless uniforms. Even the tram goes right past the front door! A faultless stay. If we are fortunate enough to be able to return to SF one day then I hope The Chancellor have a spare room.

Reviews.Title: “It's like coming back to a familar place that you know and love.”
Reviews.Author: marrone1012
Reviews.Content: We love staying at the Chancellor from the friendly staff to the great location it always makes for a perfect get-a-way. It's convenient to get to by car and the garage is close by. You can walk most anywhere in the city within a 3 mile radius. There are tons of great places to eat nearby and if you can't sleep you can always go next door to Borders and get a book. Room 206 is perfect in the back with your windows open and you can walk down to the lobby, plus the oversized tubs and water pressure are amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, historic and chic”
Reviews.Author: TAtripper
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights based on all the TA reviews and can only say that all the positive ones were totally accurate. Not sure if there are negative ones, but probably - I can't imagine it though. My husband and I loved everything about the hotel. Very friendly, accommodating staff, lovely room with a huge tub and we also had an excellent breakfast at the hotel restaurant. The location can't be beat, the room was of ample size, very nicely furnished with an extremely comfortable bed and it was immaculate. You can also use the fitness center down the street (complimentary) during your stay. We got a great price (probably due to the economy) and booked directly on the hotel website. Will stay again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: oceangirl25
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Chancellor, first time in 2006. Choose this hotel again, for its location and comfort of the room.Appreciated the coffee and cookies in the lobby. Was great to be able to buy a Muni pass from the gift shop in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: alwaysathome
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed several nights at the The Chancellor and thoroughly enjoyed the ambiance of an old hotel updated with modern conveniences in a PRIME location with helpful, friendly staff. THE BEDS ARE OUT OF THIS WORLD! The small restaurant was excellent, as well. Ask Mao for his special coke and coffee drink!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: tpaterry
Reviews.Content: We chose the Chancellor based on Trip Advisor reviews and were not disappointed. We loved the location, the European feel of the hotel and the friendliness of the staff. Yes the rooms are small, but that came as no surprise since it has been mentioned more than enough in other reviews. Air conditioning was no factor since we knew in advance there was none. This too was mentioned many times in other reviews. However, it always seems to catch a few by surprise. The staff went out of their way to accomodate our every request. Most notable was houekeeping. We never saw them but the room was kept spotless....that's the way housekeeping should operate. If we had special requests, we left a note in the room and it was immediately taken care of. The coziness of the bar, the friendliness of Alicia the bartender, , the restaurant breakfast crew especially Mao, all added to a great stay. We will visit San Francisco again and will surely stay at the Chancellor Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and neat place to stay for first timers”
Reviews.Author: angelamarie85
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed three nights at the Chancellor for our first trip to San Francisco. We found the boutique hotel to be very clean and charming. We called a couple of months in advance to request a room on a high floor, so we could see down to the street below. We were given a corner room on the 13th floor, and had a really cool neon sign outside of our room (don't request this room if you can't sleep with noise/lights, we could see and hear the cable cars, street traffic, flashing lights, etc. but we don't mind that sort of thing at all.) The room was a bit on the small side, but comfortable enough for the little amount of time we actually spent there. The bed was so comfortable, and they have a pillow menu. That's right. A whole list of specialty pillows to choose from for your stay. I went for the magnetic therapy pillow, but there was also memory foam, body pillows, buckwheat pillows, down, etc. Pretty neat amenity. Our only complaint about our stay at the Chancellor was the pushy woman in the lobby selling Muni passes. A word to the first-time vistor: the Muni pass she's peddling will NOT work on BART or Golden Gate transport. We were told that it would work on "any" bus, train, cable car, etc. Not being from the area, we of course didn't realize Muni was separate of BART or Golden Gate. Also, she delayed us from getting up to our room by pushing herself into the elevator to pretty much attack new guests with her sales pitch, keeping the door held until she was done. That really rubbed me the wrong way, and the hotel should do something about it as a service to its guests.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Conners17
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Chancellor Hotel for 4 nights. Check-in was straightforward and the staff in reception were helpful with directions to nearest carpark. Our room was on the back of the hotel so was quiet. The room was large with two chairs, coffe table, writing desk, drawers, large flat screen TV, iron and ironing board, safe and a walk-in wardrobe. The pillow menu is a nice touch and they are delivered quickly to your room. The bed was massive and very comfortable. Its a small hotel in a fantastic location right on Union Square, surrounded by shops and restaurants, the cable car runs past the front of the hotel on Powell Street. The staff are friendly and efficient. When I told them it was my husband's birthday trip we were surprised with a bottle of complimentary champagne in the room on our return from a day out and the receptionist sang 'happy birthday' when we checked out. I would have no hesitation in recommending this friendly hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Location, Staff”
Reviews.Author: pgad
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel through TripAdvisor recommendations. This hotel is not a national brand name, but across the street from big name and $ hotels. I'm looking out the window at Union Square and can see the Ferry Terminal and Bay in the distance. Cable Car is out the front door. Rooms are well appointed, Wi-Fi, hair dryers, LCD TV's, comfy beds and very clean. Staff is very helpful. Breakfast downstairs was excellent for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service”
Reviews.Author: Zamilah
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, cable car out front and walking distance to most other places. Yes the room is on the small size but the great service, free tea and coffee and homemade cookies in reception makes up for it. I dealt with Kevin Vossen to prepay and amend my booking before arriving and can not speak highly enough of the prompt replies l received.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Keesfriend
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful little hotel with a great location. I chose to stay here because of the location. The bed was very comfortable, and the hotel offers a "pillow menu" which I took advantage of, and improved my sleep considerably. The room had a quaint feel to it. You can see that it has been renovated, but they have retained the original charm. I had a room facing Powell Street, which some people consider noisy. With the sounds of the street cars and people walking at night, it was a little noisy, but with the window closed it was hardly noticeable. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. There is no formal concierge, but Susan in the lobby was extremely helpful regarding tours, shuttles, cabs, etc. The restaurant was very good, with excellent food at a reasonable price. Service was excellent, except for the last two mornings when a new young man was being trained (I don't think he would have lasted). The bar is friendly and has an extended "Happy Hour". The bartender makes a "mean Margharita". Overall I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a central location in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service, Outstanding Value”
Reviews.Author: 08Bandit
Reviews.Content: Service was outstanding. Examples include holding bags before and after checkin/checkout, delivering complimentary refrigerator to room, free coffee/cookies all day, and they allowed us to check in extremely early. Room wasn't huge, but it was big enough for a couple. We were worried about bathrooms based on previous reviews- they were small, but had a nice tub. The bed was extremely comfortable. They have new LCD TVs, but only 20 channels (HBO). Free wi-fi was adequate for web browsing, but don't expect to stream video. Location couldn't have been better. You're right in the heart of Union Square. You can walk out the front door and get on a cable car that takes you to Fisherman's Wharf. There's a major transportation hub about 4 blocks south of the hotel that can get you on a train to SF Giants, Oakland Athletics, Airport, and Stanford University (1 transfer). Definitely no need for a vehicle. You also have the option to travel one block to a pretty nice gym (complimentary). We booked our room as a package with a flight on Priceline.com and got an incredible deal. The employees here genuinely care about the customers. An incredible experience, I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional value, tons of charm, & the perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: neb_1984
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stay at the Chancellor every time we visit San Francisco. The rooms are clean and comfortable, every staff member is very pleasant and helpful and, above all, the value is exceptional. The Chancellor is centrally located on Powell in Union Square, making it easy to hop on a cable car and head up to the wharf and the Golden Gate or down to Market where you can catch the muni and explore the city. It is within walking distance of good food, good shopping , and, conveniently there is a bank of America and Walgreens a few doors down. I love this hotel for it's convenience, value, and charm - I wouldn't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great service & accomodations & convenient to everything.”
Reviews.Author: alwaytraveling
Reviews.Content: Even though the room was small, it was very well decorated and comfortable. We would definitely stay there again. We were traveling with friends and the hotel staff was very tuned in to our needs to have rooms close together. Also, it was great to choose a special pillow.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable, clean hotel in Union Square”
Reviews.Author: 262run
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one night at the Chancellor Hotel on May 27, 2010. He was in San Francisco for a business meeting, and I tagged along because it was our anniversary. I chose this hotel after reading all the reviews here. I got a room rate that included self parking. When we arrived, there were no parking spots out front, so I jumped out and got the parking instructions and we took our car to the 450 Sutter parking lot ourselves (only 1 block away). If there are spots, the valet will take your car, but it was no big deal. We were given room 1405. It was 2nd to the top floor, looking over Union Square and across from Macy's with a little view of the bay towards Oakland. There was a small complimentary bottle of wine and chocolates for our anniversary. A very nice and sweet touch, thank you! The room was on the small side, but enough for a couple. The closet was a walk in closet, very roomy. We left our luggage in there, to give ourselves more room. The bathroom was small, but adequate. The wifi worked well, the bed was very comfortable and the room clean. The window in the room opened completely, and you are looking at the fire escape. There is no air conditioning, but a ceiling fan is present. We left our window open to get the wonderful fresh air. The only drawback to opening the window was that it is quite noisy. Even though the cable car wasn't nearby, you can hear the cables running until they shut down service. Once you close the window, it is quite soundproof. We had breakfast the next morning at the Sear's Find Foods Restaurant which is next door. It was recommended to us for breakfast and the food was good. We didn't realize that the hotel had a restaurant downstairs. There was coffee & tea service in the lobby, and cookies. This is a very reasonable, clean hotel in the heart of Union Square with great access to all of San Francisco. Even though it was only one night, we really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: seaweedsprites
Reviews.Content: We selected a quiet room during the booking process and it was located high up on the rear of the building, far away from the traffic and tram noise at the front. Breakfast via room service was excellent although down in the restaurant, the breakfast service was a bit variable. The bed was amazingly comfortable but the shower head over the bath will be too low for anyone over about 4ft tall ! The location of the hotel is superb.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, good location.”
Reviews.Author: Bearcatgirl08
Reviews.Content: This hotel us right on union square. A great location for sightseeing. One of the trolley lines runs right by the hotel. You are close to great shopping and china town. The rooms are small; probably not great for families. They are clean and the beds are comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: MNHoneymooner
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend over Memorial Day weekend. Check-in was seamless. I had requested for a mini-fridge in our room for the duration of our stay - it wasn't there when we checked in. But I made one call to the front desk and it was brought up within 15 minutes. The rooms looked very true to the website. We had the twin beds and they were very comfortable. I loved that we could open the window, the ceiling fan, and the walk-in closet. We noticed that our door did not automatically shut all the way, so we had to make sure to close it tightly ourselves. It was also difficult to get the bathroom door to shut all the way. We were in room 1400 - we did notice the elevator noise in the morning and I could hear other rooms' toilet flushing. But it wasn't anything that would cause us to change rooms or anything, we only noticed it when we were awake. The location was great. We could see Union Square from our lobby, the cable car stopped right outside the door. We had a really yummy breakfast next door at Sears (try the pecan waffle!). I liked that there was coffee available in the lobby. Susan at the guest services desk was very helpful. She told us about the $13 one-day MUNI passes that we used all day and she booked us on a shuttle to the airport. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: GMCM
Reviews.Content: Nice small hotel. Rooms were very clean with comfortable beds. Great price for a good city location. Concierge, Susan, was definitely on top of things for the guests without being high sell. Restaurant in the hotel was good for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: netoll
Reviews.Content: We chose the Chancellor Hotel for our stay because of the reviews on TripAdvisor. We were not disappointed. From our arrival to departure the staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms are small but well-equipped with everything we needed. (There was even an umbrella in the over-sized closet.) It was my husband's birthday and when we arrived in our room the hotel had a bottle of champagne and a gift in his honor. What a nice surprise! We highly recommend this hotel for your stay in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “worst room ever”
Reviews.Author: trvlrs2
Reviews.Content: very small room was tolerable but bathroom door wouldn't close, view was of fire escape and brick wall and loud plumbing sprayed water when other guests flushed! they finally changed us second night to more acceptable room but still would not recommend as tour agent for hotel spoke broken english and knew very little about area. Desk clerk seemed inconvenienced by our request for another room. They left window to fire escape open with our luggage in room, broke lock on window so anyone could have entered from that floor.

Reviews.Title: “Gross Bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: GlamourSparty
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel for its location, reasonable price and good reviews. Location is excellent definitely. The room itself is ok, the bed looked clean and the furniture was okay. However the bathroom was completely disgusting. The shower curtain was way too long and the bottom 6 inches laid in the tub. It was so dirty that I did everything I could to prevent any part of my body from touching it. Also the sink was cracked and the toilet and floor permanently dirty. It is in desperate need of updates! I personally wouldnâ€™t stay here again, Iâ€™d rather pay a little more and be in a slightly less desirable area than be grossed out while trying to get ready.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Historic building, modern rooms w/GREAT beds!"”
Reviews.Author: Aisagulyan
Reviews.Content: The best part of this hotel was it's location! Right next door is the famous SEARS restaurant, right in front is the famous DRAKE, Rite Aid is conveniently down the street, Union Square is literally 20ft away, trollie stop right outside... you get my drift. Request a high room so you have a nice view of union square. Although the rooms are renovated with new furniture, comfortable bedding and flat screen tv's, you still get a sense of the age and history of the place which for me was nice b/c it was historical but with a clean and modern twist, but not everyone has that kind of outlook. Windows opened outward so you could let the city air and sounds flow right in. Some negatives were the smelly closet and the VERY LOUD flush of the toilet. Also the hallways were somewhat dated and the elevators were EXTREMELY small. If you prefer taking the stairway, be prepared for a cramped almost boatlike curving stairway.

Reviews.Title: “4 star service in a 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: TerriLondon
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor Hotel is situated in a great location near Union Square, the train from the airport takes you to a station about a 10 minute walk away (10 minutes with suitcases as it's up a hill but 5 without!). It's more or less directly opposite Union Square and one of the cable cars stops right outside the hotel which is handy for China Town and getting up all those hills. The rooms were smaller than they look on the promotional material, difficult with two suitcases as there is only a small area to hang clothes up and not anywhere really to put folded clothes. There wasn't a fridge in the room and as I found out with all American hotels there aren't any drinks facilities in the room like tea / coffee. There is a TV in the room. The beds were very good and they pride themselves on being able to choose a multitude of pillows to suit your needs! There can be a bit of noise outside but then again you are on a main street... The reception staff were brilliant, very friendly and knowledgeable, the lady behind the shop / excursions counter is great. By the 3 day travel pass from her, you'd have probably made your money back within a day and a half, you need to use the cable car and trams quite a lot to get around - everyone says San Fran is small but we thought everything was really spaced out plus there are so many hills! You can use the internet for free in the lobby so don't use the one that's available in the room, as you have to pay for that and it's really slow. We tried and then went to reception who told us about the free one and refunded us the charge from the room. We got a reasonable deal on this hotel by booking direct and although you get what you pay for, it's definitely a worthwhile place to stay purely for its location.

Reviews.Title: “The Chancellor goes above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: hoel
Reviews.Content: The rave reviews about this hotel are absolutely true. The location in Union Square can't be beat, and the hotel itself was perfect. We stayed in Helen's Suite on the top floor, which offered a nice living area, two bathrooms, and the bedroom. The bed was super comfortable and offered a great night's sleep. The bathroom products were top of the line and were replinished daily. The general manager Wes and his entire staff go out of their way to make you feel welcome. From the two for one drink coupon at the hotel bar, to the complimentary maps of the city, everything was well thought out. This will be our hotel of choice from now on in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel; very comfortable; excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ChrisP26
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights at the start of our holiday in California. The location of the hotel was excellent - I can't think of a better, more central location as it was right next to Union Square, near to major public transport hubs, and had the Powell Street cable cars running right past the front door. The staff were friendly and helpful. You could buy MUNI transport passes at a tourist desk in the reception area. There was a lift to all floors. The room wasn't huge (as you would expect from a hotel right in the city centre) but was very comfortable and nicely decorated. The room had a two queen beds, a flat-screen TV, free wireless with a decent connection speed, a large closet, and a compact but well kitted bathroom. There were a couple of rather nice more personal touches that set the Chancellor apart from many of the chain hotels I've stayed in. In the bathroom was a rubber duck with a snorkel. And the hotel provided a 'pillow menu', allowing you to choose from a range of extra pillows (real down; buckwheat; memory foam). I know that these are just little touches, but it does show that the hotel makes the effort to just offer that little bit more in terms of customer service and personality.

Reviews.Title: “First rate location...”
Reviews.Author: ROBBINGHOOD
Reviews.Content: Sometimes a hotel can ruin the first impression of a newly-visited city, especially after a long Transatlantic flight. Well, the Chancellor didn't. A comfortable hotel, excellent location and helpful staff created a good feel immediately and it formed the bedrock of a great first time visit to San Francisco. Hotels in downtown San Francisco can be very pricey but, with the breakfast and parking package (we rented a car), the Chancellor was very good value. (You must have a car to experience driving down Lombard Street! ) Unless you arrive very early in the day, suggest you buy a bus/trolley ticket on the day of arrival and use it the following day. This ticket is not valid for 24 hours from the time of activation - it is valid for a calendar day only. But it is good value for money and great for the essential trolley (and old-fashioned trams) rides.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT CHOICE!”
Reviews.Author: APMQUITO
Reviews.Content: Great location in Union Square!! Very clean. A little old but didn't matter to us. Cable car stop on the corner of the hotel. Very close to everything!!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Kept Secret in SFO”
Reviews.Author: licricket_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chancellor Hotel, quite by accident. We were at another hotel in town, and were not happy. One morning when we were looking for breakfast, we stopped in to the Chancellor's Luques Restaurant and were so impressed with the service and food that we decided to check the hotel out. Well, we checked out of the other hotel and into the Chancellor. Everything was perfect for us: the wonderful staff, front-desk, cleanliness of the hotel and rooms, etc. We could not have been happier and have recommended the hotel to our friends. We will always stay there when visiting SFO

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel fantastic location fantastic city!”
Reviews.Author: KatDallas
Reviews.Content: Chancellor Hotel was recommended us, and it did not disappoint. The location was perfect (4 blocks from the BART) and right on the trolley line. Older hotel, but in fantastic space and it looks like the rooms had recently been re-done. The price was fantastic and the hotel staff friendly. We LOVED having the window open and hearing the trolley cars go by. Eat breakfast at Sears next door and get the 3 day trolley pass for $20. Would return to the Chancellor and actually we are looking forward to our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel a stone's throw away from Union Square”
Reviews.Author: MAB28
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor Hotel is a good centrally cheap hotel close to Union Square. The hotel is a good 10min or less walk from Powell St station, you get off the BART station (if coming from the airport at $8.10) at Powell St and walk straight up the hill to the hotel, it is also a stones throw away from Union Sq and from all the major shops and various restaurants and cafes. The plus sign is that you are able to get free wi-fi which is easily accessible in your room should you need it. The hotel will gave me a 10% off voucher to use at Luques in house restaurant for lunch & breakfast excluding liquor. I was also given a 2 for 1 beverage voucher to use at the same bar but it has to be said that this is bar is tiny, if I were to use it, I'd probably just use it for a very quick drink. There are some great bars in the city so it'd be wise to explore and see what takes your fancy. I was also given a Savings Pass which gives 10%off selected merchandise at Macy's. Umbrellas are provided in the small closet area next to the bathroom should you require one Upon checking into the hotel, I did not find the greeting as warm and welcoming as I had expected, more of a quick hello and confirming that I was checking in which was evident given that I had my overnight bags with me. It has to be noted that the hotel is a on old property and thus the room I occupied was fairly small. My room had two single beds with a small bathroom (pics attached), but having said that, you get what you pay for. This is no-ones fault but I had an adjoining room, so I could hear the conversation from the couple next door plus their tv which was a little off-putting. I found the room to be noisier during the day which of course isn't a problem if you intend being out exploring the city, I had arrived late afternoon and noticed noise from the streets below, even from the 12th floor, having said that, I personally had no problems with that given the location of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very nice and comfortable stay, great location !”
Reviews.Author: akesas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Cahncellor for 8 days. Cable car was just in front of the door. Market street was in walking distance. Our room had Unio Square view. The staff ( Matt, Zack, Nate and SUSAN and all the others) were very helpful and smiled all the time. Cookies and coffee at the lobby, we enjoyed so much. I will definitely stay here if I go back to SF again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and well kept”
Reviews.Author: Statikfeed
Reviews.Content: The hotel makes you feel like you stepped back in time. It feels very historic but it was remodeled well. The rooms were small but the furniture didn't seem to crowd the room to much. We were on the 15th Floor and enjoyed the view. The staff was helpful on arrival - thanks Matt- and we enjoyed the breakfast at the hotel. We used the valet service and the car came back in the same condition. The location was great access to Union Square and the price including parking and food credit was lower than many surrounding hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Chancellor hotel is excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: LondonHulaBaloo
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel on trip advisor and read mostly good reviews and a few less favourable so in my experience as a traveller you may find the following review helpful too.... The location is excellent - cable car exactly opposite the hotel, and not only that but you are about 30 seconds away from union square so if you are a tourist you can easily catch any of the hop on hop off bus tours, which for anyone staying in the city for a week or more may find it useful to know that for about 40 dollars you can go uptown or to fisher mans wharf over and over again. The main benefit of this is that you won't need to waste money on taxis. The tour guide gave us a whole week of travel and we literally covered the city centre,north beach, china town, fishermans wharf, golden gate bridge, sausilito, golden gate park and more for two people. Basic advice? Ask for a bargain and you will get one. Hotel room was excellent. Emailed manager to ask for room high up and it was provided. Don't know why some reviews say the room was so small. Our room had a queen size bed, large tv, walk in wardrobe, drawers, two chairs and a table, as well as a full en suite bathroom. We got all of that at a bargain rate of just over 110 dollars plus tax per night. I don't know anywhere you can get that much for so little. Hotel is so clean. Annie and Maria cleaned our room to a very high standard and the entire hotel is immaculate so it gets a ten out of ten for that. Breakfast was fairly good with excellent service every day and again all food served quickly and everything was very, very clean. Susan on the tour desk / gift shop was very helpful and efficient and the front desk staff were good too. Free coffee and cookies as well as newspapers available in lobby every day, Susan always willing to assist with everything and this is a hotel I would most definitely be staying in again. Susan arranged bike tours as well as airport transfers for us so again worth her weight in gold. Bad points - nothing for the price. Not one bad remark I can say about this great little hotel to be honest. Suggestions - might be nice if coffee was available in the room - that's the only suggestion but it's not the end of the world as it is provided, but it's the only thing I felt would be a convenience. Other than that? This is a brilliant hotel and yes it's not the ritz but if you want clean, stylish with good service, a central location and something above and beyond a soul less travel lodge this is the best hotel of it's kind in San Francisco. Well done chancellor for really providing a beautiful hotel that is safe and sooooo clean!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location with easy access to everything”
Reviews.Author: chattycathy10
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor Hotel is exactly as advertised - small, friendly, old word charm, renovated, clean and the best location ever. Our room was not large, but adequate. Being at the back, on the third floor we had no view at all. I assume the higher floors would offer very good views but we didn't ask for a change. We had the "room and dine" package, which gave us $25 a day in restaurant credit. They issued a card worth $75 for our three day stay, which could be used all at once, or over the three days until the crdeit was used up. The food was excellent and reasonable, even without using a card. Staff were pleasant and helpful and the service was good. Best of all would be location. We easily arrived from the airport by BART, which has a stop at the bottom of Powell Street. We then purchased a three day transit pass at a kiosk on the corner, for $20. We could have taken the cable car up the hill to our hotel but walked instead. It was only a few blocks away. Being on the cable car route, and only a few blocks from Market Street and all the buses was very convenient. It was very easy to get to Fisherman's Wharf, Chinatown, Haight, Castro - everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: WindyOaks
Reviews.Content: Our initial stay was extended by over a week due to the volcano and we were very happy here. It is in a great position, if you like shops, cable cars, eateries and activities in Union Square and obviously comes with the buzz that these things bring. Easy to walk to Chinatown. Rooms attractive and beautifully kept; those at the back are quieter. Eat at Sears and browes books in Borders; great.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a super location”
Reviews.Author: LorraineMac
Reviews.Content: We had booked this hotel for 3 days and ended up staying 7. It was very clean with great staff and the room was a great size for the 2 of us. Loved soaking in the big tub. The location was great - very central. It is right on the cable car line and also within walking distance of a great many attractions. The coffee and cookies in the lobby are a great touch. This was our first visit to San Francisco and the whole experience at this hotel was great. It was very quiet at night even with the windows open although we were on the back of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome boutique-y hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeakerTravel
Reviews.Content: I booked the Chancellor based on the recommendations here on tripadvisor for a short vacation with my mom, to celebrate her 50th birthday. The hotel did not disappoint! We had two twin beds, and the room, while smaller than typical business hotels, was the perfect size for us. I requested in advance a room on the quieter side that still had a view, and we got just that. We had no problems sleeping, even with the cable cars going by the front of the hotel. Also, since the hotel knew we were celebrating a birthday, they left a very nice note, bottle of wine, and chocolates for my mom. The location was excellent and it was easy to catch the cable car or the bus to get to every corner of the city. The room and bathroom were very clean and comfortable. The coffee, tea, and cookies in the lobby were always a welcome sight after a long day of sightseeing. And the WIFI always worked for us and was a great resource for us. The hotel reminded me a lot of the smaller boutique hotels I've stayed at in Europe. Overall I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting in San Francisco. I'll stay there the next time I'm in San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was perfect for our stay”
Reviews.Author: island085
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Chancellor for 3 nights in April. We had a fanastic stay. We had twin beds. The rooms, staff and location were all excellent. We stayed on the 11th floor, the street noise wasn't bad at all, It added charm to our stay - I loved hearing the Cable Cars go by. The strength of the free wifi was always excellent. Occasionally heard the footsteps from the room above but only ever for a few seconds. Showers were really good and the wardrobe was very spacious but we never used it. We had both our suitcases out in the room and there were will plenty of space left. The beds were awesome, great nights sleep after long days sightseeing around the city. We had originally planned to return to the airport using the BART but our bags were quite heavy and there was no problem booking the Shuttle bus with Lorries with short notice. The tea and cookies in the lobby were a great way to start the morning. We will definately be returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Bit of Europe in Union Square”
Reviews.Author: gum57
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chancellor for three nights over the weekend of the 17th of April and had a fantastic time. Because of the terrific location of the hotel, my husband and I walked everywhere which is something people don't usually say about San Fransisco. It's steps from Union Square and right on the cable car line which is why you should request a room at the back of the hotel which makes it quieter. Our room was 1305 which still had a view of the square, but was quiet enough for us to sleep with the windows open. And sleep we did. The beds are very comfortable although a queen is the largest. My husband is very tall but was still comfortable in the small room. Our closet was big enough to hold both of our duffle bags leaving the room free for us to walk around the bed. There was a safe and all the ammenities. I even took what was left of the shampoo because I liked it so much. In the lobby, they sell Muni passes for the cable cars and bus systems. It's a good deal. The valet parking package is also a good deal. There is a little breakfast and lunch place in the lobby as well as a small bar which has coffee in the morning and serves wine or cocktails in the afternoon and evening. Chinatown is within walking distance as are all the best shops in and around Union Square. It's located right across the street from the Drake, which is a fun place to have dinner in the looby and people watch. We took the Go shuttle from the airport which is linked into the Hotel's website. It was very cost effective. The staff was friendly, helpful and eager to please. This is a great find. I hope it stays this way.

Reviews.Title: “Very very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: GroovyGreg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and is within walking distance to the underground MUNI/BART station and the cable car stop for Powell/Hyde and Powell/Mason is right in front of the hotel. The hotel staff is very friendly (especially the concierge), the hotel itself is clean, and the rooms are spacious enough with large closets and a manageable bathroom. Shopping and dining options are plentiful in the Union Square area. There is a pharmacy/grocery mart half a block away. The hotel's restaurant Luques serves very good breakfast at reasonable prices. (they also serve lunch and dinner, but we only had breakfast there). Overall I very highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is staying in San Francisco. We felt very safe, very comfortable, and very satisfied! We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Believe the reviews- this place is great!”
Reviews.Author: njewell
Reviews.Content: I'm always a little wary of hotels that have all excellent reviews on tripadvisor, but the Chancellor Hotel deserves all the best reviews and more. I just got back from a week long stay at the Chancellor and it was great. My husband and I met my parents in San Francisco to celebrate my mom's 60th birthday. Before we arrived, I was contacted by Monica, the events coordinator. She arranged flowers and champagne and chocolates to be delivered to my mom's room for her birthday. It was great service. The hotel admenities are great as well. The rooms are big enough. Very clean. Great bathrooms, comfortable beds, etc. The staff is at your service for whatever question/request you have. The breakfast we had in the hotel was great...very good eggs benedict! All in all...this hotel made our trip to san francisco perfect. We had the best time in such a great city and I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: mols2000
Reviews.Content: This was a combined business and leisure trip. I stayed for 7 days, 4 of which were for a conference. The official conference hotel would have cost over $200/night, with a $15/day charge for internet, and probably no breakfast included unless a small continental one. In contrast, at the Chancellor, I got their $99/night (it was more on Friday and Saturday) dining package that included $25/day at the restaurant. There was free wireless internet in the room. On top of that, I had the perfect Union Square location, which was walkable to the Moscone, as well as to practically anywhere else. I was able to walk to Fisherman's Wharf, AT&T Park, the Ferry Building, and got the bus to the Golden Gate Bridge. The rooms are small as advertised, but if you've ever stayed at a not-outrageously-priced hotel in New York or Europe, you'll be amazed by the comparative opulence of the Chancellor. There is certainly room to walk around between the bed and the wall. My sister joined me for a couple of days, and there was plenty of room for two of us. I didn't miss having air conditioning, as I always wake up with a sore throat when I sleep in a room with AC on. The ceiling fan and having the window open a bit made the room plenty comfortable. It was cool at night in April anyway. I knew about the free chocolate chip cookies, apples and coffee/tea in the lobby 24/7, but having the clock radio with an MP3 player attachment so I could listen to my own tunes earphone-free was a great surprise. I enjoyed having a big flat-screen tv and the large walk-in closet too. My laptop fit perfectly in the room safe. The hotel restaurant was amazing. I ate breakfast there every day, for free because of the dining credit, and everything I had was great. The different varieties of Eggs Benedict are all fabulous, and the Greek yogurt was the best I've ever had. I'd love to know what brand it was. I even had dinner there one night, and it was actually one of the best meals of the trip. The day I walked across the Golden Gate Bridge, they also packed me a sandwich to go. The only glitch was that somehow another guest's breakfast wound up on my room charge, but when I reported it to them, they researched it and responded immediately. Because of my business/personal trip split, there were some minor issues with which card they credited, but everything worked out pretty promptly and politely. If the Chancellor could somehow be cloned and put in every place around the world I hope to visit someday, I would be one happy traveller. I would only hesitate to recommend the hotel to someone elderly, only because the extra-deep tub requires you to lift your leg kind of high to clear it when you're getting in and out of the shower. I didn't have a problem, but I'd be worried about someone prone to falling. Helpful hint: I used Google Transit to figure out where to catch public transportation, which all worked great. I found that if the stop was listed as the corner of Street A & Street B, instead of being exactly at the corner of A & B, you had to cross Street B, and the stop was actually about 20-25 feet further on Street A.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: manyhappydays
Reviews.Content: I would highly reccommend the Chancellor Hotel on Union Square to anyone visiting San Francisco. My husband and I were in San Francisco for the first time and stayed at the Chancellor Hotel for 4 nights over Easter and found the location very central and value for money excellent. For an older hotel, the rooms were renovated, large and most importantly, clean. We were lucky enough to have a room that looked out onto Powell Street, accross to Union Square, with the Cable car right outside the hotel. What a great start to our U.S holiday - I just wished we had the same experience in New York!

Reviews.Title: “I think if you aren't high maintenance the place is great.”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixBunn
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great. Very easy to access the Trolley cars, bart, and muni. We purchased the 3 day pass and we used it for 2 days and it had more than paid for itself. As for the hotel - the service was great. It is very much a boutique hotel and looks a bit warn. The rooms get a bit humid and uncomfortable during the night because there is no air conditioning. The walls are a bit thin because we could hear the neighbors a little too well in the evening. I am a light sleeper, but my husband didn't even wake up. For the amount we paid it was just perfectly located and we used it to sleep so it served it's purpose. We celebrated a special occasion and the hotel treated us when we arrived with a bottle of champagne. I think if you aren't high maintenance the place is great. I also recommend the pancakes and french toast from sears next door and don't eat at Lori's Diner. I would definitely try a different hotel the next time I visit san francisco only because of the humidity during the evening.... i take showers at night and I don't think it helped. Also wifi worked great!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: LMMDublin
Reviews.Content: Despite reading good reviews of this hotel it still exceeded my expectations. The location is great - it's beside all the main department stores and shops ( macy's, saks and borders are within sight of the front door), the trolley runs along powell st, there's plenty of places to eat nearby and all of San Francisco's attractions can be easily reached. While our room wasn't very big it was bright, clean and fresh with a walk in storage area/wardrobe and the room/bathroom was fitted with everything we might need - hairdryer, iron, ironing board. Trips and bus tickets can be booked in the lobby. Internet access, an atm and complementary tea / coffee are also available. I wouldn't normally submit reviews but I thought this hotel was a little gem particularly in terms of location and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel + awesome location = great deal!”
Reviews.Author: MiahSaoPaulo
Reviews.Content: Great place, awesome location!â€Ž - â€Ž - 2010-04-11 We stayed at the Chancellor Hotel for 3 nights early in April, mostly based on reviews written by other guests and a great deal at Quickbook. It turned out to be a lot more then we'd expected; the hotel has an awesome location and, though old, it's been well preserved and recently renovated. In our arrival we were delighted to be received by a cute little duck to be used in the bathroom's bathtub, besides the complimentary coffee and cookies for guests. The room is clean and comfortable, the staff is courteous and helpful. We travelled to NYC right after and were appaled to learn that we'd have to pay 50% more for a tiny, ugly, crapy room. We strongly recommend the Chancellor!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: FloridaJojo57
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real gem - we booked the package including parking and dining credit (which covered great breakfast for two each day). The price was a real bargain compared to other hotels in area. Rooms were recently renovated, clean and tasteful. Bathroom is really tiny - similar to European hotel. Location is fantastic - staff was extremely helpful. They put us on the "quiet" side, unfortunately, there was a loud guest staying on our floor who was outside his room talking at all hours of the night, but not hotel's fault. Highly recommend hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaC2
Reviews.Content: Perfect location - fun, charming hotel. Cozy, clean, quiet - very friendly and comfortable. Cable car right outside so easy transport but great sound proofing so never bothered by this. Good price. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Chancellor hotel - great location but small rooms and older hotel”
Reviews.Author: leecat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chancellor hotel - Can't beat location- we took the train from SFO airport to Union Square and then we walked with suitcases about 4 blocks. Right on Union Square and on cable car line. Awesome to hear the trolly cars! Union Square - huge Macys/Nordstoms that you can see from Chancellor hotel. First impression of hotel - OLD. Small rooms and bathrooms. We had two twin beds - The hotel has no A/C but it's was cool in San Francisco. They really need to update the lobby! The price was great and again the location is the best. If I had to do it again - I think that I would stay in little more modern hotel but the location and price are what the Chancellor is all about..

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nicbarr
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel. Centrally located, rooms clean, staff helpful. Would definitely stay here again. We had the Jack S Ross suite which was huge.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, unique hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: charmless
Reviews.Content: I will say upfront that the rooms at the Chancellor are SMALL. If you like to run laps around your room, this is not the hotel for you. The building itself is old. The elevators are old and slow, but the Chancellor provides the sort of mix of modernity and timeless elegance that really appeals to me. The furniture in our room was new and modern, but maintained the aesthetic of a European boutique hotel. The mattress and linens were top-of-the-line. I always travel with my own pillow, but the pillows were so nice that I was tempted to sneak one of them into my pillowcase, on the way out. There was even a request sheet for specialty pillows (i.e. a body pillow or between-the-knees pillow). We didn't need any, but I wish we had tried them anyway. The bathroom was tiny and a bit older looking, but very clean and functional. Only one person will fit in there at a time and there isn't a huge counter to pile your toiletries on. Again, if you and your companion need a lot of space, or you're not fond of pedestal sinks, look elsewhere. High-end toiletries are provided and the rubber duck was a thoughtful touch. The location is very central. I would NOT recommend driving around San Francisco, but you can travel just about anywhere from Union Square, by Muni. We picked up a 3-day pass for $20 and it took us everywhere we needed to go. The Caltrain station to San Jose (where we went for a hockey game) was a 10-minute ride away. On a nice day, you can walk to a number of spots, if you're willing to dedicate a few hours to meandering around. One thing of note about Union Square is that it is in the downtown core. There were homeless people roaming around the neighborhood and one perched directly outside the hotel door, on one occasion, but I did not feel unsafe at any time. No in-room coffeemakers were provided, but complimentary self-serve coffee and tea were available in the lobby. Valet parking is offered by a third-party company, for a reasonable fee (given the location). If you need your car for any reason, you must provide 20-30 minutes advance notice so the hotel can contact the valet company. Keep this in mind, if you're on a tight schedule when checking out, or if you're the sort of person who accidentally leaves things in your car, like we did. Two things prevented my stay at the Chancellor from being 100% perfect. Firstly, the Wifi was terrible. We planned on going online to look up addresses and transit schedules, but it was often too slow to be functional. On the bright side, it was complimentary, so at least we weren't paying extra to be frustrated. We were also on the very top floor. Depending on the location of the hub, I wouldn't be surprised if the connection would have been better elsewhere in the hotel. There also wasn't a fridge in the room. Fortunately, we were traveling with a cooler and there was an ice machine nearby. If you enjoy having snacks in your room, this is something to note. All in all, I thought the value was fabulous, for the area and the quality of the accommodations. Unless I was interested in staying in a different part of the city, the Chancellor would be my first choice, the next time I visit San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Comfy Beds and awesome service”
Reviews.Author: 1girl1boy
Reviews.Content: After picking the hotel from fellow trip advisor comments I was not disappointed. The hotel location was great right on Powell st for the cable car. The service was impecciable. Warm welcome on arrival and even a happy anniversary surprise in our room, champagne, glasses and a picture frame from the management, thank you Hotel is quite small, think thin front but deep back. We were on the front side with our window on Powell St, I read other reviews that said the street side was noisy. I didn't find this at al when the window was closed. Yes, the rooms are small but the service and comfy beds (and I mean comfy beds) definitely out weigh this. Spot on Chancellor thank you for making our stay so memorable

Reviews.Title: “Glad I chose to stay at the Chancellor.”
Reviews.Author: UNCMOM2011
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at the Chancellor Hotel at the end of febuary and we really enjoyed our stay. I even found a lower rate for a competing hotel and e-mailed them and they matched the rate another example of their great customer service. The rooms are small but are comfortable and the huge walk-in closet is great since we were able to store all our luggage,shopping bags etc. in there. The staff are very friendly and courteous and the bartender at the Clippership bar in the hotel pours a generous drink. The WI FI worked great and they even brought up a small bar fridge for free to use in the room which I had requested through e-mail. We ate breakfast at Luques in the hotel one morning and it was very good and the man that ran the place was very nice and even brought us free OJ because he forgot my husbands hot sauce again great customer service. The location is perfect such easy access to the Muni,Bart and Cable Cars. We used public transportation exclusively and even to and from the airport it was great we loved not having to get into the car for a week. We would definitely stay at The Chancellor again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable. Lovely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Pablo_M
Reviews.Content: San Francisco was the third stop on our four week holiday to the States. We decided on the Chancellor hotel based heavily on T.A. reviews. I booked through expedia.com.au . Our group consisted of six young adults. The accomodation more than met our requirements. Each room had enough wardrobe space for our belongings and the bathroom facilities were adequate. The bedding and pillows were comfortable (you can order special pillows at no extra cost, check the hotel guide in your room). The bar on the ground floor is very convenient if you want to throw back a couple of martinees before heading out for the evening, even better during happy hour! The guest lift is small, just like you would find in some traditional hotels in Europe. If you plan to stay at the Chancellor and you have many large bags you might need to make a few extra trips up the lift or if you're lazy just ask the front desk fro help. Each room had ceiling fans but no air con. We were there towards the end of the North American winter so air con was not required, but this could prove to be an issue in the hot summer months. You can open the window which I think is a real plus, not just for the fresh cool air but I thougth it was nice to stick my head out the window for a look or have the window open to listen to the hustle and bustle of Union Square. Location is great, if you havent' been to San Fran before do your research and look up Union Square, you'll find that it's a real central location, great for shopping! As suggested by the Hotel we booked GO Laurie's Shuttle for transport to and from the airport. It worked out around AU$90 in total for the private van each way. Susan at the tour desk in the lobby was fantastic, nothing was an issue for her, she booked everything for us with pleasure! The Chancellor Hotel ended up being a memorable part of our San Francisco experience. We were more than happy with our stay. All the employees were very friendly and accomodating at all times and the hotel itself has real character. Dont' expect a big modern fancy lobby or hi-tech lighting and electronic mod con devices in your room.. if you want that then go somewhere else. Stay at the Chancellor if you want great customer service, simple, basic but comfrortable acccomodation that represents great value for money. Overall a great experience. I would recommend it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation in Busy City”
Reviews.Author: casadedale
Reviews.Content: Comfortable room to come back to each day .... small by US standards, but comparable to European hotels. Though small, very adequate -- the choice of pillows is an added plus!! Great bed - and isn't that what it's all about anyway?? .... Centrally located - walk to Chinatown and shops - across from Union - cable car pick up in front. ... Next door to Sears restaurant, but quite frankly for breakfast, the hotel restaurant is just as good w/o the waiting in line and higher prices. ..... Parking is a challenge in this city (and quite expensive), but the hotel has reduced "off-site parking" about a block away - if part of your accomodation package, will reduce your expenses for parking (with in/out privileges). There is temporary parking in front of the hotel for loading/unloading. .. Wireless internet in the room wasn't too good however - perhaps a problem that needs correction. ..... Would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “I guess the secret is out...”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkCityAlex
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Chancellor each time I visit SanFran (about twice a year for the past 4 or 5 years). I just returned from yet another stay. It is, as the other reviews say, a wonderful hotel. Yes, the rooms are very clean, the coffee in the AM is great, and I like the apples, but what makes it wonderful for me? Note to the manager: the staff at the front desk know the importance of being pleasant. No hassles. No "I'll see what I can do later." No phony attitude. Just a pleasant group of folks. I arrived early from a flight out of New York and I much appreciated there was no hassle: "Here's your room." And that was it. No "Sorry, you are early, come back at 3pm." Great. Also to management: here is my criticism - I hated those peppermint cookies; PLEASE bring back good old-fashioned chocolate chip. One last point to newcomers: Eat at Lori's Diner up the block. Wonderful food. Not fancy, but delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been any better”
Reviews.Author: travel_forever25
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon this hotel met and exceeded our expectations.Awaiting in our room when we arrived was a wedding gift a bottle of champagne and a photo frame and lollies.The hotels location is perfect. It's right in the heart of the city opposite union square.Walking distance to Chinatown.You cannot beat this location.The rooms were very clean and tidy.The reception staff were always very polite and helpful. The housekeeping staff were great the room was always made up when you arrived back after a long day.The pillow menu was fantastic you could just call up and order a pillow to try. We liked the memory foam ones so much we went out and bought some.There is a computer by the reception to use for free or if you have a lap top there is free internet in the rooms, which is awesome.This hotel is value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, Great Hotel, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: NZLou
Reviews.Content: We started our USA trip at this hotel and were pleasantly surprised.. We had considered staying in Fisherman's wharf but this for us for a much better location. The rooms were lovely and the added bonus of being able to do a pillow order was great. Added extras that we really appreciated were the cookies,apples and coffee always availabe in the lobby. Across the road from Union Square and a short walk to Bart/Muni and also on tram line. In summary 5/5.

Reviews.Title: “what an ideal spot!”
Reviews.Author: NWroamer11
Reviews.Content: I hadn't stayed at the Chancellor or perhaps 20 years, but based on reviews decided to try. THIS IS A TERRIFIC VALUE! We used to BART from the airport and easily walked the 3 blocks on a slight uphill with our rolling bags. Our room was ready (early), was on the 12th floor, and very clean and perfectly quiet. The room as small ONLY if you are used to American oversized rooms. Very much on the order of a small European Hotel with small but perfectly adequate room with all that we needed. Firm Queen Sized Bed. Nice little bar off the lobby. We didn't try the restaurant but went next door for Sears pancakes! The "business center" is one wee computer right next to check in- again very European in feel. Great location from which to explore the city

Reviews.Title: “we realy enjoyed this hotel we will be back”
Reviews.Author: gandffarms
Reviews.Content: i can not say enough about this hotel form susan the travel agent to all the people we met at the resturant everyone was warm and friendly it was our first vacation in san francisco and we had a great time we will be comming back and we will be staying hear again

Reviews.Title: “You can't get a better deal”
Reviews.Author: SusanWillits_CA
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed at the Chancellor and it's the greatest place to San Francisco. It's right on Powell St. and the cable cars go right by the front of the hotel. It's right by Union Square and it's great shopping. The rooms are small but so cute and full of personality. It's the first hotel I've stayed at that had a pillow menu. How great is that? The staff is really friendly and go out of their way for you. Some one taught them excellent customer care. The best part is the parking. The valet parking is $7 more! How can you beat that. You can't even park in SF for $7 for an hour. The best deal in town.

Reviews.Title: “clean, quiet,good local, great staff, good price.”
Reviews.Author: VernonSuperlou
Reviews.Content: I rented two rooms at the Chancellor for 4 nights in march. One for myself and one for my sister. This is a great hotel , its very clean. considering its age you would expect it would smell all old and musty but it does not. The rooms are very small but the decor is clean tastful and stylish. The staff are great, the first night I found my room extremely hot, even with the windows open and the fan on ( there is no air conditioning) so I asked the front desk the next morning what could be done and they immediatly changed me to another room that turned out to be much cooler and surprisingly quiet even though I had the windows open.. The location is really great, the cable car is right outside the door. And the price was 89.00 per night., And a fair warning to anyone going to san fran for the first time , it has a very extreme homeless problem Every few feet it seems there are beggars. You will notice that many( but not all ) have untreated mental illness. I learned from speaking to a reporter doing a story on this problem that many other californian cities will purchase bus tickets for their homeless to go to san fran. Once they arrive there is no help, they need to wait up to 7 years before receiving medical treatment for their illness and assistance. There are very few mental health hospitals. When they say they are hungry they probably are. I gave away lots of garanola bars, and found out what fast food places were in the area and purchased lots of 5$ gift cards and handed them out so they could at least get a sandwich. I do this anytime I travel to cities with high homeless populations. These folks are always very thankful and friendly. Feel free to make eye contact and smile share your food and shake a hand or pat a back. It WILL make your vacation much better. Just do it with one homeless person on the first day you get there to see how it feels to behave humanely. Cheers , have a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay...perfect location...exceptionally clean...LOVE IT !”
Reviews.Author: London.dreaming
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Chancellor several times now and it just gets better and better. The staff are SO friendly and eager to make your stay perfect. The room staff (for us it was Alice) was fast and super effiicient - the restaurant staff couldn't be more patient and attentive. We love this hotel...it is in a perfect location and for those light sleepers, just ask for a room to the back of the hotel. Not much of a view there but very quiet!

Reviews.Title: “From now on my default hotel to stay in town”
Reviews.Author: Jeja08
Reviews.Content: After trying a couple of hotels near the Moscone Center, we came across Chancellor, hotel located right across Union Square that proved to be a jewel. The price we paid over Expedia was fabuolous and the hotel certainly proved fantastic value for money. Let's start with the location - Chancellor excels by being close to almost everything you need in this part of San Francisco - Moscone (conferences), food (definitely try the mexican restaurant just one block down), shopping (Macys, Apple store), as well as the cable car. Rooms were very clean, cosy and the staff was great. There is a concierge service in the lobby run by a lady that was very helpful, even got us a limo to the airport for the price of a town car. From now on, Chancellor Hotel on Union Square is definitely my default place to stay in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot beat the location”
Reviews.Author: brunettegirl07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chancellor Hotel for 3 nights in early February. We always base our hotel selection on location and trip advisor reviews. You simply cannot beat the location for the Chancellor. Cable cars stop directly out front of the hotel and every other mode of public transport is within quick walking distance. You are also within easy walking distance for great shopping (which may or may not be a good thing). The hotel was clean, the staff were helpful, unnecessary but nice touches in the room (such as the rubber duckie, jar of lollies and biscuits) and the room size was more than adequate for two of us particularly when we were only sleeping there. Speaking of sleep - the Chancellor has the most comfortable bed and pillows. We got an amazing rate on line which included parking at a parking station just around the corner. The price could not be beat. It also included free wifi in the room. Would definately stay here again when we go back to San Francisco. If you are going to be travelling on many and varied modes of public transport throughout your stay, get a MUNI pass. They are accepted on all public transport and valid for the whole day or 3 depending on what pass you get. A cable car is $5 one way and an all day MUNI pass is $13 - you very quickly get your money's worth out of it.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, clean and affordable. Repeat visitor”
Reviews.Author: skrdina
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Chancellor. Although with our first visit we were concerned with the low price but followed the advice of fellow tripadvisor reviewers. Our fears were immediately put to rest. Our first visit went so well here we decided to revisit it. This hotel is consistently clean and hospitable. Although the hotel is older expect a modern art deco decor. It's very charming and would highly recommend it to a friend. The location is superb near main stream shopping spots. The neighborhood is great both day and night. The rooms are smaller since the hotel is older but that's the case with most all of S.F. Everyone on staff from checkout, waiter to housekeeper is kind and eager to offer outstanding service. I haven't seen such a staff since my last stay at a Ritz Carlton! Last note...if your hotel faces Powell Street(room with views) expect to hear the trolley in the evening. I would suggest staying in a room that faces the back if your not used to the city noises at night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in ideal location.”
Reviews.Author: PeterMk
Reviews.Content: We arrived for a 4 day stay as part of a world trip. The reception staff were very helpful and we were shown to the room by a helpful bellhop. The room was clean and comfortable, and looked out to the front. The only noise we heard was the cable car, but there was some comfort in hearing it. The location was excellent, and we would recommend the restaurant next door - SEARS - the food was excellent, and what breakfasts.
