We also use the Daily Grill one block down, and can recommend that restaurant as well. We enjoyed our stay and will be returning to San Francisco in the near future, and although there are many other hotels in the area, we will return to this hotel. The Chancellor offers that feeling of old fashioned customer service and good value -Well done.

Reviews.Title: “Take a chance in The Chancellor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: isseyb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Chancellor on Powell Street for 3 nights during January2010.Although the room on the 7th floor overlooking Powell Street was not the largest we have stayed in, we found it quite adequate for the 150$ per night that we paid.We found the hotel staff very friendly and helpful and although we only had breakfast in the hotel restaurant we thought it offered good value.Penny Pinching Tip: look at the menu before you enter the restaurant and if your meal does not include tea or coffee take one in from the lobby as its free!

Reviews.Title: “If your going to San Francisco be sure to wear some flowers in your hair.”
Reviews.Author: isseyb
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 week holiday in New Zealand staying over in San Francisco for 3 nights going out and 3 nights in Perth on the way back.Looking at the reviews on hotels on Trip Advisor we decided to stay at The Chancellor, Powell Street on Union Square.We paid 150$ a night for a room on the 7th floor overlooking Powell Street.Although the rooms are small as stated in other reviews, we found it to be more than adequate and good value.for the money.We found the staff on reception very pleasant and although we only had breakfast in the hotel restaurant we were very satisfied with the quality and price.PENNY PINCHING TIP: look at the menu before you go in and if tea or coffee is not included in the price take one in from the lobby as its free out there! I would definitely recommend this hotel along with these other suggestions: a 3 day MUNI travel card for 20$ an absolute steal, you only have to take 4 journeys on the cable car at 5$ a time to be in profit.Go on an URBAN TREK with Anton, there are 4 to 5 hour trips or longer 7-8 hour trips when you will be guided by Anton around San Francisco on foot.He has a vast knowledge of SF and will give you advice on where to eat ,how the transport system works etc.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: n0lar0cks
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with my stay at the Chancellor Hotel. I had a couple of requests prior to my arrival and was happy to find that they were granted. Wes and his staff are clearly dedicated to great service. Thanks a million!

Reviews.Title: “One night - Perfect location, no complaints”
Reviews.Author: Gblyn
Reviews.Content: I chose the Chancellor due to trip advisor reviews, and recommendations to stay near Union Square as we were only in SF for 24 hours and the price suited out budget. I have no complaints at all. Excellent location, clean, friendly hotel - we were given a suite on the top floor - maybe because it was for one night and it was vacant..... excellent if you were staying a few days - or had more than a couple staying. I concur with previous posts - close to everything - we didn't have a problem with noise from next door - although our room was at the end of the hall, and the other adjoining wall to the bedroom was our sitting room. Bathrooms (2) were extremely clean. The building is an older style, but everything has been done up very nicely. they had free wi-fi, which whilst travelling I found to be an excellent convenience (used it via my iphone), so much so that wherever I book in the future will have free wi-fi (in all the hotel, not just the lobby).

Reviews.Title: “Top location but...”
Reviews.Author: luffsnoopy
Reviews.Content: My partner and me stayed at The Chancellor from 9 - 20 Feb. Location wise, the Chancellor was absolutely fantastic. Just minutes away from the main shopping area and with the cable car stop right outside, we were able to get to most of the must-see destinations and do our shopping easily. Even when we needed to take the buses, it was very convenient as the bus stops were within walking distance (five minutes on average). However, do note that as the hotel has rather thin walls so you might occasionally be awakened at night if other guests return late at night and make lots of chatter in the common corridor way. We were aware of the thin walls from previous reviews so we were prepared for it. There were a few nights when other guests came in late at night and we were woken up by the chatter. There were previous reviews about the room being small but it was good enough for us. The closet room was big enough for 2 our big suitcases. There was a safe deposit box in the closet room as well. Hot coffee, teas and cookies available 24 hours at the lobby. The tea selection is quite good. For those who want to explore the city and beyond, you definitely have to speak to Susan from the Tour Desk. Susan is a GEM! She is a friendly lady who always smiles and greeted us everytime we passed by her when we headed out. She is very knowledgeable on the tours and will help you to book tours to Monterey Bay, Yosemite, Napa Valley and many others. We signed up for almost all the tours available and had a fantastic time. The customer service at Chancellor Hotel before we arrived were splendid. My gf keyed in the wrong expiry date for our credit card during reservation and Mike McConnell (reservations agent) helped to rectify it very quickly. As we were staying for more than 10 days, we requested for a high floor room with a view of Union Square. Mr. Kevin Vossen (reservations manager) was superb in answering all our enquiries via email before our arrival and did helped to arrange a high-floor room with excellent view of Union Square for us! Unfortunately, our final day stay was marred somewhat by some hiccups. We were woken up at 7:30am twice by phone calls from the front desk who mistook us as the ones who had an airport pickup at that time. We checked with the front desk after we woke up and found it strange as the guest who arranged for the pickup had a totally different surnname from ours. We were quite disappointed as the staff didn't make any apologies for their mistake. This is strange as they are in the service industry. A second hiccup followed later in the afternoon. We had earlier twice informed and confirmed with the front desk during arrival and also the day before our check-out that we will be extending our check-out time to 4pm and were well aware that we will be paying extra for the late checkout. While we were catching on our sleep (having been woken by the front desk in morning at 7:30am), we were woken up again at 2pm by the front desk telling us it's time to check out. These are just minor issues but it's good to note as guests will still review the hotel based on overall experience. Other than this, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay in the Chancellor and will definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “don't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: bam1748
Reviews.Content: Have stay in plenty of downtown hotels, the Chancellor is at the top of the list. I email the hotel in advance for a rate and booking, Wes the Manager himself emailed me back to say all was in order and room confirmed. I got the room I asked for (low and to the front) without fuss. Better hotel than many who charge two or three times the price. Helpful staff, clean rooms, good price, good location, no reason to stay anywhere else. My girlfriend already wants to stay there on our next visit. Thankyou Wes and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet & well located with comfy basic rooms.”
Reviews.Author: oz666
Reviews.Content: Chancellor provides good service and excellent location with a modest price. Breakfast was a bit pricey but otherwise excellent order-from-menu type cafe. In Feb time quiet and nice although very near to Market Street and Union Square shops & restaurants. O.K. Finland

Reviews.Title: “Terrific”
Reviews.Author: TucsonJimi
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Chancellor in mid-February 2010. Just 4 or 5 blocks up Powell from the Powell St. BART station, the Chancellor was easy to find. Our room was ready for us even though we checked in at noon. The room was modern, very clean, quiet and reasonably sized. The staff were helpful, and the free coffee and cookies in the lobby were great after a day of sightseeing in the cold. You just can't beat the value of the Chancellor in San Francisco. The location is ideal for seeing the major sights and you don't need a car to see 'em. We walked to Chinatown and North Beach but if you don't feel like walking we discovered the #30 bus on Stockton will take you to Chinatown, North Beach, Fisherman's Wharf, the Palace of Fine Arts and the marina green on it's route. Jump on any Powell St cable car heading up the hill just outside the lobby, and arrive at Fisherman's Wharf in style and grab an Irish coffee at the Buena Vista right at the end of the Powell/Hyde St line. We had a terrific stay and I will definitely return here again and would not hesitate to recommend this fine hotel to my friends considering traveling to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Castalla
Reviews.Content: Great loacation, very friendly and helpful staff, rooms small but very comfortable, great value for money, free Wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Charming!”
Reviews.Author: HeartTravellin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here after eloping in Napa Valley. After our stay in Napa we drove down and spent two nights here. I loved that it is privately owned, you can tell the service is very genuine. Everyone we encountered from the bartender to the bellhop was more than happy to help and answer any questions we had. When we got up to our room we found a bottle of champagne waiting for us as well as a little gift. It was a Chancellor Inn Hotel picture frame. I loved the pillow menu! From what I recall there were 7 different choices. The room was really clean, free internet access was a plus and the decor was cute. And you can't forget to mention the location!!! In the middle of Union Square, but my favorite was the trolley right in front of the door! Cross the street to head toward the wharf and after a long day of sightseeing, it takes you right back to where you started!! Awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Whisk-Chef
Reviews.Content: You can't get a better location than this hotel. Ask for a room on the Powell Street side (yes, it's a little noisy-bring earplugs) so you can step out onto the fire escape and enjoy the air and the view. Be sure and ask NOT to have an interior view room... they face a wall. Horrid. If you like baths then you must order the bath pillow (they have a pillow menu in the rooms) and fill it with hot water. It totally does not suck like most air filled pillows. The tubs are DEEP! (No overflow, careful!) The rooms are tiny but clean and nicely decorated, I've stayed in smaller in Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great people, great breakfast, and parking included!”
Reviews.Author: EBChico
Reviews.Content: We loved the Chancellor Hotel on Powell Street right across the street from Union Square. It is such a nice hotel! The rooms are pretty in apple green, white and black. The employees there are so so nice, from the bell "boy" to the waiters in the restaurant... All very nice! We especially liked our waiter, Mao. He was very nice and efficient. Parking and breakfast was included in the price. We got on the Cable cars right out side the hotel and everything is so centrally located, it was fantastic to be here in the Chancellor.

Reviews.Title: “a terrific hotel”
Reviews.Author: Creyton
Reviews.Content: This is the third consecutive year I've spent Christmas - New Year at the Chancellor and my praise is undiminished for this splendid hotel. The entire experience - staff, ambience, service - cannot be faulted. I can only continue to offer my highest praise and my highest recommendation for this gem in the heart of San Francisco. BARRY CREYTON

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 120Rocks
Reviews.Content: We were in one of the corner rooms, I suppose any of the floors with the room number ending with 03. We actually found the room large for the price and very well appointed. The work desk was comforatable and we had chairs and a table. Very spacious. Everything about our stay was right from the moment we walked in the lobby to the time we picked up our car to head home. We even met one of the folks who has his photo on the wall honoring his 30 years working there, seems he is nearing 40 years now, what a remarkable feat that is. They must do much right, not just with guests but employees too!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is amazingly awesome!”
Reviews.Author: biddlywad
Reviews.Content: I recently went to SF with my husband on our honeymoon and chose this hotel because of it's great Trip Advisor reviews. The room was amazing with a lovely comfy bed, view over Union Square and super deep bath. The little extras - photoframe, bottle of wine and congratulations card were brilliant and really cheered us up after a long flight. The location of the hotel itself was perfect - across the road from a cable car stop and a few doors down from a Walgreens - what more can a girl ask for! The staff were polite and friendly at all times and the service they provided was second to none. Nothing we asked was too much trouble and room service was always spot on time! The free cookies and coffee were a nice touch and were excellent for waking my husband up in the morning! I would recommend this hotel without a doubt and if I am ever lucky enough to go to SF again I will definitely stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Ksarul
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor is ideally situated about 20 yards from Union Square, with easy access to the cable cars and hop-on hop-off buses, as well as plenty of department stores if you like that sort of thing. A well run hotel, friendly staff, lovely bedding, perfectly adequate and nice room for the price. We also got a $25 voucher per night's stay to spend on breakfast or bar (we chose the latter generally!). The hotel is just over a 5 minute walk to Dotties True Blue cafe on Jones St., which doesn't look like much but has really great breakfasts, enough to last you until dinner! Free wifi very reliable and a decent speed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: JJDB1400
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the weekend, taking the BART from SFO. Took 20 min. and only costed $8. It was only a 3 block walk from BARt, which was awesome. The staff was fantastic and let us check in early. The room was about size of a Motel 6. Not tiny, not huge.Very clean. The bathroom was small but very clean. Awesome water pressure in shower. Had a nice view of Union Square (you can request a view). Lady at attraction desk in lobby sold us a Muni Pass for $20, good for 3 days.With that, rode bus, cable cars, and muni unlimited. Public Transportation took us everywhere! Golden Gate Bridge, Park, Wharf, China Town. Don't bother with a car. Cabs also take you everywhere for about $10. Cable car stops in front of hotel. Starbucks across street.Very safe, no homeless in front of hotel, lots of shopping. Very happy with our stay! Liked the pillow menu, fresh cookies in lobby. Got a roll away bed within 5 min of request. Awesome value for an excellent location

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, nice room, great staff”
Reviews.Author: marcathy
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the West Coast and our last stay was San Francisco. Chancellor is in a great location, walk to Chinatown and North Beach, right on trolley line. Staff was really helpful and room was small but adequate, clean and attractive. Parking is reasonable which is a real plus. The room with parking was a real value for a big city. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Emma1975
Reviews.Content: We picked the Chancellor for its location and it was by far one of the best positioned hotels in San Francisco. Union Square is such a handy location, with everything at your fingertips. The hotel itself is a nice, boutique hotel. The staff are very friendly and eager to help. The rooms, as per the other reviews, are small and the bathrooms need a bit of an update, but for the price, you can't complain - the water was always hot, the towels always fresh! The free wi-fi was great and the coffee in the lobby was lovely and always hot. I wouldn't suggest you stay at this hotel if you are travelling with a baby, the walls are a little thin and each time our daughter woke up in the night we would worry she was waking up the whole floor. As the room wasn't that big, it was a bit of struggle to fit a portacot, but we knew that before we arrived. We would, and have, suggested this hotel to others, especially couples travelling to San Fran that want a great location.

Reviews.Title: “The only good thing is the location”
Reviews.Author: jayne2164
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews prior to booking i was extremely disappointed. The room was one of the smallest i have ever stayed in and the bathroom awful, long overdue for a refit and cramped. Even on the 11th Floor the noise from traffic and Union Square is terrible, keeping us up at night and awake early in the morning. The room became very hot but if you open the window the noise gets worse and the room fills with cooking smells from some nearby extractor - absolutely vile. If we had been here for more than 2/3 nights (my husband arrived one night before me) i would have checked out and stayed elsewhere. The bar is dark, dingy and uninviting, so much so we didnt have one drink despite a free drink voucher! Except for the green decor our room looked nothing like the pictures on the website. There must be one nice room somewhere and we were not in it! You can lose the will to live waiting for the lift. Good points - the location, proximity to shopping and free coffee in the lobby. Unless you are on a very tight budget stay elsewhere! I travel extensively worldwide and can honestly say this is one of the worst hotels i have stayed in in a very long time.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: emah
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Chancellor for 4 nights in mid January 2010, on the basis of reviews on Tripadvisor. Initially I booked for $149 a night on the hotel website, but a couple of months out I found a better rate ($89 a night plus taxes) on Expedia, so I took that rate with a smile. I arrived at 2pm but my room was not available until 3pm, no problem - they took my bags and I went for a walk. They gave me a room on the 12th floor in the corner looking out over Union Square. It's a small room but it has a walk in closet, and its very well furbished. The bed was a little hard the first night (I have a princess and the pea back) but the next day they put a egg-crate foam topper on the bed and that made it incredibly comfy. There is the full complement of toiletries - shampoo, conditioner, lotion, soaps, plus cotton buds and tips, shower cap - and your own take-home rubber duckie. Mine came with a mobile phone and filofax! There is no mini bar but when I realised this, I asked if it was possible to have a bar fridge brought up and it was delivered within the hour. There is a Walgreens on the corner to buy milk etc - I prefer to have cereal in my PJs - can't handle company before breakfast! The room has a desk, chest of drawers with a big flat screen tv, table and chairs, and lots of lamps. Nice heavy curtains keep out the neon lights from the Square. I only realised it on day 3 but my window was open about an inch which was why it was so noisy - when pulling the curtains on the morning of day 3 I noticed curtain billowing outside and followed it back to the source; once I closed the window it was really quiet and peaceful! Nice carpet, nice soft towels and flannels etc. There is a pillow menu with 12 different types of pillows but I just stuck to the down pillows. The location could not be better; a 5 minute walk down Powell takes you to Market St, and the cable car stops just outside the hotel so you can shoot up to the tourist sites without having to queue down on Market. Get a Muni Pass if you are visiting - 3 days for $18 compared to $5 per trip on the cable car; I estimate I would have 'spent' $15 a day on local transport without the pass. Tea and coffee are available all day in the foyer, along with REALLY yummy cookies and fresh apples. There is a tour desk down there too - the woman behind the counter has a lot of zeal! They can book you on the airport shuttle for $14. The front desk staff are incredibly helpful and friendly - even with my extra demands (fridge, bed) they didn't blink - and they lent me packing tape and scissors when I decided to see how much stuff I could pack into one of those flat-rate boxes the USPS the sells ($56 to Australia, up to 20lbs - I managed to get 17.5 pounds in there!). The rooms and the foyer are all wireless - and its pretty high-speed for wireless too. Plenty of power points throughout the room and the bathroom - and the light switches are night lights which is cool because the bathroom is a step-up and the light always reminded me. There is a restaurant downstairs for breakfast and lunch, and room service is available until 9pm. I had breakfast there on my last day, using the discount voucher they provided on check in and it was absolutely fine. I would definitely stay here again - it was really good value.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Staff, Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: vjmelzer
Reviews.Content: Had a short but sweet stay here and everything went smoothly. The staff were all on target (the folks that tend tables at the breakfast restaurant downstairs are amazingly attentive), the location is central for San Francisco shopping or sightseeing, and rooms are relaxed and pleasant. Plus is easy to spot from the surrounding streets with its bright vertically-lettered signage! No chance of losing your way.

Reviews.Title: “A quirky, beautifully decorated hotel with wonderful service and a fab location”
Reviews.Author: KatyR_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Chancellor Hotel for 10 nights and it was an ideal place to stay to access all the delights of San Francisco. Instantly accessible to the Cable Cars and Union Square, the Ferry Building was also only a short walk away. On arrival at the hotel our bags were efficiently whisked away as we arrived before our room was ready. Our room was lovely with an art-deco feel and lovely bath products, internet access and a quirky 'pillow' menu should you want to choose something special to sleep on. Everyone at the hotel was charming and very helpful. It was also great to be able to buy a travel pass from the booth in the hotel foyer - it was hard to find other places to buy them. I would go back to this hotel in a flash. We loved San Francisco too so I think a return visit will be on the cards in the future!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: pusskin
Reviews.Content: The staff here at brilliant - they refused a tip for valet parking the car on several occasions, went out on the street and hailed a taxi cab for us using a whistle (I felt like I was in the movies), helped carry out my luggage and put it in the car without my even needing to ask, were upfront about the hollandaise sauce needing to be redone for my husband's eggs benedict and brought toast in the meantime. Great idea to have free coffee and apples in the lobby at all times - especially nice to see some fruit in America! Brilliant location for shopping and the tour the staff advised us to go on was great -the tour company even picked us up outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small comfortable hotel with an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Holiday1234England
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights over New Year and were really impressed with the hotel. The staff were really friendly and helpful. The rooms were well equipped with comfortable beds. The location was perfect for Union Square and surrounds with everything you need on your doorstep (including Walgreens for forgotten items and refreshments). The complimentary coffee, apples and cookies were really welcome after a day of sightseeing too. For a central location hotel the Chancellor Inn is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Small but comfortable and close to Union Square”
Reviews.Author: KennethM2
Reviews.Content: The room was a bit small and a tight squeeze to enter (corner room). The room was clean, the water hot, and the staff friendly. Plus the price was reasonable considering the location. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Aus_princess
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right in the heart of San Francisco and was exteremly great value for money. I spent hours researching many different hotels in the Union Square area and this one did not disappoint. There is a tram that stops right out the front of the hotel if you want to go down to the fishermans wharf. I would also recommend that you buy a Muni pass if you don't have a car and if you are staying in town for a few days. It cost $18 for three days and you can use it on the buses, F trains, trains and also the trams (trolleys). If you buy a single ticket for the tram it would normal cost $5 each way so this is well worth it. When I go back to San francisco I would definetly stay at this hotel again, the staff are so friendly and the free cookies and coffee is such a treat. The only bad thing that I would say is that the rooms are a little on the small side but this really didn't bother us as they were very clean and tidy and well decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: klimag
Reviews.Content: A thoroughly helpful bellboy took care of us when we arrived, all jet-lagged and crazy. Thereafter we enjoyed a lovely comfortable clean room overlooking Union Square. This is a gracefully aging and elegant hotel at an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect budget hotel on Union Square”
Reviews.Author: irishpines
Reviews.Content: This fit the bill exactly for us - we were arriving from Ireland with two days to spend in SF before getting in an RV, and we wanted to stay somewhere central without spending too much. We only used the hotel for sleeping in, so I don't know about the bar/restaurant or anything else. However it's a nice 3 star hotel, perfect location and no complaints about the small, clean rooms or the friendly service. Incidentally, when looking for a hotel in SF we saw the great Tripadvisor reviews, with a few complaints thrown in about bathroom size etc. What caught our eye was the responses from the manager, who answered them with no BS and no apologies to those who just wanted to whinge or who had been hoping for a freebie - very refreshing attitude, and when we stayed there we had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay - location is the best”
Reviews.Author: UKJosie
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family of 4 with 2 teenagers in rooms with an interconnecting door on the 12th floor facing the front. It wasn't too noisy with the windows closed. Everything has already been said in previous reviews - clean, helpful staff, good breakfast, so not much to add. We liked the free never ending coffee from the lobby, free WIFI, brilliant location and trying out the pillows. There was nothing we did not like in fact. We had breakfast on day one there and it was fine - friendly service, good food. We liked it. I have often seen questions in the forum about whether to stay near Union Square or Fishermans Wharf and having stayed at the Chancellor, Union Square would win hands down. There is so much to do and the Chancellor is just in the best place for it. You can't beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for exploring a great city”
Reviews.Author: devrieaj
Reviews.Content: Union Square is the place to stay for exploring San Francisco for the first time and the Chancellor is a great value. With a Muni pass, you are right on the Powell-Hyde/Mason line to Fisherman's Wharf or can use Powell station to get pretty much anywhere else. The room was perfect - cozy and comfortable. The slight downside was that we easily heard a crying newborn two rooms over and loud strike protests at the St. Francis early in the morning. We enjoyed the free coffee, cookies and fruit!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Traveler14698
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on holiday for 4 nights in December of 2009. In short, everything was grand! For a traveler on a budget I doubt you can do better. The long version. Pros: - Splendid location. The hotel is in the heart of Union square - a busy shopping district in the centre of town. The area is also very pretty at night (around the holidays there's a massive Christmas tree lighting up the square). - Price. I booked the room for $100 per night - very low for a decent hotel in San Francisco, so excellent value for money. - Comfortable rooms. Great beds, free wi-fi in the rooms. Lovely (walk-in) closet. - Friendly and welcoming staff. Cons: - Room size: the rooms are comfortable, but small. - Slow (free) wifi. Good for surfing the web, but too slow to stream video. Tips & tricks: - Guests have complimentary access to a great health club just around the corner. Or you can just get a room on the top floor and walk up the 15 floors of stairs instead of taking a lift. :) - Delicious coffee, tea (and biscuits in the morning) are available in the lobby around the clock and free of charge. - Because of the lack of AC, the bathroom window needs to be opened regularly to avoid getting mold spots on the mirror and walls. - Room doors have standard locks, but no door chains - a first among dozens of hotels I have stayed in and should be trivial to resolve. Overall, I had a fantastic experience and will gladly stay here if I holiday in San Francisco again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a prime location!”
Reviews.Author: frequenttraveler234
Reviews.Content: Location: The hotel is in one of the best San Francisco locations - one block from Union Square, close to shopping, restaurants, night life, cable car lines and numerous city bus lines, a few blocks from Market Street, Chinatown, and downtown. The area is safe, with many locals and tourists during all hours of the day. The hotel itself: It is a boutique hotel, which is of course a difference from a large chain such as Marriott or Hyatt, but the experience was great. The hotel staff were polite and helpful but not intrusive. A few notes about the building: it is older; less space in the staircases/elevators; no A/C in the rooms (ceiling fan present) but SF doesn't get that hot/cold during most months. Rooms are cozy, but furnishings were functional and in good condition. Inside the room: flat-screen TV, free wi-fi in the rooms and in the lobby, no coffee maker (but you can place a request), free coffee and cookies in the lobby, free access to the Club One gym a block away (no fitness center inside the hotel), well organized walk-in closet, comfortable and clean bedding, all light fixtures were in order. Reservations: You could get a better nightly rate by booking ahead on a third-party site. In summary, the hotel was a great deal in a prime location, with a nice ambiance and friendly staff and they didn't nickel-and-dime for standard amenities. I would recommend it to friends and stay there again. A hidden gem in the heart of SF.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: MallyBeckenham
Reviews.Content: For a 3-star hotel this was perfect! When we booked with trailfinders we were offered several 4-stars at the same price but based on the reviews we took the Chancellor and were not disappointed. Firstly the location is perfect, could not ask for any more. We stood on the 8th floor of Macys in Union Square (after dinner at the Cheesecake factory!) and could stand on the balcony and see our hotel, you don't get closer to the action than that! The rooms may have been small, but in reality, if you've been to Toyko, they are actually quite spacious!! We had 3 suitcases and had no worries fitting them all in. A nice size closet was included and an in room safe. The beds were so comfortable, if only I had similar at home! There was an umbrella supplied for the wet weather and a lovely little rubber duck in the bath (ok so little things amuse me!). The lady on the tourdesk arranged airport transit for us with 5 mins notice, was very efficient and helpful. We didn't eat in the restaurant or use the bar so can't rate this. On the whole, we have no complaints, would definitely stay here again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Chancellor delightedly DELIVERS once again”
Reviews.Author: connieamethyst
Reviews.Content: This was the second time for my husband and me to stay at the Chancellor, and the first for our adult son. Before our first visit in December, 2009, I e-mailed Mr. Tyler ahead of our visit to tell him that I would be celebrating my birthday. We were gifted with a 2 room/2 bathroom suite on the top floor overlooking Union Square---ooooh! Last week, I e-mailed Mr. Tyler again just to ask a couple of questions; did not mention my birthday. Imagine my surprise and joy when we checked into the room and found a nice card with birthday greetings for me, and a gift certificate to the wonderful Luques restaurant in the hotel. I honestly don't believe that would have been remembered at very many, if any, other hotel anywhere. And I'm sure Mr. Tyler ordered the rain and cold just for me during our visit, just as the topping for my birthday visit. Chancellor is rated 3 stars technically, but in our book, it's a 5 star, beginning with the eager-to-please and always smiling staff. Rory, Zach, Shamina, Harris, Nate, Mike, Johnny, Alicia in the bar (who remembered us from LAST year!), Yesmie in the restaurant, the lady at the tour desk (I forgot to get her name.), the housekeepers, the maintenance people - honestly, every single person wants to be sure you're happy. The hotel is small, which adds to its appeal. You're greeted not only with a smile, but with your name. Cookies and coffee are always available in the lobby. The rooms are very nice. If you need great big suites, and huge bathrooms, go elsewhere. We're out and about a lot, and don't need a large room to sit idle during the day. If you want a beautiful room with a very comfortable bed and pillows, flat screen tv, walk-in roomy closet (not all rooms, though), very nice bathroom amenities including bath salts, come to the Chancellor. I even like the green walls and chairs! And a hot soak in that deep tub with the wonderful bath salts after walking those hills - my goodness. I now have 2 Christmas rubber duckys (duckies?) - another nice little gift touch from your bathroom, and I hope to acquire many more from future visits. Breakfast at Luques was wonderful - uncrowded, quiet, great food, great service. Try the eggs benedict, French toast, Chicken California sandwich. All were delicious. And finally, the proximity to the cable cars, bus routes, Union Square shopping, Market Street, Chinatown - just more and more reasons to make your home base the Chancellor while in San Francisco. The only negative is that we don't live closer, and can't visit more often. I am so grateful to fellow travelers who take the time to write reviews, or the 3 stars may have prevented my ever giving the Chancellor a try. Now I can't imagine ever staying anywhere else in San Francisco, unless I were to actually move there! I believe any one who ever tries them just once will be just as "knocked out" and hooked by their charm, as we are.

Reviews.Title: “This a gem of a hotel in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: mrstuna
Reviews.Content: We liked everything about this hotel: Location, staff, amenities, restaurant, bar, etc. It is a small comfortable hotel on Union Square. The rooms are small, but that really didn't bother us at all. They are very well arranged and worked just fine. The decor is nice, the beds comfortable, the hotel is well maintained, the wireless access works, the restaurant serves a good breakfast (the only meal we actually had there), the staff is pleasant and helpful. Also, we got a great deal--look at the specials on-line! Our absolutely only problem was that the room was overly warm the first night we were there, even thoughwe turned the thermostat way down and ran the ceiling fan. We discovered the second night we could open the window because it had a safety stop on it. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “You can count on this hotel to deliver each and every time”
Reviews.Author: nancyesca
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the perfect location - adjacent to Union square and the cable car really does stop outside. The rooms are perfect good...flat screen TVs, serviceable bathrooms, good cleanliness and a great value for the price. Since it was winter A/C was not an issue and the umbrella in the closet for use while you are there is very handy. The huge tubs are great for soaking feet and body after a long day of sightseeing and walking. HINT: LUSH, the bath products store is just a couple of blocks down the hill towards Market St. Another HINT: get the 1 or 3 or 7 day MUNI pass, it makes taking the cable cars and other public transport very reasonable. We ate breakfast at Luques the restaurant in the hotel each day and thought the food was good. Another HINT: there is an Irish type pub a block down the hill and to the right...cannot remember the name, but they have a piano and it is a great sing along bar. To get from the airport to the hotel - you can take BART for $8.10 each way...and the hotel is 3-4 blocks up from the Powell and Market BART stop I have stayed in this hotel at least 5 times and it remains my "go-to" hotel in San Francisco. Also the bellman...I did not get his name but I remember him from last time, gave us a good hint about how to get to the Presidio by bus...which saved us lots and make it a great adventure. Free PC and printer in the lobby is great to look things up and sign in for your flights.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, lovely rooms, great staff - what more could you want?”
Reviews.Author: Brighton_Claire
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel - the location is great. We had an internal facing room, with a view of a wall, but we did get the room really cheap, and it was really quiet at night - so complaints there. The decor is lovely, really chic and the room was spacious enough for a city center hotel - great walk in wardrobe big enough to store suitcases open. The staff we dealt with were really helpful and friendly. We didn't eat anything in hotel, so can't comment on the food. But when your in heart of SF you've so many choices. Right next door there is Sears which is famous for breakfast (although we didn't make it cause the queue's were SO huge!). I'd definitely stay here again, and I loved SF - hope to get back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: jcphilo5
Reviews.Content: Location was in the middle of everything you can walk to, close to shops, food, trolley. Value for hotel and parking was the best around, and parking lot is only a block away. Rooms were not very large, but only stayed for one night. Bathrooms are a bit small and we had a room close to the elevator which was a bit noisy. Bed was not super comfortable. View was great on the 15th floor. If you are looking for a good hotel in the middle of everything for a goo price this is it, overall we were satisfied with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Auntie033
Reviews.Content: I booked the Chancellor for my first trip to San Francisco, based on the price for the location and on the trip advisor reviews. On subsequent conversations with people about where I would be staying, I discovered that 2 or 3 people I knew had previously stayed there and they raved about the hotel so I was really looking forward to my stay there. I was not disappointed. We stayed for 7 nights in a twin room on the 14th floor. I had emailed the hotel a few days before my arrival to request a high floor if possible â€“ and received a very prompt and personable reply from Kevin, the Reservations Manager. As some others have said, the room was small, but we didnâ€™t need a lot of space, and anyway we spent very little time in the room. The closet was the biggest I have seen and we had our suitcases in there so they were not taking up space. The bathroom was also small, but sufficient. I have a similar sized one myself at home and itâ€™s perfectly adequate. The free wireless internet was a big bonus as you often have to pay for it at more expensive hotels. It worked absolutely fine for me. The internet terminal in Reception is also a great service, as we booked something online that we needed a printer for. All the staff that we dealt with in the hotel were super nice and very efficient. We had an issue where the safe in our room went to â€˜sleepâ€™ twice but when we reported this to reception it was fixed in less than 10 minutes on both occasions. The lady at the tour desk gave some great recommendations for restaurants. Although she did tell us that the Alcatraz night tour that we booked online 3 months earlier didnâ€™t exist which sent us into a bit of a spin, but a phone call to the company quickly sorted that it was in fact running !! We ate breakfast in the hotel a few mornings and it was lovely and the restaurant staff were great. The cookies at reception were delicious, I wish I had started eating them earlier in the week than I did!! The location of the hotel is absolutely fantastic and one of the cable cars runs right outside the door. I loved San Francisco and will certainly be going back sometime in the future. I will definitely stay at the Chancellor Hotel again and will tell anyone I know thatâ€™s going to San Francisco to book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb...everything about it!!”
Reviews.Author: MelbTraveller85
Reviews.Content: This was actually my boyfriend's favourite hotel we stayed at for our whole 3 week holiday! To be honest, we didn't like San Francisco all that much but were thrilled with this hotel. As everyone has said, it is RIGHT in the middle of everything you need - shopping, restaturants, BART and you can walk anywhere. We ended up doing a walk from the hotel, alllllll the way up the hilly roads, turned left and walked a bit more to the really zig-zag windy street, then allllllll the way DOWN to Fisherman's Wharf. It was a long warm, but a quick cable car ride back and a very comfy bed to hop into to rest our exhausted bodies. I read the reviews here beforehand and noticed that the rooms were said to be quite small. I agree they aren't huge rooms, but I wouldn't say they're small. 2 of us and a fair bit of luggage were more than comfortable in it. The decor of the rooms is beautiful and adds an old-fashioned, classy feeling to the place. The lady at the bar was very friendly when we went down for a drink, as were the staff at the restaurant when we had lunch there on our departure day. There is a little kiosk/desk where we were able to get some help organising a shuttle back to the airport, buy a ticket for the cable car and also a postcard and stamp for me to send. Front desk then sent the postcard for me which was a nice touch by them. As everyone else on here, I would definately recommend staying here. And the free tea, coffee and cookies come in very handy too!

Reviews.Title: “Superb, clean hotel in an amazing location with bags of character”
Reviews.Author: LeeGuffy
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here after researching heaps of hotels in San Fran. We wanted somewhere central for the four days that had some character and soul. Step up The Chancellor Hotel complete with superb service and favourable rates. After sending an enquiry about the rooms, a helpful chap called Kevin got straight back to me and offered me a room for the period we needed and reserved them. Keen to make sure things were ok I ended up calling him and having a chat and to my pleasure, he was even nicer on the phone. he offered to give us a room at the top facing the square; what more could you ask for. As for the stay, well it was as good as the email and phone experience. Very clean hotel, amazing location on the square, helpful staff (especially the lovely lady who runs the bar) and rooms that we're just right. I've read that people think the rooms are small and a little run down. Nonsense really as the hotel is a real, proper San Fran hotel that's not a template chain. They are super clean, have everything you need and perfect for a stay in San Fran. What on earth do folk want a big room for? A party? In short I'd whole heartedly recommened a stay here. I've seen a lot of hotels on my travels and this is one I remember for all the right reasons. I'd stay again AND recommened which I guess is the true test of whether it's any good.

Reviews.Title: “Just step out the door to everything”
Reviews.Author: worldrounder
Reviews.Content: A fab location if you want to be in the buzz zone of San Francisco. Staff very friendly + helped play along with a 'surprise' visit. Room fine for our 3 nights + suited us fine - may be small for a longer stay. Walk everywhere - shops, restaurants, BART, taxis at the door if you want. We were on the 14th floor + you can hear city noise at night if window is open but did bot bother us. Would stay again on future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Do your self a favour, stay here”
Reviews.Author: KymSydney_Australia
Reviews.Content: After returning home from a very long holiday and having gathered my thoughts I would like to post this review of the Chancellor Hotel on Union Square San Francisco I would like to say you can't go wrong staying there, 5 stars to the Chancellor we stayed in the beginning of August, the room was a decent size just right for the two of us , with a large wardrobe which had a personnel safe inside ,comfortable queen bed, nice and clean room with pleasant decor, table and chairs by the window, we even had a view of Union square it is very nice indeed there was a Fan on the ceiling which was so good especially if you get hot through the night, just enough to keep you cool and if you don't like the sound of the city, just close your window and it is nice and quite the bath tub is a nice deep one, so relaxing that I fell asleep in it, after we had a wonderful day doing a Segway tour and walking around San Francisco how good was that and what a location right there in the middle of the city, nice places to eat next door or just around the corner, Staff were very friendly and helpful at all times and best of all, they had a sense of humour so all in all if you want a good hotel to stay in, that is central city with cable car at the front door, right on good shopping outlets, nice eating, drinking etc with rates that wont break the bank this is the place for you, Stay there, see for your self, Best to Wes K&K

Reviews.Title: “Quaint But Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Heisler49
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on way to HNL via SFO. Room comfortable but smaller than anticipated. Would not try to swing a cat with a long tail in there. (Hard to get a sense of the size from on line pics) Very handy to Union Square & the cable car system. Lots of good eating down the side streets. H

Reviews.Title: “Chancellor - a great stay every time”
Reviews.Author: traymd
Reviews.Content: I've been visiting San Francisco for around 13 years now and all but one of my stays (except the first time as I didnt know this hotel existed) have been at the Chancellor. The hotel was first recommended to me by my travel company and I have never felt the need to even consider another hotel when visiting San Francisco. Standout points for rme are: - Excellent customer service from all the staff I have encountered in my visits - Ideal Union Square location - Home from Home feel - Spotlessly clean rooms & bathrooms - Very comfortable beds - Flat Screen TVs and Free Wifi - The hotel has real character and isnt one of your slick cookie-cutter chains - Excellent value for money - Nice quirky little features like the sweet jar, the rubber duck and pillow choice. Yes its not going to float your boat if you insist upon your typical marble clad 5 star hotels with the attendant features but give me character over sterile uniformity any day. I'll be visiting the city many more times in the future - the Chancellor is the only place I want to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: travelbug61
Reviews.Content: I recently had my second stay at the Chancellor. I liked it very well on my first stay, and I'm happy to say that it has actually improved over time. The bedroom was recently refurbished with new furniture and a flat-screen TV. As before, both bedroom and bathroom were compact, but everything was immaculate, well functioning, comfortable and cozy. Amenities such as a room safe and a mini-fridge (the latter upon request) were much appreciated. Only slight problem was slow, somewhat unreliable free wi-fi in my room; however, when I brought my netbook down to the lobby, Internet access worked great there. Even though I paid a rock-bottom room rate ($67/night on an Expedia package), my request for an upper-floor room with a Union Square view was promptly and courteously honored. I didn't have much interaction with hotel staff, as I didn't need any help with directions, dining recommendations, etc., but in the interactions I did have, the staff were consistently friendly and professional. The servers in Luques, the hotel restaurant, were especially lovely; the breakfasts were delicious too. As a solo female traveler, I felt very safe and well cared for at the Chancellor, and I definitely plan to stay here again on future SF visits.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: buzzLeicester
Reviews.Content: originally booked the chanceller for two nights. on arrival dealt with in a very proffesional friendly manner .Rooms are clean and well equipped .booked for a further two nights for the following week on our return to san francisco and had a street facing room which had a great view of union square.the standard of the hotel was fantastic and the location is ideal for shopping and site seeing. will definately be staying there again

Reviews.Title: “Good decision”
Reviews.Author: Aatu
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on its rating on TA, great price we got, and because of the location. I usually prefer business hotels and tried to find another place until the last minute. However, this hotel seemed to offer best value for money and we decided to stay there. This was a good decision. Having read all the great reviews about the service in the hotel I was disappointed at first. I felt that we needed to make the initiative to get the service, i.e. ask about everything as nothing was explained in the beginning (coffee, breakfast, bar, fridge in the room..). However, as soon as we did this, it was apparent that the reviews we correct. We got very good and personal service. Everyone working at the hotel was very polite and easy to approach. The tourdesk downstairs is the best. You can book tickets, buy Muni Passes and get all tourist information you need. We stayed in the hotel on two different occasions during our visit to SF. Both times the rooms were clean and nice with good pillows, flat screen TVs, good sized closets and best of all free internet. Rooms donâ€™t have air conditioning, but this didnâ€™t bother us at all. Open window and a ceiling fan did the job. Bathrooms were a bit on the old side, but perfectly usable (and clean). As said earlier, this is not a standard business hotel, but a hotel with character. One negative aspect was the noise from a room next door on our second stay. Our first room was very quiet but in the second one we could hear our neighbors talk and at night, snore. It felt as we were in the same room. The noise coming from the street didnâ€™t bother us at all â€“ it was nice hearing the streetcars pass by and ring their bells. We had breakfast on four of the six mornings we stayed downstairs in the Luques Restaurant. It cost abt 35 USD (tip and tax included) for 2 and was definitely worth it. We didnâ€™t see the point in going to the restaurant next door as they pretty much had the same menu and prices. Service at the Luques was very good and friendly. Location of the hotel is perfect, right next to Union Square. In addition to the shopping and restaurants, it is an excellent place for public transportation. You can hop on the cable car to get to Fishermanâ€™s Wharf or walk down two blocks to Market Street and hop on a tram/bus to get to Ferry Building (or if you go the other way - to Castro District). You can also easily walk to Chinatown and to Financial District. Overall the hotel has character, offers great service and has a good location. I would definitely recommend it to all my friends looking for value for money.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: travelbug007ny
Reviews.Content: We chose the Chancellor as recommended and we're so happy with ther advise. The hotel is centrally located in downtown San Francisco, we didn't need to rent a car. The rooms are on the small side like a European hotel but the space is enough for us. I like that they have a closet for the luggages and a safe deposit box. Our room is quiet,very clean and the beds are comfortable. The free coffee/tea and the delicious homemade cookies and apples available 24 hours in the lobby adds a very nice, homey touch. The staff are very friendly especially Susan the concierge who helped us book our trips and point us to the good and reasonable restaurants and gave us helpful tips while touring the city. We will recommend your hotel to our friends and will definitely stay in the Chancellor again .

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: travelingqueen1
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Chancellor last week. We loved the location. The hotel is very close to all public transportation, which we used everywhere we went. Helpful hints would include stocking up on drinks such as water and soda at Walgreens on the corner and also don't be shy about asking the front desk if you need anything. The staff was extremely professional . The rooms can get very warm when it is hot outside. There is only one window in each room, which limits the amount of air circulation. We asked for a fan the second night and it helped tremendously. We knew going in the hotel did not have air conditioning so we adjusted with the abnormally high temperatures for that time of year. It was worth it for the location. We also loved how helpful the staff was and how clean the rooms were. The maid service is great at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: LAScotty
Reviews.Content: The title says it all. Rooms are not large but when spending time visiting, who needs huge spacious rooms?!! They were clean, the hotel although centrally situated is not noisy - always a blessing in a city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to call home for a while”
Reviews.Author: Leeandob
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chancellor for a week and had the best time. Everyone who works there could not be any more helpful and friendly. I have to say thanks for such a nice visit. This was a very pleasant surprise as we didn't have any idea about the area and how we would enjoy it. The cable car stops at the front door and all the shopping is steps away. Inside rooms are very quiet and peaceful. Bravo to all staff !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: faruz
Reviews.Content: Chancellor Hotel was absolutely great. We payed a 100$ a night, and got great location, great staff and just great value-for-money rooms. We also got 25$ a day to spend in the restaurant so that was awesome! Only problem was the bath. The shower is really short (Located around 5'11-6'0, 175-180cm) and was a problem for me because I'm 6`3. (had to bend to wash my hair). if you come here, don't forget to visit Sears Fine Food which is famous for its little pancakes. (It's just downstairs, you'll see it because of the line). Oh, don't forget - Free WI-FI!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: at23
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great directly opposite union square and close to many shops, bars, restaurants and transport links including the tour bus (we loved the tour bus and particularly top deck across golden gate bridge!) However, for the price I would say the hotel was only average with quite small rooms, no breakfast included and quite old fashioned being in need of renovation. The free sweets in the room and cookies, tea/coffee on reception were a bonus though which we liked.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: veganexplorer
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Chancellor after everyone suggested that we stay in Union Square on our first trip to San Francisco. After driving across the country from Chicago and staying in various different hotels along the way, the Chancellor Hotel felt like an old-school Hollywood hotel of which we got a great rate on. Everything was so authentic and unique throughout the entire hotel from the lobby with extremely personable staff to the room which was cute and well furnished. It looked and felt like one of the older buildings in San Francisco which added a very nice feel to the experience of our trip. However, they are very well kept with modern features like a flat screen TV in the room, high speed wireless internet and the options to choose a dozen different types of pillows! The best part of the hotel was the location. You're in the heart of San Francisco and the trolley really does stop right at the Chancellor's doorstep. Everyone was very helpful in helping out the "out of towners" get around and navigate the public transit system (which was fairly simple if you're familiar with riding buses and trains in a major city). Overall, I would definitely stay at the Chancellor again. We even spoke to a gentleman in the elevator who said that he's stayed across the street at a different hotel for 20 years and decided (opting for a better rate) to stay at the Chancellor this particular weekend. He said that he was happier with this stay than in the 20 years he's traveled to San Francisco. Only drawback was parking, we got a deal where our parking at the Valet Garage around the corner was included with our room rate. It's downtown San Francisco so there's not much room to park anyway. It was a small price to pay for an amazing stay in a beautiful city. We loved the experience, would stay here again and suggest it to all who are thinking about staying in San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: lizdcook
Reviews.Content: My stay was perfect. I can't wait to return to San Francisco and the Chancellor. Everyone was so helpful and pleasant. My room was very clean and cozy. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, friendly staff and fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Siddex
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chancellor as the first part of our West Coast honeymoon and after reading many great reviews on Trip Advisor, I can say I was not disappointed in the slightest. From the moment we checked in the staff were very friendly, helpful and informative. We loved our stay in San Francisco and especially loved our stay at the Chancellor, we have vowed to go back to San Francisco and would definitely stay at this hotel again. We asked for a high room with some sort of view and got just that. A room on the 14th floor with views over Union Square. The room, although not large or luxurious, was great and extremely comfortable. The bed and the pillows made sure we always had a great nights sleep for our 4 nights there. The bathroom was fairly small but the bath tub was deceptively large and very deep. It is a boutique style hotel and is very nice and the location cannot be beaten. A couple of minutes walk to Union Square and cable car stops either side of the hotel. This made getting around San Francisco very easy for us. Book a stay here if visiting San Francisco you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a very central position”
Reviews.Author: JeanetteNewZealand
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Chancellor - have only been home just over a week. We spent over 3 weeks in the States from New Zealand, mostly riding Amtrack and had wonderful experiences everywhere we went. The Chancellor's rooms were clean, quiet and the staff all very friendly and helpful. Must mention the Concierge, she was so knowledgeable. Enjoyed the restaurant for breakfast and the bar at night for a drink. Would definitely stay there again, and will tell anyone here who is going over to San Francisco to stay there too.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Booms16
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with the Chancellor. The location is absolutely perfect for first time visitors to SF, right beside Union Square and the main shopping district. The cable car runs outside the hotel on Powell St. The second stop is across the road and you can skip the queue at the bottom by just hopping on there. The room was small, but nicely furnished and clean. There was no AC, but it wasn't needed. It was the first stop on our honeymoon and there was wine, champagne, sweets and a photo frame in the room for us - very nice touch. Also the free wifi is rare for a hotel in the USA. You could go for a more expensive place with more space, but in a city like SF you don't spend much time in your room and you're better off saving your money for the fantastic restaurants and shops.

Reviews.Title: “This was our 15th stay, and we still enjoy the Chancellor”
Reviews.Author: Tip71
Reviews.Content: Everyone is very friendly and helpful. The location is great.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel, its staff and location are fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Adelynne
Reviews.Content: We were so happy with our stay. The hotel is charming with a kind of cozy feeling. The personal service was outstanding. Helpful, courteous and welcoming, that was the staff. The location is the best. Right on Union Square. From my window I could see the happenings and experience the excitement of being in San Francisco. The small bar is really fun. Coffee always at hand and cookies for a snack. The restaurant is convenient and quite good. We stayed at several "chain" hotels during our trip and believe me The Chancellor was in a totally different category. We will recommend it for sure to our friends and we hope someday to be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: jeteye99
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor Hotel is exactly what that advertise. Historic hotel with great service in the BEST location. The rooms are small but very charming and just perfect for a weekend in San Francisco. The staff is great. Nate, Tina ...thanks for the recommendations. Uncle Vito's was great. The head of hotel housekeeping saved my son's little black bear and we very much appreciated it. Breakfast at the hotel was delicious, and in S.F. with so many great places to eat that is saying something. Beds are very comfy!! If you want to stay at a place with character and charm this is it!

Reviews.Title: “It's like coming home after a long day”
Reviews.Author: stuBolton
Reviews.Content: Just returned home after 5 nights at the Chancellor for our 25th wedding anniversary and we have already told friends of our wonderful stay here. You are given a guest critique form to fill in during your stay and after we filled it in and added our comments we realised you can't fault this hotel. Sure it's not new but so what, the service is efficient and polite, the rooms are very clean, it's located on Union Square the hub of San Francisco, the cable car stop is outside the door, there are loads of restaurants within 3 or 4 blocks and the cost of staying here is favourable. What more do you need? A special mention about the breakfast staff and the lady working the bar who always smile and give great service under pressure. I can't recommend this hotel highly enough. Many thanks for the champagne waiting in our room on our first evening, much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Better than ever”
Reviews.Author: Oskar
Reviews.Content: Well, what has changed in the past year_____absolutely nothing ! The hotel is just as good as it was last year and we enjoyed our stay immensely. Perfect location right on Union Square with the Cable Car going right by the door and that was great as we used the Cable Cars more this trip than ever before over many years of visiting the city. The rooms as usual were clean and tidy, great walk in robe and those little extras like an umbrella, pillow menu and of course a rubber ducky for the tub ! The breakfasts at Luques Restaurant are great and excellent value and always served with efficient smiling staff. On this trip we travelled to many US cities and each time we made mention that the breakfasts at Luques were far superior than every other stop. In San Francisco and experiencing many hotels over many years we far prefer boutique historic properties and this place, still family owned from 1914 gives you a rich, unique, and true San Francisco experience. Great location, great staff, great value, great experience_____we are planning the next visit !

Reviews.Title: “Clean, centrally located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RandGP
Reviews.Content: We booked this through Trailfinders after reading reviews. It is centrally located for Union Square; easy to get around on trams; was very clean and staff helpful. They will let you use a computer at reception which is useful for those like us without laptop. We had room on 11th floor at back. Looked recently renovated. Was adequate size, clean bathroom - smallish but adequate. Quiet enough for us. We stayed 5 nights and had complimentary bottle of wine which was nice touch & unexpected. Travellers Info:- Taxi was $40 from airport. Cab hire cycles from Blazing Saddles on next street, 1 block down. We cycled 2 days - once over Golden Gate Bridge, through Sausilto and on to Surbiton - then ferry back. NB it is quite a distance from Sausilto to Surbiton - ok for regular cyclists but care if not. Cycle ride through GG Park and up caost via Baker Beach well worth it and not as hilly as cycle shop indicated. Walked from Fisherman's Wharf to Golden Gate Bridge - very nicer walk along coast and then 2 buses (no.s 28 then 30) get you right back into Union Square for $2. Best meal out was across the square at Cheesecake Factory above Macy's. Not enough room left to try a cheesecake slice after meal but at up to 1575 calories a slice probably a good thing!

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Service I've Had in a Long Time”
Reviews.Author: houck25
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at this hotel with our two service dogs. Because we don't have visible disabilities, we often get questioned. The front desk person was appropriate when dealing with our dogs and house keeping even left bowls in our room for them. The rooms are clean, modern, and comfortable. The location is right in Union Square with tons to do within walking distance. The best was the customer service. Every staff member said, "hello" when walking out of the hotel or down the hall. There is also free coffee and cookies in the lobby. : )

Reviews.Title: “Best location in town!”
Reviews.Author: Kenfaisey
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at the Chancellor and had a wonderful time in San Francisco. The hotel is an independent run family hotel and the rooms are maybe not as large as others in the states but all this is set out clearly on the website and on trip advisor. The plus points are the fantastic location right in the heart of this amazing city and on two cable car lines which pass right outside the front door. The hotel decor is in keeping with its age/style and we found it a charming place to stay. The downstairs bar and Mellissa and Rex who look after the bar were a big plus - reasonably priced drinks, a good place to meet other guests and a source of advice and tips on SF places to visit and eat. Thanks to all at the Chancellor for a wonderful visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great, cute hotel”
Reviews.Author: ifcaroline
Reviews.Content: I had a great time at this hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was great and the bed was very comfortable. The only things that annoyed me was: a) the water pressure in the shower was too low and b) there was some fan whirling noise in the background in our room. Apart from that I really liked it- from the free oatmeal cookies in the lobby to the rubber ducky in the bathroom- details a grandmother must have thought of.

Reviews.Title: “Great value & location”
Reviews.Author: idlethyme
Reviews.Content: Great value in Union Square. Pillows were nice, but mattress was firm for someone used to a pillow top. Great linens but it was too warm to use them. Took awhile to see & figure out how to operate the vent. Great staff - assisted in taxis, directions, and printing our Southwest 24 hr advance boarding passes while we were sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Tour transport at the door”
Reviews.Author: AtlasMac
Reviews.Content: clean & tidy. good travel/tour desk help, but watch the taxis they order, if you leave anything in the taxi. u never c it again

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience EVER!!”
Reviews.Author: shermcs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came to San Francisco for our 3 year anniversary and we chose this hotel for its extremely affordable rates. Not knowing what really to expect, we were blown away! The hotel staff were so helpful, telling us how to get where, what to see and what not to see. They even had complimentary champagne waiting for us in our room when we got there because of our anniversary. Location was in the middle of everything that we wanted to do. Next time we visit San Fran we won't stay anywhere else but at the Chancellor.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: emmerloulou
Reviews.Content: I don't care how much money I make one day . . . I can't see myself staying anywhere but the Chancellor. Loved the Union Square Location. The rooms were so fabulously deocrated. The service was "above and beyond." They gave us a bottle of wine, since we were on our honeymoon. They have a "pillow menu." There is a rubber ducky in the bathroom. I enjoyed several baths in the tub. Loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “We plan to stay at this location again!! Excellent,historic!!”
Reviews.Author: kharrisminiponies
Reviews.Content: While planning our first trip to San Francisco I came upon this hotel rated well by other reveiws. The location was central, with a wonderful veiw. The price was right and the hotel was clean!!! We will return to San Francisco and enjoy another great stay at The Chancellor Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: daisydaisy10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights at the end of our stay in the US. This hotel is situated a stones throw from all the great shopping that SF has to offer and is also close to all the major transport links. If you don't mind walking it's only 15 min to Chinatown and North Beach also. As people have already said the rooms are on the small side but there is a large walk in closet which we managed to get 4 suitcases in the room wasn't cluttered at all. All the staff that we encountered were extremely helpful, especially Sue the concierge who remembered when we were leaving and offered to arrange transport to the airport when she saw us in the lobby the day before we were due to leave. The cookies and coffee at reception were also a nice touch. This is a really charming hotel, centrally located which I would happily stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cartoon
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 4 days staying at the Chancellor. Staff were extremely helpful and polite. Location was fantastic, so easy to go anywhere. Union Square was nearby, plus shops and many many restaurants. The cable car passed in front of the hotel. The rooms were very comfortable, not huge but still very nice. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel (optional in our booking) as most days we were heading out somewhere different. Great bonus of free tea and coffee in the foyer plus oat biscuits. There is a bar in the foyer and big screen TV. Very close to Chinatown, and the BART station is at the bottom of the street. I actually left a small jewellry conainer in my room and hosuekeeping found it. When I contatcted them they were very good in Fed Exing to our next USA address at our cost. I would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: ZoeRobRodriguez
Reviews.Content: From the minute we checked in to the minute we left we had fantastic service at the Chancellor Hotel. We booked the hotel mainly based on the reviews on trip advisor and they didn't disappoint. When we were there, the weather was quite warm for San Francisco (so I've been told) but with the fan on and the window open no need for Air Con so that is not an issue at all, dispite what other reviewers have said. We were on our honeymoon when we visited the Chancellor and were greeted not only by the receptionist congratulating us but also some very kind gifts, you definately wouldn't get that in most hotels. As my husband is a big American sports fan we took advantage of the NFL package the hotel was offering the 49ers game on the first Sunday at the hotel, the seats were amazing and definately made up for the sunburn I got at the game! Overall the hotel and our stay was great and couldn't have been better. If you like to be treated with respect and like a valued customer, even if its your first stay, then pick this hotel. But if you want to be treated like just any other person then stay in one of the 'corporate' hotels.

Reviews.Title: “I was extremely pleased with my room and the staff at the Chancellor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ilsro
Reviews.Content: I had not been to San Francisco in 10 years and the last time there, I stayed at a hotel on a hill that I found not to be convenient for a tourist who likes to walk and take public transportation (cable cars and trolleys). This time when I visited SF, I stayed at the Chancellor, and besides liking the hotel and the staff, I found it extremely convenient to use mass transport to get to many tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to San Fransico for 40th Wedding Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: TynesideGirl
Reviews.Content: Arrived in San Fransico very tired after a long flight arrived at the Chancellor Hotel and the staff just took over taking our luggage out of the car to the room checking us in very quickly and welcoming us to the US it was a great check-in. The hotel has a lovely feel about it very friendly our room was perfect and very comfortable. The location of the hotel is perfect you can just jump on a trolley outside the door and go where ever you want to go. Didn't bother getting the car out of the valet parking until we left for LA. Great hotel could thoroughly recomment it. Well done Chancellor

Reviews.Title: “Small, but not too small. Nice, but too nice.”
Reviews.Author: Wesnkat
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on a personal recommendation. It is just OK for the price, better than most its size, but not all it could be. Location is perfect for everything! The rooms are petite, as many old hotels in SF are, but my wife and I were not stumbling over each other. We were on the back of the hotel which was quiet (although old walls are very thin), but has no view of anything unless you like vents and roof tops. It was nice to have two chairs, plus a desk in the room, however there is no refridgerator and no in room coffee maker. To be fair there would be no place to put them anyways. Queen bed was too hard for my taste and actually got sore sleeping on it, but they do have a pillow menu! Bathroom is very small and very dated, but also very clean. The whole place is actually very clean. The person who recommended the Chancellor to us gushed over the staff, however, I did not experience anything uncommon. In fact, the lady at the tour desk was unhelpful, bordering on rude (although I don't think she actually works for the hotel), and the desk staff was efficient, but amateurish and dull. It felt like I was checking into a motel, not a historic, Union Square SF, boutique hotel. I would stay here again, but if I could get a similar rate at the Westin or Drake, I might move down a block or two.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Joehel2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights at the Chancellor during the week of September 20th. The location is great, steps from Union Square and surrounded by public transportation options. The room was cozy and the large flat screen tv was a nice touch. The rooms here are not air conditioned but even during a few unseasonably hot days the ceiling fan and an open window created a very comfortable environment. The front desk personnel were very friendly and responsive to our inquiries. The restaurant was great for breakfast and a good value. The restaurant staff was friendly and professional in their service. The concierge/concession operator was knowledgable and arranged for a city tour (Grey Line) which picked us up in the lobby. The hotels location is within walking distance to China Town and many nice restaurants. The hotel was all in all a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great rooms”
Reviews.Author: Cochran16
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful and clean room, it was not huge but enough room for 2 people and 3 suitcases and still room to sit. Very friendly staff and service and excellent location right in the middle of downtown. would come back anytime. got free parking right around the corner with online reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Charming accommodations in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: SheilaG23
Reviews.Content: The staff is friendly and helpful; particularly Susan who was always there to answer my questions and give me some helpful hints about things to do and how to get around the city. The rooms are comfortable and clean and the hotel is a perfect location to get anywhere you want to go. My only criticism is not about the hotel per se but was upset with the car rental place, Reliable, and the vehicle that I was given was in very poor condition with bad brakes which was better than the original they wanted to give me and I would never rent from Reliable again. I also was upset with the shuttle driver who dropped me off quite far from my airline. I realize that is not the hotel's fault but they are services utilizied by the hotel and delivered poor customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: djh1
Reviews.Content: This review basically agrees with all its predecessors â€“ this is a wonderful hotel! The rooms were fantastic and nowhere near as small as other reviews led us to believe.
